Title: DSP Engineer for tools and test development
Description: Apply                          DSP Engineer for tools and test development  Smørum            Would you like to be at the forefront of the latest audio technology and make a difference for hearing impaired people worldwide? Can you see yourself as part of a team that shapes the future for audiological solutions within hearing aids? Then we might have an exciting career opportunity for you!  Welcome to team Digital Signal Processing  You will join our committed and highly skilled DSP Team, which is part of the Audiological Solutions group within R&D. We are innovators in our business and develop advanced audiological solutions for our future hearing aids. We are working with new state-of-the-art technologies within signal processing and machine learning.  “ We are a group of experienced DSP engineers waiting to welcome you. You will join a team with a high technical knowledge level, maybe some of the best at what we do, so this is really a place where you can exchange knowledge and learn something .” says your new manager, Erik Lund, and continues “ And innovation means everything to us, so your ideas and inputs are really appreciated. Besides that, we have a fantastic working environment with a lot of flexibility and a low hierarchy .”  We work in an agile setup, and in your daily work, you will be part of a scrum team with 8-10 team members with different competencies and backgrounds, where you work together to enhance audio processing and improve hearing aid functionality.  Make a difference in a great working environment.  You will be working in a growing international company, where there is rich opportunity for professional and personal development and plenty of new learnings. You will be part of an environment built on trust and openness. We all aim for an open and inclusive way of working where sharing knowledge and ideas are highly valued.  “ The role is central in supporting the team’s progress and development, where your focus will be on tools and test development .” says Erik and continues “ It’s a great way to really get to know your way around DSP and learn from the best .”  You will develop build/test framework for automatic tests used in the DSP area and develop audio/signal processing tools for Hearing Solutions. You will also contribute to tools roadmap in close collaboration with architects and other stakeholders.  In addition to this, you will:   Be point of contact for Continuous Integration related matters.  Build bridge between Feature Teams and Continuous Integration team.  Idea generation and innovation projects for new tools and signal processing.  Prototyping of new concepts.   We recognize that to bring energy and inspiration to work, you need to re-energize and spend time with family, friends, and hobbies in a healthy work life balance. We therefore offer the flexibility to work from home.  Tools for signal processing is your thing!  You hold a degree in engineering with a background in signal processing, computer science or similar. You have some experience with simulation tools and test automation within the DSP domain. In addition, you can probably tick off many of the following competencies:   Experience with Python, Matlab and GIT  Experience from test automation development  Knowledge of best practices with software development  Familiar with Windows or Linux environments for development.   We work with TeamCity and Simulink, so if you don’t already know them, you should be willing to dive into them.  As a person, you would describe yourself as someone, who works well within teams and likes technical challenges. You possess good communication skills, both orally and in writing and appear to be systematic, creative, and investigative. You are focused and motivated with a supporting mentally. You are motivated by dealing with numerous stakeholders and collaborating closely with your team colleagues.  Want to join the team?  Please send us your CV as soon as possible and no later than 7th of December 2023 , as we are screening applications on a continuous basis. Please note that we only accept application through our online recruitment system.  If you would like to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Senior Manager, Erik Lund via e-mail: erlu@demant.com .  We are curious to meet you!  At Demant we value diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) and we are committed to creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of ethnic background, personality, age, gender, and education. Diversity is part of our cultural DNA. Women in STEM areas are particularly encouraged to apply, as Demant supports United Nations Sustainable Development Goal 5 on gender equality.        Read more                             Mirjana Adnadjevic – DSP Specialist  “At Oticon we do beautiful engineering that brings music to people. How cool is that!”             Anders Erik Petersen - Specialist, PCB & Electronics  “I have close relations to my colleagues, and together we develop products that truly help people”             Kajsa Angesten - Senior CRM Marketing Manager  “At Oticon I contribute to making a life-changing difference for people with a hearing loss. That is worth fighting for”                         4 af 5 stjerner   112 of Oticon´s employees have rated Oticon on Jobindex          Meet our employees                 Employee benefits    Working at Oticon    Graduate progamme    Student jobs          Read more     Employee benefits   Oticon is a workplace comprised of many people with various backgrounds. Needs and desires vary from person to person, which is why we offer a large range of employee benefits suited to the individual. We continuously work to optimise our benefits in order to provide our employees with attractive programmes and offerings.  Oticon offers an array of benefits including a business travel card for public transportation, employee broadband, attractive and flexible pension schemes, education support, and a wide range of discounts on everything from fitness to car repair. Our list of benefits is continually updated.            Read more     Working at Oticon   Oticon is part of the Demant Group – one of the largest hearing healthcare companies in the world. This opens up an exciting world of opportunities when you join us.  We believe that innovation is the cornerstone of our success, and we encourage of our employees to think out of the box, focus on teamwork, and continuously sharpen both professional and personal competencies.            Read more     Graduate progamme   Join our 2-year programme and get a unique opportunity to develop your personal and professional skills. Be part of our mission to create life-changing differences through hearing healthcare to millions of people worldwide!  The Graduate Programme at Demant offers you a unique opportunity to develop your personal and professional skills. You will join us in creating life-changing differences through hearing health to millions of people worldwide.            Read more     Student jobs   Oticon has approximately +70 student assistants working in various parts of our organisation. A student job is your opportunity to test out your theoretical knowledge obtained in your studies and put it to use in "real-life" projects. Student jobs also offer you an excellent entry point to permanent employment after graduation.  We consider our student assistants to be an important part of our business, because they contribute new knowledge, energy, and alternative perspectives. Look under Positions to see if we are advertising your dream student job. You are also always welcome to join us on LinkedIn and become part of our network.                   The recruiting process  At Oticon we strive to make the hiring process a positive experience for everyone involved. Below you can see about the individual steps that you as an applicant can expect to undergo throughout the process.           Writing a good job application  Your application provides an initial impression of you as a person; it not only describes your professional qualifications and experience, but it also reflects your personal qualities.      Interviews  An interview process typically includes two interviews. The first interview is attended by one of our talent acquisition consultant and either a personnel manager, project manager or employee who knows your prospective job area well. The second interview always involves the personnel manager and the recruiting specialist.      Starting work at Oticon  It is very important to us that you get a good start at Oticon. And it is also important to us that as a new employee, you gain a broad understanding of our company and its culture as quickly as possible. Therefore we have designed a mentor programme and introduction programme to help you settle into your new position.       Read more               2 open positions  Oticon offers the possibility of working within a wide range of professional areas. Here you can view all open positions. Title: Senior IoT Specialist
Description:
Ansøg nu                                                 Senior IoT Specialist        Hørsholm            Are you driven by innovation and the possibilities of Internet of Things technology in driving sustainability? Are you well-versed in IoT solution development, with a solid grasp of hardware, firmware, and sensor technologies as well as cyber security requirements and technologies at the product and system level?    If you are ready to translate your expertise into advising prospective clients on harnessing the full potential of IoT solutions, we invite you to consider the role of IoT Senior Specialist!   At FORCE Technology, we are undergoing a transformative journey, pivoting towards enhanced business orientation, digitalization, and sustainability, all while prioritizing our clients' needs. We cater to thousands of companies worldwide across diverse industries, and with your prowess, we aim to expand our reach and offerings.  About the role and key responsibilities  As a Senior IoT Specialist in the department for Digital and Sustainable Innovation at FORCE Technology, you will be an integral part of a dynamic team dedicated to digital innovation research, development, and commercial consultancy.  Among our twenty-five highly skilled specialists and consultants in areas such as data and computer science, data analytics and machine learning, wireless communication, sensor technology, digital production as well as design and business innovation, you will contribute with your deep-seated knowledge of electronics and firmware design, and implementation, and digital technology at large.  Combined with your broad grasp of sensor technology, wireless communication, and cyber security you will apply these skills when seeking out digital solutions, advising, and innovating in the areas of production optimization, sustainable business development, and smart city applications. Our overarching mission is to shape a safer, more sustainable future for all stakeholders.  Your key responsibilities include:    Strategic Consultancy:   Guiding companies in selecting optimal and secure IoT solutions tailored to their digital and sensor application needs.  Conducting technology scouting and benchmarking.  Collaborating with clients to define solution and product requirements.  Collaborating with IoT solution suppliers to ensure high-quality, purpose aligned IoT solutions.   Applied Research Projects:   Engaging in collaborative applied research initiatives and projects with universities, research organizations, innovation clusters and industrial partners both in Denmark and internationally.  Harnessing the power of data by enabling sustainable and secure digital solutions in these key areas: Digital and sustainable production, sustainable business innovation, digital water technologies and smart city applications.  Disseminating knowledge through national and international conferences, webinars and workshops, white papers, peer reviewed articles, and articles in relevant scientific journals, industry magazines, and news outlets.   Your main workplace will be in Hørsholm, situated in the DTU Science Park, just 20 km north of Copenhagen. Reporting to Head of IoT Architecture and Technology, Michael Vaa, you will enjoy a flexible work environment that includes the option of remote work on select days.  Your profile  To excel in this role, we are looking for someone with:  An academic background in electronics engineering, at the B.Sc. level or above, specializing in electronic hardware and firmware design with solid knowledge of electronic product cyber security requirements and standards and preferably with knowledge of IoT technology, sensor technology, and wireless communication.  A track record of minimum 8-10 years' experience in developing and implementing digital and electronics solutions and technologies. If you have a M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree 5 years’ experience will suffice.   Enthusiasm for engaging holistically with IoT technology, both through advisory consultancy and applied research projects.  A capacity to manage multiple projects and a drive for continuous personal growth and knowledge enhancement.  A proactive, focused approach to work, with strong project management skills, driving tasks to completion.  Exceptional communication skills, enabling seamless collaboration across organizational, and professional boundaries.  A good sense of humour and the desire to be part of a team working toward a common goal.   Additional information    If you are passionate about driving IoT innovation and leveraging your skills to guide businesses towards a more sustainable future, we invite you to explore the exciting role of IoT Senior Specialist at FORCE Technology. Embrace the opportunity to influence positive change while honing your expertise. Let us connect and discuss how you can become an integral part of our forward-thinking team.  We can offer a unique workplace with a great diversity of professions and tasks. We work to make the world more sustainable and safer, and as an Approved Technological Service Institute we are a central part of technology development in Denmark.  You will be greeted by more than 1000 enthusiasts who work every day to make the greatest possible benefit to business and society. Everyday life is characterized by busyness, high professionalism, curiosity and humor in an informal atmosphere.  Does this sound like something for you?  If you think this job is for you, send us your application today. We process applications on an ongoing basis and invite candidates for interview along the way. Please note that we only accept electronic applications via our recruitment system.  If you have any questions about the position, please contact Michael Vaa on 4022 3288.  We look forward to receiving your application, CV and other relevant attachments.  At FORCE Technology, we are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment, and we are actively looking for qualified people candidates regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, disability or age. Det betyder, at du får mulighed for at arbejde med det nyeste udstyr, udforske ny viden og flytte grænserne for, hvad der er
            muligt, ved at teste ting af, der ikke er prøvet før.  Dermed får du chancen for at udvikle dig i og med din rolle, samtidig med at nye muligheder hele tiden åbner sig. Så i FORCE Technology kan du finde mange forskellige karriereveje. Karriereveje der former sig efter lige

Title: Development Engineer - DTU Wind
Description:
Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 Development Engineer - DTU Wind        Roskilde, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   The section for System Engineering and Optimization (SYS) at DTU Wind and Energy Systems is offering an exciting opportunity to work as an a development engineer. You will work within the field of system engineering applied to wind based energy systems (Wind Farms, Wind Clusters, and Hybrid Power Plants, including wind, solar, batteries, P2X), in collaboration with domain experts from different sections.  The job You will join an international team that works with developing methods and software tools for supporting research internally at DTU and externally in the wind industry. The System Engineering and Optimization section of DTU Wind is a group of researchers and development engineers working closely with domain experts from other sections to address real problems faced by the wind industry to simulate, design and control complex wind-based energy systems.  Furthermore, you will be part of a dynamic work environment with a pleasant team atmosphere, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your academical, technical, industrial, and personal skills. Besides participation in cutting-edge research, as a development engineer, you are given the opportunity to lead the development of world-class scientific software tools used in research projects, collaborate with industry, participate in writing papers, participate in teaching training courses, and co-supervise MSc students, which allows them to develop various skills for the next stages of their career.  Our expectations of you In the position you are expected to contribute to high-quality research and develop high-quality code at the intersection of wind farm flow modelling, wind based energy system design and control and electrical systems engineering.  We imagine that you are a self-motivated and team-oriented person who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoys working with complex topics. You must hold a MSc or equivalent and to be successful in the position you have expertise within:   Scientific python programming  Optimization and / or Control  Problem-solving, and ability to create efficient numerical algorithms   On a personal level you possess:   Excellent command of the English language  Good ability to present results in written documents and oral presentations.   Finally, it is highly advantegeuous, if you have experience with:   Machine Learning / AI  Wind Farm Flow Modelling  Wind Farm design and / or control  Wind farm electrical cable layout optimization  Contributing to open-source software development and documentation, CI and community engagement  Running code on high performance computers and / or GPUs  version control systems such as Git.  simulation tools and environments relevant to wind energy (e.g., PyWake, TOPFARM, FLORIS, WRF, FAST, HAWC2, WAsP).   What we offer in return DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation, and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility. The SYS section is developing research-based software used by many wind energy companies, which will offer you a unique position to effectively impact society through your high quality research.  Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations (AC).  Expected starting date is 1st of March 2024 or as soon as possible according to mutual agreement. The position is a full-time position.  Application and contact Please submit your online application no later than 30 December 2023. Open the “Apply now” link, fill out the form and attach your motivated application, CV and exam certificates.  If you would like additional information about the position, please contact Head of Section Pierre-Elouan Réthoré pire@dtu.dk, +45 2133 1293.  Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.  All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.  About DTU Wind and Energy Systems At DTU Wind and Energy Systems, we put knowledge to work. The department is one of the largest public research organizations for wind energy systems in the world with about 400 staﬀ members. We educate and train tomorrow’s technology leaders. We collaborate with researchers, global leaders in the energy industries and public authorities around the world to research and develop new technologies and services to power the green transition.  Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                                     Senior Full Stack Developer for Generative AI Projects     About the job  At KPMG NewTech, we are passionate about AI and how new technologies can change the way companies and organizations work.  We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our growing Machine Learning and Quantum team. If you are passionate about Generative AI, and the newest trends and developments in the industry, you might be our new colleague.  We manage AI projects from idea to implementation  At KPMG NewTech, our Machine Learning team manages AI projects from start to finish: identifying emerging business issues, crafting innovative models, executing and rolling out scalable systems, and empowering peers and customers to leverage the full potential of AI.  As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you will work on different projects critical to our clients' needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects.  We expect you to display leadership qualities, and be enthusiastic to support other team members in developing expertise.  Our team  The Machine Learning and Quantum team is focused on delivering solutions using the latest developments in the AI space. Our team consists of diverse individuals with backgrounds in data science, software, UX, business, and engineering. We are passionate about using AI to solve real-world problems for our clients and take pride in being experts in the field.  Currently, we are heavily focused on generative AI and how recent and ongoing developments are shaping the landscape.  Our team is dedicated to creating an inclusive and welcoming work environment for all employees. We value diversity and believe it is crucial to our success.  About our newest team member:  Minimum qualifications:   B.E. or M.Sc . in Computer Science or a related field.  5+ years of industry experience.  Excellent communication and teamwork skills.  Demonstrated ability to lead complex software development projects from conception to deployment.   Preferred qualifications:   Solid proficiency in frontend technologies such as Angular/React, Typescript/JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS/SCSS.  Experience with backend languages and frameworks like C#, Python, NodeJS, SQL, and NoSQL.  Familiarity with cloud providers like AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus.  Knowledge of containerization, such as Docker.  Having a pragmatic approach without over-engineering.  Drive for continuous learning and staying updated with the evolving tech landscape.  Knowledge and experience in the generative AI space.   Responsibilities:   Interact directly with clients to understand their requirements, provide technical insights, and ensure that the development aligns with their expectations.  Lead the design and implementation of scalable software architecture.  Foster a team culture that values inclusiveness, collaboration, and making a meaningful impact.  Mentor junior developers and team members, providing guidance and support for their growth and development. Lead by example in both technical expertise and professional conduct.  Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards and best practices.   Why join us?  We offer a dynamic and inclusive work environment that supports your professional growth and development. With competitive compensation and benefits, flexible work arrangements, and a commitment to learning and innovation, we provide opportunities for you to excel in your career.  At our organization, we value and respect diversity. We believe that a diverse workforce leads to better outcomes for our clients and employees. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, abilities, identities, and perspectives to apply.  Please don’t hesitate to contact Barbara Isaksen, Manager in Machine Learning and Quantum, at +45 31415095 or baisaksen@kpmg.com , if you’d like to know more about the position.              Application due 17/12/2023  Start date Start as soon as possible   Position type Management Consulting      Work hours  Workplace Copenhagen       Website      Questions regarding the position     Barbara Isaksen  Manager        baisaksen@kpmg.com                                                   Follow us               KPMG is a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 144 countries and have over 236,000 people working in member firms around the world. We work closely with a broad range of clients, such as business corporations, governments and public sector agencies and not-for-profit organisations. We support them in mitigating risks and exploiting business opportunities.  KPMG in Denmark is the fastest growing professional services firm in Denmark, achieving 1,365,279 million DKK in revenue in FY22. Together, over 1100 employees and partners work to deliver value to our clients through a combination of deep local insight and strong global perspectives. We tailor our approach to the challenge at hand, and we are constantly pushing boundaries to deliver the best services and solutions for our clients.  KPMG P/S, Dampfærgevej 28, 2100 København Ø, Tel: +45 7070 7760, CVR no. 25578198                               ShareThis Copy and Paste

Title: OPS Data Scientist
Description: ×                  OPS Data Scientist         Applications are considered on a rolling basis         Multiple locations     Hybrid                I'm interested              Applications are considered on a rolling basis         Multiple locations     Hybrid        Job Description  Join our Operational Analytics team as a Data Scientist, where you'll play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data to uncover strategic insights and drive tangible business growth. As a key member of the Ops Data & Analytics team, consisting of three analysts and one data scientist, you'll be at the forefront of transforming raw data into intuitive insights.  This role primarily focuses on text analysis, speech-to-text analysis, and other predictive analysis, ensuring alignment with those who have a keen interest in these specific areas.  Utilize advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze extensive datasets, extracting actionable insights. Engage with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges, fostering collaborative efforts to develop data-driven solutions that optimize customer processes and enhance operational efficiency.  Main tasks and responsibilities:   Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques, with a primary focus on text analysis, speech-to-text analysis, and other predictive analysis.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges, developing data-driven solutions to optimize customer processes and drive operational efficiency.  Design and implement predictive models and algorithms for forecasting, anomaly detection, and decision-making.  Develop and maintain data pipelines, ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the data lifecycle.  Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to facilitate informed decision-making.  Stay updated on the latest industry trends and emerging technologies in data science and analytics.   Skills & Requirements   A bachelor's or master's degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.  Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, with experience in data manipulation, analysis, and visualization.  Solid understanding of statistical concepts and experience applying statistical modeling techniques.  Experience with machine learning algorithms, data mining, and predictive modeling.  Familiarity with databases and SQL for data extraction and manipulation.  Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail, with the ability to work independently or as part of a team.  Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.   Experience:    Experience as a data scientist, data engineer, data specialist or data analyst.  A strong track record of building and deploying predictive and/or prescriptive models.  Proven programming and modelling expertise.  Experience with cloud platforms, such as AWS or Azure, is a plus.  Prior experience in customer analytics or process optimization is advantageous but not mandatory.   What we offer   An opportunity to work in a large, high-performing international company, in a dynamic environment that is constantly changing.  A corporate culture that is professional and dynamic, yet informal. Bureaucracy is kept to a minimum, as we expect our skilled employees to make long lasting and impactful decisions to shape our future.  Highly competent, dedicated, and friendly co-workers with strong collaboration across the Nordics.  Hybrid work environment (2-3 days remote work per week).  Emphasis on work-life balance.  Anticipated travel activity of 2-3 times per year, each trip lasting a few days.  Opportunity to work with the latest technologies in machine learning and AI.   This position can be in any of our Nordic locations in Helsinki, Hvidovre, Solna, Stavanger or Lysaker.  Are you interested?  If you are intrigued by this position and possess the right profile and mindset, please submit your application and CV via the link. Applications will be reviewed continuously, and interviews will be planned as soon as a suitable candidate is identified.  If you have any questions about the position, you can contact Philip Aarup, Team Leader of OPS Data & Analytics.          Great Place to Work    We invest in you   Innovative and looking to the future   BeHealthy | Your health is important to us   Social events for all employees   Engaged colleagues   Dynamic work environment   Employee benefits and discounts   Competitive insurance and pension plans   We give back to society   Gode pensions- og forsikringsforhold   Vi investerer i din udvikling   Vi giver tilbage til samfundet   Medarbejderfordele og rabatter   Dedikeret kollegaer   Globale muligheder   Sociale arrangementer for alle medarbejdere   Innovativ og fremadtænkende virksomhed   Gode forsikrings- og pensjonsordninger   Engasjerte kolleger   Sosiale arrangement for alle ansatte   BeHealthy | Din helse er viktig for oss   Innovativt og fremtidsrettet selskap   Vi investerer i deg   Vi gir tilbake til samfunnet   Personalgoder og rabatter   Dynamisk arbeidsmiljø   Sociala evenemang för alla anställda   Dynamisk arbetsmiljö   Vi ger tillbaka till samhället   Konkurrenskraftiga pensioner & försäkringar   Innovation, förbättring och utveckling   Globala möjligheter   Friskvård - din hälsa är viktig för oss   Engagerade kollegor   Personalförmåner via Benify             About the company  We are a Nordic bank with more than 1,200 colleagues in Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland, and proud to be part of Banco Santander, one of the largest banks in the world with a solid history going back more than 160 years.  Our purpose is to help people and businesses prosper and we aim to be the best retail and commercial bank, earning the lasting loyalty of our people, customers, shareholders and communities - through simple, personal and fair banking.  In our organization we foster and value an engaged, challenging and passionate environment that provides opportunities for personal and professional growth. We operate in an ever changing environment, and believe the key to success is innovative involvement, a playful approach to active learning and continuous improvement in our daily work.  We are firmly committed to being a responsible bank in the way we operate, our culture, caring for our environment and giving back to society. Banco Santander is recognized as the most sustainable bank in the world following the publication of the Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) for 2019.  Read more about responsible banking on our global webpages.  Santander Consumer Bank is one of the largest Nordic banks providing loans and credits, credit cards, deposits and insurance to private customers. A cookie is a small data file stored in your computer, tablet or smartphone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful malware or virus.  How our website uses cookies  Some cookies perform essential functions for our website. Cookies also help us get an overview of your visit to our website so we can continuously optimize and tailor the experience to your needs and interests. For example, cookies remember things like the items added to the shopping cart; whether you have visited our website before; if you are logged in; and the specific language and currency you prefer to see on the website. We also use cookies to target our ads specifically to you on other websites. In general, we use cookies as part of our service to present you with content that is as relevant to you as possible.  You can see the specific services that store cookies and why they do it, under the different categories:   Functional  Statistical  Marketing   How long are cookies stored?  The length of time a cookie is stored on your devices and browsers varies. The lifetime is calculated according to your last visit to the website. When a cookie expires, it is automatically deleted. All our cookies’ lifetimes are specified in our cookie policy.  How to block or delete cookies  You may at any time block all or just third-party cookies completely by changing the browser settings on your computer, tablet or smartphone. The location of these settings will depend on the browser you use. However, you should be aware that if you block all or just third-party cookies, there may be functions and services that you will be unable to use on the website (because these depend on cookies).  You can opt-out of cookies from Google Analytics here .  How can you delete cookies?  It is easy to delete cookies that you have previously accepted. It depends on which browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, etc.) and device (smartphone, tablet, PC, Mac) you are using. You can typically find this information under settings – Security and Privacy – but this may vary from one browser to another.  Specify which device/browser you are using (click the appropriate link):   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Chrome, Android   Changing your consent  You can change your consent by either deleting cookies from your browser or by changing your original choice by clicking the link below:  You can change your consent by clicking here  Remember: If you use more than one browser, you must delete cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  If you have any comments or questions relating to our information and/or processing of personal data, please feel welcome to contact us. 
The cookie policy itself is updated once a month by Cookie Information . If you have any questions about our cookie policy, you are welcome to contact Cookie Information on their website.     Settings  Accept all cookies     powered by: Cookie Information       Functional  Statistical  Marketing                                                Careers  Careers  Sustainability  Sustainability  Our Company  Our Company  News  News  Brands  Brands                 Senior AI Application Engineer                    Join our pioneering team at BESTSELLER, where innovation meets expertise in the realm of AI and machine learning. We are on the lookout for a seasoned Senior AI Application Engineer with a profound passion for data-driven innovation and exceptional skills in developing cutting-edge machine learning solutions.     YOUR NEW ROLE As a pivotal member of BESTSELLER's Data & Analytics department, you will spearhead the development of interactive AI solutions, applications, and dashboards that are the cornerstone of our data-driven decision-making process. Collaborating closely with a team of expert data scientists, engineers, analysts, and various stakeholders from the business. Your role is not just about building solutions but revolutionizing how we understand and utilize data. YOUR TEAM You will be an integral part of a dynamic team within the Data & Analytics department, a group of over 50 data enthusiasts driving the data agenda at BESTSELLER. Our focus is not only on delivering unmatched value to our end consumers but also on maintaining the highest standards of customer satisfaction and quality. You will join a product team of eight highly skilled professionals, all committed to harnessing the potential of data to enhance customer experiences, streamline operations, and drive revenue growth. YOUR IMPACT In your role as a Senior AI Application Engineer, you will: Drive the development of data-driven services and visualizations using tools like Python, Plotly Dash, TensorFlow, Kubernetes, Databricks, Snowflake, and dbt. Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and backend developers to ensure seamless data flow and successful feature implementation. Drive application development, data modeling, and UI/UX development, all aimed at delivering value to our end consumers and ensuring that satisfaction and quality are always on the radar. YOUR BENEFITS A dynamic and challenging role in a fast-paced, decision-driven environment. Collaboration with a diverse, highly skilled team and various business stakeholders. Extensive opportunities for skill enhancement and professional growth in an international setting. Dedicated time for training, education, and a pathway to a wide array of certifications. YOUR PROFILE We are seeking an energetic, proactive team player with: A Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Advanced proficiency in Python and a genuine interest in data engineering and visualization. Proven experience in containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes) and developing/maintaining production-grade web applications. Demonstrated expertise in deploying machine learning-driven applications in production environments. Excellent communication skills for effective technical presentations to non-technical stakeholders. The following qualifications would also be an advantage: Proficiency in Plotly Dash, cloud computing services (GCP, AWS, Azure), and database management (SQL, NoSQL). Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. WORK LOCATION Your primary workplace will be at our vibrant office in Aarhus. WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Emil Hartvig Pedersen (+45 29628203). Otherwise, please send us your application and CV as soon as possible, but no later than December 13th, 2023. We invite for interviews on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the add when we have found the right candidate     ABOUT BESTSELLER At BESTSELLER, we are more than 18,000 people in 38 different countries working for over 20 fashion brands such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, NOISY MAY and Y.A.S. We are a family-owned company with a strong foundation and values to build on, empowering us to pursue the ideas we believe in to take BESTSELLER forward. We are committed to diversity and provide equal opportunities for everyone, irrespective of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or gender identity. We strive to create an empowering environment where people can thrive and develop. For more information, visit www.bestseller.com.        You will become part of the BESTSELLER family, a culture where new ideas are welcomed, and all voices are heard. We believe in entrepreneurship; this means you have the freedom to do this in the way which works for you. You get responsibility and the opportunity to develop yourself and your area from day one. We believe in flexibility and autonomy in your daily routine and working location.         At BESTSELLER, we own it. Every chance. Every challenge. Every choice. We’re the global fashion company that’s fast paced and family run. We’re the business that’s built some of the strongest brands in the industry. By empowering every individual to own their journey, we’ve found the courage to keep getting better. To act more sustainably. To foster diversity and provide equal opportunities. To compete more confidently. And to keep challenging the status quo. Time and time again. We are BESTSELLER - and together, we own it. Title: PhD scholarship in Prescriptive Analytics for District Heating Networks at DTU Engineering Technology
Description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 PhD scholarship in Prescriptive Analytics for District Heating Networks at DTU Engineering Technology        Ballerup, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   Do you want to break new ground in technology development and implementation in the District Heating industry?  The fault management and maintenance/renovation practices in district heating networks are currently limited to reactive or preventive approaches. These inefficient practices pose significant challenges to the performance of modern district heating systems. Furthermore, the aging infrastructure of many district heating systems necessitates constant renovation. However, the existing approach to renovation planning is suboptimal and lacks a proactive strategy. Addressing these challenges is crucial for improving the performance and reliability of district heating systems. We have an opening at DTU Engineering Technology for a PhD-student on developing Prescriptive Analytics tool for District Heating Networks addressing these challenges.  You will become a member of the AI, Mathematics, and Software research group at DTU Engineering Technology under the supervision of Associate professor Maryamsadat Tahavori from DTU Engineering Technology.  Responsibilities and qualifications Your primary tasks will be to   Conduct research in the intersection between academia and the industry  Write academic papers aimed at high-impact journals  Participate in international conferences and workshop  Disseminate research results and teach as part of the overall PhD education  Learn the role of the researcher and the specific tasks how to conduct research  Participate in teaching and student project supervision   The responsibilities may vary based on your profile and interest as well as project requirements.  You must have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree in fields such as Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related discipline.  We imagine that you are an ambitious, self-organized individual with curiosity and deep interests in how new technologies can be usefully applied in industry.  To succeed in the job, proficiency in programming languages commonly used in AI/ML, particularly Python, and familiarity with data analysis libraries, frameworks, and data visualization tools is essential. Furthermore, a solid knowledge and experience of using AI/Machine Learning, data analytics, data visualization or optimization is necessary. Finally, strong communication skills in spoken and written English are also a requirement.  We see it as advantageous if you have prior research experience and understanding of district heating (DH) networks, including their components, operation, and maintenance.  Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education .  We offer DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.  Salary and appointment terms  The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years with the starting date of February 1st, 2024.  You can read more about career paths at DTU here .  Further information  Further information may be obtained from Associate Professor Maryamsadat Tahavori ( marta@dtu.dk ). You can read more about DTU Engineering Technology at www.engtech.dtu.dk/English .  If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar “ PhD relocation to Denmark and startup “Zoom” seminar ” for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU.  Application procedure Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 7 December 2023 (23:59 Danish time).  Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English) including official description of grading scale  List of publications and maximum 2 examples of relevant publications, in case you have any publications  References (names and e-mails)   You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it.  Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.  All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.  About DTU Engineering Technology We work at the forefront of university-industry collaboration and develop tools and methods for technology implementation. We are organized in 9 research groups all focused on technology implementation, engineering technology and engineering education within a wide range of engineering fields.  Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Title: Data scientist for image analysis of biomedical data
Description: Create job agent    Available positions   Login My profile My profile                          Data scientist for image analysis of biomedical data   Do you have a passion for automated image analysis using AI and machine learning. AI has emerged as an important tool for studying complex disease endpoints. At Gubra we rely on advanced image analysis to extract quantitative information from large microscopy datasets. This is a fast-growing field, and we have a vacant position to advance and support our pipeline. So if you are motivated by working in a multi-disciplinary environment, this might be an exciting opportunity for you at Gubra.  You will be part of AI Technology that consists of highly passionate data scientists. The department develops smart and tailor-made solutions to understand and visualize biological problems in close collaboration with scientists spanning multiple disciplines, often with short yet realistic deadlines. Furthermore, our experts engage in scientific discussions, various data management and software development tasks. Gubra is an ambitious biotech company striving for excellence at all levels. We insist on doing things efficiently – and often differently - to reach the results we aim for. Our vision is to become leaders in the fight for a more sustainable and healthier world. We do that by facilitating the discovery of new medicines, and by acting and inspiring others to fight against the ongoing climate and biodiversity crisis.  You can work independently but understand that being part of a team is the way to success. You take ownership over your tasks and can transform complicated data to valuable interpretable results. You can explain your computational problem-solving and solutions to non-computational-science-experts to non-department colleagues and our customers. You have an eye for automation and validation of processes and constantly look to optimize tasks and steps that can be better solved by a computer than by humans.  The tasks include, but are not limited to:  Development and maintenance of our automated image analysis (2D and 3D) pipelines spanning raw data acquisition all the way to the final data packages for internal/external customers Establish QC and validation steps in our workflows to ensure high-quality data packages Support our CRO business with data analysis and scientific counselling and collaborate across multiple disciplines Facilitate communication between the AI Technology department and our sales department Take part in the daily scientific research, discussions, and presentations internally and externally  As a candidate for the job, you possess several of the qualifications below  A relevant master or Ph.D. degree Experience in processing and analysis of biomedical image data, using both classical and deep learning approaches Writing well-structured and readable code Can comfortably work in a Linux server environment Familiarity with statistics and common data science approaches Proficiency in version control in git, Github, Azure or similar tools Biological knowledge of e.g. brain, cardiac, liver, or kidney pathologies  As a person you are  Highly enthusiastic about data analysis and computational biology Detail-oriented and motivated by going the extra mile to deliver high-quality data Excited about new insights and data Keen to take on responsibility within your area of expertise Curious by nature, motivated by data and not afraid to challenge status quo Proactive and able to initiate, focus and deliver on tasks and projects Able to navigate and collaborate in an energetic and rapidly changing organization Appreciating being part of a collaborative team  Please apply no later than December 3, 2023 by uploading your motivated cover letter and resume on our website. We will be processing incoming applications continually. If you have any questions about the position, please contact Department Manager Casper Salinas at cgs@gubra.dk. About Gubra  Gubra is an ambitious and innovative biotech company striving for excellence at all levels. We insist on doing things efficiently – and often differently - to reach the results we aim for. Our vision is to become leaders in the fight for a more sustainable and healthier world. We do that by facilitating the discovery of new medicine, and by acting and inspiring others to fight against the ongoing climate and biodiversity crises. We have two primary areas of business: Preclinical contract research (CRO) services, and Proprietary early target and drug discovery programs. We are a biotech company delivering science to our partners and to our own research projects. We are active in the so-called pre-clinical space - before drugs are tested in humans - and generate our revenue by performing research for small and large pharma companies. Our focus is within the metabolic space (obesity, diabetes, NASH (Non-alcoholic steatohepatitis), and diabetic complications), where we specialize in in vivo pharmacology, peptide chemistry, molecular pharmacology, histology, stereology, imaging, NGS (next generation sequencing), bioinformatics and biomarker assays. We work with some of the most interesting and loyal partners and customers from across the world within big pharma, biotech, and academia. Through a constant focus on high quality, scientific excellence, speed, and solid teamwork we have established ourselves as a highly professional and competent partner in the market. People are our greatest asset, and our team consists of +210 employees all located in Hørsholm, Denmark. The mix of people from different cultures and educational backgrounds combined with our entrepreneurial mindset have greatly impacted our working environment, which is characterized by intensive drive, scientific curiosity, and teamwork – we join forces!  Apply   Share in your network                Deadline:  03/12/2023     Contact person:    Casper Gravesen Gravesen Salinas  Department Manager       Mail:    cgs@gubra.dk       Job area:  AI Technology    Employment terms:  Full time                                   Powered by Emply          Login  Have you applied for a job or created a job agent? Title: PhD scholarship in Computer Vision with Deep Learning for Human-Machine Collaboration – DTU Compute
Description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 PhD scholarship in Computer Vision with Deep Learning for Human-Machine Collaboration – DTU Compute        Kgs. Lyngby, Denmark                    Trending                                        Jobbeskrivelse   Do you want to advance the state-of-the-art research in computer vision systems using human-machine collaboration? The Technical University of Denmark (DTU) invites you to apply for a fully funded 3-year PhD position. The position is funded by the Sapere Aude: DFF-Starting grant . The position is offered at DTU, in the Department of Computer Science and Applied Mathematics, at the Visual Computing Group , and will work closely with researchers from the Pioneer Centre for AI . Project description Learning visual recognition models requires huge amounts of data, especially when relying on data-hungry deep neural networks. These data need to be manually and passively annotated by humans. This labeling procedure is one of the most important steps in a machine learning pipeline and is tedious, expensive, and susceptible to noise leading to erroneous labels. We aim to establish a deeper human-machine collaboration for all stages of the learning pipeline via multimodal labeling and learning. The goal of this project is to leverage information from different modalities that naturally occur near web images to assist the image annotation.  You will develop state-of-the-art multimodal models for self-supervision with human-in-the-loop text supervision. This PhD project will be supervised by Associate Professor (DTU). Responsibilities During the PhD program, you will:   Work with state-of-the-art deep learning computer vision models.  Develop state-of-the-art models for human-machine collaboration in computer vision.  Publish scientific papers and present research results in top computer vision conferences (CVPR, ECCV, ICCV).  Spend a few months during the PhD program abroad.  Work as a teaching assistant in courses at DTU.   Qualifications To succeed in this position, you should have the following required skills:   A master’s degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar in Computer Science, Informatics, Computer Engineering, Applied Mathematics or equivalent.  Proven experience in Python.  Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks.  High level of motivation and innovation.  Experience in computer vision is a plus.   Excellent written and communication skills in English. Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education . Assessment The assessment of the applicants will be made by Associate Professor Dimitrios Papadopoulos . We offer DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility. Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years; start in Spring or Summer 2024. You can read more about career paths at DTU here . Further information  If you have questions, you are very welcome to contact Associate Professor Dimitrios Papadopoulos at dimp@dtu.dk . If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar “ PhD relocation to Denmark and startup “Zoom” seminar ” for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU. Application procedure Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 2 January 2024  (23:59 Danish time) . Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae (CV)  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English) including official description of grading scale   Incomplete applications will not be considered. You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it. Applications received after the deadline will not be considered. All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply. DTU Compute DTU Compute is a unique and internationally recognized academic department with 385 employees and 11 research sections spanning the science disciplines mathematics, statistics, computer science, and engineering. We conduct research, teaching and innovation of high international standard – producing new knowledge and technology-based solutions to societal challenges. We have a long-term involvement in applied and interdisciplinary research, big data and data science, artificial intelligence (AI), internet of things (IoT), smart and secure societies, smart manufacturing, and life science. At DTU Compute we believe in a diverse workplace with a flexible work-life balance. Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Title: PhD Student in Wind Turbine Load Surrogate for Wind Farm Control - DTU Wind
Description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 PhD Student in Wind Turbine Load Surrogate for Wind Farm Control - DTU Wind        Roskilde, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   Are you a curious, self-driven individual with a strong passion for developing sustainable energy solutions? The Department of Wind and Energy Systems at the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) invites applications for a PhD position focused on the creation of a Wind Turbine Load Surrogate for Wind Farm Control. This is your opportunity to make a significant contribution towards improving wind farm efficiency and sustainability.  We need a passionate, curious, and enthusiastic new team member committed to addressing climate change through advancing renewable energy systems. We're searching for someone who flourishes in the face of complex problems, isn't afraid to ask probing questions, and possesses the grit to pursue innovative solutions in a rapidly evolving field.  You are a committed individual with a strong engineering or computer science background. You have a keen interest in scientific programming and machine learning. Your curiosity guides you to explore and understand the intricacies of wind energy systems, and your self-guided nature encourages you to push the limits of what is today possible for a better tomorrow.  You have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree.  As a PhD candidate, you will be tasked with the creation of dynamic and transient load surrogates that can interface with both reduced order models of wind farm wake flow and Dynamic Wake Meandering (DWM) type of engineering models. The aim is to develop versatile load surrogates that can predict time series or statistics of power and loads based on a range of data-driven/machine learning methodologies. Such models can accelerate the prediction of wind farm performance, and be used to devise sophisticated wind farm control strategies.  This project is co-financed by the EU-H2020 SUDOCO project , which focuses on developing new methods for the control co-design of offshore wind farms. In line with the goals of the SUDOCO project, the load surrogate should be capable of predicting changes in power and loads with respect to control set-points such as yaw misalignment, global pitch/RPM changes and cyclic pitch RPM.  You will get  the chance to work in one of the best Technical University Europe, at the Risø campus, the cradle and world renown campus of innovation and research in wind energy.  Furthermore, by being part of an EU project you will have the opportunity to meet regularly and work closely with a distributed team of experts, both from academia and wind industry located all across Europe.  Required Qualifications and Competencies  - A Master's degree in an engineering field or computer science - Proficiency in scientific Python programming - A background in machine learning  Desirable additional background knowledge  - Wind energy - Data-driven methods, such as SVD/POD and deep learning - Control or optimization - Wind turbine aero-elastic modelling - Wind farm flow physics (wind farm wake)  Wind and Energy System Department is a mission-oriented organisation focused on accelerating the development and integration of wind based energy systems. The System Engineering and Optimization (SYS) section work closely with experts from all across the department and companies to create simulation, design and control solutions for wind farm, wind clusters and hybrid-power plants.  DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation, and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.  Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programs at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study program, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education .  Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years.  You can read more about career paths at DTU here .  Further information Further information may be obtained from Head of Section, Pierre-Elouan Réthoré tel.: +45 21331293, pire@dtu.dk  You can read more about DTU Wind at http://www.vindenergi.dtu.dk/   If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar " PhD relocation to Denmark and startup "Zoom" seminar " for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU.  Application procedure . Your complete online application must be submitted no later 15 December 2023 (23:59 Danish time) .  Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English), including an official description of the grading scale   You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it.  Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.  All interested candidates, irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion, or ethnic background, are encouraged to apply.  Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                                  Senior Software Engineer   Cloud Services   |   Backend   |   Infrastructure   |   Data Science   |   Machine Learning  We are looking for a senior software engineer that can work alongside our data scientists to develop cloud-based analytics and machine learning solutions for the food production industry world-wide.  Scio+ is part of the SKOV A/S group of companies and we are the competence center for data-driven and vision-based solutions for the food production industry within the livestock segment. We provide production insights and predictions by applying machine learning techniques to discrete data and vision data from farm production sites. These innovative solutions focus on bringing added value to the production by optimizing processes, reducing cost and not least by reducing environmental footprint and improving animal welfare.  Working in Scio+  You will be a member of an international, skilled, highly motivated and self-driven team of software developers and data scientists spanning different educational backgrounds and competences. We do weekly sprint-like iterations, focusing our work on what adds value to our customers. We work as a DevOps teams meaning that we are responsible for developing, running and maintain our services.  We expect you to be passionate about development infrastructure backend and deployment of machine learning solutions. We value individuals who have an open and positive attitude towards colleagues, are ambitious about their work, and what we can achieve together.  You will be working together with colleagues in other development teams which are located globally in our regional offices.  What profile are we looking for?   You have a master's or PhD degree in computer science, engineering or in a related field  You are an experienced software developer (3-5 years+) that understand the challenges in designing and implementing and running cloud-based services  You have experience in delivering solutions using continuous integration and continuous delivery. It is beneficial if you have experience with continuous training of ML models  You have experience in Java, and it is a plus if you know .Net and Python.  You have experience with Azure or other cloud platforms like AWS or GCP  You have experience with Event-Streaming Platforms such as Apache Kafka or Azure Eventhub  You care about agile development processes and continuously improving velocity and applications  You like to foster the agile mindset within the group  You know the importance of data security  You are a great team player with a willingness to take responsibility in completing the different tasks for us to reach our goals together  You are flexible when it comes to tasks and able to keep an overview of multiple tasks in a sometimes hectic environment   What would you actually be doing?   Support, improve and maintain our current cloud infrastructure backend  Building reliable and secure data collection systems for experimentations and for production-ready systems  Create transparency on the health and the performance of cloud infrastructure for solutions in production and drive optimizations on operation and costs  Participate in chapter-work with other development teams in our group  Impact new products development on the infrastructure side   Join us  We offer a flexible work arrangement with respect for a healthy work–life balance for all employees, and a unique opportunity to make your impact on the organization as it grows together with you. We offer you to join social activities with your colleagues, also here we hope you might have a great idea for some activities.  Want to know more?  Please contact Recruitment Consultant Luqman Mohammed-Brown, phone +45 88 74 11 43 or by e-mail: l.mohammed-brown@frankgroup.com  Apply for the job  We are assessing applications on an ongoing basis, so please send your cover letter, CV and relevant attachments as soon as possible to Recruitment Consultant Luqman Mohammed-Brown by e-mail: l.mohammed-brown@frankgroup.com     Scio+ is an ambitious young company working at the forefront of data science in the food production sector. Our vision is to be a world class partner in data driven livestock yield optimization and our mission is to optimize livestock food production yield across the entire value chain by providing reliable data driven insights.        Apply for position  Application due: 12/29/2023  Workplace: Denmark  Position category: Research & Development        Share/Print    Questions regarding the position        Simon Binderup Johansen   Business Development Director  sij@skov.dk  +4572175588                                                                                ShareThis Copy and Paste

Title: Data Engineer - Machine Learning Research & Development
Description:

Vendors  Youtube, Linkedin      Accept these cookies  Decline non-necessary cookies                Career menu       Start    Departments    People    Jobs      Employee  Log in   WS Audiology  WS Audiology  WS Audiology APAC  WS Audiology Americas  WS Audiology EMEA   Candidate  Log in to Connect       WS Audiology EMEA             Facebook       X       LinkedIn       Mail            Research & Development  ·  Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark   Data Engineer - Machine Learning     Apply now            Join us in the newly established role and utilize your skills to advance the hearing aid industry with AI-based innovations. Does this sounds wonderful to you? Then have a look. Who we are At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services. Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world. With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes. Sounds wonderful? Then keep on reading The Team To deliver on our purpose to make wonderful sound part of everyone’s life, we are strengthening our capabilities with an additional, passionate, and purpose-driven team player in our AI Fitting Accelerator. This is a newly established unit, that is inspired by the opportunity to advance the hearing aid industry with AI-based innovations. You will get to learn a bit more about the innovations, that you will be working on, further along in the recruitment process. As it is a self-sustaining unit, it will handle the entire innovation cycle, from idea generation, through prototyping and testing, to product delivery. To do so, the team will foster a creative spirit while being on the forefront of newest technologies. You will be part of a team with an informal culture and consisting of skilled and dedicated individuals lifting together. The Role As our new Data Engineer , you will be building the bridge between our centralized data team (that are responsible for ingesting production data from various sources into a central data lake), and the AI Fitting Accelerator, by developing and maintaining a data eco-system that is the foundation of our machine learning projects. Main responsibilities and tasks e.g.  Ingesting production data, understanding the underlying hearing aid data domain, and ensuring development of a data model architecture that exposes the data in an interpretable way ready for data analysts, data scientists and other data consumers.  Collaborating with data scientists on machine learning projects by delivering curated datasets that are ready for predictive modelling, as well as seeking out opportunities where a data-centric approach can support move the project forward.  Building core infrastructure for data-driven products in collaboration with software and machine learning engineers.  About You To be successful in the role as our new Data Engineer you recognize that having quality data requires an understanding of where and how the data is generated, and thus what real-world process it describes. Therefore, you enjoy interacting with subject matter experts to understand the reality in the data you provide. You are a team player who seeks design feedback and engage in constructive discussions with your fellow colleagues. To summarize, we are hoping to see the following qualifications in you:  Master’s Degree within Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field  Python machine learning/data science stack (such as Torch, Tensorflow, scikit-learn, ClearML, etc.)  Distributed data processing frameworks (such as Databricks, Spark, Hadoop, etc.)  Cloud development and deployment (we use Microsoft Azure)  As person we expect you to be creative, have attention to detail, and a collaborative attitude that you see as a part of what defines you. You can work with a range of programming languages and tools, depending on the project requirements. You have a diverse computer science foundation that enables you to learn and apply new skills as needed. The corporate language is English, so you need to have professional proficiency in English both verbally and in writing. What we would like to offer you The working environment at WS Audiology is informal with helpful and skilled colleagues. Our values focus on teamwork across functions, pioneering as well as having the passion to make an impact. So, if you can see yourself in those values, you will fit right in. The benefits we can offer include an advantageous pension scheme with health insurance, sports and arts club as well as good canteen facilities. Our Danish headquarter, is a CO2 friendly and modern facility with beautiful surroundings close to Allerød north of Copenhagen, Denmark.  Sounds wonderful? Join us Please submit your CV as soon as possible. We will screen and invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, but the latest deadline is the 1st of December 2023 . In case you have any questions, you are more than welcome to contact Caspar Bang Jespersen at caspar.jespersen@wsa.com WS Audiology is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.       Department   Research & Development   Role  Global Innovation and Intellectual Property  Locations  Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark  Employment type  Full-time                  Contact  Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen  Talent Acquisition Partner - EMEA
