Title: Senior Software Engineer
Company: Brinch & Partners søger for Zenegy ApS
Description: Skip to content      Søg efter:    Forside Team Stillinger Rekruttering International Referencer Kontakt DK  Dansk English  Forside Team Stillinger Rekruttering International Referencer Kontakt DK  Dansk English Senior Software Engineer Zenegy, 12.607 Hjem » 12.607 Senior Software Engineer, Zenegy  12.607 Senior Software Engineer, Zenegy Jens Christian Jensen 2023-09-11T10:57:52+02:00 Zenegy Zenegy Senior Software Engineer – Payroll, Expenses, and Finance Join Zenegy and be part of our journey to redefine payroll, expenses, and finance software. Your expertise and passion will drive our mission to provide innovative solutions to organizations worldwide . Are you an experienced and talented software engineer looking for an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies in the payroll, expenses, and finance domain? Join our dynamic software company as a Senior Software Engineer and contribute to the development of our innovative, robust and scalable solutions. As a key member of our team, you will play a crucial role in designing and implementing Software solutions that empower organizations in managing their financial operations efficiently. At Zenegy, we disrupt traditional payroll and financial software. We operate on an open platform of innovation, integration, and user-friendliness, and we are growing rapidly. To support our growth, we are currently seeking talented and passionate colleagues for our headquarters in Hørsholm. You will be part of a professional and dedicated team with many exciting profiles. We highly value culture and community, and we mean it when we say that work should be fun. ”Zenegy is the ideal workplace for software engineers who are immersed in the Microsoft tech stack. This encompasses cutting-edge, legacy-free products built on Azure with .NET Core.” Says Yannik, Technical Lead. Role and Responsibilities: As a Senior Software Engineer at Zenegy, you will: Utilize your strong experience in backend development using .NET, .NET Core, and C#. Proficiently build .NET Core web APIs and work with RESTful APIs, gRPC, and SignalR. Apply your solid understanding of Docker and experience with containerized deployments. Leverage your extensive knowledge of Azure, including AppServices, Functions, Service Bus, Logic Apps, Application Insights, and Redis Cache. Work with MS SQL Server and Cosmos DB for data storage. Utilize Azure DevOps for source control, CI/CD, and project management. Focus on non-functional requirements, ensuring the development of high-quality and scalable solutions. Desired Additional Skills and Experience: In addition to the core requirements, we value the following skills and experience: Understanding of Enterprise Architecture principles, with a keen interest in software architecture. Experience in designing, maintaining, and optimizing large-scale SQL Server databases. Knowledge of Machine Learning and AI concepts, enabling integration of intelligent features into our solutions. Proficiency in frontend development using Angular for building user-friendly interfaces. Familiarity with mobile development using Xamarin Forms or .NET MAUI. Experience with payroll, banking, payments, expense management, or accounting software (not required but highly desirable). ”Zenegy is a fast growing new player in the market that challenge status quo when it comes to financial software. Our platform is cloud based and fully API enabled providing us the ability to provide true modular solution that easily integrates. It’s one product or the full suite – according to need.” Says Katrine, CTO at Zenegy.  Why Join Us: Collaborative and Innovative Environment: Work with a talented team of professionals in a collaborative and innovative environment. Impactful Projects: Engage in challenging projects that have a direct impact on the financial operations of organizations. Cutting-edge Technologies: Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools to enhance your skillset. Competitive Compensation: Compensation and benefits according to qualifications. Professional and Personal Growth: Professional growth and career development opportunities. Remote Work Flexibility: Enjoy the flexibility to work from the comfort of your home, a few days a week. Work/Life Balance: Maintain a healthy work/life balance. Social Environment: Be part of a good social environment with social events. How to Apply: Read more about Zenegy at www.zenegy.com , The application and selection process will be done in collaboration with Brinch & Partners. If you would like to know more about this opportunity and Zenegy, please feel free to contact Partner Jens Christian Jensen by telephone +45 2784 7405. In order to apply for the job, use the “Apply” option below. We look forward to receiving your application and CV as soon as possible. We appreciate all applications, but only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further steps. All inquiries will be treated confidentially. Location: Hørsholm, Denmark (Remote work flexibility available) Note: Relocation assistance is not provided by the company. Apply Jens Christian Jensen Partner +45 2784 7405  jc@brinchpartners.dk Tweet Share Share Tweet Share Share BRINCH & PARTNERS Hos Brinch & Partners leverer vi professionel og kompromisløs rekruttering af specialister og ledere. Vi lever af at finde og vurdere mennesker og er en naturlig sparringspartner for din virksomhed, hvis du ønsker at drøfte emner som Search & Selection og HR Consulting. Vi er en landsdækkende virksomhed med kontorer i København og Århus. Kandidatdatabase Vi løser en række af vores rekrutterings-opgaver uden brug af annoncering. Som et væsentligt supplement til vores øvrige netværk og metoder bruger vi aktivt LinkedIn og vores database. Hvis du har spidskompetencer indenfor bl.a. ledelse, salg, management consulting, økonomi eller IT er du velkommen til at registrere dig i vores database. Kandidatdatabase Linkedin LinkedIn har været en integreret del af vores arbejde siden opstarten af Brinch & Partners. Vi vil derfor anbefale at du linker op med os, og derved bliver en del af vores stærke netværk både i Danmark og Internationalt. Følg os på LinkedIn GDPR Compliance:  Læs mere Brinch & Partners København Højbro Plads 10 DK-1200 København K. Århus Mariane Thomsensgade 4B DK-8000 Aarhus C Kontakt: Phone: +45 7020 2328 Email: mail@brinchpartners.dk

Head of AI Solutions           Application Deadline:  Ongoing          Workplace:  Hybrid Position          Location:    Bjerringbro, DK, 8850   Mölndal, SE, 43124   Aartselaar, BE, 2630   Oslo, NO, 596   Almere, NL, 1327 AE             Contract Type:  Full-Time          Working Hours:  37          Employment Type:  Regular                Would you like to steer the development and execution of the AI and data strategy of the company that is striving to make a positive impact on global water and climate challenges?  Become our new Head of AI Solutions and enable us to unlock the full potential of our IoT data and build an AI powered portfolio !    What is the job about?  As a Head of AI Solutions, you will ensure customer value creation for the Grundfos Business Divisions by leading the AI Solutions team of Data Engineers and Data Scientists to leverage data and AI technologies. This should be done in close collaboration with stakeholders from business and the other development units in the Global Technology and Innovation organization.   Your main responsibilities :   Leading the AI and data strategy development with the Grundfos Business Divisions to ensure cross-organizational alignment on data and AI in digital products and solutions;  Setting the direction for a team of AI Specialists, Lead data scientists, Chief Data Analysts, and Data Engineers while ensuring prioritization of their tasks;  Ensuring that stakeholders are aligned and onboard with the AI strategy and data strategy that has been devised;  Facilitating solid collaboration with other R&D functions at Grundfos and establishing effective cooperation in developing new products for AI and data strategies;  Ensuring that AI development is protected by filing industry-specific patents - both to secure new applications and to ensure that our development is not in breach of third-party IPR;  Establishing efficient data pipelines to effortlessly collect, process, and analyse data, which includes managing data connectors and integrations;  Securing real-time and batch data is used effectively to keep our insights up-to-date and accurate;  Leading the team in implementing cutting-edge machine learning techniques such as federated learning and transfer learning, as well as supervised, unsupervised, semi-supervised, and self-supervised learning for model training and in-depth data analysis. This includes the exploration of reinforcement learning for optimizing real-time decision-making.;  Leading the team in creating and overseeing digital twins used to simulate and analyse complex systems;  Making sure that the team makes use of leading technologies like deep neural networks (DNNs), convolutional neural networks (CNNs), and graph neural networks (GNNs) to address complex problems in data domains such as time series data, spatio-temporal data, image data, etc.;  Driving the adoption of ML/Ops practices to ensure the efficient deployment and management of AI models throughout its lifecycle.     Your background  We imagine that you have:   MSc in computer/data science or other relevant AI-related education.  More than 5 years of large-scale, hands-on experience with applied AI.  More than 10 years of relevant work experience in business leadership and digital solutions preferably in the water technology industry.  More than 5 years of experience in Leading and developing people.  Experience working in cross-functional teams.  Proven experience in project and change management.  Fluent in English verbal and written.     What’s in it for you?  You’ll be an invaluable part of our global leadership team, a diverse network of pioneers guiding others in seeing possibilities, not problems. You’ll be instrumental in spreading our optimistic, can-do attitude to advance global innovation and a clear sense of purpose, embodying our six core values , guiding our colleagues in living them day by day, and making a difference in global projects. We support you in navigating your own career and development path, offering you tools to hone your leadership craft, both within your field and to broaden your interest or expertise in areas such as diversity & inclusion, coaching and culture.    In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:   Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly  If you’ll be working from your home office, we’ll make sure you are well equipped with a good workstation. However, you are always welcome to our offices where you can engage, learn, and have fun with colleagues  On the top of it, flexible working hours and up to 3 days’ additional paid leave for volunteering  Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes  Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development     Do you want to learn more?  If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume by clicking “Apply”.    To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube , and t o get to know some of your future colleagues and why they enjoy working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people    We look forward to hearing from you.            About Grundfos  Grundfos is one of the world’s leading water technology companies with more than 19.000 employees in 60+ countries all over the world. Our skills commit us to pioneering solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do, as we believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.  An inclusive team If you like the look of this job and know you can bring your skills to contribute to our purpose, please apply. We need and welcome professional people from all corners – however you identify and whatever your background is.           Apply now »    Apply now    Apply Now        Start applying with LinkedIn                  Start           Please wait... Data Processor:     Purpose:     Data Processor Privacy Policy:      Expiry:  a year    Name:  cf_clearance    Provider:  .insights.thehub.io            Your consent applies to the following domains:  insights.thehub.io, hubtest.io, thehub.io    Cookie declaration last updated on 08.11.2023     Please read our cookie and privacy policy   What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small datafile that is saved on your computer, tablet or mobile phone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful programs or viruses.  How/why the homepage uses cookies  Cookies are necessary for the homepage to function. Cookies help us get an overview of your visit to the homepage so that we can continually optimise and adjust the homepage to your requirements and interests. For example, cookies remember what you might have added to a shopping cart, if you have previously visited the page, if you are logged in and what languages and currency you want displayed on the homepage. We also use cookies to target our ads to you on other homepages. On a very general level, cookies are used as part of our services in order to show content that is as relevant as possible to you.  How long are cookies saved?  How long cookies are saved on your device can vary. The time when they are scheduled to expire is calculated from the last date you visited the homepage. When cookies expire, they are automatically deleted. You can view a complete list of cookies below.  This is how you can reject or delete your cookies  You can always reject cookies on your computer, tablet or phone by changing your browser settings. Where these settings can be found depends on the type of browser you are using. If you do change the settings, please be aware that there will be some functions and services that you cannot use because they rely on the homepage being able to remember the choices you have made. You can choose to not receive cookies from Google Analytics here .   Deleting cookies  You can delete cookies that you have previously accepted. If you are using a PC with a recent version of a browser, you can delete your cookies by using these shortcut keys: CTRL + SHIFT + Delete.  If the shortcut keys do not work and/or you are using an Apple computer, you must find out what browser you are using and then click on the relevant link:   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Windows 7   Remember: If you are using several different browsers, you must delete the cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  Should you have any questions or comments in connection with this information and/or our processing of personal data, you are welcome to get in touch with us. The cookie declaration itself is updated every month via Cookie Information . If you have any questions regarding the Cookie Information, you can send an email to info@cookieinformation.com.      Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         C++ software tester for MedTech company  Cystotech ApS  Aarhus  Student Part-time   Salary Competitive     Cystotech ApS is a Danish MedTech company with deep academic expertise in various fields of both medicine and AI, covering machine learning and computer vision, among others. At Cystotech, we are developing an AI-based support tool for bladder cancer diagnostics. We are looking for a software tester, student job or part-time , with C++ programming experience and experience with testing software. Must have C++ programming experience Nice to have (but not a must) Experience in creating & implementing test plans, protocols, and cases for both verification and validation purposes Medical device experience Knowledge in regard to regulatory guidelines Google Test(C++) experience System test experience Experience in Jira Experience in Scrum  For more information or questions please contact us at  jacob.elmose@cystotech.com   Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Near public transit  Easy access and treehugger friendly workplace.  Social gatherings  Social gatherings and games; hang out with your colleagues.  Flexible working hours  Time is precious. Make it count. Morning person or night owl, this job is for you.  Remote work allowed  You know how you perform best. Work from your couch, your favorite cafe or abroad when you feel like it.  Skill development  We want to take you from good to great.  Central office  Your local office is your anchor point, thus, we placed it centrally at your convenience.  See all 7 benefits  Working at Cystotech ApS  See company profile  Cystotech ApS is a Danish MedTech company developing a Medial Software support -tool based on Artificial Intelligence to help detection and categorization of bladder cancer.

The Company is a spin-out from Aarhus University/ Aarhus University Hospital founded in October 2021. The founding team have deep academic expertise in various fields of both medicine and AI, covering machine learning, Computer Vision, business development among others.
___

Bladder Cancer is the 5th most common cancer type world wide in men, and have the highest lifetime treatment cost per patient of all cancer types.

Bladder cancer has a high recurrence and progression rate. Worldwide 1.65 M people live with the disease and 550.000 new cases are diagnosed worldwide every year. 

In Denmark, approx. 2000 new cases are diagnosed with bladder cancer every year, and approx. 20,000 patients live with the disease in Denmark.  Read more about Cystotech ApS    Apply       We connect global talents with career opportunities in Nordic

And do you see yourself using your experience in Danske Bank’s newly established Group Data & Analytics team reporting to the Group Chief Data Officer ? Our team Our team is the Group Data & Analytics function for Danske Bank working with each of the businesses to accelerate the adoption of data and utilise analytics and data science to enhance our products and services to our clients. The Group Data & Analytics team consists of Data Management, Data Platform,  Analytics Centre of Excellence,  Data Programme delivery, Business Intelligence and Data Governance. Data & Analytics is one of the central enablers identified as a priority by Dankse Bank’s Executive Leadership Team (ELT) with significant mandate and support. What you will be responsible for The Head of Data Science and Artificial Intelligence will be responsible for leading the Data Science and Artificial Intelligence activity, developing the framework and standardisation for enhancing our data science, machine learning and advanced analytics practices.   This role will work collaboratively with analytics practices across the bank the develop and execute use cases which generate business benefits. What you bring We imagine that you have extensive experience as a recognised leader in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Analytics. -You are an expert in developing data analytics solutions, and with a strong desire to deliver on the mission and goals of the business. You value feedback, received as well as given as a way for you and the members to grow and learn. You appreciate a fast-paced environment where you bring your extensive experience with Data transformation Furthermore, you bring: Leader in Machine Learning and Data Science Techniques Proven thought leader in the space of ML, DS (AI) and Advanced analytics Proven Experience in delivery of ML and analytics use cases in a Banking context Experience in establishing Data Labs, AI, Analytics and Machine Learning Centre of Excellence in  European Banks Banking background Track record of delivering Banking data science, Machine Learning (AI) and analytics use cases We offer: An exciting job, where the tone is informal, and the form of collaboration is characterised by trust and helpfulness. The opportunity to work together with committed and skilled colleagues with the room to experiment and grow together as a team, and exciting opportunities to learn and grow personally and professionally. An important part of your job is stakeholder management, and you will gain an extensive network across the Danske Bank Group. Have we caught your attention? For additional information about the position, please contact Niresh Rajah at nirr@danskebank.dk . We will conduct interviews continuously, so we encourage you to apply as early as possible! Fascinated by 3D, cloud and machine learning? Love working with cutting-edge tools, on a blank canvas, and in unconstrained environments? Want to play a leading role as H3D grows from a profitable startup to an iconic scaleup?  We are looking for an ambitious 3D Developer who gets excited by these questions! You will report directly to the R&D Director and shape the DNA of our company.  Location: EU (Copenhagen or Dublin area preferred)  About H3D  H3D is an Australian Ph.D. research spinout whose mission is to make custom-fit devices (e.g. hearing aids, dental appliances) accessible to everyday people. We do this by providing AI technology to audio and dental labs – our Dental CAD , Audio CAD and Smartphone Scanning products – to grow their businesses and better support patients.  Since our product launch in 2021, H3D are growing fast and working with industry leaders such as Logitech, GN Resound, Modern Dental Group and many others. The company is backed by leading VC investors and has customers based worldwide.  What You’ll Do  Outcomes you’ll deliver:   Research, write, and document algorithms in Python/C++ that perform specific processes on raw 3D data.  Research and develop machine learning algorithms to improve the systems, we mainly work with PyTorch.  Write regression tests to ensure functioning outputs from our systems.  Work with product management to plan feature requests from customers  Give opinions and help drive the technical product roadmap   Who You Are  Must-Have Experience:   3+ years of Python development  Knowledge of 3D data processing  3D creation/altering/manipulation of 3d surfaces and objects   Nice-To-Have Experience:   C++ programming  3D Design using Blender  Working with Git, Docker, and AWS Lambda   Our Culture   Mission Driven: we value the social impact our work drives.  Balanced + Fun Loving: we value our lives outside of work, as we’re a collective of dedicated family members, surfers, rock climbers, musicians, travellers, and more.  Quick Movers: we value getting things done, with a bias for action.  Autonomy and Empowerment: we value independence and ownership.  Embrace Challenges: we value resourcefulness, facing ambiguity with comfort.   The Benefits   Impactful Work : your work will benefit patients and humanity at large, and you will gain a unique career experience.  Generous Remuneration : we value working with the best, and we remunerate accordingly. This includes valuable equity options.  Remote First + Flexible : we enjoy the liberty of living where we want and working when we want, with teammates spanning Ireland, Denmark, Ukraine, France, and Australia. Fascinated by 3D, cloud and machine learning? Love working with cutting-edge tools, on a blank canvas, and in unconstrained environments? Want to play a leading role as H3D grows from a profitable startup to an iconic scaleup?  We are looking for an ambitious Full Stack Developer who gets excited by these questions! You will report directly to the R&D Director and shape the DNA of our company.  Location: EU (Copenhagen area preferred)  About H3D  H3D is an Australian Ph.D. research spinout whose mission is to make custom-fit devices (e.g. hearing aids, dental appliances) accessible to everyday people. We do this by providing AI technology to audio and dental labs – our Dental CAD, Audio CAD and Smartphone Scanning products – to grow their businesses and better support patients.  Since our product launch in 2021, H3D are growing fast and working with industry leaders such as Logitech, GN Resound, Modern Dental Group and many others. The company is backed by leading VC investors and has customers based worldwide.  What You’ll Do  Outcomes you’ll deliver:   Assist in the development and deployment of web apps hosted on AWS, using common frameworks such as VueJS, Flask, etc.  Solve complex AWS cloud architecture to deliver reliable and efficient services to both web applications and iOS apps.  Help to improve our build and deployment processes to make iterations more efficient. We are fully AWS-hosted and use a range of tools, including ECS and Docker.  Collaborate with our product managers and customers to design, build and integrate new features into our systems.  Write both unit and integration tests.  Establish, maintain and document multiple API systems.   Who You Are  Must-Have Experience:   2-5+ years as a professional full-stack software developer  Language required = Javascript (VueJS, ReactJS, etc) and Python, with a demonstratable portfolio  Deployed and/or maintained at least 1 web-hosted app  Working with APIs (REST/GraphQL)   Nice-To-Have Experience:   Design and deployment of AWS cloud services (AWS ElasticBeanstalk, AWS S3, AWS Lambda, AWS Batch, etc)  Processing 3D data – e.g. visualizing 3D models in a web browser  Designing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines  Developing iOS applications or knowledge of Swift programming   Our Culture   Mission Driven: we value the social impact our work drives.  Balanced + Fun Loving: we value our lives outside of work, as we’re a collective of dedicated family members, surfers, gamers, rock climbers, musicians, historians, travellers, and more.  Quick Movers: we value getting things done, with a bias for action.  Autonomy and Empowerment: we value independence and ownership.  Embrace Challenges: we value resourcefulness, and facing ambiguity with comfort.   The Benefits  Impactful Work : your work will benefit patients and humanity at large, and you will gain a unique career experience.  Generous Remuneration : we value working with the best, and we remunerate accordingly. This includes valuable equity options.  Remote First + Flexible : we enjoy the liberty of living where we want and working when we want, with teammates spanning Ireland, Denmark, Ukraine, France, and Australia. Would you find it interesting to develop and define our best practices for validation of digital solutions and IT infrastructure, bringing your innovative spirit to our organization? Then you could be our new colleague - read more and apply!  The position You will be validation lead on projects of varying sizes as well as helping and advising other projects on how to ensure that our digital solutions covering apps, dashboards, as well as machine learning tools are all in compliance.  Your daily tasks and responsibilities will be to: •    Lead compliance activities on projects as responsible for the end-to-end quality and compliance for our digital initiatives •    Work collaboratively across functions with stakeholders and vendors to plan, coordinate and execute IT system and infrastructure validation activities •    Perform risk-based validation of GxP systems and infrastructure to ensure requirements coverage and develop validation documents in accordance with corporate procedures •    Have the ownership for the development and delivery of complete validation packages •    Facilitate verification and validation activities including automated testing, documentation review and approval  Finally, you will also be in charge of training colleagues in GXP and validation.  You will be the interface between the IT QA organisation and our digital developers ensuring that we follow best practices for qualification and validation. You will also feedback learnings and suggestions on how to improve the validation process.  Qualifications For this position, we are looking for someone that has worked with the guidelines provided by the global regulatory and authority agencies such as FDA, EMA and MHRA, in areas such as GxP, FDA 21CFR part 11 and GAMP Annex11.  To succeed in this role, you: •    have a Master’s degree in a relevant subject or a Bachelors’ with extensive experience •    have some years of experience with IT validation in a GMP regulated environment •    have experience within pharmaceutical Quality Management, have taken part of GxP system and/or infrastructure qualification and validation •    are fully proficient in English  Also experience or interest within Azure DevOps, software development and scripted/automated testing is going to be considered an advantage.  As a person, you are team-oriented, self-driven, proactive, and responsible. You are willing to bring your thoughts out in the open, creating a healthy discussion, and at the same time, setting a direction, giving and receiving feedback. You are looking forward to challenging the business processes by also collaborating closely with stakeholders, ready to operate in an environment that is subjected to frequent changes.  About the department In Novo Nordisk Digital Quality we are responsible for driving Innovation and Digital transformation across the Global Novo Nordisk Quality Organisation. We consist of a central team - that is responsible for strategy, follow up and support - and two departments: Process Digitalisation & Quality Data & Insights.  Process Digitalisation is responsible for making Digital Products that makes our Quality processes simpler and more effective. We have a tech stack that ranges from No-code/low-code to full stack. Quality Data & Insights are responsible for Data management of Quality owned data and providing valuable insights on Quality performance in an effective way to all levels in the organisation.  Our area is a group of engaged and highly skilled colleagues based at Novo Nordisk headquarters in Bagsværd, Denmark and our Global Service Center in India.  Working at Novo Nordisk At Novo Nordisk, we don’t wait for change. We drive it. We’re a dynamic company in an even more dynamic industry, and we know that what got us to where we are today is not necessarily what will make us successful in the future. We embrace the spirit of experimentation, striving for excellence without fixating on perfection. We never shy away from opportunities to develop, we seize them. From research and development, through to manufacturing, marketing and sales – we’re all working to move the needle on patient care.  Contact For further information, please contact Gustav Lind at gsl@novonordisk.com  Deadline 10 December 2023  Please note that interviews will be scheduled as soon as the ideal candidate is identified, so we encourage you to apply sooner rather than later.  You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.  We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.  At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing. Data Processor:     Purpose:     Data Processor Privacy Policy:      Expiry:  a year    Name:  cf_clearance    Provider:  .insights.thehub.io            Your consent applies to the following domains:  insights.thehub.io, hubtest.io, thehub.io    Cookie declaration last updated on 08.11.2023     Please read our cookie and privacy policy   What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small datafile that is saved on your computer, tablet or mobile phone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful programs or viruses.  How/why the homepage uses cookies  Cookies are necessary for the homepage to function. Cookies help us get an overview of your visit to the homepage so that we can continually optimise and adjust the homepage to your requirements and interests. For example, cookies remember what you might have added to a shopping cart, if you have previously visited the page, if you are logged in and what languages and currency you want displayed on the homepage. We also use cookies to target our ads to you on other homepages. On a very general level, cookies are used as part of our services in order to show content that is as relevant as possible to you.  How long are cookies saved?  How long cookies are saved on your device can vary. The time when they are scheduled to expire is calculated from the last date you visited the homepage. When cookies expire, they are automatically deleted. You can view a complete list of cookies below.  This is how you can reject or delete your cookies  You can always reject cookies on your computer, tablet or phone by changing your browser settings. Where these settings can be found depends on the type of browser you are using. If you do change the settings, please be aware that there will be some functions and services that you cannot use because they rely on the homepage being able to remember the choices you have made. You can choose to not receive cookies from Google Analytics here .   Deleting cookies  You can delete cookies that you have previously accepted. If you are using a PC with a recent version of a browser, you can delete your cookies by using these shortcut keys: CTRL + SHIFT + Delete.  If the shortcut keys do not work and/or you are using an Apple computer, you must find out what browser you are using and then click on the relevant link:   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Windows 7   Remember: If you are using several different browsers, you must delete the cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  Should you have any questions or comments in connection with this information and/or our processing of personal data, you are welcome to get in touch with us. The cookie declaration itself is updated every month via Cookie Information . If you have any questions regarding the Cookie Information, you can send an email to info@cookieinformation.com.      Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Senior Backend Engineer - Distributed Systems  Synthesia  Remote  Full-time   Salary Competitive     Hey 👋🏻 you can find out more by reading below or let Natalie tell you a summary here https://share.shttps://app.synthesia.io/#/video/52d39892-5843-4abc-8895-be8d50e61261     TL:DR  🎬 We are making the future and changing everything we think we know about video production  📌 The role is remote in Europe or US Eastern Time, or on-site from our offices (London, Copenhagen, Munich, Amsterdam, New York)  ⚒ Stack: Python, Flask, AWS, MongoDB  👩‍💻 We need senior software engineers that will can build features end-to-end, independently  💶 from €100k gross yearly + stock options (full-time employment only, no contractors)  🦄 We just closed a 90 million € Series C round with Accel and NVIDIA, and 70% of our clients are B2B, including a lot of Fortune 500 enterprises. We have a very high NPS of 71 and customer reviews of 4.8/5 on G2.  ⬇ Below, you find much more info and the apply button ✅  Who are we  On a mission to make video easy for anyone …  Synthesia is the world’s #1 AI video generation platform. Well, it’s actually a video production studio — in a browser. As in, no cameras or film crews at all. You simply choose an avatar, enter your script in one of 60 languages, and your video is ready in minutes. In Synthesia, you can build personalised on-the-fly videos, give your chatbot a human face or run 24/7 weather channels in different languages, to name just a few of the possibilities. 🎬  We believe the future of media is synthetic, and we are on a mission to turn cameras into code and make everyone a creator. Not sure what we’re talking about? Check out our brand video that explains what we’re doing at Synthesia in a way that even our grandparents * kind of * understand what this AI video stuff is all about.  About the position  The Avatars & Voices team is responsible for developing and maintaining our avatar inference, production and customisation as well as text-to-speech and voice cloning. In this role, you will have the opportunity to build a distributed system for user specific voices plus work on scaling the current product and shaping future projects in our pipeline.  We're looking for very Senior / Principal / Staff Engineer-level engineers to take ownership of workstreams and eventually build out teams.   Requirements    You have a minimum of 5+ years of experience working in software development  You have strong computer science fundamentals  You have experience building APIs and integrating with third-party APIs and service providers  You have experience building complex, resilient workflows involving asynchronous jobs on multiple services  You have experience scaling a multi-tenant SaaS backend to handle a large number of concurrent requests  You have a solid understanding of distributed systems and the challenges in scaling a distributed system  Ideally have a high-level understanding of the latest developments in AI and deep learning, especially around generative models for synthesising audio and/or video  Ideally have experience in building a SaaS product that involves handling a large amount of user-submitted audio or video data  Ideally have experience building a SaaS service around a machine learning model  Ideally have experience building a machine learning product with a large number of user-specific models  You are product focused  You have the experience that ranges from early-stage start-ups to bigger, well-established organizations  You like to take ownership of features and execute from planning to production  You are very pragmatic in your approach and you don't over-engineer  You are very good at profiling and debugging performance issues   How we work  We have a fast yet non-hacky development style. We work strictly with product managers who have a technical background. As a result, we do not overwhelm engineers with unrealistic expectations/requirements, and we can therefore move forward much faster. Well, we don’t have unrealistic expectations/requirements in the first place, since we see our roadmap as a set of high-level goals and we have no fixed timelines on deploying features - we want to get things to production as fast as possible. We do that by pushing features behind a feature flag - so not all users see all features, but our production is always updated. This brings zero-downtime deployments, backward compatible features, and similar challenges since our users should never be impacted. Our engineers have one sync meeting per week, async text Slack dailies, we have no dedicated QA people, we work in super small & independent teams, we have no Jira and in our team, we only have engineers, no code monkeys.   For us, it's simple: give people time to do deep work. And help specify features that are limited in scope while discouraging hacky workarounds.   It's early for us and we don't know how right we are yet. But after two years of building our product team and core engineering principles, we can see that we are on the right track. Progress over perfection.    Our stack & some context  We started to work on our main product - Synthesia STUDIO - two years ago with a very small team of engineers (BE and FS). We now have a functional product, that we develop, push forward and improve constantly. While we know, we have a long way to go, to bring our product to where we want it to be, we also have to be mindful of our existing userbase, which is also really involved with us and provides great feedback for each update and new feature we roll out. We have a lot of custom components and multiple layers of complexity, our product is constantly changing but if we try to sum up our stack:    Frontend is TypeScript/HTML/CSS using React.js + Redux;    Backend is a mix of Python, Flask, Node.js (for real-time collaboration), and C++ components (we have our own Chromium fork for headless video rendering) that are mostly containerized with Docker, and hosted on a number of AWS services (Lambda, Fargate, EC2, EKS)    We have a dedicated DevOps Engineering team.      The good stuff...  💸 You will be compensated well (salary + stock options + bonus)  📍 You will work in a remote-first environment with offices in 5 locations  🏝 You get 25 days of annual leave + public holidays in the country where you are based  🥳 You will join an established company culture with regular socials and company retreats  🤩 You get 4 weeks paid sabbatical after 4 years at the company + $10,000!!  🍼 You get a paid parental leave  👉 You can participate in a generous referral scheme  💻 You get a brand new computer of your choice (if that still counts as a benefit in 2023 🤔)  🚀 You will have huge opportunities for your career growth    #LI-SI2     Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Flexible working hours  Time is precious. Make it count. Morning person or night owl, this job is for you.  New tech gear  Are you a true Tech Savvy? Macbook, trackpad, you name it, we get you covered.  Paid holiday  Metropolitists, beach boys and mountaineers we salute you and pay you to go and explore the world.  Skill development  We want to take you from good to great.  Equity package  Want to be a partner? Look no further.  Near public transit  Easy access and treehugger friendly workplace.  See all 7 benefits  Working at Synthesia  See company profile  In a nutshell: we're building a video production studio - in browser. 
Here's our story 👇

Synthesia is the global leader in synthetic media. Our vision is to build the first fully programmable video generation platform and help everyone transform non-video content into video.

Synthesia is already working with some of the world’s biggest companies and celebrities such as David Beckham, BBC, EY, McDonalds and WPP.

Our investors include some of the biggest names in the business: Marc Cuban, Google Ventures, Kleiner Perkins, Seedcamp, LDV Capital, MMC Capital and more. Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Senior Machine Learning Engineer  Unumed  Copenhagen  Full-time   Salary Competitive     Senior Machine Learning Engineer  Unumed believes in a world where technology allows scarce healthcare resources to reach more patients with better care. To realize this vision, we developed Unumed HMS, a smart Hospital Management System based on a modern cloud native architecture. Unumed HMS is already being used to manage 30+ hospitals in 6 different countries in Africa and Asia, and we are planning an expansion to many other markets (including Europe). We are seeking a seasoned Machine Learning Engineer to join our AI and Data team. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in the development and implementation of AI algorithms and business intelligence solutions, that use the extensive clinical and financial data collected in our system to revolutionize how healthcare resources are utilized and patient care is delivered. Your main focus will be in our medical imaging initiative where, in collaboration with the AI Centre at the University of Copenhagen and radiologists from Rigshospitalet, we are building an AI decision support system for chest x-ray analysis. This system aims to assist radiologists by optimizing workflows and enhancing diagnostic precision. Your expertise will drive innovation, transforming medical imaging and improving healthcare delivery.  About the position  Our AI and Data team is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to build, deploy and scale the next generation of intelligent features in our hospital management system. You will be reporting to Marco, our Chief Data Officer, and will work closely with the broader engineering organization both on the x-ray project and on other ML/data-related features in Unumed HMS. Your main responsibilities will be: Be in charge of our MLOps, focusing on reproducibility, testability and seamless model deployment Improve our ML models and training infrastructure to allow for faster experimentation Build our model monitoring infrastructure Build and maintain internal tools that facilitate data labelling and data analysis Extend and scale the analytics and business intelligence functionalities in Unumed HMS Project manage the delivery of research with the University of Copenhagen  Ideally, you bring the following technical skills...  Expert knowledge of the Python programming language Strong software development skills (including git, testing frameworks, documentation) Proven track record of conceptualizing, building, and deploying machine learning applications to address real-world challenges Proficiency in MLOps pipelines and CI/CD tools (e.g. mlflow, jenkins) Experience with at least one deep learning framework (e.g. PyTorch, Tensorflow) Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure Hands-on experience with Docker Familiarity with Python’s data science stack (numpy, pandas, duckdb, ..) Knowledge of relational/non-relational databases  As a person, you…  Have 4+ years of experience working as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role Have university degree in computer science or machine learning Are structured and able to prioritize multiple projects Have willingness and demonstrated ability to learn about new technologies and industries Bring a positive attitude and new perspective Are a skilled communicator  Join us  We encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, so please reach out even if you believe you only cover 70% of the requirements. You will have ample opportunities to learn the rest! The position is full-time and starts as soon as possible. We offer a competitive salary and company benefits. We have an office in the city center of Copenhagen and follow a hybrid work model with flexible working hours. Want to have a life-changing impact and join the team that is empowering the human in healthcare? Click the 'Apply' button!   For more information or questions please contact us at  mf@unumed.com   Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Free coffee / tea  Get your caffeine fix to get you started and keep you going.  Near public transit  Easy access and treehugger friendly workplace.  Free office snacks  Peckish after lunch? We got your back with soft drinks, treats and fruit.  Central office  Your local office is your anchor point, thus, we placed it centrally at your convenience.  Paid holiday  Metropolitists, beach boys and mountaineers we salute you and pay you to go and explore the world.  Flexible working hours  Time is precious. Make it count. Morning person or night owl, this job is for you.  See all 13 benefits  Working at Unumed  See company profile  Unumed believes in a world where technology supports, enables, and empowers the human in healthcare. To bring about this vision, we developed a smart Hospital Management System based on a next generation innovative scalable software platform.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, with offices in various countries, we empower hospitals, healthcare professionals, and patients in Africa and Asia, allowing scarce healthcare resources to reach more patients with better care. Data Processor:     Purpose:     Data Processor Privacy Policy:      Expiry:  a year    Name:  cf_clearance    Provider:  .insights.thehub.io            Your consent applies to the following domains:  insights.thehub.io, hubtest.io, thehub.io    Cookie declaration last updated on 08.11.2023     Please read our cookie and privacy policy   What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small datafile that is saved on your computer, tablet or mobile phone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful programs or viruses.  How/why the homepage uses cookies  Cookies are necessary for the homepage to function. Cookies help us get an overview of your visit to the homepage so that we can continually optimise and adjust the homepage to your requirements and interests. For example, cookies remember what you might have added to a shopping cart, if you have previously visited the page, if you are logged in and what languages and currency you want displayed on the homepage. We also use cookies to target our ads to you on other homepages. On a very general level, cookies are used as part of our services in order to show content that is as relevant as possible to you.  How long are cookies saved?  How long cookies are saved on your device can vary. The time when they are scheduled to expire is calculated from the last date you visited the homepage. When cookies expire, they are automatically deleted. You can view a complete list of cookies below.  This is how you can reject or delete your cookies  You can always reject cookies on your computer, tablet or phone by changing your browser settings. Where these settings can be found depends on the type of browser you are using. If you do change the settings, please be aware that there will be some functions and services that you cannot use because they rely on the homepage being able to remember the choices you have made. You can choose to not receive cookies from Google Analytics here .   Deleting cookies  You can delete cookies that you have previously accepted. If you are using a PC with a recent version of a browser, you can delete your cookies by using these shortcut keys: CTRL + SHIFT + Delete.  If the shortcut keys do not work and/or you are using an Apple computer, you must find out what browser you are using and then click on the relevant link:   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Windows 7   Remember: If you are using several different browsers, you must delete the cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  Should you have any questions or comments in connection with this information and/or our processing of personal data, you are welcome to get in touch with us. The cookie declaration itself is updated every month via Cookie Information . If you have any questions regarding the Cookie Information, you can send an email to info@cookieinformation.com.      Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Full Stack Developer for an exciting AI beauty company💄  Compar  Copenhagen  Full-time   Salary Competitive  Equity To be negotiated    Who are we?  Do you want to be a first mover in BeautyTech and innovate the beauty market? Compar is a highly advanced machine, utilising AI and machine learning to help consumers navigate the beauty market. Our powerful engine identifies the consumer’s unique face and hair features, then unlocks a personalised beauty space filled with beauty products, in-depth match and ingredient analysis, guides, and trends that match the consumer’s features.  We make it technologically easy and efficient for consumers to identify their unique features and give them objective, scientific, and sustainable advice for buying and applying beauty products. All of this will be available in our mobile app…which you will be building!    Why work for us?  As a startup that is well and truly in its “scale-up” phase, we offer an enormous opportunity to be a part of the most exciting time in our journey so far. A full-stack developer at Compar will be helping the business realise its potential and leave a lasting, positive impression on the beauty industry.  We are still a small team, meaning you will get to work directly with our founder, Thea. You will gain direct insight into how the business works and what makes it successful. If you are interested in being up close and personal with the decisions and processes that make a startup business successful, then you will learn a lot at Compar.  Our office is located in central Copenhagen, making it easily accessible and surrounded by beautiful buildings and cafés. We also offer a flexible working arrangement but do require you to work primarily from our office in order to collaborate directly with the team. Finally, you will not only be offered a competitive salary, but also an opportunity to have a stake in the company (equity).    What is your role?  As the new Full-Stack Developer, you will develop the frontend and backend of our mobile application and assist with our admin web application. The role will morph into a CTO or Founding Engineer depending on the right candidate’s level of skill and experience.  Current Tech Stack: React Native, React.js, Typescript, Express.js, AWS, TypeOrm, PostgreSQL, Docker, Python    Who are you?    You are comfortable developing user-friendly cross-platform mobile apps from scratch on your own and have examples to show    Full-stack developer experience, with 2+ years of experience    Experience with building secure, fast, large, and scalable RDBMS    Experience with software development projects and frameworks like Scrum    Attention to detail, quality, testing, and obsession with pixel perfection    You speak and write fluent English (and/or Danish)    You live in Denmark    Degree in Computer Science      Required skills    React Native / React.js    Typescript    Docker    Relational databases and CRUD operations, preferably experience with AWS    Understanding of UX design principles    GitHub      Bonus skills    TypeOrm, Express.js, Python    Web scraping    Mobile app development experience with phone camera, images, executing Python scripts, authentication, notifications      HOW TO APPLY    We will be inviting candidates on an ongoing basis. Please send your application by pressing 'Apply'.    Answer the screening questions    Include your LinkedIn profile and CV    If we believe you are a match for us, we will invite you to a 30 minute conversation followed by a case test and a final interview in person at our Copenhagen office.    For more information or questions please contact us at  marko@thehub.io   Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Social gatherings  Social gatherings and games; hang out with your colleagues.  Equity package  Want to be a partner? Look no further.  Near public transit  Easy access and treehugger friendly workplace.  Central office  Your local office is your anchor point, thus, we placed it centrally at your convenience.  Free coffee / tea  Get your caffeine fix to get you started and keep you going.  Paid holiday  Metropolitists, beach boys and mountaineers we salute you and pay you to go and explore the world.  See all 7 benefits  Working at Compar  See company profile  Today's beauty market is a jungle to navigate, exactly 70% report experiencing choice paralysis when researching products for themselves. Consumers often choose beauty products that are wrong for them and contain harmful ingredients, resulting in poor beauty outcomes and wasteful consumption. Consumers are not aware of how their specific features have an influence on what beauty products are their match.

Our AI-driven app scans your unique face and hair features, providing you with personalized and scientifically-backed beauty advice. Discover the perfect products on the first try, save money, reduce plastic waste, and boost your confidence. With our intelligent beauty expert right at your fingertips, you'll access a wealth of knowledge beyond what a traditional beautician can offer.

Our CEO is Thea Emilie Larsen, a software developer passionated about AI, algorithms and Beauty. Data Processor:     Purpose:     Data Processor Privacy Policy:      Expiry:  a year    Name:  cf_clearance    Provider:  .insights.thehub.io            Your consent applies to the following domains:  insights.thehub.io, hubtest.io, thehub.io    Cookie declaration last updated on 08.11.2023     Please read our cookie and privacy policy   What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small datafile that is saved on your computer, tablet or mobile phone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful programs or viruses.  How/why the homepage uses cookies  Cookies are necessary for the homepage to function. Cookies help us get an overview of your visit to the homepage so that we can continually optimise and adjust the homepage to your requirements and interests. For example, cookies remember what you might have added to a shopping cart, if you have previously visited the page, if you are logged in and what languages and currency you want displayed on the homepage. We also use cookies to target our ads to you on other homepages. On a very general level, cookies are used as part of our services in order to show content that is as relevant as possible to you.  How long are cookies saved?  How long cookies are saved on your device can vary. The time when they are scheduled to expire is calculated from the last date you visited the homepage. When cookies expire, they are automatically deleted. You can view a complete list of cookies below.  This is how you can reject or delete your cookies  You can always reject cookies on your computer, tablet or phone by changing your browser settings. Where these settings can be found depends on the type of browser you are using. If you do change the settings, please be aware that there will be some functions and services that you cannot use because they rely on the homepage being able to remember the choices you have made. You can choose to not receive cookies from Google Analytics here .   Deleting cookies  You can delete cookies that you have previously accepted. If you are using a PC with a recent version of a browser, you can delete your cookies by using these shortcut keys: CTRL + SHIFT + Delete.  If the shortcut keys do not work and/or you are using an Apple computer, you must find out what browser you are using and then click on the relevant link:   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Windows 7   Remember: If you are using several different browsers, you must delete the cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  Should you have any questions or comments in connection with this information and/or our processing of personal data, you are welcome to get in touch with us. The cookie declaration itself is updated every month via Cookie Information . If you have any questions regarding the Cookie Information, you can send an email to info@cookieinformation.com.      Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Audio/Video Annotator - Generative AI  Synthesia  Remote  Full-time   Salary Competitive     Who are we?  On a mission to make video easy for anyone …  It is an exciting time to join Synthesia as we reached a hallmark by becoming a Unicorn , having raised $90 million in Series C funding and now evaluated at $1 billion!! ✨ 🦄  Synthesia is the world’s #1 AI video generation platform. Well, it’s actually a video production studio — in a browser. As in, no cameras or film crews at all. You simply choose an avatar, enter your script in one of 60 languages, and your video is ready in minutes. In Synthesia, you can build personalised on-the-fly videos, give your chatbot a human face or run 24/7 weather channels in different languages, to name just a few of the possibilities. 🎬  We believe the future of media is synthetic, and we are on a mission to turn cameras into code and make everyone a creator. To learn more, check out our brand video that explains what we’re doing at Synthesia.    About the role  We are looking for a detail-oriented and experienced Data Annotator to join our team. You will be responsible for both annotating in-house data-sets and ensuring the quality assurance of our outsourced data annotation deliveries.  Your key responsibilities will include text , audio , image , and video annotation tasks, following detailed guidelines. The successful candidate will be comfortable working with standard tools and workflows for data annotation and possess the ability to manage projects and requirements effectively.  This is a mid-level position with potential for advancement into data annotation project management roles.  👩‍💼 You will join a group of more than 40 Researchers and Engineers in the R&D department. This is an open, collaborative and highly supportive environment. We are all working together to build something big - the future of synthetic media and programmable video through Generative AI. You will be a central part of a dynamic and vibrant team and culture.  Please, note, this role is office-based . You will be working at our modern friendly office at the very heart of London - just off Oxford Street .  What will you be doing?  🚀 In this position, You will be collaborating with our Machine Learning teams to define requirements for data annotation projects.  We want you to:   Actively participate and deliver internal annotation projects for text, audio, and video data.  Manage data delivery for external data annotation workflows.  Conduct quality assurance to ensure the high quality of deliverables for our external annotation projects.  Ensure adherence to all project requirements and guidelines.  Communicate effectively within the team and with external parties when necessary.  Constantly seek improvements in data annotation processes and workflows.   Who are you?  You will have:   At least 3-5 years of relevant work experience in data annotation or a related field.  Strong digital literacy and familiarity with tech/AI fields.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite or Google Suite.  Exceptional communication and documentation skills.  Experience with presentation tools such as PowerPoint or Google Slides.  Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.     Nice to have tools/skills:   Experience with data annotation platform or software is a plus.     The good stuff...  💸 You will be compensated well (salary + stock options + bonus)  📍 You will work in a hybrid setting with an office in central London just off Oxford Street.  🏝 You get 25 days of annual leave + public holidays 🏥 You will have Private Health Insurance 🥳 You will join an established company culture with regular socials and company retreats  🤩 You get 4 weeks paid sabbatical after 4 years at the company + $10,000!!  👉 You can participate in a generous referral scheme  🚀 You will have huge opportunities for your career growth  You can see more about Who we are and How we work here: https://www.synthesia.io/careers   Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Flexible working hours  Time is precious. Make it count. Morning person or night owl, this job is for you.  New tech gear  Are you a true Tech Savvy? Macbook, trackpad, you name it, we get you covered.  Paid holiday  Metropolitists, beach boys and mountaineers we salute you and pay you to go and explore the world.  Skill development  We want to take you from good to great.  Equity package  Want to be a partner? Look no further.  Near public transit  Easy access and treehugger friendly workplace.  See all 7 benefits  Working at Synthesia  See company profile  In a nutshell: we're building a video production studio - in browser. 
Here's our story 👇

Synthesia is the global leader in synthetic media. Our vision is to build the first fully programmable video generation platform and help everyone transform non-video content into video.

Synthesia is already working with some of the world’s biggest companies and celebrities such as David Beckham, BBC, EY, McDonalds and WPP.

Our investors include some of the biggest names in the business: Marc Cuban, Google Ventures, Kleiner Perkins, Seedcamp, LDV Capital, MMC Capital and more.  Read more about Synthesia    Apply       We connect global talents with career opportunities in Nordic

Title: Senior Specialist - Test Management, Viby/Gdansk
Description: Press Tab to Move to Skip to Content Link  Skip to main content          Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates                        Search by Keyword                         Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates             View Profile                      Search by Keyword        Filter using country       Loading...        Country/Region    All                            ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:     Create Alert         ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:                 APPLY NOW »             Senior Specialist - Test Management, Viby/Gdansk           Location:    Viby J, DK              Are you a dynamic and results-oriented individual who excels at enabling efficiency within projects? Do you possess a natural passion for optimizing processes and motivating teams towards success? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!    In Arla, Global IT is a powerhouse of over 400+ highly skilled employees across Denmark, Germany, the United Kingdom and Poland. In addition to this impressive group, we work with approximately 800 consultants who are experts in SAP, Microsoft, cloud-based solutions, and targeted business needs.    “ As an experienced Test Manager, you will play a crucial role in fostering efficiency and productivity within project teams. Your ability to identify areas for improvement and implement streamlined processes will be instrumental in enhancing project outcomes” says Manager Jonas Lyngkjær Druedahl    About the job  As a Senior Specialist, you will be working with the project teams within the Arla Release Trains (ARTs) to ensure testing is performed at a top level. Your exceptional ability to identify areas for improvement and implement streamlined processes will be instrumental in enhancing project outcomes. By leveraging your strong analytical skills and strategic mindset, you will proactively identify bottlenecks, mitigate risks, and ensure the smooth execution of testing activities.  But it does not stop there. We are seeking someone who is truly passionate about the craftsmanship of testing. Your deep understanding and expertise in testing methodologies, frameworks, and tools will be put to the test as you navigate various technologies and global setups. From web applications to mobile platforms, from cloud-based environments to distributed systems, you will have the opportunity to flex your testing skills across a diverse range of projects. Your primary tasks will be:   Identify efficiency and productivity improvements and implement streamlined processes  Oversee and execute testing activities across various technologies and global setups  Ensure alignment with project objectives and deliverables  Stay up to date with the latest testing methodologies, frameworks, and tools to continually enhance testing practices and drive innovation  Monitor and report on testing progress, quality metrics, and key performance indicators  Identify areas for skills development and provide training opportunities for team members   We are working very closely with the business in Arla in cross-functional Scrum teams where business needs and IT solutions are matched to provide the greatest value to Arla. We are a multi-national, multi-functional and very dedicated team working truly agile according to the SAFe framework.    Who are you?  You should have prior experience with the agile culture and mindset, demonstrating strong knowledge of various software testing methodologies, such as Agile, Waterfall, and hybrid approaches, and the ability to tailor them to project requirements. You maintain transparent and open lines of communication and facilitate effective collaboration and sharing of information among team members and stakeholders across multicultural and global environments . With a personal ambition for success, you thrive in managing stakeholders and have experience in empowering efficiency in testing setups. Ideally you have:   ISTQB (International Software Testing Qualifications Board)  Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification  Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, with a focus on software testing and quality assurance  Extensive professional experience as a Test Manager or a similar role, leading and managing testing activities within complex projects  Solid understanding of quality assurance processes, standards, and best practices, such as defect management, test case management, and test coverage analysis  Familiarity with tools and technologies commonly used in software testing, such as JIRA, TestRail, Jenkins, Git, or Docker     Application and contact  If you want to seize this exciting opportunity, please apply as soon as possible, we are reviewing applications as they arrive. For additional information, please call Manager Jonas Lyngkjær Druedahl at +4591310071.    We have a purpose for Good  At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you?    BEWARE! RECRUITMENT FRAUD  It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails and fake recruitment campaigns on the internet from people purporting to work for Arla Foods. Learn more via this link .    #LI-FRJAG  Ref.: 90464                     APPLY NOW »        Find similar jobs:   Information Technology            Home  All jobs  Cookies  Arla.com                                © Arla Foods amba 2020                             " Privacy Preference Center When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information. Title: Software Engineer
Description: Eltronic Group A/S          Dansk  English    Log på Min profil Min profil                  Software Engineer   At Dynatest we are looking for an experienced and highly motivated Software Engineer. About the position As our new Software Engineer, you will be part of our R&D department consisting of twelve highly skilled software- and robotics engineers. You will be participating in the development of software, primarily, for our .NET desktop applications and maintenance of our current software applications. We work within the .NET developer platform, where we use .NET tools and libraries such as WinUI 3, Windows Forms, Blazor, Xamarin, Forms, Entity Framework Core, and ASP.NET Core. You will be part of a team that takes pride in looking out for each other and collaborating on finding the best solutions while working in balanced, interdisciplinary, and self-managed teams based on agile principles. Your primary tasks will be: Development of .NET desktop applications in C# that our customers use for collecting data from our test equipment and analyzing the data gathered by our physical products. Software testing, including unit-, integration-, and acceptance testing. Participate in the maintenance of current software applications through bug fixes or refactoring of the existing code base. The position reports to the Software Engineering Manager of Dynatest, and you will be based at our office in Ballerup. Professional qualifications You have a relevant education, perhaps a bachelor’s degree or higher in software engineering, computer science, or similar. You have experience with the development of .NET desktop applications using C# and are familiar with software development tools such as Azure DevOps and Git. We also imagine that you have at least one years of experience working in software engineering. A relevant master’s degree and familiarity with Azure would also be preferable. You are fluent in both Danish and English, written and spoken. Personal qualifications You are driven by working with software development, and you understand technical needs as you manage to turn these into unique software solutions. As a person, you are responsible, reliable, and self-driven. You have an eye for how processes are developed – and at the same time, you can stay focused on the task at hand. At Dynatest we appreciate sharing our knowledge and experience across our departments. We would like you to contribute to our positive working environment, where professionalism, reliability, and social interactions are prioritized and valued. We offer A very exciting position in a fast-growing, innovative, and well-reputed company that is the market leader in the field of pavement evaluation. You are offered continuous professional and personal development combined with great responsibility, flexible boundaries, and a salary package that corresponds to your qualifications. You are going to be part of a team with some of the most respected and trusted engineers and technicians within the business area. The organization is further characterized by an informal tone. Dynatest As a  part of Eltronic Group , Dynatest is an engineering company that develops and manufactures high-tech pavement testing equipment, and we export our innovative and fascinating technical equipment across the globe. We primarily produce precision equipment for non-destructive assessment of roads and pavement surfaces incl. their load capacity. Our clients are road administrators, advisors, and research institutes. We operate in every corner of the world from our offices and production facilities in Ballerup, Denmark, and Gainesville, Florida USA. Questions and application If you have any questions regarding the position, you are always welcome to contact Software Engineering Manager, Marius Amarandei at +45 4211 8962 or mai@dynatest.com . Please submit your CV and application. The applications will be processed on an ongoing basis, and we are hiring with start-up in February-March or as soon as possible hereafter.  Apply   Del i dit netværk            Dynatest value diversity and inclusion. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply regardless of country of origin, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or age.  Dynatest is the pavement industry’s global partner on pavement evaluation solutions. We develop, manufacture, and service equipment and software that defines the industry standard. With more than 40 years of experience, we deliver seamless 360° solutions based on innovative, market-leading expertise. Knowledge is the very backbone of Dynatest, and our know-how is one of our biggest assets. We are passionate about technology and pavement engineering and our employees are some of the most respected and trusted engineers and technicians in the business. In collaboration with our highly skilled distributors, we operate in every corner of the world from our offices and production facilities in Ballerup, Denmark, and Gainesville, Florida, USA.  Dynatest A/S is part of Eltronic Group A/S       Deadline:  27/12/2023     Contact person:       Marius Amarandei  Software Engineering Manager  +4542118962       Job area:  Engineering    Position type:  Full time                           Dynatest A/S Tempovej 27 DK-2750 Ballerup CVR: DK-40916458                         Powered by Emply          Log på  Har du ansøgt et job eller oprettet en jobagent?
