Title: Robotics Software Engineer – R&D
Description: Sorry, Internet Explorer 11 is no longer supported by SmartRecruiters    Please update to one of the following browsers:   Google Chrome  Microsoft Edge  Apple Safari  Mozilla Firefox     You can find details about supported web browsers here .       Robotics Automation Engineer - R&D Full-time Job Description Do you want to play a crucial role in developing near real time software solutions within robotics and automation technology on an application level? And are you interested in Artificial Intelligence and Vision?  As our new Robotics Automation Engineer, you will become part of a cross functional R&D team consisting of highly skilled people within vison, mechanical, electrical engineering, data analytics and software developers. We strive for a high competence level. The position is in Aarhus and you will have stakeholders within the organization, both locally and internationally Take part in a fascinating journey You will play a pivotal role in our journey by ensuring a high level of technology readiness and knowledge of robot and automation technology. You will be working on developing real time software and bringing already existing technology to a higher utilization level as well as creating new products and solutions. Moreover, your tasks will include: Be part of the R&D team, participate in project development as a software specialist. Participate in the entire journey; from product ideation through exploration, validation, and development to the first test installation at a customer. Develop near real time software using applied robot and automation systems with the marketplace of logistic systems and airports in mind. Often on an industrial pc level, Linux or windows based. Robot types like 6 axis Fanuc, Schneider, Kuka etc. Facilitate configuration and programming of applied robots and motion control. Participate in validation of relevant technologies Manage and organize large data sets and perform analysis and optimization Your background: We are looking for someone who is passionate about AI, vision and real time software and who is eager to put it into play in a robotics and automation technology context. We imagine that you might have: An education within computer science, engineering, physics or a related field Experience with robotics and automation technology – maybe from a similar or related industry Experience with near real time software and solid knowledge of C#. Knowledge of Python could be an advantage Interest in robot software and technologies in combination with vision applications You as a person In general, you are driven by technology, curiosity and willingness to learn new things, always with a proactive attitude and a high sense of quality. You work independently and take pride in keeping one step ahead of things and pay attention to the details. You communicate effectively and find it easy to work with others You are a robust and persevering person – and good at maintaining focus on long-term goals You are service-minded and have a corporate understanding. Would you like to play a committed part in our successful family business? Then please follow the link. If you have any questions about the job, please feel free to call Head of R&D Henrik Skyum at +45 20 15 13 80. We look forward to welcoming you!  Conveying, loading, palletizing, packing, sortation and distribution – BEUMER Group is a leader within the development and manufacture of high-technological intralogistics systems for global markets. Our employees stand out from others thanks to their ability to supply innovative solutions to our customers. They can do this because they know the industry and are passionate about continuously developing and expanding their knowledge. We support these high standards through teamwork, mutual respect and a working culture based on trust that fosters stability and security for all of our employees. Our common goal is to implement outstanding and innovative projects worldwide. Title: Dedicated ISMS Manager with a strong desire to improve the current practices
Description: Job description  Working at FOSS  Meet our employees  About FOSS    Apply                Dedicated ISMS Manager with a strong desire to improve the current practices                       Save    Company Profile     Follow   Following    Share      Are you a dedicated Information Security professional ready to take on a new challenge? Join our team at FOSS as an ISMS Manager and play a crucial role in safeguarding our organization's assets. This a new position at FOSS so this is your opportunity to help us establish the future role of our new ISMS Manager.  We hope you are a strong team player with an invididual drive  We are looking for an ISMS Manager responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining the Information Security Management System (ISMS) within the organization. This role primarily focuses on planning, coordinating, and overseeing security policies, procedures, and practices to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of sensitive information. The ISMS Manager is also the driving force in compliance with industry standards and regulations, such as ISO 27001, GDPR, and NIS2.  The ISMS Manager is part of our devoted QA department, to enhance the great synergies between the required management systems across ISO standards. Our team consists of nine engaged colleagues working across the entire organization. We are dedicated, ambitious, and aware that if all contribute and work together, our outcome will be better. We care for each other and love a good laugh. We are located at the FOSS Innovation Center in Hillerød.  You will gain an outgoing role, where you through audits, workshops, and daily dialogue will teach and guide your colleagues toward an increased understanding and focus on information security. So, your personality and mindset are crucial. You should bring a passionate attitude towards organizational security challenges and be a collaborative team player striving to continuously improve information security management. We expect that you bring a flexible and self-motivated mindset, engaged to create value for the FOSS Security program based on best practices.  Your main responsibilities will be to:   Maintain and further improve our Information Security Management System (ISMS).  Participate in regular risk assessments to evaluate and enhance our security posture.  Promote security awareness among our employees.  Maintain comprehensive security documentation, including policies, procedures, and security controls.  Continuously evolve the FOSS security framework.   We expect you to have the following qualifications:   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field.  Strong knowledge of ISO 27000 family, NIST SP 800-series, and similar security standards & frameworks.  Professional certifications like ISO 27001 Lead Implementer, CISSP, or CISM are a major advantage.  Prior experience in information security management and risk assessment. Plus three years in the Information Security domain, with an experience in Security - Management, would be preferred.  Being comfortable with technical writing and documentation.  Knowledge about security concepts for software development, cloud system operation, and office IT.  Excellent communication and leadership skills.  Proficiency in spoken and written English at a professional level.   We offer a global job in a successful team  An interesting and challenging job in an international relaxed atmosphere with a strong focus on successful strategy execution and change management. We emphasize a high level of personal drive and responsibility as well as success as a team.  FOSS is a global company, and we have strong cooperation with our colleagues distributed across the globe. Being part of the QA team at FOSS means that you will be working with super knowledgeable colleagues in a great team atmosphere, where we strive to be and act as one team – regardless of location, background, and roles.  Please apply today as we look forward to hearing from you  We conduct interviews regularly, so we recommend that you apply as soon as possible through the link provided in the ad. For further information regarding the job, please do not hesitate to contact QA Director Lene Uhre Hansen at +45 2761 6889.  FOSS is committed to maintaining an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. You can help us sustain an unbiased recruitment process by not including photo or age in your application.  We in FOSS are on a mission and we sincerely hope you will join us!  Today, more than 8 billion people around the world are dependent on nutritional food. Tons of food being produced in a million different ways and under varying conditions, creating challenges all the way from field to fork. One of them, obviously, being the effects, it has on climate change. FOSS helps the world’s 100 biggest food companies and more than 40.000 others around the world navigate exactly that with intelligent, data-driven and innovative analytical solutions. We are making sustainability a better business and we’re doing so as global market leader in our field – improving food quality, minimizing food waste, ensuring food safety and securing fair payment.  Join a pioneering and innovative company in the food and agriculture industry. A company on a mission, with offices all around the world and 1.700 talented colleagues from more than 32 different countries.          How to apply  Our goal is to make the recruitment process as professional and positive as possible. The recruitment process starts when you’ve submitted your application online. Vacant positions at FOSS do not always have an application deadline, so please apply today rather than tomorrow. The reason for this is that we want to ensure a fast and efficient process, which means that we review applications on an ongoing basis. Candidates who are invited for interviews will receive an invitation per email.   Apply                Sustainability is an integral part of our business  At FOSS, we have a taken a holistic approach to Sustainability. It’s not only about conducting our business in a responsible and ethical manner. It’s also about developing solutions that make a difference in the world. We help our customers tackle difficult global challenges such as efficiency in food production, consistency in quality and food safety.  We are operating in a world with significant population growth, scarce resources, food safety scandals and growing concerns about the climate. As the leading business-to-business provider of dedicated analytical technology, we play a key role in this environment.  For example, our technology is increasingly important in expanding food supply by making rational use of increasingly limited resources, while ensuring the best quality food reaches the consumer. To address this challenge there is a need for the development of solutions that analyze and make data manageable and actionable throughout the production process. Information management of analytics will be the future of the food and feed industry, enabling producers to increase yields by being more efficient. Intelligent and automated processes that run on data will define our customers’ future production - and much of the 10% of our turnover we annually invest in research and development will be dedicated to this area.           Working at FOSS  We work on a global scale to develop the people working at FOSS. We strive to enhance job satisfaction and motivation by constantly improving the competencies of our managers as well as following up on employee satisfaction.  We know our employees are our strongest asset.  Therefore, we emphasise, invest in and appraise our employees’ knowledge, skills and attitudes, and take pride in creating an environment with trust, confidence and development. We also believe that clearly defined objectives enable people to achieve their performance potential and that the support from the immediate superior is essential. Most important of all; trained, well-motivated and competent employees are a perquisite for success in the future. We manage by values, but also clear objectives, and follow up through regular meetings between the employee and the manager. In these meetings, there is also room to discuss career aspirations and other development opportunities including internal career moves.  You will have the opportunity for internal career development.  As a company, we are small enough for you to get high influence in the job, but we are also big enough for complex development and global careers. If you want to move in a new direction and continue to develop along with your professional capable colleagues, we offer the opportunity for internal career moves inside FOSS. As we are a knowledge-heavy company, this is a win-win scenario for both FOSS and our employees.          Philip from Sales and Hanne from Digital Business work close together  Philip and Hanne share their experience working in a business culture that encourages collaboration between many different colleagues, from research and development to global sales, across departments and countries.        Follow Søren during his work day  Søren is a Project Manager in Research & Development. In this video Søren shares how his career at FOSS has developed from student help to chemist to project manager. The project manager position is a very diverse job that involves bringing together a team of specialists with different skill sets with the shared goal of developing new and better products.           Work with creative and professionally strong colleagues.  Teamwork is essential to FOSS. By developing solutions in cross-functional teams, we integrate knowledge, experience and competences from many perspectives to achieve great results. We communicate in a straight-forward manner and solve challenges together. In FOSS, we truly value that you voice your opinion, take responsibility and ownership. Our company size in turn allows for independent, dynamic and fast decisions.  If you join FOSS, we promise you that you will enter an environment with new learnings through projects, new technologies and market opportunities. We love to be entrepreneurial and open-minded to new ideas, and if you get a good idea – you can bring it forward.  Join a company with a clear business idea and purpose, but also strong values.  In a global world with a growing population, there is an ever-increasing demand for safer food, production that is more efficient and less food waste. Globally, we need to produce as much food the next 40 years as the last 8,000 years to meet the needs of a growing population and declining natural resources. A huge challenge, which requires that we become better at utilizing the resources available.  The business vision of FOSS to contribute to a more sustainable use of increasingly valuable agricultural resources, and to the nutrition and health of the people of the world. We provide the industry’s best analytics, which add value to our customers by improving quality and optimising food and agricultural production.  Join FOSS, and you will be part of this mission, more relevant today than ever.         Meet our employees        Meet Mette   Mette has just started in a new position as Head of Market Management in FOSS. She comes from a position as launch manager today and has been with FOSS for more than 14 years. During this time she has been in 7 different positions at 3 different departments.   A great journey  “A great journey” Mette sums up. Mette’s openness towards new opportunities, combined with her experience and unique qualifications has recently got her the position as Head of Market Management in Sales & Marketing.   Mette emphasizes the benefits of internal career development: “You have the ability to transfer knowledge from your prior position into a new, gain a deeper organizational understanding and build a greater network. This makes it easier to create results”.                 Meet Jan – manager of Concept Development in Research & Development  Jan’s daily work as a manager in Concept Development consists of generating new ideas in collaboration with his team and deciding which ideas should be developed. The daily challenge of finding the right solutions to address the needs of our customers is solved by a diverse and competent group of specialists working together.       Meet Mariana – Chemometrician in Research & Development  Mariana is a Spanish Chemometrician specialised in NIR. Coming from a research background her move to FOSS was motivated by a desire to work with real products and real customers. AT FOSS she is involved in the innovation of new products, developing calibrations for the EyeFoss image analysis grain analyser.          About FOSS  FOSS creates end-to-end solutions that secure and improve food quality. From raw material to finished product. Our analysis instruments refine measurements into information management that enables businesses to run intelligent data-driven productions with less waste and bigger yields. Controlling cost and quality across all sectors and value chains, we help food and agricultural producers limit the number of human errors, scale their business faster and reduce manual labour as well as labour costs. We call it analytics beyond measure.  Over the last 60 years, we have made it our business to define the standard of analytical solutions for the food and agricultural industry. We pioneered advanced analysis for the challenging production environments in the 1960’s, and we were the first to integrate chemical composition analysis in process lines. Now our resolve and ambition have also made us the international benchmark in the field of chemometrics and real time analytics.  FOSS is a 100% family-owned company and the leading supplier of innovative analytical solutions; 98 percent of FOSS’ business is generated outside Denmark. FOSS has more than 100 patents and more than 20 world-first product introductions. FOSS employs more than 1700 dedicated people worldwide and has manufacturing, research and development facilities in Denmark and China. Solutions are sold and supported through FOSS sales and service companies in 28 countries and by more than 75 distributors. Many employees have a top-level scientific or technical background, including more than 130 Master of Science and more than 20 PhDs in areas such as photonics, chemometrics, physical chemistry, analytical chemistry, fermentation and bio-engineering, astrophysics, optical communication, physics, quality, nanotechnology, food science and adaptive radiotherapy. We also employ many factory-trained and certified support engineers stationed close to our customers.                               FOSS  Foss Allé 1  DK-3400 Hilleroed  Denmark    Phone: +45 70 10 33 70  E-mail: info@foss.dk                                Ansvarlig brug af dine oplysninger    ×     Jobindex ønsker at tilbyde en service, der giver dig den bedste oplevelse. Upload your resume Let your resume search for jobs Drag & drop file .doc, .docx, .pdf or .rtf or Select file or Build your resume When you upload your resume: Jobs will be labeled when they're a good or great match Great matches will be shown first in search results Relevant skills and experience will be listed so you know why those jobs are a match Project Manager - Software Implementation Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Mobility Hybrid Supplier Collaboration Digitalization IT Expert (f/m/d) Munich, Bayern, Germany and 15 more Information Technology Flexible Location Hybrid Energy Engineer Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Smart Infrastructure Servicetekniker Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Smart Infrastructure Projekttekniker CTS/BMS til kunder i pharmaindustrien Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Smart Infrastructure Hybrid Projektleder (teknisk) CTS/BMS til kunder i pharmaindustrien Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Smart Infrastructure Service Technician Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Digital Industries Remote PA to the head of Nordic, Smart Infrastrucutre Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Smart Infrastructure Finance Business Partner Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Smart Infrastructure Hybrid Økonomielev Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Controlling and Finance Head of Operations GBS H2R Denmark Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Global Business Services Show More Positions Project Manager - Software Implementation Ballerup, Hovedstaden, Denmark Hybrid Apply Now Job Description Job ID 388578 Company Siemens Mobility A/S Organization Mobility Job Family Research & Development Experience Level Mid-level Professional Full Time / Part Time Full-time Remote vs Office Hybrid (Remote/Office) Contract Type Permanent As A Software Project Manager You will be responsible for the planning, organizing, monitoring, and overseeing data warehouse deliveries in Metro projects. In this role you will coordinate the project stakeholders and empower the project team to achieve the targets. Technical background in the rail domain would be an advantage. You will take the lead on the following: Building and maintaining close relation based on trust and efficient communication with interface and contact    partners along the project organization and the project team Execution of multiple projects according to the agreed requirements, from project and resource planning to the successful completion and maintenance of the project Alongside the project team, track, and report on progress to work delivery, schedule, and change requests against the plan and adjust consistently with plan objectives Product ownership of the local data warehouse solutions including backlog handling About you You hold a bachelor’s degree or higher (electrical engineering, software engineering, industrial engineering, data engineering) with great command of English (Danish and/or German can give you an advantage). Also, you have about five years’ experience as a Software Project Manager with a strong background in Data Engineering. The following technical skills hold no secrets for you: Technical background in software interfaces, server technologies, where you are used to leading software projects (DevOps, Agile), software interfaces and server technologies Knowledge of Rail infrastructure, Siemens Mobility Portfolio and SW hardware is of advantage Very good skills as project manager including professional handling of PM tools, e.g. Office 365, Jira Stakeholder management comes naturally to you Your personality You have excellent interpersonal skills: the ability to work well with people from many different fields with varying degrees of technical experience; competence in clear, concise, and thoughtful communication with management, partners, peers, and staff Good presentation and communication skills Thrives in an international environment are a matter of course for you Excellent people leadership skills Conceptual analytical thinking and solution-oriented Adaptability and flexibility include the ability to manage deadline pressure, ambiguity, and change We offer Siemens Mobility Denmark is an open and dynamic workplace where employee development is high on the agenda. We have interesting career possibilities in an international work environment with lots of interesting challenges. Our success is based on our skilled and innovative employees, using their curiosity and high professional competences to create new knowledge and participate in answering some of the toughest questions in the world. Meet your future colleagues here . We prioritize accountability for the health and well-being of our employees, and offer many employee benefits such as training facilities, company clubs and a stock program. In addition, we have favorable pension conditions with health insurance for you and your family. We work with work-life balance to create mutual and flexible working conditions, where you can also work from home a few days a week. Otherwise, you can look forward to working from our open and bright offices in Ballerup. What else do you need to know? We recruit great minds from all walks of life. We embrace diversity and create what’s right for the world by employing the people who live in it. We continuously strive to strengthen our position, and we are therefore looking for bright minds eager to join a dynamic, international organization offering unique opportunities for its employees. We’re looking for forward-thinking teammates with the aptitude and attitude to succeed in the world of Rail. Think this is you? Join us! We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we are continuously processing applications. For further information, please contact Engineering Head Tina Bosse christina.bosse@siemens.com  If you have questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Senior Talent Acquisition Partner Rikke Pihl at rikke.pihl@siemens.com. Title: Business Change Manager - Gdansk or Viby
Description: Press Tab to Move to Skip to Content Link  Skip to main content          Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates                        Search by Keyword                         Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates             View Profile                      Search by Keyword        Filter using country       Loading...        Country/Region    All                            ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:     Create Alert         ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:                 APPLY NOW »             Manager - Business Change Management - Gdansk or Viby           Location:    Gdansk, PL   Viby J, DK              Catch this exciting opportunity to join Arla's Global IT team. With over 200+ highly skilled IT specialists and 800 expert consultants, we are transforming the future of dairy products while making a meaningful impact on people's lives.  But here at Arla, we're not just about making some of the world's most beloved dairy products. We're about making healthy taste delicious, making mornings worth getting out of bed for, and making family dinners unforgettable. Our iconic brands, such as Arla®, Castello®, and Lurpak®, are more than just products; they're an integral and natural part of modern life in over 100 countries around the globe.  We are looking for an experienced and inspiring Business Change Manager to secure the implementation of innovative IT initiatives, guiding colleagues at all levels through their change path.    About the job:  As Business Change Manager in Arla, you will become part of Dairy Art. This department supports the organization across functions with Production IT.  Your responsibility will be to ensure business adaption in the roll-out and implementation of IT solutions to support the new ways of modern working. You do so by analyzing how changes will affect our business and identifying, involving, and collaborating with key stakeholders to enable the changes needed. And as such, we rely heavily on your ability to inspire, prepare, and mobilize the organization for the changes to come.    Specifically, you will:    Work closely with our Business Change Management Lead, Business Change Manager colleagues and other team members to ensure coordinated efforts    Create stakeholder mappings and ensure clear communication to different levels of stakeholders    Lead team towards business to secure optimal use and utilisation of the implemented solutions/systems    Manage the function/team budget and resources    Prepare stakeholder management and end user adoption plans    Facilitate workshops to create understanding of the changes    Produce communication materials and run training sessions    Set and follow up on initiatives    Support other ad hoc change initiatives      Who are you?  We expect you to have minimum 3 years of experience from a similar position. You possess a good business and process understanding and are able to understand IT technical solutions on an overall level. As you will become part of an international setup, we expect you to be fluent in English, verbally as well as in written.    Due to the challenges in implementing and communicating business changes, you utilize your strong communication and relationship building skills to influence and ensure effective collaboration with all levels across the Arla organization. You possess the empathy to handle and understand human elements in transformational change efforts. You are open-minded and thrive in a role, where you interact with colleagues at all levels and across national borders.    What do we offer?  The area of modern ways of working is developing faster than any other area. We offer you a chance to join a fast-moving department that is constantly developing, inventing new ways to secure business engagement and awareness. We are offering an informal environment with high degree of empowerment combined with several interesting possibilities and challenges.  At Arla, we value our IT specialists and provide a range of attractive benefits to support your personal and professional growth:  · Trainings with industry experts and a comprehensive induction program.  · Financial support for ongoing education and professional development.  · Flexibility in working hours and the option to work from home.  · Medical care and life insurance coverage.  · Employee Assistance Program offering legal, psychological, health, and financial consulting.  · Additional perks like gym memberships, vouchers, travel points, and cinema tickets.  · Home kit including a monitor, laptop, keyboard, mouse, headsets, and webcam.  · Relaxation breaks to recharge and maintain work-life balance.  · Relocation allowance for a smooth transition to our vibrant city.  · Referral program for employees to earn rewards by recommending top talent.  · Additional holiday days based on length of employment (up to 4 days).    Apply now!   If you want to facilitate innovation and help shape the industry, then seize this exciting opportunity. Please apply as soon as possible as we will process applications on a continuous basis and close the recruitment once the right candidate is found.     We have a purpose for Good  At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you? Description: 31.200 job i dag         For jobsøgere    For arbejdsgivere     DA    EN          Log ind  Opret profil                Jobsøgning       Søg job Vælg mellem flere søgekriterier    Din side Skab overblik over din jobsøgning      Jobagent Få nye job direkte i din indbakke    CV Opret dit CV og bliv headhuntet      QuickApply-profil Søg jobbet nemt fra mobilen    Jobannoncearkiv Find inspiration i udløbne jobopslag      Få en jobvejleder Bliv afklaret i din jobsøgning    Jobs For Ukraine Hjælper ukrainske flygtninge med at få job        Arbejdspladser       Se virksomhedsprofiler Få viden om din næste arbejdsplads      Evaluér arbejdsplads Hvordan er din arbejdsplads? Stresstest Mål dit stressniveau      Talenttest Find dine arbejdstalenter        Guides       Ansøgninger Sådan skriver du en god ansøgning    CV Få de bedste tips til dit CV      Jobsamtale Gør et godt indtryk til samtalen    Lønforhandling Stå stærkt til lønforhandlingen      Opsigelse Brug denne guide og kom godt videre    Uopfordret ansøgning Sådan søger du uopfordret      Dit første job Værktøjer og tips til dit nye arbejdsliv    Jobglæde Sæt jobglæde på agendaen        Kurser       6 ugers jobrettet uddannelse Opgrader dine kompetencer      Jobsøgningskursus Skab struktur i din jobsøgning              For arbejdsgivere    Tilmeld dig Jobindex    Switch to English        Log ind  Opret profil                    Søg job       Gemte job       Jobagent       Mere     Overblik   Ansøgninger   Henvendelser   CV   QuickApply-profil   Virksomheder   Råd og vejledning   Indstillinger          Save  Share  Apply        Partisia Applications ApS    Aarhus     Share    Save      Sr. Marketing Manager for Partisia    Are you interested in being part of branding and promoting the future of privacy-enhancing technologies? Do you want to be a part of a team establishing the next big B2B initiative? Partisia is changing the way we interact with private data around the globe as we are building a new, emerging business to solve some of the biggest challenges of the future.  We are looking for an innovative, resourceful and collaborative Sr. Marketing Manager to be the first to join the Marketing Operations team. Our new colleague will take on the unique opportunity to shape and own the marketing tech stack, managing marketing and communication technologies, including email, automation and marketing analytics solutions at a global scale. You will guide strategy and solutions for improvements to existing tools and platforms, and drive integrations with other internal teams’ data.  You are a data-driven, organized and passionate individual, who can effectively drive a vision and build the brand strategy through multiple channels. A proven track record in taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced, dynamic business environment is strongly preferred.  Our ideal candidate can   Work at both strategic and tactical levels to champion bold, innovative automation, creating and communicating a vision for long- and short-term marketing operations requirements  Leverage automation to improve processes and productivity and make recommendations to support an organization scaling at a rapid pace  Manage complex roadmaps gracefully and balance contending priorities in a constantly changing environment  Collaborate closely with technical teams, marketing and communication stakeholders and international counterparts to deliver tools and templates that can scale globally   Basic Qualifications   Experience in managing high-performing teams  Project delivery experience, lead management, or demand generation operations (e.g. integrating new 3rd party tools, migrating CRM or marketing automation platforms)  Experience with central sales tools (e.g. Salesforce) and/or marketing automation systems (e.g. Pardot/Marketo) including setting up end-to-end Marketing Automation data flows  Bachelor’s degree or similar in Marketing, Business, or a relevant field of study  Experience in using data and metrics to measure impact and determine improvements   Preferred Qualifications   Familiarity with SQL; experience with analytical tools such as Tableau and ability to dive deep into and create metrics and reporting  Project management skills with a track record of delivering on-time, within-budget initiatives that meet and achieve goals  Dedicated self-starting and team-oriented colleague who flourishes with working in ambiguous, complex and challenging environments of a rapidly evolving business  Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English  Ability to manage multiple parallel projects and deliver quality releases on schedule   Key job responsibilities   Implement and manage marketing and communication technologies, including email, automation, and marketing analytics solutions that accelerate marketing effectiveness  Own and establish best practices for marketing technology infrastructure, including database/lead management, data hygiene and enrichment, system governance and security, campaign creation, reporting, and integrations with first-party and third-party systems  Develop technology solutions that enable customer segmentation and personalization at scale  Identify opportunities for automating ingestion of data into and out of marketing tools  Define and manage marketing tracking and attribution at scale, develop reporting dashboards, and prioritize work with BI and BA  Building effective lead scoring and management processes  Train and support coming Marketing team members, developing best practices and materials to standardize and scale campaign activations  Work closely with cross-functional teams to enable smooth data flows and integrated reporting between related tools.   Working at Partisia  We are a young, enthusiastic and welcoming organization delivering high-quality solutions. We value quality over speed, as we believe our platform must endure the test of time and strive to make long-term solutions while keeping the technical debt at a minimum.  Our office is located in the heart of IT-byen Katrinebjerg (the IT city of Aarhus) next to the Department of Computer Science. At the beginning of your employment with us, you will be working at the office on an everyday basis with your colleagues to ensure you become well-integrated into the team. We support working from home, and once you become confident with your tasks and the team, we support a high degree of flexibility in planning your work, so you can make all ends meet professionally as well as privately.  You will work in the Partisia group. We have worked with commercial use of advanced cryptography such as Secure Multiparty Computation and Blockchain technologies for more than 10 years together with partners and customers all over the world ranging from Tokyo to the US. We have a close relationship with the research community and the scientists in Partisia, the Alexandra Institute, the Department of Computer Science in Aarhus as well as the ecosystem around the newly established public blockchain Partisia Blockchain. Big Data Engineer           Application Deadline:            Workplace:  Hybrid Position          Location:    Bjerringbro, DK, 8850             Contract Type:  Full-Time          Working Hours:  37          Employment Type:  Regular                This is a fantastic opportunity for a junior person to learn and grow.  We have a startup mindset in this department, with deep knowledge in cloud, snowflake and Ml learning and AI application development. We are customer minded and are building critical function/capability for the future of Grundfos digital products.    What is the job about?  As a Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in building and evolving our data platform to drive advanced digital capabilities for our future product s.  You will be at the forefront of designing and developing robust data models  and pipelines , collaborating closely with Data Scientist s , Data Analysts and Application development teams  to ensure smooth data service .     Your main responsibilities :   Data Model and Pipeline:    Design and implement data ingestion and delivery service towards data providers and consumers, such as IoT data from pumps/systems, asset master data, weather forecasts, ML models, application teams, dashboards, data scientists and data analysts etc.   Design and implement robust and efficient data model and ETL pipeline to support advance analytics, machine learning and application data service etc.       Infrastructure and Deployment:    Improving data platform infrastructure and pipeline deployments using Git, IaC, CICD etc   Advocating team collaboration and knowledge sharing through pull request, peer reviews   Implement data governance and security measure to ensure data integrity, privacy and compliance with relevant regulations   Facilitate self-service analytics in application and technology teams by utilizing data platform infrastructure, tooling, deployment capabilities and sharing data engineering best practice.       Collaboration and Communication:    Collaborate with data scientists, technology SMEs, data analysts, software engineers etc to understand data service requirements and integrate them into the DataOps practice.   Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to ensure smooth handoffs and seamless collaboration.      Your background  We imagine that you have:   Master or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar   Experience with SQL and ETL using snowflake or similar   Data ingestion and delivery experience using Azure Data Factory, Azure eventhub, kafka, API, and object store, json, protobuf, avro etc., Azure or AWS certifications are highly desirable   Exposure to large scale data projects or operations with industry IoT, time series, asset master,  digital twin, ML workload in cloud or edge.   Data modeling experience such as Kimball and Data Valut 2.0   Solid software development experience in a team setup using git, CICD, Azure Devops or similar   Solid experience in Python, good exposure to shell script, docker, IaC(such as Bicep, terraform or pulumi), YAML      What’s in it for you?   What are your goals? Here at Grundfos it’s our mission to help you develop and fulfil your ambitions, both career and personal. We are guided by our six core values , and you’ll find that your fresh ideas will be welcomed and make a difference in everything from local to large-scale global projects. You’ll encounter colleagues from all over the world both as part of your daily work, supporting and all the while broadening each other’s cultural horizons.    In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:   Flexible working hours; home office possibility and equipment; up to 3 days’ paid leave for volunteering  Annual bonuses, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes, engaging team buildings   Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly  Long-term career development with regular dialogue, as well as continuous learning and development opportunities.     Do you want to learn more?  If you have questions or would like to know more about this position , please contact Head of UX UI Design Platform, Dripta Guha Roy at +4553194745    If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume by clicking “Apply”.    To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube , and t o get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out  Meet our people    We look forward to hearing from you.              About Grundfos  Grundfos is one of the world’s leading water technology companies with more than 19.000 employees in 60+ countries all over the world. Our skills commit us to pioneering solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do, as we believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.  An inclusive team If you like the look of this job and know you can bring your skills to contribute to our purpose, please apply. We need and welcome professional people from all corners – however you identify and whatever your background is. Title: Onsite IT Engineer
Description: Skip to main content The website uses cookies to remember your settings and authentication. This information is not shared with any third party. Read more Decline Accept Cookies English Sign In Nilfisk Careers Search for Jobs Onsite IT Engineer page is loaded Onsite IT Engineer Apply locations Hadsund Aalborg (Nilfisk Food) time type Full time posted on Posted 4 Days Ago job requisition id R010507 Location : Hadsund or Aalborg, Denmark We are seeking a skilled and motivated Onsite IT Engineer to join our User Experience (UXP) organization. Nilfisk IDE (Information and Digital Enablement) is going through a digital transformation, where we take an outside-in approach to eventually become a trusted business partner and a service provider of choice for our internal customers. As part of our new EMEA Onsite Support Services Team, you will be reporting to the Service Manager of the region. You will play a crucial role in ensuring the reliability, security, and performance of our company's IT infrastructure, and will serve as our cornerstone of operations in Hadsund and other locations in Denmark. You will work closely with our employees, providing technical support, troubleshooting hardware and software issues, and maintaining our network and systems - all to ensure a seamless experience of our services. Together we win! You will be a part of a team, with different skill sets, experiences, and perspectives and together you will foster creativity and broader range of problem-solving approaches. In Denmark, you have one colleague sitting in Hadsund who is responsible for software and hardware and other colleagues based at our HQ in Copenhagen. What's on the menu? You will provide technical support to Nilfisk colleagues, addressing hardware and software related issues. You will be responsible for install, configure, and upgrade computer hard- and software as needed. You will manage incidents created in ServiceNow relevant for your locations and follow through until the incident is resolved and has end-user confirmation. Handle requests created in ServiceNow for new PC’s, keyboards, headsets, and other IT equipment that end-users in your locations order. Your primary focus will revolve around the Nilfisk R&D-hub in Hadsund (Industrivej 1, 9560, Hadsund), where you will predominantly operate in your role. Additionally, you will hold responsibility for Nilfisk Food in Aalborg (Blytækkervej 2, 9000, Aalborg) and occasionally commute to our Copenhagen HQ to provide support to your colleagues. We value the experience you bring: For success in this position, you should possess a service-oriented mindset, adept at multitasking, capable of independent work, and dedicated to delivering optimal solutions for end-users. Proficiency in communication, fluency in both written and spoken Danish and English, and the ability to effectively engage with non-technical individuals are essential. While not mandatory, a background in IT, prior exposure to Service Now, and experience supporting Windows 10/11 and Office 365 would be advantageous. Preferably: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (preferred). Familiarity with network protocols, security, and administration. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Certifications such as CompTIA A+, Network+, or Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) a plus. Practical information: Given the nature of your responsibilities, a vehicle is essential for fulfilling your role as an Onsite IT Engineer. Expect 1 weekly trip to the Aalborg-site, and 4 days a week commuting to your main site in Hadsund. Periodically, you may contribute to larger IT implementations, averaging about once a year to CPH. How do we get in touch? If you have any questions, please reach out to Hiring Manager David Gorzsas for further information – email: dgorzsas@nilfisk.com . You can apply directly and attach your CV by clicking “ Apply now”. Let’s create a cleaner future together Cleaning has emerged as a key contributor to health and safety, sparked by technology and innovation. At Nilfisk we are a driving force in this development. Being part of Nilfisk means thinking outside of the box, bringing your inspiring ideas to life, sharing the results, and learning from your setbacks. We believe that diversity is our greatest strength – as we achieve the best results from a wide variety of views and approaches. At Nilfisk you have the freedom to be yourself and express your opinions. Nilfisk is firmly committed to growth and sustainability in everything we do. You will be empowered in your role as you collaborate with passionate colleagues on a quest to create a cleaner future. Are you ready to make a change? Clean is changing Job applicant FAQ Do you have questions regarding the recruitment process or alike? Please visit our  FAQ for job applicants . A leading global provider of professional cleaning products and services  Nilfisk was founded in 1906 by the Danish engineer P.A. Fisker. Today the company is a world-leading provider of professional and consumer floorcare equipment, vacuum cleaners, and high-pressure washers. Around 90 per cent of sales target professionals, while the remaining 10 per cent of the business is focused on consumers. Nilfisk products and services are sold in more than 100 countries and produced at 9 manufacturing sites across the globe. The main facilities are based in the U.S., Mexico, Hungary, Italy, and China. A total of 4,700 employees secured revenue of 1069.5 mEUR in 2022. The largest single market is the U.S., covering 30% of revenue in 2022, followed by France (11%), Germany (10%), the U.K. (5%), and Denmark (4%). Do you have questions regarding the recruitment process or alike? Please visit our FAQ for job applicants .  Read More Follow Us © 2023 Workday, Inc. All rights reserved.

Title: SAP Data Warehousing & Analytics Specialist
Description: Apply now                Forward  your career                      Hedehusene  SAP Data Warehousing & Analytics Specialist     Join Our Team as a SAP Data Warehousing & Analytics Specialist  DSV is a global player in the logistics industry, and we are on the lookout for an experienced SAP Data Warehousing & Analytics Specialist to join our dynamic team. As a key player in our Data Warehousing, Analytics, and Reporting department, you will be at the forefront of shaping and optimizing our SAP BW/4HANA, SAP HANA, Analysis for Office, and SAP Analytics Cloud landscape. From addressing user issues and ensuring system stability to collaborating with business stakeholders, your role will be diverse and impactful.  Your responsibilities include:   Support:   Provide day-to-day support for SAP BW/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, Analysis for Office, and SAP HANA modelling systems.  Troubleshoot connectivity issues and resolve technical data load issues promptly.  Collaborate with end-users to optimize processes and ensure system stability.  Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of support processes and configurations.   Development:   Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements for new SAP BW/4HANA data models.  Design, develop, and maintain virtual data models, ensuring accuracy and performance.  Implement data integration solutions and create data transformation logic.  Coordinate with SAP BASIS and Authorization teams for technical tasks and role development.   Testing:   Develop and execute tests for SAP BW/4HANA and SAP Analytics Cloud solutions.  Identify and rectify defects and ensure data quality and accuracy.   Change Processes:   Participate in change management processes, including creating change requests and coordinating changes.  Support the deployment of SAP system updates, patches, and enhancements.   You will work closely with other SAP specialists and architects especially within data warehousing and analytics. Furthermore, you will be working with business users, project managers, IT architects and other IT team members to understand the business requirements and develop compliant solutions, that are aligned with business and IT standards and strategies.  Driving Excellence in BW/4HANA and Analytics  Our ideal candidate has 5-10 years of hands-on experience in SAP BW, with certification in SAP BW/4HANA, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP HANA modeling, and holds a bachelor’s degree in information technology, computer science, finance, or related field (master’s degree preferred).  Additionally:   Proven expertise in SAP BW/4HANA development and administration, including data extraction from SAP S4 finance, such as Group Reporting and Universal Journal.  Proficient in building CDS views for data extraction and data integration in BW/4HANA for both SAP and non-SAP sources, utilizing streaming process chains and SAP HANA SDI adapters.  Strong proficiency in SAP Analytics Cloud configuration, administration, and connectivity.  Experience in SAP HANA modeling on BW/4HANA data, SQL scripting, and building HANA artifacts like calculation views and table functions.  Knowledgeable in BW/4HANA analytic engine, BW queries, customer exits, composite providers, and ETL processes for both SAP and non-SAP sources.  Familiarity with ABAP and HANA SQLscript.   Problem solver with great communication skills  You have an analytical mindset, adept problem-solving skills, and proactive communication style that set you apart. You thrive in a team-oriented environment, showcasing flexibility in multitasking, and your great interpersonal skills contribute to effective collaboration, complemented by clear spoken and written English proficiency. You are system/process oriented, particularly in finance, with proven analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.  Join an encouraging work environment built on ownership and empowerment  In Global IT we enable and develop the business through technological innovations to keep supply chains flowing in a world of change. Global IT consists of 2,300 employees spread across the world and we work with a high sense of integrity and ambition to deliver the best services and products for colleagues and customers alike. We are doers, and we are driven to go further, faster. One could say we move goods through technology and innovation in Global IT.  Want to know more and apply?  If you are ready to take on a challenging role in a global IT environment and contribute to the success of SAP projects, we encourage you to apply via the apply button.  We will be happy to answer your questions about the position and the possibilities in DSV. Please contact Maria Bille, Director, SAP Finance Solution Delivery on +45 2541 6291.  We process applications on an ongoing basis so please do not hesitate to apply.  #DSVGlobalIT    Apply now      Read more           I work in the innovation part of IT, and I love that we get to work with the latest technologies. My team and DSV are very open to new ideas and ways of working, and everyone has a say.  - Inta, Senior UX Designer                       4 af 5 stjerner    241 of DSV’s employees have rated DSV on Jobindex     What I really love is that in DSV, it is entirely possible to combine having a career AND a family life. It is amazing not having to compromise – even with young kids at home. DSV gives me the flexibility needed to grow professionally while also enjoying my family.  - Inta, Senior UX Designer    See what else your new colleagues say                  There are hundreds of great reasons to work at DSV.  Here are just a few collected from our employees ...        EMPOWERMENT  We’ll empower you to make a difference. We believe that people do great things, when they are given the opportunity and support they need to succeed. We trust in people.     GLOBAL CAREER DEVELOPMENT  You’ll have access to a massive network of possibilities. We build inspiring careers locally and internationally.     INFORMAL ENVIRONMENT  You’ll be part of a dynamic and informal environment, where people speak their minds. This allows us to move fast, stay ahead and face challenges head-on. This is the DSV way.     LEARNING  Our DSV academy will give you access to knowledge and training, which will allow you to grow and influence the path of your career. We want you to realise your potential and reach your career goals.        OWNERSHIP  We’ll encourage you to act as if DSV were your own business. Our local branches work very autonomously and decisions are made close to the customer. This is what makes us unique, agile and strong.     PERFORMANCE  You’ll join a group of highly dedicated people who strive to improve every day. If you like a challenge and a constantly changing environment then join us.     TRULY GLOBAL  We’ll give you 75,000 colleagues in more than 90 countries all over the world. We’re a global family.     WE GROW TOGETHER  You will be part of a genuinely fast-growing company. We started our journey in 1976, and since then we have expanded our market share immensely. But we have only just begun – the most exciting time to join DSV is now!                                     Our hiring process  At DSV, we are always looking for the most skilled employees within our field. It is our goal to hire the very best match and ensure that our employees across the company are successful in their job. That is why our recruitment process is so important. Title: SAP S/4HANA Group Reporting Specialist
Description: Apply now                Forward  your career                      Hedehusene  SAP S/4HANA Group Reporting Specialist     Are you ready to take on a pivotal role in SAP Group Reporting and Analytics?  Join our dynamic team at DSV as a SAP Group Reporting, SAP S/4HANA Specialist. In this role, you will be at the forefront of implementing, supporting, developing, testing, and driving change processes within our SAP Group Reporting and SAP Analytics Cloud landscape.  You will join our Data Warehousing, Analytics and Reporting department, and work closely with other SAP specialists and architects within S/4, data warehousing, and analytics. Additionally, collaboration with business users, project managers, IT architects, and other IT team members is crucial to align solutions with business and IT standards and strategies.  Driving SAP excellence: Core responsibilities of the SAP S/4HANA Specialist   Technical Support and Stability:   Provide day-to-day support for SAP Group Reporting, SAP Analytics Cloud, Analysis for Office, and SAP HANA modeling systems.  Collaborate with end-users to optimize existing processes and promptly resolve functional issues, minimizing disruptions.   Testing and Quality Assurance:   Develop and execute tests for SAP Group Reporting and SAP Analytics Cloud solutions.  Cover unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing to ensure system reliability.   System Updates and Enhancements:   Support the deployment of SAP system updates, patches, and enhancements.  Coordinate with other SAP professionals to minimize downtime and disruptions during updates.   Change Management and Requirements:   Participate in change management processes.  Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and document requirements for new functionalities.   Documentation and Communication:   Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of support processes, configurations, and issue resolutions.  Contribute to successful testing and deployment of SAP solutions through effective collaboration and communication.   Proactive communicator and analytical thinker  The ideal candidate should possess strong interpersonal skills, both in written and verbal communication. They should be proactive in driving tasks forward, demonstrating effective communication and adaptability in a team-oriented environment. The ability to multitask with a strong systems and process orientation, particularly in finance, showcases their analytical thinking and problem-solving skills. Fluency in written and verbal English is essential. Additionally, the candidate should exhibit a proactive attitude in staying current with industry trends and contributing innovative ideas to ensure secure and cost-effective IT usage.  Additionally, you possess:   A bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or relevant fields.  3-5 years of experience in S/4 Group Reporting as a functional consultant.  Knowledge of Group Reporting, maintenance, and configuration.  Experience with Fiori platform.  Ideally, 2+ years of S/4 HANA Experience.  Strong analytical skills and a focus on providing visible business results.  Excellent communication and presentation skills in English (both verbal and written).  A proactive mindset that is up to date with relevant trends in the industry.  The ability to contribute new ideas and seek opportunities for secure and cost-effective IT usage.   Join an encouraging work environment built on ownership and empowerment  In Global IT we enable and develop the business through technological innovations to keep supply chains flowing in a world of change. Title: Project IT Delivery Manager for SAP Area
Description: Apply now                Forward  your career                      Hedehusene  Project IT Delivery Manager for SAP Area     Join DSV as a Project IT Delivery Manager in SAP!  Are you a seasoned SAP professional with a passion for delivering complex projects and driving positive change in a dynamic environment? We are currently seeking a talented individual to join our Data, Governance, and Analytics department within Group Applications IT, Global IT, as a Project IT Delivery Manager for SAP Area.  At DSV, SAP is at the heart of our business, playing a pivotal role in our finance-related operations. We are now expanding our team to ensure effective governance and high-quality deliveries within the SAP area, contributing to projects such as SAP FI/CO/SD/MM rollouts and global analytics initiatives.  As a Project IT Delivery Manager, you will:   Lead and facilitate sessions with stakeholders from business, vendors, and SAP IT.  Ensure tasks align with project scope, proactively follow up on assignments, and drive progress.  Collaborate with business and SAP professionals to design, implement, test, train, and rollout solutions.  Act as a Delivery lead/SPOC/track lead for focus projects such as Rollouts, EPM, legal, and more.   You will collaborate closely with business stakeholders and highly skilled colleagues in an open, informal environment where your input can shape global functionalities.  What you bring  Your primary skills are within SAP/S4 ERP Implementation, Release Development, Problem Management, IT Validation. We also expect you bring great experience in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Access, and Visio, including experience with project or program management.  Additionally, you bring:   Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or relevant fields.  5-7 years of SAP ERP experience as a functional consultant within FICO.  Experience with Fiori platform.  Ideally, 5+ years of S/4 HANA experience.  +4 years of Project Management experience.  Strong analytical skills with a focus on delivering visible business results.  Excellent communication and presentation skills in English, both verbal and written.  Up to date information on relevant trends in the SAP and IT industry.   Our new Project IT Delivery Manager possess great interpersonal and communication skills. The ideal candidate is proactive, team-oriented, and adept at managing multiple tasks. They should demonstrate a strong orientation towards systems and processes, especially in finance, with proven analytical and problem-solving skills. Adaptability to uncertainty and a holistic view of tasks and resources are key. Candidates should be willing to take on responsibilities and actively assist business partners. Influential leadership qualities, promoting development, transparency, and collaboration, are highly valued.  Join an encouraging work environment built on ownership and empowerment  In Global IT we enable and develop the business through technological innovations to keep supply chains flowing in a world of change. Global IT consists of 2,300 employees spread across the world and we work with a high sense of integrity and ambition to deliver the best services and products for colleagues and customers alike. We are doers, and we are driven to go further, faster. One could say we move goods through technology and innovation in Global IT.  Want to know more and apply? Title: Senior Manager of Digital Platform Operations (m/f/d) Information Technology
Description:

You can change or withdraw your consent at any time, by clicking the link “Manage Cookies”, which is always available at the bottom of the site. Strictly necessary  These cookies are necessary to make the site work properly, and are always set when you visit the site. Vendors  Teamtailor          Marketing  These cookies are used to make advertising messages more relevant to you. In some cases, they also deliver additional functions on the site.   Vendors  Youtube, Linkedin      Accept these cookies  Decline non-necessary cookies                Career menu       Start    Departments    People    Jobs      Employee  Log in   WS Audiology  WS Audiology  WS Audiology APAC  WS Audiology Americas  WS Audiology EMEA   Candidate  Log in to Connect       WS Audiology EMEA             Facebook       X       LinkedIn       Mail            Information Technology  ·  Erlangen, Germany, Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark  ·  Hybrid Remote    Senior Manager of Digital Platform Operations (m/f/d)  Help us to unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world!     Apply now    We usually respond within two weeks           We are seeking a highly experienced and skilled individual to join our team as a Senior Manager of Digital Platform Operations (m/f/d). As a key member of our organization, you will ensure our Platforms are secure, run optimally and provide a positive customer experience. You will supervise, coordinate, mentor, support and recruit the various Digital Platform Operations teams. Acting as a demand manager, you will be working closely with internal teams across the organization and Markets (both may be distributed over multiple geographical locations). The position is based in our office in Erlangen, Germany or Lynge, Denmark. What you will do   Lead and Inspire: Support your IT team, providing inspiration and motivation to achieve professional quality. Offer guidance, mentorship, and professional development opportunities. Own and coordinate the onboarding process for external and internal resources.    Communication Management Own effective communication and collaboration with markets and affiliates, acting as a liaison between the IT team and regional stakeholders.    Ecommerce Platform Management: Be      accountable for Operations topics (root cause analysis, release      management, technical debt, platform, and hardware upgrades, etc.), solution      development (CRs). Ensure      our Platforms are secure, run optimally, provide a positive customer      experience Establish and enforce protocols, best practices and ensure      business requirements are met. Provide subject matter expertise on multiple projects      and collaborate on identifying/recommending the appropriate solution.    Agile Culture Support: Own the      structure for Agile development across the teams and drive adoption across      the organization.    Data Driven Culture: Establish      and build a data driven culture through OKRs and KPI’s performance.    Drive Technology Upgrades and Innovation: Stay ahead of emerging technologies and industry trends, identifying opportunities for innovation and efficiency improvements.    Manage Vendors Effectively: Collaborate closely with external technology vendors, ensuring seamless coordination to meet service level agreements.    Own Change Management: Ensure the effective implementation of new technology solutions and process improvements.    Sustainable documentation: Develop      and maintain global templates for Digital Platform Operations      documentation and process flows.    Ensure Security and Compliance: Establish and enforce robust security protocols, ensuring compliance with industry standards, regulations and WSA policies.  What you bring  Your Experience: - University degree in engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or similar. - 8+ years of leadership and eCommerce system management experience. - Project management experience, managing multiple workstreams concurrently. - Functional experience in Online Customer journeys, Workflows or Digital Workplaces, Customer Experience - Knowledge and execution experience with eCommerce platforms such as Adobe Commerce would be a plus. - Experience with web technologies and underlying languages. - Familiarity with Jira Software and Confluence, or similar software.  Your Personal Competencies - Positive, collaborative attitude, solution-oriented, and data-driven, process focused, technical, organized mindset. - Good communication skills in English (verbal and written). - Continuous learning - Supports and contributes to a culture of positivity, inclusion, creativity, attention to detail, and a focus on "Customer Excellence" are part of your skills. - Willingness to travel. Join us in shaping the future of ecommerce and digital platform operations at WSA! What we offer We offer a dynamic and inclusive work environment where you can contribute your expertise and make a significant impact on our organization's success. We are driven by innovation and development so working with us is a constant learning curve. You will be located in our site in Erlangen, Germany or Lynge, Denmark with dynamic and progressive colleagues, who are highly skilled and empathetic. If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for manufacturing execution systems and a drive to deliver exceptional results, we encourage you to apply. Who we are Our products - help millions of people regain their hearing and quality of life. This is what drives us every day! Our social responsibility - sustainability is not just an idea for us, it is part of our business purpose. Together with you, we can continue to make the world a better place! Creative freedom - your ideas are welcome and you can try out new solutions. Individual responsibility - you can actively shape, decide and, most importantly, move things forward with us. Personal development - trying, learning and reflecting are part of our DNA. Internationality - as a global player, you will have the opportunity to work with colleagues in different parts of the world. At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services. Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world. With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes. Sounds wonderful? We can't wait to hear from you! WS Audiology is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.       Department   Information Technology   Role  Commercial Systems  Locations  Erlangen, Germany, Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark  Remote status  Hybrid Remote                  Contact  Sabrina Lorenz  HR Business Partner EMEA

Title: Experienced Software Architect
Description: Experienced Software Architect, Lystrup             Are you passionate about software -arch itecture and -design, and do you possess strong leadership and stakeholder management skills? Then you might be our new senior software architect in our Command & Control (C2) organization based in Lystrup.  Terma provides mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. We are guided by one overall purpose: to deliver security for countries, alliances, critical infrastructure and individuals utilizing advanced technologies. Our systems provide security for people and critical infrastructure on land, at sea, and in the air. In space, we are engaged in reaching new frontiers and enabling people on our planet to deal with new and upcoming challenges.  The TEC C2 Organization The C2 organization in Lystrup is responsible for our C2-Ground/Air solutions - that provides situational awareness for surveillance, perimeter safety, and combat planning and execution purposes. The C2 organization counts 100 highly engaged colleagues, we are located at 2 sites; in Søborg and in Lystrup. Within the C2 organization in Lystrup we work in stable, interdisciplinary, and self-managed product/project teams based on agile principles from Scrum.  The role and your most important tasks As Software Architect, you will work together with other members in the Architect Team. You will have the technical responsibility for the architectural design of our mission-critical applications, considering all aspects related to the software development including performance, reliability, modularity, and maintainability. You will report directly to the Senior Director of the C2 organization in Lystrup.  Examples of area of responsibility:   Technical leadership and guidance of teams implementing mission-critical software systems across different applications  Architectural design and implementation of software following professional, modern software engineering principles  Taking ownership in strengthening our work methods and improving our development tool chain in close cooperation with C2 Line Management  Creating technical documentation, including architectural and software design documentation, interface control documents and design justification documentation  Contributing to ensuring implementation and delivery of software to schedule and required quality   Your experience and education You have a relevant education, i.e., Bachelor or Master degree in software engineering, computer science, data scientist or similar educations and a proven solid track record as software architect.  Your primary programming language is Java , experience with other object-oriented languages like C++ is a plus. Additionally, you can add a checkmark at some of the following bullets:   Have experience with design of software solutions through all the steps from requirements, architecture, design, implementation and verification - the latter especially in terms of automated tests  Are an experienced technical lead with well-developed problem-solving skills  Are a natural informal leader who can drive teams and individuals to become high performing  Broad experience in agile development and supporting tools   You as a person   You are proactive by nature, e.g., showing the good example making sure to align upfront and that you are not afraid to challenge your colleagues in a respectful manner and to ask the “stupid” questions  You are enthusiastic, self-motivated, team player and able to work independently  You enjoy working in a complex and highly specialized environment where you respect the formal working processes while still mastering agile principles  You can work in an international, multi-cultural team and you are well articulated in writing and speaking, as a minimum in English, preferable also in Danish.   What can Terma offer you? In Terma it is your skills, commitment and ambitions that help us fulfil our mission of delivering technologies to keep people safe. We offer a job with great opportunities for the right, talented candidate with a challenging position in an international high-tech company. You will be part of a dedicated team characterized by professional pride and a great deal of humor :0)  Want to know more?  This recruitment process is being facilitated by Capax Recruitment. You can apply for the position here . If you have any inquiries regarding the position, please feel free to reach out to Xenia Rosiak at xrr@capax.dk  Please observe that candidates must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish national security agency. This entails that candidate’, as a minimum , have stayed within NATO/EU countries for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad and have citizenship from a NATO country.      The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.   Terma A/S is headquartered at Aarhus, Denmark. Internationally, Terma has subsidiaries and operations in The Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, United Kingdom, United Arab Emirates, India, Singapore and the U.S.           Application deadline: Ongoing
