Title: Enterprise Architect Production and Supply Chain
Description: Apply                          Enterprise Architect Production and Supply Chain       Humlebæk        Would you like an outgoing role where an enterprise architectural perspective is spiced with close collaboration with the Senior Enterprise Architect, the Domain, Solution Architects and our Production and Supply Chain areas? Are you a passionate and experienced professional looking to take on a pivotal and influential role in our dynamic and close-knit team?  Join us as the Enterprise Architect for the “Production and Supply Chain” (IT/OT) domain, where you’ll not only have the opportunity to influence solutions but also lead the strategic direction by defining and establishing architectural roadmap, guardrails, processes and more for the area.  You’ll not only be a very important player in building a new engagement model and lead the architectural roadmap for the Production and Supply Chain domain but also gain a large network across the organization. ”We need a strong candidate to join us on this journey to assemble the oddly shaped, yet interlocking and mosaiced pieces of the IT/OT architecture. This calls for an enterprise perspective on the architecture – a very interesting challenge in light of the future plans for Coloplast production” says Henrik Madsen, Senior Director, Project Management & Enterprise Architecture.  DD&IT (Digital, Data and IT) recently redesigned the entire organization to be fit for the next major focus area which among other areas are covering governance and architecture. Here we need your skills, curiosity, and drive for enterprise structure to be our companion.  As our new EA-PSC, you will join the EA & PM team - an integral part of DD&IT. The team is focused on delivering business value and driving business outcomes, supporting innovation, transformation, and the use of the right technologies. To continue supporting our journey the EA practice is continuously refined, ensuring that EA framework, governance setup, services etc. bring value to our organization. Together with the rest of the Enterprise Architecture team you must ensure that the chosen IT/OT architecture fits into the bigger picture.  Your key responsibilities will be:   Define our IT strategy for the Production and Supply Chain domain  Define IT transition- and target architecture for the Production and Supply Chain domain.  Define roadmaps and support realization of IT Strategy  Define and ensure realization of enterprise-wide architecture principles  Develop and participate in governance of Enterprise Architecture  Modelling business capabilities, processes, and data  Engaging with stakeholders and developing an understanding of their needs and desired business outcomes  Work with domain and platform owners  Staying current with industry trends and emerging technologies  Fostering a collaborative and enjoyable team environment, contributing to our informal and friendly work culture.   Skilled and outgoing personality  “Your role will require a lot of networking, so it is important that you can communicate clearly and consistently across the organization and dare to speak your mind. Navigating the enterprise perspective, sometimes pushing back and being able to work with constructive feedback is key,” says Henrik.  We would also like you to have:   At least five years of experience within management consultancy, solution or enterprise architecture in an international setup within the IT/OT area  Experience with implementing systems like MES, WMS, TMS, LIMS  Knowledge of ISA95  Experience working with EA frameworks and tools  Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field  Experience in regulated industries  Understanding the pivotal role that production and supply has in a medical device manufacturing company  Strong communication and presentation skills, ability to communicate across on more abstraction levels to both technical and non-technical stakeholders  A pragmatic approach, a “can-do” attitude, with focus on what is best for the company  Ability to work independently and with a high level of personal integrity and accountability  Strong team player mindset, emphasizing "we" over "I"   Interested?  If you would like to know more about the position, please call Senior Director, Project Management & Enterprise Architecture Henrik T. Madsen, on +45 4911 1375. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate has been found.     Read more                       5 af 5 stjerner  188  of Coloplast´s employees have rated Coloplast on Jobindex       “We all come to work every day to make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs and to create a culture of empowerment, energy and long-term engagement”   Dorthe Rønnau  People & Culture.     Read more quotes                  Why Join  Welcome to Coloplast – one of the most successful medical device companies in the world. We are glad you stopped by to get to know us better.  People at Coloplast are proud of their workplace. It is expressed in our People Survey, in development conversations and the number of recommendations they give to others to work here. If you want the short version of why to join us, read more below:                     There is purpose to what we do  Most of us want to work for a company that makes a difference. Well, in Coloplast you can. Our purpose is to make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs.        We are truly global  We are about 14,000 people in 41 countries. A mix of different nationalities and cultures working together in many languages. But we are also much more.        A uniquely human performance culture  Your colleagues are professional experts in their field, together with being genuinely nice people. They will do what they can to help you succeed and grow and they will expect you to do the same.        Good career opportunities  Our management style is based on empowerment. Empowering our employees to influence their daily work life, to be decision-makers and to grow in the company.        Benefits and healthy lives  At Coloplast our mission is to care for our users and we invest in the care of our employees as well.  This includes health insurance, pension plans, individual treatments, sports and healthy eating.                    Students & Graduates    Career development              Students & Graduates  Coloplast Strive is a 2-year program for recent graduates striving for an accelerated global career within the MedTech industry. We are offering various tracks across the value chain, as well as a stimulating learning journey, including activities that will strengthen the global graduate network. The programme consists of two rotations of approximately 12 months each, with graduates doing one of their rotations abroad for most of the tracks.      Read more           Career development  At Coloplast, we don’t just hire you for one job. We encourage our people to further their career within the company. Throughout your career at Coloplast, you will be given the opportunity to grow in new directions. We aim to promote our own people, which is reflected in our ability to fill 67% of critical managerial positions with internal candidates.      Read more                        14,000  employees worldwide    Products sold in  140  countries    Represented in  41  countries      8  global production sites                       Apply for one of our positions            About us  Coloplast develops products and services that make life easier for people with very personal and private medical conditions.Working closely with the people who use our products, we create solutions that are sensitive to their special needs. We call this intimate healthcare.Our business includes Ostomy Care, Continence Care, Wound & Skin Care, Interventional Urology and Voice & Respiratory Care. We operate globally and our organisation is about 14,000 employees.    Follow us                              Ansvarlig brug af dine oplysninger    ×     Jobindex ønsker at tilbyde en service, der giver dig den bedste oplevelse. Title: Software Engineer with life sciences experience
Description: Home    Available positions   Login My profile My profile                  Software Engineer with life sciences experience   We are looking for a talented Software Engineer to design and build applications for our scientists and accelerate our digital transformation About us Minerva Imaging’s vision is to become the leading contract research and contract development organization for targeted radionuclide therapy and imaging, enabling improved treatment regimens for cancer patients. Our focus is on the use of advanced animal models within oncology and cardiovascular diseases and in vivo molecular imaging for translational research and drug development. We aim to excel in delivering customized cancer radiopharmaceutical research and serve as an extended research team to our collaborators. We have built a global leading R&D platform for targeted radionuclide therapy and Contract Development and Manufacturing (CDMO) to enable integrated planning and faster execution of promising new radionuclide theragnostic projects in close collaboration with leading researchers, biotech, and pharmaceutical companies. Minerva is at the forefront of R&D in the theragnostic area. We are in a very fast-paced environment, where our scientists directly impact the advancement of new improved, and lifesaving drugs for seriously ill cancer patients. We have the ambition to make a difference for our clients, collaborating on advancing new treatment modalities for patients. Our plans for the new Software Engineer The role will support Minerva Imaging's digital transformation and play a crucial role in our application development, accelerating our laboratory workflows and supporting our scientists with solutions. As a Software Engineer, you will create a strong relationship to our scientists, understand their needs and develop the right solution for them. The ideal candidate will have experience with both the life science industry and software development. You have experience within web development, adapting open-source software in a corporate environment and programming e.g. in python and experience with databases. You will be joining a small team and as such you will quickly become a key team player with a wide variety of tasks. Minerva Imaging is a growing company and you will get the opportunity to help shape both your own tasks and the future digital infrastructure of the company. You will be joining the department of digital solutions and technology consisting of IT and data/image processing professionals. Tasks: Design and development of software to support our in-house research and development organization Deployment and support of in-house developed web apps Assess current data handling and pro-actively come up with solutions Improving the overall data flow within the company Support setting up and maintaining data processing and analysis tools Ability to cross-collaborate throughout the whole organization within the various disciplines in the company Provide technical support and training to the users of our apps Experience: Background in software development, including programming languages such as R, Python, SQL, JavaScript, HTML and CSS Experience with software development or data analysis within  life sciences Experience with version control (Git) and containerization technologies (docker) Familiar with agile principles and previous experience using tools like Azure DevOps to manage software or data science projects, track progress and improve collaboration Previous experience in implementing automated testing and deployment processes is a plus Qualifications: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Life Sciences or related fields with  2+ years of experience Problem-solving and make-it-work attitude Good team player and eager to learn Excellent communication skills in English, both written and oral Strong analytical skills and attention to detail Thrive in a fast-paced and service-oriented organization English is required and Danish is an advantage Please submit your application no later than 30th of November. The application must include a motivated cover letter and a CV addressing the listed qualifications and must be submitted through our application portal. Applications will be evaluated continuously.  If you have questions regarding the position, please contact Moritz Braig on mob@minervaimaging.com About Minerva Imaging Minerva Imaging is a scientifically driven CRO/CDMO founded in 2011 counting 130 employees. Our focus is on the use of advanced animal models within oncology and cardiovascular diseases and in vivo molecular imaging for translational research and drug development. We engage with our collaborators to understand their scientific questions and discuss how our methods and capabilities can provide answers. We are rapidly growing, and the right candidate will be a key contributor to maintaining the scientific foundation and our approach to research while expanding our business. You will join a highly specialized CRO/CDMO, with ambitions of taking disease treatment to the next generation of personalized medicines. We are an informal organization with a strong focus on open and honest communication. We value humor and a natural care for one another, meaning stepping up and lending a helping hand to a colleague when needed. We offer a combined compensation package which includes a base salary, pension and an attractive bonus program. We believe in creating an agile working environment, so we have flexible working options including the possibility of partly working from home. We care about our employees’ well-being and offer health insurance and a quality conscious lunch scheme and arrange monthly social activities. Minerva Imaging is an equal opportunity employer and encourage candidates of all backgrounds and experiences to apply. Follow Minerva Imaging on LinkedIn for the latest news.   Apply   Share in your network               Deadline:  30/11/2023     Contact person:       Moritz Braig  Department Manager       Job area:  Digital solutions and Technology    Position type:  Full time                       Minerva Imaging Lyshøjvej 21 DK-3650 Ølstykke +45 38 25 20 15  info@minervaimaging.com                   Powered by Emply           Login  Have you applied for a job or created a job agent? Title: DSP Engineer for tools and test development
Description: Apply                          DSP Engineer for tools and test development  Smørum            Would you like to be at the forefront of the latest audio technology and make a difference for hearing impaired people worldwide? Can you see yourself as part of a team that shapes the future for audiological solutions within hearing aids? Then we might have an exciting career opportunity for you!  Welcome to team Digital Signal Processing  You will join our committed and highly skilled DSP Team, which is part of the Audiological Solutions group within R&D. We are innovators in our business and develop advanced audiological solutions for our future hearing aids. We are working with new state-of-the-art technologies within signal processing and machine learning.  “ We are a group of experienced DSP engineers waiting to welcome you. You will join a team with a high technical knowledge level, maybe some of the best at what we do, so this is really a place where you can exchange knowledge and learn something .” says your new manager, Erik Lund, and continues “ And innovation means everything to us, so your ideas and inputs are really appreciated. Besides that, we have a fantastic working environment with a lot of flexibility and a low hierarchy .”  We work in an agile setup, and in your daily work, you will be part of a scrum team with 8-10 team members with different competencies and backgrounds, where you work together to enhance audio processing and improve hearing aid functionality.  Make a difference in a great working environment.  You will be working in a growing international company, where there is rich opportunity for professional and personal development and plenty of new learnings. You will be part of an environment built on trust and openness. We all aim for an open and inclusive way of working where sharing knowledge and ideas are highly valued.  “ The role is central in supporting the team’s progress and development, where your focus will be on tools and test development .” says Erik and continues “ It’s a great way to really get to know your way around DSP and learn from the best .”  You will develop build/test framework for automatic tests used in the DSP area and develop audio/signal processing tools for Hearing Solutions. You will also contribute to tools roadmap in close collaboration with architects and other stakeholders.  In addition to this, you will:   Be point of contact for Continuous Integration related matters.  Build bridge between Feature Teams and Continuous Integration team.  Idea generation and innovation projects for new tools and signal processing.  Prototyping of new concepts.   We recognize that to bring energy and inspiration to work, you need to re-energize and spend time with family, friends, and hobbies in a healthy work life balance. We therefore offer the flexibility to work from home.  Tools for signal processing is your thing!  You hold a degree in engineering with a background in signal processing, computer science or similar. You have some experience with simulation tools and test automation within the DSP domain. In addition, you can probably tick off many of the following competencies:   Experience with Python, Matlab and GIT  Experience from test automation development  Knowledge of best practices with software development  Familiar with Windows or Linux environments for development.   We work with TeamCity and Simulink, so if you don’t already know them, you should be willing to dive into them.  As a person, you would describe yourself as someone, who works well within teams and likes technical challenges. You possess good communication skills, both orally and in writing and appear to be systematic, creative, and investigative. You are focused and motivated with a supporting mentally. You are motivated by dealing with numerous stakeholders and collaborating closely with your team colleagues.  Want to join the team?  Please send us your CV as soon as possible and no later than 7th of December 2023 , as we are screening applications on a continuous basis. Please note that we only accept application through our online recruitment system.  If you would like to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Senior Manager, Erik Lund via e-mail: erlu@demant.com .  We are curious to meet you!  At Demant we value diversity, equity and inclusion (DE&I) and we are committed to creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of ethnic background, personality, age, gender, and education. Diversity is part of our cultural DNA. Women in STEM areas are particularly encouraged to apply, as Demant supports United Nations Sustainable Development Goal 5 on gender equality.        Read more                             Mirjana Adnadjevic – DSP Specialist  “At Oticon we do beautiful engineering that brings music to people. How cool is that!”             Anders Erik Petersen - Specialist, PCB & Electronics  “I have close relations to my colleagues, and together we develop products that truly help people”             Kajsa Angesten - Senior CRM Marketing Manager  “At Oticon I contribute to making a life-changing difference for people with a hearing loss. That is worth fighting for”                         4 af 5 stjerner   112 of Oticon´s employees have rated Oticon on Jobindex          Meet our employees                 Employee benefits    Working at Oticon    Graduate progamme    Student jobs          Read more     Employee benefits   Oticon is a workplace comprised of many people with various backgrounds. Needs and desires vary from person to person, which is why we offer a large range of employee benefits suited to the individual. We continuously work to optimise our benefits in order to provide our employees with attractive programmes and offerings.  Oticon offers an array of benefits including a business travel card for public transportation, employee broadband, attractive and flexible pension schemes, education support, and a wide range of discounts on everything from fitness to car repair. Our list of benefits is continually updated.            Read more     Working at Oticon   Oticon is part of the Demant Group – one of the largest hearing healthcare companies in the world. This opens up an exciting world of opportunities when you join us.  We believe that innovation is the cornerstone of our success, and we encourage of our employees to think out of the box, focus on teamwork, and continuously sharpen both professional and personal competencies.            Read more     Graduate progamme   Join our 2-year programme and get a unique opportunity to develop your personal and professional skills. Be part of our mission to create life-changing differences through hearing healthcare to millions of people worldwide!  The Graduate Programme at Demant offers you a unique opportunity to develop your personal and professional skills. You will join us in creating life-changing differences through hearing health to millions of people worldwide.            Read more     Student jobs   Oticon has approximately +70 student assistants working in various parts of our organisation. A student job is your opportunity to test out your theoretical knowledge obtained in your studies and put it to use in "real-life" projects. Student jobs also offer you an excellent entry point to permanent employment after graduation.  We consider our student assistants to be an important part of our business, because they contribute new knowledge, energy, and alternative perspectives. Look under Positions to see if we are advertising your dream student job. You are also always welcome to join us on LinkedIn and become part of our network.                   The recruiting process  At Oticon we strive to make the hiring process a positive experience for everyone involved. Below you can see about the individual steps that you as an applicant can expect to undergo throughout the process.           Writing a good job application  Your application provides an initial impression of you as a person; it not only describes your professional qualifications and experience, but it also reflects your personal qualities.      Interviews  An interview process typically includes two interviews. The first interview is attended by one of our talent acquisition consultant and either a personnel manager, project manager or employee who knows your prospective job area well. The second interview always involves the personnel manager and the recruiting specialist.      Starting work at Oticon  It is very important to us that you get a good start at Oticon. And it is also important to us that as a new employee, you gain a broad understanding of our company and its culture as quickly as possible. Therefore we have designed a mentor programme and introduction programme to help you settle into your new position.       Read more               2 open positions  Oticon offers the possibility of working within a wide range of professional areas. Here you can view all open positions. Indrykket:                                 About us  500 million people worldwide suffer from hearing loss. It is Oticon's ambition that our customers - hearing clinics throughout the world - prefer to use our products for people with impaired hearing. Oticon is one of the two largest companies in the industry, and in Denmark, all 1,400 employees, with passion, dedication and professional expertise, develop some of the most innovative hearing aids in the world.  Oticon is an international growing company, and 98% of Group revenues is generated outside Denmark. Title: Infrastructure Security Engineer
Description: Job description  Working at Radiometer  Watch our video    Apply             Infrastructure Security Engineer                       In our line of work, life isn’t a given - it’s the ultimate goal. When life takes an unexpected turn, our technology and solutions enable caregivers to make informed diagnostic decisions to improve patient care. This is our shared purpose at Radiometer and what unites all +4000 of us - no matter our roles or where in the world we’re located. Creating impactful innovations like ours, doesn’t happen overnight - it requires uncompromising persistency, passion, and a desire to make a difference. Here, you can learn, grow, and chart an uncommonly diverse career.  Radiometer is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.  The Infrastructure Security Engineer for Radiometer is responsible for deploying secure network solutions and participate in global network and security projects.  In Radiometer Global IT, we operate and maintain our global Infrastructure operations and technologies and we are on a very exiting journey transitioning more and more services to cloud which increase the need for strong leadership of our high performing teams.  In your role you will participate in in projects delivering security solutions for our infrastructure regarding network segmentation and establishing of Zero-Trust infrastructure. Technology focus is Cisco, Check Point, Palo Alto and Microsoft.  Radiometer Global IT operates with IT functions on a global level, having our international subsidiaries around the world. The overall responsibility for IT and IT security lies within Radiometer in Denmark.  As our new IT Infrastructure Security Engineer, you will join the Global IT network & Security team at Radiometer in Brønshøj DK. In this role you will report to the Senior Manager of Global IT Infrastructure & Cloud Operations.  The position is in Denmark and can be offered as a hybrid work arrangement. Together, the support, infrastructure and security teams currently include a total of 30 fulltime colleagues based in Denmark, Sweden, Poland, India, and US.  In this role, you will have the opportunity to:   Design, plan and implementation of Zero-Trust and segmentation globally in Radiometer.  Provide technical insights into project planning and implementation.  Play a key role in debugging and troubleshooting during project implementation.  Ensure compliance to FDA & Compliance regulations, Quality standards, and Security Policy in relation to project.   The essential requirements of the job include:   Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent and international working experience with global IT.  5+ years’ experience in working with IT security and network.  Experienced in building strong relations with peers and relevant stakeholders.  Experience with network segmentation is key to success in this position.  Technical knowledge in areas around network, firewalls, IT security, micro-segmentation, and Zero-Trust application access   There will be an expectation of travel of 5-15% pr. year.  Application  We continuously assess candidates and invite them for interviews, so please don’t hesitate to write and send in the application.  We encourage you to apply before end of business on 10th December 2023. If you have questions, feel free to contact Senior Manager, Global IT Infrastructure at christian.skovdal@radiometer.dk . We look forward to seeing your application.  We thank you for your interest. Please read our Applicant Data Privacy Notice carefully here.  Hybrid  At Radiometer we believe in designing a better, more sustainable workforce. We recognize the benefits of flexible, hybrid working arrangements for eligible roles and are committed to providing enriching careers, no matter the work arrangement. This position is eligible for a hybrid work arrangement in which you can work part-time at the Company location identified above and part-time remotely from your home. Additional information about this hybrid work arrangement will be provided by your interview team. Explore the flexibility and challenge that working for Radiometer can provide.  Danaher  When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.  At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.  If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.    Part of Danaher Corporation  Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 71,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $19.9B in revenue last year. We are ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 5,200% over 25 years.           This is who we are and the essence of why we come to work every day. It’s a sneak peek into our world. Welcome to Radiometer.        Follow us             Save    Company Profile     Follow   Following    Share      © viamap ApS  © OpenStreetMap contributors  Åkandevej 21, 2700 Brønshøj    Apply                      Working at Radiometer            Helping health care professionals put life first  While every day half a million blood samples are tested around the world using Radiometer equipment, we are not the heroes.  The heroes are the health care professionals who face constant change and challenging situations. And, we are proud to help them ensure life comes first through connected solutions, expert knowledge and trusted partnership.  After all, no one knows what comes next, but in Radiometer, answering what’s next in health care starts with what comes first - life.    Better together  The uniqueness of our team members is key for our ability to grow our business and continue to understand and support an increasingly diverse customer base.  Currently, our team comprise 68 different nationalities speaking 63 different languages. Their unique perspectives are the reason we can continue to meet customer needs and bring new and innovative solutions to market.  ‘Best team wins’ is our mantra and a strong competitive differentiator for us. It applies to both the way we work in our teams and the way we work with our customers.             About Radiometer - We save lives for a living  At Radiometer, our mission is to help caregivers make diagnostic decisions that save lives. To provide caregivers the insight and confidence that help them arrive at the right diagnostic decisions - decisions that in the end help save lives.  On a yearly basis millions of lives are touched by the information our solutions provide and that’s a fact, we take very seriously; the more critical the setting, the greater the requirements are and that’s why we’ve made it our vision to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast and easy patient diagnoses.  Want to know more about our mission and vision? Description:

Vendors  Youtube, Linkedin      Accept these cookies  Decline non-necessary cookies                Career menu       Start    Departments    People    Jobs      Employee  Log in   WS Audiology  WS Audiology  WS Audiology APAC  WS Audiology Americas  WS Audiology EMEA   Candidate  Log in to Connect       WS Audiology EMEA             Facebook       X       LinkedIn       Mail            Research & Development  ·  Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark   Scrum Master - Embedded Software     Apply now            For WSA, it is all about making Wonderful Sound for All, and we really hope you are ready to join our exciting projects. So, continue reading, if you are looking for a position with a true purpose, as we are looking for a Scrum Master to contribute to our purpose. Who we are At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services. Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world. With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes. Sounds wonderful? Then keep reading  The role At WS Audiology, Research & Development is it all about understanding people – and building awareness about how our hearing aids can improve their quality of life. In our Embedded Software department, we are looking for an experienced Scrum Master who effectively can influence our Scrum Teams to deliver great quality and value in a large-scale agile environment. You are a structured person, who can communicate in a precise and easy-to-understand way. You can make things happen, and you do not back down from a challenge. Finally, you thrive in walking the extra mile for the team and you have great collaboration skills. Interested in a virtual coffee meeting? We are curious to get to know you and discover if there could be a mutual interest. We welcome people with different kinds of experience and uniqueness, as long as you have practical experience with being a Scrum Master, work permit in Denmark and can commute to the Lynge office. So, click the apply button now and upload your CV, or read on and learn more about the position. Your responsibility With us you will be responsible for:  Helping your team learn and adopt an agile mindset  Ensuring the team process is effective  Driving a continuous improvement culture in and around the team  Coaching and mentoring team members in the agile mindset and process  Helping your team to live the agile values and principles  Facilitating team events, such as Sprint Planning, Sprint Review and Retrospective, ensuring those events are valuable and effective  Establishing an environment where the team can thrive and deliver value and high quality  Helping your team deal with outside interruptions and distractions  Coaching and supporting the team Product Owner to grow and mature  Helping your team deal with impediments and dependencies  Coaching your team on transparency of progress and forecasts  Ensuring good collaboration inside the team  Ensuring good collaboration with other teams, including dependency management and compliance with agreed standards such as Definition of Ready and Definition of Done  About you The ideal candidate has several years of experience as a Scrum Master, preferably within a software- or firmware-development organization. You do not need to have an engineering or programming background, but a basic understanding of software development processes and terminology will be useful. As a person, you have the passion for impact and are motivated by seeing the results of your effort as well as engaging with others to create them. You are an excellent team player and believe that you can accomplish more as a team than as an individual. We guarantee that when working at WSA, you will grow personally as well as building a new set of competencies. At the same time, you will be supporting people in making wonderful sound for all through the solutions you develop. We expect you to have:  Experience working as a Scrum Master  A strong understanding of an agile mindset  An internal drive for continuous improvement  Ability to foster teamwork and collaboration  Experience with SAFe or other multi-team agile frameworks is a plus  Great communication  and facilitation skills, to drive collaboration within and across teams  Experience with common agile tools such as Azure DevOps or Jira is a plus  Knowledge and understanding of Medical Device Regulation and Design Control is a plus  Knowledge about EN 62304 is a plus  Sounds Wonderful? All you need to do is click “Apply now” to show your interest and we will schedule a virtual meeting with you. Please send your CV no later than the 7th of January 2024. WS Audiology is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.       Department   Research & Development   Role  Embedded Software  Locations  Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark  Employment type  Full-time                  Contact  Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen  Talent Acquisition Partner - EMEA

So, continue reading, if you are looking for a position with a true purpose, as we are looking for an Embedded Software Developers to contribute to our purpose. Who we are At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services. Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world. With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes. Sounds wonderful? Then keep reading The role At WS Audiology, Research & Development it is all about understanding people – and building awareness about how our hearing aids can improve their quality of life. In our Embedded Software department, we are looking for an experienced Embedded Software Developer who can deliver top quality output. You are a very structured team player, who can communicate in a precis and easy-to-understand way. You can make things happen and you do not back down from a challenge. Finally, you thrive in walking the extra mile for the team and you have great collaboration skills. You will be working on development projects, from specifying the features to writing the code. You will be responsible for creating efficient software that is optimized for speed, power consumption and memory. Interested in a virtual coffee meeting? We are curious to get to know you and discover if there could be a mutual interest. We welcome people with different kinds of experience and uniqueness as long as you have practical experience with being an embedded software developer, work permit in Denmark and can commute to the Lynge office. So, click the apply button now and upload your CV, or read on and learn more about the position. Your responsibilities With us you will be responsible for:  Create requirements which is the foundation for what we develop  Write design which describes what you intend to implement  Implement feature to match the requirements and design  Contribute to our peer review and continuous integration  Implement unit tests to ensure correct behavior of your      implementation  Create test specifications to ensure high-quality deliveries      for our users  Meet our Definition of Ready and Definition of Done  Ensure compliance with medical standards  Bring a positive mindset to continue the cozy atmosphere which      we treasure in the team  About you The ideal candidate holds a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in IT, Software, Electronics, Computer Science or similar combined with several years of practical experience within the medical industry. As a person, you have the passion for impact and are motivated by seeing the results of your effort as well as engaging with others to create them. You are an excellent team player and believe that you can accomplish more as a team than as an individual. We guarantee that when working at WSA, you will grow personally as well as building a new set of competencies. At the same time, you will be supporting people in making wonderful sound for all through the solutions you develop. We expect you to have:  B.Sc. or M.Sc. in IT, Software, Electronics, Computer Science      or similar  Experienced within C++/Python and real-time embedded      programming.  Thorough experience in communicating with hardware  A thorough understanding and experience with multithreaded      programming  Experience with debugging real-time systems that have very few      resources  A proven continuous improvement mindset  Great communication skills, to effectively communicate across      cross-functional teams  Knowledge and understanding of Medical Device Regulation and      Design Control is a plus  Knowledge about EN 62304 is a plus  Sounds Wonderful? All you need to do is click “Apply now” to show your interest and we will schedule a virtual meeting with you. Please send your CV no later than the 7th of January 2024. Vendors  Linkedin      Accept these cookies  Decline non-necessary cookies                      Career menu       Careers    Event Calendar    Jobs    Recruitment Process    Become a Graduate    Career & Development Opportunities    Diversity    Working at one of our biogas plants    Departments    Locations    People      Employee  Log in  Candidate  Log in to Connect  Homepage  nature-energy.com                Facebook       X       LinkedIn       Mail             Nature Energy Odense   Data Engineer – Maternity leave  You are responsible for developing the dataflow and implementing software solutions for the world's largest producer of Biogas     Apply            A key position within Nature Energy's biological work with data processing and statistics You will be part of Nature Energy's R&D and Biological Support department, with a total of 22 employees, who conduct research within biogas. An MS SQL database exists to keep track of all the data generated from our own and external laboratories. In addition, we have just started to implement LIMS (Laboratory Information Management System) as a tool to help track workflows for each analysis, implement automatized QC on our process and results, and facilitate a better dataflow. You get the responsibility as a “Product Owner” where you will implement and configure LIMS in close collaboration with external consultants within Europe and our own Laboratory staff. Work tasks can among other things include:  Implement and adjust dataflow between LIMS, new Dataverse/Power Apps, and existing MS SQL databases  Project Management and communication with external consultants - and internal resources within R&D, Laboratory, and IT  Assist in the definition and implementation of Quality Control for analyses and data processing  Data processing  Statistics on laboratory data, for both production and research (data visualizations and analyses)  Your workplace will be at our headquarter in Odense. The maternity leave is expected to be approx. 1 year. IT- and Data profile with Project Management skills and motivation for the green transition You probably have a degree in data science, data analysis, computer science, software engineering, or similar. The most important thing is that you thrive in the intersection between data processing, project management, and programming. You have already acquired your first experience with project management in the field of IT or Software implementation, so you can help facilitate a solid foundation for the data handling procedures in the laboratory. In addition, it is an advantage if you know Python and SQL or have other related programming experience - especially with API’s. We are convinced that the personal match is crucial for us to be successful in the collaboration. That is why we invest in your development and give you the necessary knowledge and insight so that we jointly ensure that you succeed in the position. In addition to being motivated to contribute to the green transition, you are structured and have an analytical approach to tasks. You appear calm and accommodating when working with colleagues and consultants. Working at Nature Energy By joining Nature Energy, you will be part of a highly experienced and ambitious team of leaders in the circular economy. Our common denominator is that we want to build a sustainable future for our planet and our people. we couldn’t be more excited about what the future holds. Today, Nature Energy employs more than 500 dedicated employees across offices in Europe and North America. Headquartered in Denmark, Nature Energy is the European market leader in the development, design, construction, and operation of large, industrialized biogas plants. The company owns and operates 14 biogas plants in Europe and is launching new biogas projects in Europe and North America. You can read more about Nature Energy at www.natureenergy.com and our recruitment process here: https://nature-energy.com/careers/recruitment-process  Interested? Your team and the rest of Nature Energy are excited about you joining our ambitious growth, so be sure to submit your application today! If you have any questions, feel free to contact Data Scientist Anita Eckert at +45 31 76 96 35. We will review applications continuously, so make sure to submit your application today by using our online application form by clicking “Apply for the position” below.       Locations   Nature Energy Odense   Employment type  Full-time                  Contact  Alexander Vinde  Talent Acquisition Specialist
         – 
        People & Culture             Job opportunities ⤵           Projektleder – til projektmodning og myndighedsbehandling   Nature Energy Odense      Process Engineer, Ventilation Systems   Nature Energy Aarhus, Nature Energy Odense      Financial Controller   Finance  ·  Nature Energy Odense           More jobs                   Nature Energy Odense          A unique career - Join us         About Nature Energy  Nature Energy is the market leader in turning many million tonnes of biomass into green, CO2-neutral gas as effectively as possible. We collect and deliver biomass from businesses, agriculture, and households and return the degassed biomass to agriculture that recycles nutrients. This is a circular economy at its best. At the same time, we ensure that the surrounding community around our biogas plants remains as undisturbed as possible by transport and odors. Nature Energy is already making a big difference in the green transition, but our ambitions are even more significant. That is why Nature Energy is investing intensively in research, including our laboratory at our head office in Odense. The laboratory is a site for research into refining the technology to extract more energy from biomass and produce even better fertilizer for agriculture. The laboratory is also researching new biomasses to produce green, CO2-neutral energy in the future. Title: Senior IoT Specialist
Description:
Ansøg nu                                                 Senior IoT Specialist        Hørsholm            Are you driven by innovation and the possibilities of Internet of Things technology in driving sustainability? Are you well-versed in IoT solution development, with a solid grasp of hardware, firmware, and sensor technologies as well as cyber security requirements and technologies at the product and system level?    If you are ready to translate your expertise into advising prospective clients on harnessing the full potential of IoT solutions, we invite you to consider the role of IoT Senior Specialist!   At FORCE Technology, we are undergoing a transformative journey, pivoting towards enhanced business orientation, digitalization, and sustainability, all while prioritizing our clients' needs. We cater to thousands of companies worldwide across diverse industries, and with your prowess, we aim to expand our reach and offerings.  About the role and key responsibilities  As a Senior IoT Specialist in the department for Digital and Sustainable Innovation at FORCE Technology, you will be an integral part of a dynamic team dedicated to digital innovation research, development, and commercial consultancy.  Among our twenty-five highly skilled specialists and consultants in areas such as data and computer science, data analytics and machine learning, wireless communication, sensor technology, digital production as well as design and business innovation, you will contribute with your deep-seated knowledge of electronics and firmware design, and implementation, and digital technology at large.  Combined with your broad grasp of sensor technology, wireless communication, and cyber security you will apply these skills when seeking out digital solutions, advising, and innovating in the areas of production optimization, sustainable business development, and smart city applications. Our overarching mission is to shape a safer, more sustainable future for all stakeholders.  Your key responsibilities include:    Strategic Consultancy:   Guiding companies in selecting optimal and secure IoT solutions tailored to their digital and sensor application needs.  Conducting technology scouting and benchmarking.  Collaborating with clients to define solution and product requirements.  Collaborating with IoT solution suppliers to ensure high-quality, purpose aligned IoT solutions.   Applied Research Projects:   Engaging in collaborative applied research initiatives and projects with universities, research organizations, innovation clusters and industrial partners both in Denmark and internationally.  Harnessing the power of data by enabling sustainable and secure digital solutions in these key areas: Digital and sustainable production, sustainable business innovation, digital water technologies and smart city applications.  Disseminating knowledge through national and international conferences, webinars and workshops, white papers, peer reviewed articles, and articles in relevant scientific journals, industry magazines, and news outlets.   Your main workplace will be in Hørsholm, situated in the DTU Science Park, just 20 km north of Copenhagen. Reporting to Head of IoT Architecture and Technology, Michael Vaa, you will enjoy a flexible work environment that includes the option of remote work on select days.  Your profile  To excel in this role, we are looking for someone with:  An academic background in electronics engineering, at the B.Sc. level or above, specializing in electronic hardware and firmware design with solid knowledge of electronic product cyber security requirements and standards and preferably with knowledge of IoT technology, sensor technology, and wireless communication.  A track record of minimum 8-10 years' experience in developing and implementing digital and electronics solutions and technologies. If you have a M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree 5 years’ experience will suffice.   Enthusiasm for engaging holistically with IoT technology, both through advisory consultancy and applied research projects.  A capacity to manage multiple projects and a drive for continuous personal growth and knowledge enhancement.  A proactive, focused approach to work, with strong project management skills, driving tasks to completion.  Exceptional communication skills, enabling seamless collaboration across organizational, and professional boundaries.  A good sense of humour and the desire to be part of a team working toward a common goal.   Additional information    If you are passionate about driving IoT innovation and leveraging your skills to guide businesses towards a more sustainable future, we invite you to explore the exciting role of IoT Senior Specialist at FORCE Technology. Embrace the opportunity to influence positive change while honing your expertise. Let us connect and discuss how you can become an integral part of our forward-thinking team.  We can offer a unique workplace with a great diversity of professions and tasks. We work to make the world more sustainable and safer, and as an Approved Technological Service Institute we are a central part of technology development in Denmark.  You will be greeted by more than 1000 enthusiasts who work every day to make the greatest possible benefit to business and society. Everyday life is characterized by busyness, high professionalism, curiosity and humor in an informal atmosphere.  Does this sound like something for you?  If you think this job is for you, send us your application today. We process applications on an ongoing basis and invite candidates for interview along the way. Please note that we only accept electronic applications via our recruitment system.  If you have any questions about the position, please contact Michael Vaa on 4022 3288.  We look forward to receiving your application, CV and other relevant attachments.  At FORCE Technology, we are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse environment, and we are actively looking for qualified people candidates regardless of gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, disability or age.    Ansøg nu       Læs mere                Er du klar til at tage udfordringen op?  Hvis det her lyder som noget for dig, så grib chancen og så send os din ansøgning og CV. Vi indkalder til samtaler løbende, så send gerne allerede i dag.   Ansøg nu           Hurtige facts om FORCE Technology      Blev etableret i        Antal kontorer         Antal medarbejdere                         Et læringsmiljø i konstant bevægelse  Du træder ind i en virksomhed, der hele tiden bevæger sig for at være på forkant med den teknologiske udvikling. Det betyder, at du får mulighed for at arbejde med det nyeste udstyr, udforske ny viden og flytte grænserne for, hvad der er
            muligt, ved at teste ting af, der ikke er prøvet før.  Dermed får du chancen for at udvikle dig i og med din rolle, samtidig med at nye muligheder hele tiden åbner sig. Så i FORCE Technology kan du finde mange forskellige karriereveje. Karriereveje der former sig efter lige
            netop dig, din viden og dine ambitioner.                   Følg os på:                 FORCE Technology – vi hjælper andre til at gøre forskel      FORCE Technology er et internationalt GTS-institut og en vigtig del af rygraden i det danske innovations-system. For siden 1940 har vi hjulpet virksomheder med at tage næste skridt i udviklingen og finde nye og bedre
          teknologiske
          løsninger. Det kan vi, fordi vi er specialister på teknologi, og fordi vores over 1.000 dygtige og dedikerede medarbejdere, der er fordelt på over 30 kontorer i 6 lande, står klar til at hjælpe med uvildig rådgivning, analyse, test og
          inspektioner.    Vi er stolte af vores arbejde og af, at vi kan være med til at sikre en mere bæredygtig fremtid, når vi fx hjælper med at forlænge levetiden på et produkt eller finder en ny måde at bruge det på. Ligesom vi er stolte af at bidrage til en
          mere sikker verden, når vi undersøger sikkerheden i en komponent, et materiale, et system eller noget helt fjerde. Title: Senior IT Infrastructure Architect
Description: Sorry, Internet Explorer 11 is no longer supported by SmartRecruiters    Please update to one of the following browsers:   Google Chrome  Microsoft Edge  Apple Safari  Mozilla Firefox     You can find details about supported web browsers here .       Senior IT Infrastructure Architect Fuldtid Jobbeskrivelse Are you experienced and skilled within the technical field and do you find yourself interested in having focus on the security of the technical solutions? The Senior IT Infrastructure Architect plays a critical role in advancing our IT infrastructure solutions. You are responsible for designing complex infrastructure projects, offering expertise, and mentoring team members. Success in this role involves contributing to the strategic direction of our infrastructure and ensuring its alignment with our company's vision and values. You will be part of the department, which is responsible for delivering IT Infrastructure to our customers. You will be responsible for designing the products and concepts with focus on security, quality and performance. You will get the opportunity to influence our future strategy in our delivery of infrastructure, where the most important thing is to develop sturdy and long-term concepts, fullfiling our own and our customers high demands. Since we are a global company with customers and colleagues based all over the world. Danish and English is spoken every day, but your primary place of work will be at our office in Skejby, Aarhus N. We deliver in all phases of a customer project and as a Senior IT Infrastructure Architect you possess a strong role from the sales phase, where focus is on the specifications, the design and the price setting and you also contribute with concepts and adjustments of the design in the project delivery. You will also add value through test cases and collecting information after handover to customer and customer support, which you will bring back as learning to your colleagues in the infrastructure department. Sparring and collaboration You will play a go-to-guy role where the Cyber Security team, the Software Product department, the Sales department and the Project execution department will be the key stakeholders outside the infrastructure department. The infrastructure department is a global organization with architects and engineers. Your primarily responsibilities and tasks will be: Lead the development and refinement of the design of the IT Infrastructure concepts, specifications and pricing Provide expert guidance to assess, test and ensure the security, quality and performance of the IT infrastructure. Play a pivotal role in decomposing complex systems during the design phase, considering interactions and dependencies. Act as a mentor to the IT Infrastructure Engineers fostering their professional growth. Collaborate with Sales on leads analysing the requirements from the customers and define innovative customer solutions, fully leveraging our core products. Drive internal projects regarding POC of new Infrastructure concepts Do a proper stakeholder management with both customers and internal stakeholders. Senior IT Infrastructure Architect To be successful in the position we expect you to have solid experience from a similar position with designing IT infrastructure including security components and you are an expert in communicating complex solutions in a way where your stakeholders understand it, both orally and in writing.  Furthermore, we imagine that: You have experience from a large enterprise or as an external consultant working with business-critical IT Infrastructure You have a relevant education within computer science or similar experience You have relevant certification with e.g., TOGAF, CCNA, MCP and VCP You can write and speak both Danish and English fluent You thrive with big challenges and an unpredictable workday. Interested If you have any questions regarding the position, please reach out to Head of Project IT Anette Irene Algreen at +45 3112 6406. Please apply online via the link as soon as possible. We will interview candidates on an ongoing basis. We look forward to hearing from you!  BEUMER Group  Conveying, loading, palletising, packing, sortation and distribution – BEUMER Group is a leader within the development and manufacture of high-technological intralogistics systems for global markets. Our employees stand out from others thanks to their ability to supply innovative solutions to our customers. They can do this because they know the industry and are passionate about continuously developing and expanding their knowledge. We support these high standards through teamwork, mutual respect and a working culture based on trust that fosters stability and security for all of our employees. Our common goal is to implement outstanding and innovative projects worldwide. Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                        System Architect      Do you enjoy working with complex systems designed for international customers in most of the world?  Weibel is recognized as a world-leader in radar technology, with our radars performing with a precision largely unmatched by competitors. Applications for our radars include Space Research, Missile Defence, Instrumentation Systems and lately for Drone and UAS Detection. Radars are produced at our Allerød factory, and about 98% of Weibel radars are exported. Increasing customer demand means that the company is experiencing rapid growth.  As part of this growth, we are looking for a new colleague for our Systems Engineering team.    About the position  As our new colleague you will be responsible for system architecture including system documentation and associated requirements engineering. As the design authority on the system level, you will work in close cooperation with our subsystem architects, ensuring that the various subsystems work together in a manner that will satisfy the overall system requirements.  The position will include the following tasks:   Defining the overall architecture of the product  Flow down of requirements to the subsystem level  Describing main subsystem requirements and interfaces between subsystems  Developing system budgets defining contributions from each subsystem  Reviewing subsystem design and ensuring system level performance  Coordination of the overall technical solution with the Subsystem Architects and the Project Manager  Initial pre-bid coordination with Sales regarding technical specifications  Ensuring new solutions/designs are aligned with our technology roadmap and product direction to enable maximum reuse in future deliveries   Working at Weibel will give you the opportunity to participate in the further development of our system engineering processes and tool chain. The position will also allow for influence on the direction of our future technology base.    About you  You thrive in an environment that requires you to work independently on some tasks and in close collaboration with your colleagues on others. You prefer a fast working pace that allows you to work on many different tasks simultaneously where some requires immediate action and others focus on the long-term perspective.  Your CV should include:   A university degree within either electrical engineering or software engineering  Experience with systems engineering in relation to complex systems  Knowledge of requirement engineering (Helix ALM)  Practical experience with MBSE, preferably SysML, UML or similar (Enterprise Architect)  Fluid in English both written and spoken   Experience with radar systems or complex systems for military use, is considered an advantage.  It is a requirement for this position that you can obtain a security clearance.    Your new team  You will be joining our team of 8 competent and enthusiastic colleagues in the System Engineering team. The level of experience in the team spans from a few years of experience to more than 30 years of experience. Our team members have very different educational backgrounds that varies from electrical, aerospace and mechanical engineering to physics and computer science. We have created it in this way, because we believe that bringing people with different competences together will generate the best solutions.    Contact and application  Please apply at our website using the ”Apply” button. If you have any questions, you are very welcome to contact Systems Engineering Director, Christian Munthe Støttrup chs@weibel.dk  The application deadline is December 4th, 2023.  We are looking forward to hearing from you.      About Weibel Scientific Weibel Scientific A/S is an independent privately held Danish engineering company and the leading global producer and exporter of Doppler radars for use in space research, the aerospace industry, defense, and missile defense and critical infrastructure protection. Since its formation in 1977, Weibel has delivered more than 5,000 radars to more than 40 countries. To maintain the greatest possible control and quality trough all stages of production, all work from development to manufacturing is done at Weibel’s headquarters in Allerød, Denmark, where Weibel employs approximately 345 people. Read more at www.weibelradars.com           Job type Engineer, System Engineer      Application due  12/4/2023      Contact person      Christian Munthe Støttrup  Director Systems Engineering    E-mail                   E-mail                   E-mail                   E-mail    E-mail             Homepage  https://weibelradars.com/      Workplace  Allerød        Follow us                 Om stillingen    Jobbtype Vikariat  Heltid/Deltid Heltid  Arbeidstid Dag

Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                                     Senior Full Stack Developer for Generative AI Projects     About the job  At KPMG NewTech, we are passionate about AI and how new technologies can change the way companies and organizations work.  We are looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our growing Machine Learning and Quantum team. If you are passionate about Generative AI, and the newest trends and developments in the industry, you might be our new colleague.  We manage AI projects from idea to implementation  At KPMG NewTech, our Machine Learning team manages AI projects from start to finish: identifying emerging business issues, crafting innovative models, executing and rolling out scalable systems, and empowering peers and customers to leverage the full potential of AI.  As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you will work on different projects critical to our clients' needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects.  We expect you to display leadership qualities, and be enthusiastic to support other team members in developing expertise.  Our team  The Machine Learning and Quantum team is focused on delivering solutions using the latest developments in the AI space. Our team consists of diverse individuals with backgrounds in data science, software, UX, business, and engineering. We are passionate about using AI to solve real-world problems for our clients and take pride in being experts in the field.  Currently, we are heavily focused on generative AI and how recent and ongoing developments are shaping the landscape.  Our team is dedicated to creating an inclusive and welcoming work environment for all employees. We value diversity and believe it is crucial to our success.  About our newest team member:  Minimum qualifications:   B.E. or M.Sc . in Computer Science or a related field.  5+ years of industry experience.  Excellent communication and teamwork skills.  Demonstrated ability to lead complex software development projects from conception to deployment.   Preferred qualifications:   Solid proficiency in frontend technologies such as Angular/React, Typescript/JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS/SCSS.  Experience with backend languages and frameworks like C#, Python, NodeJS, SQL, and NoSQL.  Familiarity with cloud providers like AWS, Azure, or GCP is a plus.  Knowledge of containerization, such as Docker.  Having a pragmatic approach without over-engineering.  Drive for continuous learning and staying updated with the evolving tech landscape.  Knowledge and experience in the generative AI space.   Responsibilities:   Interact directly with clients to understand their requirements, provide technical insights, and ensure that the development aligns with their expectations.  Lead the design and implementation of scalable software architecture.  Foster a team culture that values inclusiveness, collaboration, and making a meaningful impact.  Mentor junior developers and team members, providing guidance and support for their growth and development. Lead by example in both technical expertise and professional conduct.  Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards and best practices.   Why join us?  We offer a dynamic and inclusive work environment that supports your professional growth and development. With competitive compensation and benefits, flexible work arrangements, and a commitment to learning and innovation, we provide opportunities for you to excel in your career.  At our organization, we value and respect diversity. We believe that a diverse workforce leads to better outcomes for our clients and employees. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, abilities, identities, and perspectives to apply.  Please don’t hesitate to contact Barbara Isaksen, Manager in Machine Learning and Quantum, at +45 31415095 or baisaksen@kpmg.com , if you’d like to know more about the position.              Application due 12/17/2023  Start date Start as soon as possible   Position type Management Consulting      Work hours  Workplace Copenhagen       Website      Questions regarding the position     Barbara Isaksen  Manager        baisaksen@kpmg.com                                                   Follow us               KPMG is a global network of professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 144 countries and have over 236,000 people working in member firms around the world. We work closely with a broad range of clients, such as business corporations, governments and public sector agencies and not-for-profit organisations. We support them in mitigating risks and exploiting business opportunities.  KPMG in Denmark is the fastest growing professional services firm in Denmark, achieving 1,365,279 million DKK in revenue in FY22. Together, over 1100 employees and partners work to deliver value to our clients through a combination of deep local insight and strong global perspectives. We tailor our approach to the challenge at hand, and we are constantly pushing boundaries to deliver the best services and solutions for our clients.  KPMG P/S, Dampfærgevej 28, 2100 København Ø, Tel: +45 7070 7760, CVR no. 25578198                               ShareThis Copy and Paste

Our software is used for testing everything from the smallest hearing aid components to wind turbine motors, so your contribution will have a big impact on the quality of products that are vital to people and planet.  Work for better products across industries  You will play a key role in ensuring the quality of our software systems. Based on a solid understanding of the reality in which the systems will operate, you take pride in creating excellent code that can be decoupled and reused between projects and facilitate maintenance of existing equipment.  You will be working closely with other software developers/architects, engineers, IT and sales consultants. You are typically part of the process right from establishing of the customer’s needs to planning, design, implementation, and testing.  At CIM, we work with technologies ranging from data collection applications in LabVIEW to test sequences typically executed from TestStand. We are a National Instruments Center of Excellence so you will be joining a team of experts within this field.  We want you to focus on doing what you do best, so expect that meetings and time-consuming processes are kept to an absolute minimum.  You choose whether you want to be based at the Aarhus or Hørsholm office.  System engineer with an eye for quality  We imagine that you   are an experienced LabVIEW/TestStand-developer  have a relevant degree in Computer Science, Engineering (electronics, low voltage, software, mechanics, etc.), or Software Engineering  have good communication skills and are a strong team player  combine business acumen with a sense of how best to create value in your work  speak and write English at a professional level  have experience with project management and agile working methods such as Scrum  use some of the technologies (or comparable) that we work with daily: LabVIEW / TestStand / SQL / communication protocols / hardware interfaces / software interfaces, etc.  We encourage anyone qualified to apply for the position regardless of age, gender, religion or ethnicity.   Adapt your schedule to fit your lifestyle  You are the expert on what makes you happy and efficient. Whether that entails a 4-day work week or working in the evening or from home is entirely up to you.  25 years of working with the best  Companies like Pfizer, Novo Nordisk, Danfoss, Siemens, Vestas, Grundfos, and Mærsk rely on our expertise and solutions for collecting, analyzing and making data available.  Start making an impact on product quality  Please apply for the position by sending your CV and a short application by email to Site Director Anders Rohde at ar@cim.as .  Start date is as soon as possible, but we will wait for the right candidate. Please note that we will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis.  If you have any questions, please feel free to call Anders on +45 28 11 88 58.   We look forward to hearing from you!
