Title: Specialist - Information Security, Gdansk or Viby
Description: Press Tab to Move to Skip to Content Link  Skip to main content          Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates                        Search by Keyword                         Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates             View Profile                      Search by Keyword        Filter using country       Loading...        Country/Region    All                            ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:     Create Alert         ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:                 APPLY NOW »             Specialist - Information Security, Gdansk or Viby           Location:    Gdansk, PL   Viby J, DK              Would you like to use your Cyber Skills, and join the best Information Security Team in Denmark, on a heavy Digitilised company? Then, keep reading!    About the job  Catch this exciting opportunity to join Arla's Global IT team. With over 200+ highly skilled IT specialists and 800 expert consultants, we are transforming the future of dairy products while making a meaningful impact on people's lives.  But here at Arla, we're not just about making some of the world's most beloved dairy products. We're about making healthy taste delicious, making mornings worth getting out of bed for, and making family dinners unforgettable. Our iconic brands, such as Arla®, Castello®, and Lurpak®, are more than just products; they're an integral and natural part of modern life in over 100 countries around the globe.  As a Information Security Specialist, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the security and integrity of our clients' information systems. You will work closely with senior consultants and contribute to projects related to cloud security, network security, IAM, and data protection.    Key Responsibilities:  •               Collaborate with senior consultants to assess and identify security vulnerabilities in our IT system landscape.  •               Assist in the design and implementation of security measures for cloud-based environments.  •               Participate in the development and maintenance of network security protocols and configurations.  •               Support IAM, Network, Cloud security initiatives by implementing counter measures  •               Contribute to the implementation and monitoring of data protection measures, including encryption and data loss prevention.    Technical Requirements:  •               Bachelor's degree in Information Security, Computer Science, or a related field.  •               Familiarity with cloud security principles and best practices (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).  •               Familiarity with network security concepts, including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and VPNs.  •               Basic knowledge of Identity and Access Management (IAM) concepts.    Other Requirements:  •               Understanding of data protection and privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) is a plus but not a must  •               Problem-solving and analytical skills.  •               Strong communication and teamwork abilities      Preferred Skills/ It is a strong plus if you have:   Microsoft /CISCO certifications  Project Management skills, both in Waterfall and/or Agile (SAFe)  Understanding the business in a holistic way       What do we offer?  At Arla, we value our IT specialists and provide a range of attractive benefits to support your personal and professional growth:  •               Trainings with industry experts and a comprehensive induction program.  •               Financial support for ongoing education and professional development.  •               Flexibility in working hours and the option to work from home.  •               Medical care and life insurance coverage.  •               Employee Assistance Program offering legal, psychological, health, and financial consulting.  •               Additional perks like gym memberships, vouchers, travel points, and cinema tickets.  •               Home kit including a monitor, laptop, keyboard, mouse, headsets, and webcam.  •               Relaxation breaks to recharge and maintain work-life balance.  •               Relocation allowance for a smooth transition to our vibrant city.  •               Referral program for employees to earn rewards by recommending top talent.  •               Additional holiday days based on length of employment (up to 4 days).    Application and contact  If you are ready to drive innovation and make a global impact alongside talented colleagues, seize this exciting opportunity by applying today.  Welcome to Global Shared Services in Gdansk  Arla is a global farmer-owned organisation that is behind many well-known and loved brands, including Arla Apetina®, Castello®, Lurpak® and many, many more.  With 15 years of existence in Gdansk, we offer you a lot of knowledge and the opportunity to partake in challenging and exciting innovation projects. As a part of the Arla organisation, you will also enjoy a Scandinavian, collaborative work culture.    We have a purpose for Good  At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you? Title: OPS Data Scientist
Description: ×                  OPS Data Scientist         Applications are considered on a rolling basis         Multiple locations     Hybrid                I'm interested              Applications are considered on a rolling basis         Multiple locations     Hybrid        Job Description  Join our Operational Analytics team as a Data Scientist, where you'll play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data to uncover strategic insights and drive tangible business growth. As a key member of the Ops Data & Analytics team, consisting of three analysts and one data scientist, you'll be at the forefront of transforming raw data into intuitive insights.  This role primarily focuses on text analysis, speech-to-text analysis, and other predictive analysis, ensuring alignment with those who have a keen interest in these specific areas.  Utilize advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze extensive datasets, extracting actionable insights. Engage with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges, fostering collaborative efforts to develop data-driven solutions that optimize customer processes and enhance operational efficiency.  Main tasks and responsibilities:   Apply advanced statistical and machine learning techniques, with a primary focus on text analysis, speech-to-text analysis, and other predictive analysis.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges, developing data-driven solutions to optimize customer processes and drive operational efficiency.  Design and implement predictive models and algorithms for forecasting, anomaly detection, and decision-making.  Develop and maintain data pipelines, ensuring data quality and integrity throughout the data lifecycle.  Present findings and recommendations in a clear and concise manner to facilitate informed decision-making.  Stay updated on the latest industry trends and emerging technologies in data science and analytics.   Skills & Requirements   A bachelor's or master's degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline.  Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, with experience in data manipulation, analysis, and visualization.  Solid understanding of statistical concepts and experience applying statistical modeling techniques.  Experience with machine learning algorithms, data mining, and predictive modeling.  Familiarity with databases and SQL for data extraction and manipulation.  Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail, with the ability to work independently or as part of a team.  Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.   Experience:    Experience as a data scientist, data engineer, data specialist or data analyst.  A strong track record of building and deploying predictive and/or prescriptive models.  Proven programming and modelling expertise.  Experience with cloud platforms, such as AWS or Azure, is a plus.  Prior experience in customer analytics or process optimization is advantageous but not mandatory.   What we offer   An opportunity to work in a large, high-performing international company, in a dynamic environment that is constantly changing.  A corporate culture that is professional and dynamic, yet informal. Bureaucracy is kept to a minimum, as we expect our skilled employees to make long lasting and impactful decisions to shape our future.  Highly competent, dedicated, and friendly co-workers with strong collaboration across the Nordics.  Hybrid work environment (2-3 days remote work per week).  Emphasis on work-life balance.  Anticipated travel activity of 2-3 times per year, each trip lasting a few days.  Opportunity to work with the latest technologies in machine learning and AI.   This position can be in any of our Nordic locations in Helsinki, Hvidovre, Solna, Stavanger or Lysaker.  Are you interested?  If you are intrigued by this position and possess the right profile and mindset, please submit your application and CV via the link. Applications will be reviewed continuously, and interviews will be planned as soon as a suitable candidate is identified.  If you have any questions about the position, you can contact Philip Aarup, Team Leader of OPS Data & Analytics. Our purpose is to help people and businesses prosper and we aim to be the best retail and commercial bank, earning the lasting loyalty of our people, customers, shareholders and communities - through simple, personal and fair banking.  In our organization we foster and value an engaged, challenging and passionate environment that provides opportunities for personal and professional growth. We operate in an ever changing environment, and believe the key to success is innovative involvement, a playful approach to active learning and continuous improvement in our daily work.  We are firmly committed to being a responsible bank in the way we operate, our culture, caring for our environment and giving back to society. Banco Santander is recognized as the most sustainable bank in the world following the publication of the Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI) for 2019.  Read more about responsible banking on our global webpages.  Santander Consumer Bank is one of the largest Nordic banks providing loans and credits, credit cards, deposits and insurance to private customers. Description: EN   PL         KK WIND SOLUTIONS Careers website: All vacancies         Follow us                         Home    Unsolicited application    KK Job Agent          You are here :                        KK WIND SOLUTIONS Careers website: All vacancies                Follow us                       Menu Careers website KK WIND SOLUTIONS     Home    Unsolicited application    KK Job Agent                       KK WIND SOLUTIONS vacancy search engine        Keywords (e.g. Sales engineer Paris)    Job title      Job location Please select a value Asia (5) India (4) Bengaluru (4) Europe (64) Denmark (19) Horsholm (1) Ikast (13) Vojens (3) Poland (43) Szczecin - Goleniowska (41) Szczecin - Office Center (2)    Branch of Work ▼ Please select one or more values Deselect all Automation (1) Customer Service (2) Electrical Engineering (8) Engineering (9) Facility (3) Finance (7) HR (2) Logistics (2) Mechanical Engineering (3) Other (1) Production (9) Production Engineering (1) Project Management (11) Quality& HSE (2) Sales (2) Service (2) Sourcing (1) Warehouse (3)       View all vacancies    RSS and other feeds                              Technical supporter               Vacancy description     Technical supporter    If you Want a versatile, challenging and technical position, enabling you to make a difference in renewable energy Are educated and interested in industrial applications, networks and IT Are a team player wanting to work in a rapidly developing international company About us KK Wind Solutions A/S´s department in Vojens is the leading supplier of condition monitoring systems to the wind industry. Our owner has more than 35 years of experience within electrical systems for wind turbines. Together, we form the absolute front line with renewable energy technology development. Read much more about us www.KKwindsolutions.com We offer As a frontrunner in the renewable energy industry, sustainability and innovation are part of our Company DNA and strongly embedded in the way we operate our company.     Highlights of the offer     Job offer expiration:  31/12/2023    Type of work:  Hybrid    Role:  Individual Contributor / Specialist    Location:  Europe, Denmark, Vojens         Responsibilities   Then be part of our Technical support team Our current team of 3 technical supporter in Denmark need a new colleague. The tasks and responsibilities include various aspects of technical support: direct customer contact including troubleshooting, training in use of our products and international documentation, inhouse software validation and pre-RMA handling. For our TCM product you will work on server migrations, troubleshooting installations and handle software updates. Since some of our customers are based in the US the job can optionally also be executed from there. If you are competent at executing tasks, pragmatic and like a challenging work day, then this is the position for you.     Our requirements   Who you are As a person you are proactive and self-driven. You use words as forthcoming, a good communicator, structured, resourceful, persistent and enthusiastic to describe yourself. A good sense of humour will enable you to fit right into the department. Most likely your previous work experience is as senior IT supporter or working with Data engineering. Moreover, we imagine that you have: A technical education in computer science, IT Support, technician or similar Experience in working with Linux (RHEL), Windows server platforms (2012, 2019, IIS) and MySQL/MSSQL is preferable Experience with/knowledge of basic Network setup and infrastructure Experience with/knowledge of using VPN clients including configuration, port forwarding, remote desktop etc Experience with/knowledge on working with windows CMD prompt Experience with/knowledge of Bash, Power Shell and PHP is an advantage but not a requirement Experience in Database troubleshooting and maintenance (MariaDB, MSSQL/MySQL 5 & 8) International and customer-centred way of thinking and working Confident handling of the digital communication media Fluent English on a business level, Danish an advantage     We offer   At KK Wind Solutions, we offer you the opportunity to collaborate with colleagues across cultures in developing innovative greentech solutions. Founded on our long history as an industry pioneer and strong financial position, we are always looking for ways to improve our business and encourage new ideas and fresh perspectives. Combined with a flat hierarchical structure and a positive and informal working environment with a can-do attitude, this allows our employees to grow both personally and professionally.     Benefits     Further information   Since some of our customers are based in the US the job can optionally also be executed from there.  If the above matches your field of interest and your qualifications, please send your application and resume as soon as possible. Interviews are held on an ongoing basis.  For further information, please contact: Zabihullah Alefi Email: zabih@kkwindsolutions.com       About KK Wind Solutions   Building on more than 40 years of experience, KK Wind Solutions is a leading systems supplier to the renewable energy industry. Our capabilities span developing state-of-the-art technologies, high-quality lean manufacturing, and flexible aftermarket services. KK Wind Solutions is owned by A.P. Moller Holding, the parent company of the A.P. Moller Group, established in 1904 by Arnold Peter Møller. We are a global and diverse team of over 2,300 people, working towards delivering products and services that enable a future powered by renewable energy.   At KK Wind Solutions, our culture and DNA are built on a foundation of can-do attitude and innovation. We actively foster an inclusive work environment that embraces diversity, rejects any form of discrimination, and provides equal opportunities for all people. Our commitment lies in cultivating a strong culture centred around health, safety, wellbeing, and effective teamwork.   Visit www.kkwindsolutions.com to learn more about our company and career opportunities.                                   KK Legal Notices    Accessibility    Sitemap     Go to top

Privacy policy:  Facebook - Privacy policy (opens in a new tab)    Expiry:  Session    Name:     Vendor:  www.facebook.com          Decline all  Save settings  Accept all cookies         Strictly necessary        Functional        Statistical        Marketing      powered by: Cookie Information         Cookie policy   Your consent applies to the following domains:  bestseller.com  The cookie policy was last updated on 01.11.2023      What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small data file stored in your computer, tablet or smartphone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful malware or virus.  How our website uses cookies  Some cookies perform essential functions for our website. Cookies also help us get an overview of your visit to our website so we can continuously optimize and tailor the experience to your needs and interests. For example, cookies remember things like the items added to the shopping cart; whether you have visited our website before; if you are logged in; and the specific language and currency you prefer to see on the website. We also use cookies to target our ads specifically to you on other websites. In general, we use cookies as part of our service to present you with content that is as relevant to you as possible.  You can see the specific services that store cookies and why they do it, under the different categories:   Functional  Statistical  Marketing   How long are cookies stored?  The length of time a cookie is stored on your devices and browsers varies. The lifetime is calculated according to your last visit to the website. When a cookie expires, it is automatically deleted. All our cookies’ lifetimes are specified in our cookie policy.  How to block or delete cookies  You may at any time block all or just third-party cookies completely by changing the browser settings on your computer, tablet or smartphone. The location of these settings will depend on the browser you use. However, you should be aware that if you block all or just third-party cookies, there may be functions and services that you will be unable to use on the website (because these depend on cookies).  You can opt-out of cookies from Google Analytics here .  How can you delete cookies?  It is easy to delete cookies that you have previously accepted. It depends on which browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, etc.) and device (smartphone, tablet, PC, Mac) you are using. You can typically find this information under settings – Security and Privacy – but this may vary from one browser to another.  Specify which device/browser you are using (click the appropriate link):   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Chrome, Android   Changing your consent  You can change your consent by either deleting cookies from your browser or by changing your original choice by clicking the link below:  You can change your consent by clicking here  Remember: If you use more than one browser, you must delete cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  If you have any comments or questions relating to our information and/or processing of personal data, please feel welcome to contact us. 
The cookie policy itself is updated once a month by Cookie Information . If you have any questions about our cookie policy, you are welcome to contact Cookie Information on their website.     Settings  Accept all cookies     powered by: Cookie Information       Functional  Statistical  Marketing                                                Careers  Careers  Sustainability  Sustainability  Our Company  Our Company  News  News  Brands  Brands                 Senior AI Application Engineer                    Join our pioneering team at BESTSELLER, where innovation meets expertise in the realm of AI and machine learning. We are on the lookout for a seasoned Senior AI Application Engineer with a profound passion for data-driven innovation and exceptional skills in developing cutting-edge machine learning solutions.     YOUR NEW ROLE As a pivotal member of BESTSELLER's Data & Analytics department, you will spearhead the development of interactive AI solutions, applications, and dashboards that are the cornerstone of our data-driven decision-making process. Collaborating closely with a team of expert data scientists, engineers, analysts, and various stakeholders from the business. Your role is not just about building solutions but revolutionizing how we understand and utilize data. YOUR TEAM You will be an integral part of a dynamic team within the Data & Analytics department, a group of over 50 data enthusiasts driving the data agenda at BESTSELLER. Our focus is not only on delivering unmatched value to our end consumers but also on maintaining the highest standards of customer satisfaction and quality. You will join a product team of eight highly skilled professionals, all committed to harnessing the potential of data to enhance customer experiences, streamline operations, and drive revenue growth. YOUR IMPACT In your role as a Senior AI Application Engineer, you will: Drive the development of data-driven services and visualizations using tools like Python, Plotly Dash, TensorFlow, Kubernetes, Databricks, Snowflake, and dbt. Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and backend developers to ensure seamless data flow and successful feature implementation. Drive application development, data modeling, and UI/UX development, all aimed at delivering value to our end consumers and ensuring that satisfaction and quality are always on the radar. YOUR BENEFITS A dynamic and challenging role in a fast-paced, decision-driven environment. Collaboration with a diverse, highly skilled team and various business stakeholders. Extensive opportunities for skill enhancement and professional growth in an international setting. Dedicated time for training, education, and a pathway to a wide array of certifications. YOUR PROFILE We are seeking an energetic, proactive team player with: A Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Advanced proficiency in Python and a genuine interest in data engineering and visualization. Proven experience in containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes) and developing/maintaining production-grade web applications. Demonstrated expertise in deploying machine learning-driven applications in production environments. Excellent communication skills for effective technical presentations to non-technical stakeholders. The following qualifications would also be an advantage: Proficiency in Plotly Dash, cloud computing services (GCP, AWS, Azure), and database management (SQL, NoSQL). Strong knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. WORK LOCATION Your primary workplace will be at our vibrant office in Aarhus. WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU If you have any questions about the position, feel free to reach out to Emil Hartvig Pedersen (+45 29628203). Otherwise, please send us your application and CV as soon as possible, but no later than December 13th, 2023. We invite for interviews on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the add when we have found the right candidate     ABOUT BESTSELLER At BESTSELLER, we are more than 18,000 people in 38 different countries working for over 20 fashion brands such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, NOISY MAY and Y.A.S. We are a family-owned company with a strong foundation and values to build on, empowering us to pursue the ideas we believe in to take BESTSELLER forward. We are committed to diversity and provide equal opportunities for everyone, irrespective of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, sexual orientation or gender identity. We strive to create an empowering environment where people can thrive and develop. For more information, visit www.bestseller.com.        You will become part of the BESTSELLER family, a culture where new ideas are welcomed, and all voices are heard. We believe in entrepreneurship; this means you have the freedom to do this in the way which works for you. You get responsibility and the opportunity to develop yourself and your area from day one. We believe in flexibility and autonomy in your daily routine and working location.         At BESTSELLER, we own it. Every chance. Every challenge. Every choice. We’re the global fashion company that’s fast paced and family run. We’re the business that’s built some of the strongest brands in the industry. By empowering every individual to own their journey, we’ve found the courage to keep getting better. To act more sustainably. To foster diversity and provide equal opportunities. To compete more confidently. And to keep challenging the status quo. Time and time again. We are BESTSELLER - and together, we own it. Senior Systems Engineer, Digital Solutions           Application Deadline:            Workplace:  Hybrid Position          Location:    Bjerringbro, DK, 8850             Contract Type:  Full-Time          Working Hours:  37          Employment Type:  Regular                Can you use your technical understanding to create the best possible testing of our digital end-to-end IoT solutions? Do you want to see your coding end up as concrete physical products that minimise water and energy usage?    “Your job is really rewarding, as you are not just testing within a system - you are able to see the actual physical results,” says Peter Bertelsen, Head of Architecture.    A team of sustainable, digital potential  Your skilled colleagues are looking forward to welcoming you are our Digital Solutions team in Bjerringbro. We are organized within autonomous Scrum teams to deliver the digital solutions of tomorrow. In fact, we want to create the most intelligent solutions in our industry.    With colleagues from China, Romania, India and Denmark, you strive to create the best digital pump and water solutions with a direct environmental impact. Our digital aspirations will heavily affect your potential to make an impact on the way we work - with global sustainability and digitalisation alike.    You cover every eventuality  As our new test automation engineer, you will become an essential part of a Scrum team, securing that our solutions are delivering the right value to our customers by developing automated end-to-end tests from hardware (such as pumps, controllers, communication devices, sensors) to web and mobile user interface.    Another key responsibility of yours is making sure that the right solutions are implemented when discovering implications and hurdles when testing. To solve this task, you delegate the responsibility within your Scrum team.    Furthermore, you think strategically to reuse and automate. Thinking modularly is important, as well as finding solutions, that covers every eventuality when testing end-to-end.    Diligence and leadership matters  Besides your technical knowledge of test automation, your diligence is your most important personality trait. Being able to combine your knowhow and thoroughness enables you to make sure, that the products of your team always live up to the high-quality standards of Grundfos.    Additionally, your ability to lead is important as well. You will be responsible for the quality assurance – which means you will have to pass on responsibility to your team, when problem-solving.    Additionally, you:  - Hold a bachelor’s or master´s degree within engineering, software, computer science or any related branch of study  - Have experience with test automation of hardware, web and / or mobile  - Have experience in testing web API’s and IoT Devices  - Have experience in working with communication protocols like Modbus TCP  - Have good programming skills. Knowledge of python will be an added advantage  - Have good communication skills, and you speak and write English fluently.  - Have experience in setting up continuous testing in CI/CD pipelines    Why Grundfos  At Grundfos, we dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do. Our skills commit us to pioneer solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve quality of life for people. We believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short-term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.    Furthermore, we offer:  - Flexible working hours and a wide range of employee benefits and discounts  - Access to health and wellbeing initiatives, including fitness center, sports facilities, events and leisure activities  - Access to internal training and great opportunities for individual development      Additional information  f you have questions or want to know more about the position, please contact Pradeep Rangasamy on +45 52 72 27 21.    If this job sounds appealing to you, please send your resume no later than 29th December 2023.    We look forward to hearing from you.    If you want to dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, please visit us on LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/5195 or our YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zwY54t455CU.          About Grundfos  Grundfos is one of the world’s leading water technology companies with more than 19.000 employees in 60+ countries all over the world. Our skills commit us to pioneering solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do, as we believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.  An inclusive team If you like the look of this job and know you can bring your skills to contribute to our purpose, please apply. We need and welcome professional people from all corners – however you identify and whatever your background is. Title: Senior Information Architect – shape our new data model
Description: Apply now                Forward  your career                      Hedehusene  Senior Information Architect – shape our new data model     Would you like to play a key role in the creation of DSV’s new Enterprise Data Model that will serve as the backbone for the DSV organisation's business change management?  Join one of the world leaders in transport and logistics to drive a key delivery for our organisation as a whole.  Here, great colleagues are waiting to welcome you to a vibrant and ever-changing environment where there is room to grow and evolve. What is more, your work will have a direct impact on how we operate across DSV.  Welcome to Data & Information Architecture   Joining Business Continuity Management at our HQ in Hedehusene, you will become a vital member of our Data & Information Architecture team. Here, 5 colleagues are working together to create a new, global data model that is to be used and implemented end-2-end across our entire organisation.  This new shared data model will thus set the stage for how we operate within DSV, and together with your new colleagues, you will be playing a pivotal role in its creation.   "It’s easy to praise this team because they really are great – very collaborative, vibrant, and open. And overall, we have a high-quality work culture within DSV, " explains hiring manager Adi Sami Smadi.  Create a new data model  As the senior information architect, you will have the primary task of creating, designing, and documenting our new data models, ensuring that we follow an agile process. Among other things, this involves engaging with stakeholders and subject matter experts (SMEs) to ensure the accuracy of the model.  In addition, you will actively support our organisation, providing guidance and advice on all aspects related to the data model. Thus, as the advocate for the new model, you will play a pivotal role in steering and influencing its adoption.  More specifically, your daily tasks will be to:   Define and document DSV’s global conceptual and logical data model  Analyse business domains and processes and incorporate them into the data model  Help steer the data model through the organisation by presenting it to stakeholders and collaborating with the development teams assigned to implement it  Ensure alignment with the industry standards and the information architecture domain’s best practices  Support the data strategy work from the information architecture end   Experienced information architect with great communication skills   You are a great communicator and an adept problem-solver ready to tackle this task head-on. Interacting with a myriad of stakeholders, you know how to navigate an organisation at all levels. Also, you know your way around evaluating information, identifying key issues, and formulating conclusions.  We also imagine that you:   Bring a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information management, or similar  Have documented experience in information architecture and data modelling at a corporate level  Have a solid understanding of master data management, data cataloguing, and data governance  Know the domain’s best practices and industry standards   Experience within logistics and transportation is an advantage, but not a requirement – likewise, you are one step ahead of the game if you are certified in data modelling or information architecture (ex. CDM, CDMP, DCAM, etc.).  Want to know more and apply?  We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to call hiring manager Adi Sami Smadi on +45 25 45 25 40.  We look forward to receiving your application via the link below as soon as possible. We will process the applications as we receive them.  DSV – Global Transport and Logistics  DSV is a dynamic workplace that fosters inclusivity and diversity. We conduct our business with integrity, respecting different cultures and the dignity and rights of individuals. When you join DSV, you are working for one of the very best performing companies in the transport and logistics industry. You’ll join a talented team of more than 75,000 employees in over 80 countries, working passionately to deliver great customer experiences and high-quality services. DSV aspires to lead the way towards a more sustainable future for our industry and are committed to trading on nature’s terms.  We promote collaboration and transparency and strive to attract, motivate and retain talented people in a culture of respect. If you are driven, talented and wish to be part of a progressive and versatile organisation, we’ll support you and your need to achieve your potential and forward your career. Visit dsv.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Facebook and Twitter.     Apply now      Read more           I work in the innovation part of IT, and I love that we get to work with the latest technologies. My team and DSV are very open to new ideas and ways of working, and everyone has a say.  - Inta, Senior UX Designer                       4 af 5 stjerner    241 of DSV’s employees have rated DSV on Jobindex     What I really love is that in DSV, it is entirely possible to combine having a career AND a family life. It is amazing not having to compromise – even with young kids at home. DSV gives me the flexibility needed to grow professionally while also enjoying my family.  - Inta, Senior UX Designer    See what else your new colleagues say                  There are hundreds of great reasons to work at DSV.  Here are just a few collected from our employees ...        EMPOWERMENT  We’ll empower you to make a difference. We believe that people do great things, when they are given the opportunity and support they need to succeed. We trust in people.     GLOBAL CAREER DEVELOPMENT  You’ll have access to a massive network of possibilities. We build inspiring careers locally and internationally.     INFORMAL ENVIRONMENT  You’ll be part of a dynamic and informal environment, where people speak their minds. This allows us to move fast, stay ahead and face challenges head-on. This is the DSV way.     LEARNING  Our DSV academy will give you access to knowledge and training, which will allow you to grow and influence the path of your career. We want you to realise your potential and reach your career goals.        OWNERSHIP  We’ll encourage you to act as if DSV were your own business. Our local branches work very autonomously and decisions are made close to the customer. This is what makes us unique, agile and strong.     PERFORMANCE  You’ll join a group of highly dedicated people who strive to improve every day. If you like a challenge and a constantly changing environment then join us.     TRULY GLOBAL  We’ll give you 75,000 colleagues in more than 90 countries all over the world. We’re a global family.     WE GROW TOGETHER  You will be part of a genuinely fast-growing company. We started our journey in 1976, and since then we have expanded our market share immensely. But we have only just begun – the most exciting time to join DSV is now!                                     Our hiring process  At DSV, we are always looking for the most skilled employees within our field. It is our goal to hire the very best match and ensure that our employees across the company are successful in their job. That is why our recruitment process is so important. Title: PhD scholarship in Prescriptive Analytics for District Heating Networks at DTU Engineering Technology
Description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 PhD scholarship in Prescriptive Analytics for District Heating Networks at DTU Engineering Technology        Ballerup, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   Do you want to break new ground in technology development and implementation in the District Heating industry?  The fault management and maintenance/renovation practices in district heating networks are currently limited to reactive or preventive approaches. These inefficient practices pose significant challenges to the performance of modern district heating systems. Furthermore, the aging infrastructure of many district heating systems necessitates constant renovation. However, the existing approach to renovation planning is suboptimal and lacks a proactive strategy. Addressing these challenges is crucial for improving the performance and reliability of district heating systems. We have an opening at DTU Engineering Technology for a PhD-student on developing Prescriptive Analytics tool for District Heating Networks addressing these challenges.  You will become a member of the AI, Mathematics, and Software research group at DTU Engineering Technology under the supervision of Associate professor Maryamsadat Tahavori from DTU Engineering Technology.  Responsibilities and qualifications Your primary tasks will be to   Conduct research in the intersection between academia and the industry  Write academic papers aimed at high-impact journals  Participate in international conferences and workshop  Disseminate research results and teach as part of the overall PhD education  Learn the role of the researcher and the specific tasks how to conduct research  Participate in teaching and student project supervision   The responsibilities may vary based on your profile and interest as well as project requirements.  You must have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree in fields such as Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related discipline.  We imagine that you are an ambitious, self-organized individual with curiosity and deep interests in how new technologies can be usefully applied in industry.  To succeed in the job, proficiency in programming languages commonly used in AI/ML, particularly Python, and familiarity with data analysis libraries, frameworks, and data visualization tools is essential. Furthermore, a solid knowledge and experience of using AI/Machine Learning, data analytics, data visualization or optimization is necessary. Finally, strong communication skills in spoken and written English are also a requirement.  We see it as advantageous if you have prior research experience and understanding of district heating (DH) networks, including their components, operation, and maintenance.  Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education .  We offer DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.  Salary and appointment terms  The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years with the starting date of February 1st, 2024.  You can read more about career paths at DTU here .  Further information  Further information may be obtained from Associate Professor Maryamsadat Tahavori ( marta@dtu.dk ). You can read more about DTU Engineering Technology at www.engtech.dtu.dk/English .  If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar “ PhD relocation to Denmark and startup “Zoom” seminar ” for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU.  Application procedure Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 7 December 2023 (23:59 Danish time).  Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English) including official description of grading scale  List of publications and maximum 2 examples of relevant publications, in case you have any publications  References (names and e-mails)   You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it.  Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.  All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.  About DTU Engineering Technology We work at the forefront of university-industry collaboration and develop tools and methods for technology implementation. We are organized in 9 research groups all focused on technology implementation, engineering technology and engineering education within a wide range of engineering fields.  Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Title: Senior Specialist - Data Privacy Advisor, Gdansk or Viby
Description: Press Tab to Move to Skip to Content Link  Skip to main content          Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates                        Search by Keyword                         Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates             View Profile                      Search by Keyword        Filter using country       Loading...        Country/Region    All                            ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:     Create Alert         ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:                 APPLY NOW »             Senior Specialist - Information Security Governance, Gdansk or Viby           Location:    Gdansk, PL   Viby J, DK              Would you like to use your Cyber Skills, and join the best Information Security Team in Denmark, on a heavy Digitilised company? Then, keep reading!    About the job  Catch this exciting opportunity to join Arla's Global IT team. With over 200+ highly skilled IT specialists and 800 expert consultants, we are transforming the future of dairy products while making a meaningful impact on people's lives.  But here at Arla, we're not just about making some of the world's most beloved dairy products. We're about making healthy taste delicious, making mornings worth getting out of bed for, and making family dinners unforgettable. Our iconic brands, such as Arla®, Castello®, and Lurpak®, are more than just products; they're an integral and natural part of modern life in over 100 countries around the globe.    The Senior Specialist - Information Security Governance will be responsible for ensuring that Arla’s information security policies, standards, and procedures are effectively implemented and enforced    Key Responsibilities:   Security Policies and Standards   - Define, maintain and provide expert guidance on the implementation of Security Policies, Standards and Processes.  - Adhere with Arla wide Policy approach and integrate relevant legal and regulatory requirements.  - Support in definition and setup of control mechanisms.  - Security Culture, training and awareness  - Collaborate in building and execution of information security training and awareness campaigns.   Compliance and regulations   - Working together with Legal department, identify external compliance and regulatory requirements, address, manage and execute on them. NIS2, GDPR, CCPA, etc.   Third-party risk management:   - Support definition of the relevant information security requirements.  - Create, implement and manage framework.   Data protection   - Support definition and implementation of processes allowing to classify the data and ensure their protection, including backup, retention, leakage prevention (DLP)    Essentials Skills and Qualifications:   Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.  At least 5 years of experience in information security, with a focus on security governance and policy, risk management and/or audit.  Experience in developing and implementing security policies and standards in a large, complex organization.  Strong knowledge of relevant regulatory requirements and industry best practices, such as ISO 27001, IEC62443, NIST, and COBIT.  Proven ability to lead a project teams of security professionals, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to assess and mitigate security risks effectively.  Ability to work collaboratively with other departments and stakeholders, building strong relationships based on trust and mutual respect.     It is a strong plus if you have:  •            Relevant certifications, such as CISSP, CISM, CISA or CRISC as an advantage.    What do we offer?  At Arla, we value our IT specialists and provide a range of attractive benefits to support your personal and professional growth:  •            Trainings with industry experts and a comprehensive induction program.  •            Financial support for ongoing education and professional development.  •            Flexibility in working hours and the option to work from home.  •            Medical care and life insurance coverage.  •            Employee Assistance Program offering legal, psychological, health, and financial consulting.  •            Additional perks like gym memberships, vouchers, travel points, and cinema tickets.  •            Home kit including a monitor, laptop, keyboard, mouse, headsets, and webcam.  •            Relaxation breaks to recharge and maintain work-life balance.  •            Relocation allowance for a smooth transition to our vibrant city.  •            Referral program for employees to earn rewards by recommending top talent.  •            Additional holiday days based on length of employment (up to 4 days).    Application and contact  If you are ready to drive innovation and make a global impact alongside talented colleagues, seize this exciting opportunity by applying today.    Welcome to Global Shared Services in Gdansk  Arla is a global farmer-owned organisation that is behind many well-known and loved brands, including Arla Apetina®, Castello®, Lurpak® and many, many more.  With 15 years of existence in Gdansk, we offer you a lot of knowledge and the opportunity to partake in challenging and exciting innovation projects. As a part of the Arla organisation, you will also enjoy a Scandinavian, collaborative work culture.    We have a purpose for Good  At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you? That is our goal and our drive. To achieve this goals, we need experts with skill, interest and enthusiasm to IT, CAD and PLM – and that’s where you come in! Digitalization and decarbonization are the drivers of our company strategy: “Moving big things to zero – We engineer systems for deep decarbonization in sectors that matter most”.  As CAD-/PLM consultant you work in an international IT engineering division and support our internal engineering-/design departments. Our experienced team is located in Europe and India and presently undergoes a journey to migrate several services to a cloud environment. You want to be part of it?  You’ll will play an important role in:  You will:   Analyze, specify and optimize processes in international engineering environment  Consult engineering departments in solution finding  Coordinate IT-projects in engineering environment and also other IT-department  Specify, implement and test new functions within CAD as required by engineering departments  Find solutions to complex user problems   We imagine that you:   Have a Master/Bachelor in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or similar  Have worked at least 3 years within a similar field  Are expert in CAD- and PLM Systems – preferably NX / Teamcenter / Aras  Are experienced with customization / programming and interface technologies  Interested in scripting and programming (.Net / C++)  Are fluent in writing and speaking English and Danish   Welcome to IT Engineering Core Systems A brief description of the department and the team’s responsibilities and teamwork culture…   Our team is located in Europe and India and will offer a thorough introduction and interesting tasks and projects around CAD and PLM. If you are interested in joining a changing work process with an agile approach, we would be happy to meet you in person. Could we make you curious about IT, CAD and PLM, we would like to have you join our team! Interested?   What can you expect from us:  Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future We offer you a chance to help shape the world of tomorrow – whether you’re just starting out, taking your first career step after graduation or looking for the next big career challenge.  At MAN Energy Solutions, we focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture. We believe that a diverse workforce, with a mix of gender, nationalities, and perspectives, drives innovation, creativity, and productivity. We are committed to our employees’ well-being, and you will have the opportunity to join different social activities clubs from yoga and fishing clubs to creative clubs.  We prioritize work life balance with possibilities for flexible working hours, home office, and mental well-being for example health insurance and focus on work atmosphere. Here you have opportunities for growth, development and mentorship.  At MAN Energy Solutions you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions while achieving your personal career goals.  About MAN Energy Solutions   250 years of experience in advanced engineering  We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe.  We work on the motto "Future in The Making", because we make a virtue out of creating sustainable solutions and contribute to a carbon neutral economy.  We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are 2,200 passionate employees with more than 40 nationalities.   Build your own future: Send your application to us no later than (Thursday the 30th of November 2023). We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact (IT Area Lead Engineering Core Systems, Walter Hussak) by phone (+49 160 7080979) or email walter.hussak@man-es.com. More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com  We encourages all qualified candidates regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position.            Application due 11/30/2023  Start date Start as soon as possible   Work hours  Category  Position type IT Engineering  Workplace Teglholmsgade 41, 2450 København SV  Homepage man-es.com     Contact         E-mail                  E-mail                  E-mail                  E-mail                More vacant positions  Follow us         With headquarter in Germany, MAN Energy Solutions employs around 15,000 people worldwide. Of these, we are approx. 2,200 passionate employees in Denmark in 3 locations: Copenhagen, Frederikshavn and Holeby. With more than 250 years of experience in advanced engineering, we deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe. At MAN Energy Solutions we have the technologies and the experience to make a significant contribution to decarbonization. That's why we care about "Moving Big Things to Zero”. "So that the small things matter, too."                                       ShareThis Copy and Paste

ADF Developer           Req ID:  52397          Location:    Copenhagen, DK              Oracle ADF and PL/SQL Software Engineer  Position for Oracle ADF and preferably PL/SQL Software Engineer to join the R&D team    About the job   Join one of our teams in Tia R&D Enterprise and be a part of software development team. Here you will develop and maintain core software solution for insurance business management. We are focusing on enhancing and maintaining frontend that is based on Oracle ADF, and backend that is based on Oracle DB with PL/SQL, building new REST services.  In our daily work we use Scrum framework for our product development and sustainment.    Responsibilities   Develop, implement, and maintain Tia enterprise applications using Oracle ADF (Application Development Framework).  Test and troubleshoot Oracle ADF applications to ensure functionality and performance.  Ensure adherence to coding standards, best practices, and development processes.  Preferably enhance and maintain Tia backend.  Develop and maintain documentation.  Participate in code reviews and contribute to continuous improvement of the development process.  Stay up-to-date with new technologies and industry trends related to Oracle ADF.  Participate in Scrum events.   Required skills and education    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field.  5+ years of experience in designing and developing enterprise-level applications using Oracle ADF (WebLogic) and JSF:   Ability to analyze and solve complex problems.  Performance tuning, profiler usage.  Strong analytical skills.  Usage of JDeveloper debugger or similar.  Strong Java experience.    Practical experience with Oracle Database and PL/SQL:   Ability to analyze existing PL/SQL code and find solutions.  Ability to trace the data and analyze algorithm execution.    Familiarity with web development technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.  Experience with Agile methodology.  Excellent communication and collaboration skills.  Excellent English knowledge, spoken and written.   Preferred   Certification in Oracle ADF.  Experience with Oracle Fusion Middleware.  Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as AngularJS or ReactJS.  Knowledge of Oracle Forms and Reports.  Knowledge of web services and REST APIs.   Tools and technologies   Oracle ADF (WebLogic).  Oracle JHeadstart.  Oracle DB (PL/SQL, SQL).  Source code version control (SVN, Git).  Continuous Integration tools (Jenkins, Gitlab).  Docker containers .     Sapiens International Corporation (NASDAQ and TASE: SPNS) is a leading global provider of software solutions for the insurance industry, with a growing presence in the financial services sector. We offer integrated core software solutions, business services, and a full digital suite for property and casualty/general insurance; life, pension, and annuities; and reinsurance markets. Sapiens also services the workers’ compensation and financial and compliance markets.  Our portfolio includes policy administration, billing, and claims; underwriting, illustration and electronic application; reinsurance and decision management software. Sapiens’ digital platform features customer and agent portals, and a business intelligence platform. With a 40-year track record of delivering to more than 600 organizations, Sapiens’ team of over 5,000 employees operates through our fully-owned subsidiaries in North America, the United Kingdom, EMEA, and Asia Pacific. Title: Senior Solution Consultant, Arla IT - Gdansk or Viby J
Description: Press Tab to Move to Skip to Content Link  Skip to main content          Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates                        Search by Keyword                         Home  Join our talent community   Job categories    Arla Foods Ingredients (AFI)  Business Development & Cross Functions  Finance  Food Science & Innovation  Human Resources & Communication  Information Technology  Legal  Logistics & Supply Chain  Maintenance & Engineering  Marketing  Member Relations  Procurement  Production, Technology & Process Optimization  Quality Environment Health Safety  Sales  Students, Trainees and Graduates             View Profile                      Search by Keyword        Filter using country       Loading...        Country/Region    All                            ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:     Create Alert         ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:                 APPLY NOW »             Senior Solution Consultant, Arla IT - Gdansk or Viby J           Location:    Viby J, DK   Gdansk, PL              Would you like have a leading role in building the future IT solutions for Procurement in Arla? Are you a strong IT Consultant with a passion for creating new and coherent solutions? And do you possess knowledge of procurement, Ariba and 3rd party modules? Right now we are looking for a colleague who is passionate about leveraging technology to optimize our procurement operations.    Arla Foods is looking for a highly skilled and experienced IT Solution consultant specializing in procurement to join our dynamic team. As a Senior consultant , you will play a crucial role in designing and implementing innovative and efficient solutions for our procurement processes.    About the job  In your new role, you collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into scalable and sustainable IT solutions within the procurement domain. You will take an active part in designing end-to-end procurement solutions, utilizing Ariba and integrating 3rd party modules as necessary and lead the developments in close cooperation with the procurement architect.    More specifically you will:   Together with the Architect explore, analyze, and implement opportunities within SAP procurement(S/4HANA)  Implement relevant changes in SAP MM, Ariba & future 3rd party systems.  Provide technical guidance and support to development teams throughout the software development lifecycle.  Conduct regular reviews and assessments of existing procurement systems and identify areas for improvement  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration     Who are you?  The ideal candidate  has proven experience as an IT Solution consultant, specifically within the procurement domain. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Your excellent communication and interpersonal skills enable you to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels. You likewise thrive in an independent role and have the ability to prioritize tasks and meet project deadlines. Further, the preferred candidate has:     Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field  Relevant certifications and advanced degrees are a plus  Strong expertise in Ariba-Ariba P2O/Guided buying, Ariba Contracts, Ariba Sourcing/Guided sourcing, Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance (or similar solutions)  Experience with E-invoicing, Cloud integration gateway(CIG) and Ariba Network  Experience with SAP procurement(S/4HANA-MM) will be preferable  Extensive knowledge of 3rd party modules commonly integrated with Ariba and S/4HANA  Solid understanding of integration methodologies, web services, APIs, and data integration concepts     Application and contact  Join our team and contribute to the transformation of our procurement operations through cutting-edge technology solutions. If you are ready to take on this exciting challenge, please submit your application, including your resume and cover letter, outlining your relevant experience and qualifications.    We have a purpose for Good  At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you?    BEWARE! RECRUITMENT FRAUD  It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails and fake recruitment campaigns on the internet from people purporting to work for Arla Foods. Title: Integration consultant with a desire to learn ERP wanted for XL-BYG Chain Office
Description: Integration consultant with a desire to learn ERP wanted for XL-BYG Chain Office We are seeking a newly graduated integration consultant for our well-functioning IT team, which focuses on integrating our ERP system with other systems used in the 96 stores of the XL-BYG chain. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and testing the integrations. Our integration platform is Webmethods from Software AG. Additionally, we use EG Fabri (ASPECT4 Timber). Familiarity with these systems is a plus but not a requirement for success in the position. We will ensure that you receive the necessary training. You will become part of an efficient and well-functioning team consisting of currently 7 individuals who assist and collaborate across disciplines. You will also have a supportive manager. The atmosphere at the XL-BYG Chain Office is generally relaxed and humorous, and we enjoy working together. About you :  Newly graduated in IT, e.g., software development, computer science, or similar  General interest and curiosity about developments in the IT world  Good technical skills  Willingness to engage in close dialogue with involved parties when solving a task  Ability to provide relevant and creative input to ensure the optimal solution  Ability to work independently on tasks and collaborate with colleagues, suppliers, and other partners when required  Desire to learn ERP and share knowledge with members of the chain's ERP group  What you get : The position is an outstanding opportunity to learn about ERP and work on exciting and complex integration projects. You will join an organization with a positive work environment and an informal atmosphere. We offer a competitive salary, including a pension scheme and health insurance, an active staff association, lunch arrangement, and, most importantly, great colleagues. If you find the job interesting and can relate to the mentioned tasks and qualifications, please submit your application as soon as possible via the link in the upper right corner. Application and CV can be submitted in either Danish or English . The position is expected to be filled by February 1, 2024. If you have questions about the content of the position, feel free to contact IT Manager Steen Villsen at svi@xl-byg.dk. Please note that we conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, and the position will be closed when the right candidate is found.              Ansøg her!    Kontakt os  XL-BYG Kædekontor Holmstrupgårdvej 20 8220 Brabrand Denmark Midtjylland         Steen Villsen         IT Chef         27805300         svi@xl-byg.dk             Om os XL-BYG Kædekontor er en lokalforankret, privatejet virksomhed med en stærk faglighed indenfor salg af byggematerialer, trælastvarer og byggemarkedsartikler.      {"street":"Holmstrupgårdvej 20","city":"Brabrand","state":"Midtjylland","zip_code":"8220","country":"Denmark","latitude":"56.1665403","longitude":"10.1216586"}  + − Leaflet | © OpenStreetMap contributors                  XL-BYG® - Landsdækkende kæde med lokale rødder  Med 90+ forretninger og en samlet omsætning på ca. 8 mia. kr. er XL-BYG ® én af Danmarks største og mest markante byggevarekæder. XL-BYG driver samtidig en velassorteret webshop med byggematerialer og artikler til hus og have. XL-BYG er en frivillig kæde. Det betyder, at de enkelte forretninger er selvstændigt ejede virksomheder. Alle vores forretninger har en lang faglig tradition samtidig med, at de er fast forankrede i deres lokalområder.

Title: Senior Software Developer
Description: Job description    Working at Interacoustics    Meet our employees     Apply                  Middelfart  Senior Software Developer                 Come join our software team at the world’s leading company for diagnostic audiology and balance  We offer team spirit, professional development and a great working environment.  It’s important to us that you enjoy your job. We will go many a length to make sure that you are properly onboarded and trained to the tasks and areas of new expertise. To help you do that, you will get a wingman for the first months as well as have access to internal and external learning portals at which you can develop your skills at your own pace – also during work hours.  At Interacoustics we have trust in each other, and we offer a flexible working environment by focusing on personal wellbeing and effort, not just counting the hours in front of the screen.  In the Interacoustics R&D software team we are 48 dedicated developers, architects, testers, scrum masters and team managers located across Denmark, Poland and Malaysia, we aim to ensure that everybody feels part of the same team. You will find that our team closely collaborates with our hardware and digital signal processing department teams. To us software development is more than only writing code.  The job  We are rooting for you! Together with your skilled team members we expect you to actively participate in all phases of software development. Everyone's opinions are valued - the more senior, the more we appreciate you taking a place at the center of the refinement process as well as being able to keep an eye out on the goal in the horizon. We expect you take part and pride in developing and maintain quality software solutions for diagnostics, research, hearing aid dispensers, schools and more.  Expected areas of knowledge:   .NET (C#)  Unit testing  Common architecture principles (DDD, SOLID, MVVM)  Familiarity with Scrum, code review and Azure DevOps, would help you  Maybe even WPF and XAML   Who are you?  Ideal you hold a degree in computer engineering, computer science or have knowledge of related technical disciplines. Furthermore, you have extensive programming experience and will bring theoretical knowledge and professional practical skills. You are fluent in C# with broad knowledge of software methodologies and tools. Most importantly, you can see yourself as an enthusiastic member of the team – And you are eager to keep the ball rolling, as we must meet market requirements for new functionality!  We wish to support and strengthen your personal and professional development through clear and tangible goals found in an ongoing development and one to one dialog. And yes – a mechanical keyboard is an ergonomic accepted need as well as noise canceling headsets and a say in office layout.  We offer:  As we develop products and software used in the medical industry the focus is on quality over quantity. We have great open office spaces made for collaboration, but also room to focus and space to just take a break. Maybe with a game of table football.  Each day we offer a delicious lunch in our canteen, and you can use our training facilities with easy access to a large changing room, often used by those biking to work or having a short run at lunch. We have an active staff organization that organizes social events like running events, cooking evenings, summer party, hackathon, and Christmas come together. On top of that we also offer a health care scheme, and the above mentioned flexible working hours.  Questions and applications  We look forward to receive your application and CV as soon as possible in either English or Danish. We encourage you to apply even if you do not think that you meet all the above-mentioned requirements entirely, then just let us know, where we can support you in getting up-to-date.  If you would like to know more about the job, please contact Kasper Jensen, Team manager at +45 2420 7729. We’ll conduct interviews on a rolling basis. Please know, that as a part of recruitment we might ask you to provide a reference or two. As we conduct interviews on a rolling basis, don’t hesitate to get in touch.   Apply       Follow us                     Save    Company Profile     Follow   Following    Share               Working at Interacoustics  Watch video            Life-changing opportunities  We are always looking for talented people, who are keen to make life easier for hearing care professionals in diagnostic audiology and balance.       High-tech and innovative  We are a high-tech organization with highly skilled employees. Our innovative approach offers you the opportunity to explore new technology and put your mark on new solutions. Our global presence offers the opportunity to work with customers and colleagues all over the world.       Ambitious and forward-thinking  Supported by our brand promise ‘Science made smarter’ and the values of Ambition, Integrity and Customer Value, we strive to do a little better each day. You can expect a challenging workday in an ambitious working environment. We value open communication, collaboration and teamwork, and celebrate achievements together.            Meet our employees           Meet our employees         As an intern with Interacoustics, I worked with electronics and programming. I was able to influence my tasks and take my tasks in a direction I thought was relevant - not just to the benefit of the company, but also to satisfy my own needs.  Nicolas , Development Engineer              About Interacoustics      Interacoustics is a world leading diagnostic solutions provider in the field of hearing and balance assessment. We design, manufacture and sell products across the whole audiological spectrum, from small portable devices to full clinical instruments. Our products are sold in more than 100 countries through our extensive network of sales companies and distributors. Interacoustics employs more than 180 people at the head office in Middelfart, more than 500 worldwide and is among the world's leading suppliers of audiological equipment.  Interacoustics is part of the Demant Group. This group of international companies develops, manufactures and markets a wide variety of technological solutions, ranging from state-of-the art digital hearing instruments and assistive listening devices to revolutionary new diagnostic systems.         interacoustics.com               ×                 ×                        Ansvarlig brug af dine oplysninger    ×     Jobindex ønsker at tilbyde en service, der giver dig den bedste oplevelse.
