Title: SQL Data Specialist
Description: Press Tab to Move to Skip to Content Link  Skip to main content                                      Language    Ceština    Dansk    Deutsch    English    English (United States)    Polski       View profile                 About us  Careers at Orifarm  Talent Pool  LinkedIn                                             Language    Ceština    Dansk    Deutsch    English    English (United States)    Polski       View profile                 About us  Careers at Orifarm  Talent Pool  LinkedIn                         Language    Ceština    Dansk    Deutsch    English    English (United States)    Polski       View profile                      About us  Careers at Orifarm  Talent Pool  LinkedIn                                       Search by Keyword        Show Fewer Options       Loading...        Category    All  Finance IT Logistics, Warehouse & Facility Others Portfolio Development Production Produkcja Quality Assurance & Quality Compliance Quality Assurance, Quality Compliance & Quality Co Qualitätsmanagement Sales Vertrieb     Country/Region   All Czech Republic Denmark Germany Poland United Kingdom     City    All  Hemel Hempstead Hobro Hostivice Leverkusen Odense Łyszkowice                           ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:     Create Alert         ×     Select how often (in days) to receive an alert:                Apply now »                SQL Data Specialist           Category:  IT          Country/Region:  DK          Location:    Odense, DK, 5260                   – Who loves data and the connections it creates between people, processes, and systems  We are looking for a talented specialist with solid T-SQL skills to help us operate and develop our datahub platform. We deliver data to applications supporting business across the entire supply chain, and is in the process of consolidating existing solutions to prepare for the future.    About the job  The Datahub is the central data platform at Orifarm, containing all the data we currently need to exchange between systems and applications. We are responsible for the loading, flow and representation of data, and our main task is to ensure the right quality of data at the right time.    You will play a pivotal role in managing and optimizing our data infrastructure. You will work closely with our team to design, develop, and maintain SQL databases, ensuring efficient data storage and retrieval for our applications. Your expertise will be critical in helping us make data-driven decisions, improve system performance, and drive innovation.    As our new team member you will participate in:   Daily operations and on-call duties (we take turns)  Business support e.g. answering data related questions  Optimize solutions  Develop new dataflows  Create data foundations for new applications     Who are you?  We imagine that you have a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. However, you could also have proven experience as an SQL developer or from a similar position. Likewise, we imagine that you have experience with database management systems such as Microsoft SQL server.    As a person you have a flair for problem-solving, a keen eye for detail and excellent communication skills. Correspondingly, you are a team player by heart but also able to work independently with various tasks.    It is important that you:   Have advanced T-SQL skills and know how to   Design and develop SQL databases and schemas.  Write complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and load data.  Optimize database performance and ensure data integrity.  Troubleshoot and resolve database-related issues.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements.    Are familiar with scrum and agile methodologies    Can communicate fluently in Danish and English, both written and orally  Can be physically present in our headquarters in Odense     It is a huge advantage but not a prerequisite if you are familiar with C# and Datafactory.    Who are we?  As a SQL specialist you will become part of the Datahub team consisting of 6 highly skilled and specialized colleagues. The Datahub team is part of corporate IT, which is a larger function in Orifarm with colleagues on-site in Poland, Czech Republic and Germany. Corporate IT is placed in Odense and currently consist of 90 colleagues.    As mentioned, we supply internal as well as external data for a large number of applications and solutions across Orifarm. As the data are key to vital business processes – we are all strongly committed to delivering high quality data on time.    About Orifarm  Everyone should have access to modern medicine. High costs or lack of access to pharmaceuticals should never impact our possibility to receive treatment or relief and live a healthy life. In Orifarm, we aim to bring healthy days by making modern healthcare a better deal for the people and the societies we serve. Working towards our vision, we create access to affordable high-quality pharmaceuticals and healthcare products by challenging markets and always seeking new opportunities. With our core values paving the way, we always act responsibly and constantly with our customers in the center of our attention. And everything we do is driven by our sole purpose:    For as many as possible, as healthy a day as possible.    Our history goes back to 1994 where Orifarm was founded in Denmark by Hans and Birgitte Bøgh-Sørensen. Since then, Orifarm has grown from a small nine-person company into an international company operating globally in 13 countries. Today, Orifarm is Europe's largest parallel importer of pharmaceuticals and Denmark's largest supplier of pharmaceuticals with more than 2,200 employees.    We operate within seven different business areas: Over the Counter (OTC), Consumer Healthcare, Generics, Promotional Rx, Unlicensed Medicines, Parallel Import and Clinical Trials Supplies (CTS). Further, we focus heavily on new business opportunities and synergistic M&A to expand our offerings    We offer  At Orifarm, we know our growth comes from the growth of our employees. We are an ambitious organization with an entrepreneurial culture, and we celebrate can-do attitudes, smarts and hearts. Our secret to success? Valuing how different skillsets join forces to make our journey happen. Whether you play a direct or an indirect part of fulfilling our purpose, you get to contribute and use your skills, personal as well as professional. Indeed, at Orifarm your personal growth journey is shaped only by your contribution towards making healthy days for as many as possible .    We regard our feedback culture as a fundamental element in the individual employee’s opportunities for learning and development. And when we have good results, every employee, including student workers, are a part of our bonus scheme.    Job Location  Energivej 15, 5260 Odense.    Need further information?  If you need further information about the job, please contact Gitte Kvist Hansen, Head of Data Hub, at gihan@orifarm.com.    We are often looking for new employees to help us grow and therefore, we may have other interesting opportunities for you. Follow us on LinkedIn to receive updates on our business activities and job opportunities: https://www.linkedin.com/feed/     Application deadline   As soon as possible.                  Apply now »        Find similar jobs:             Front Page          © Copyright 2022

Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                         Embedded Software Developer            Are you looking to join a world-leading company and contribute to the development of the embedded platform controlling the world's largest 2-stroke engines? Are you passionate about the green transition and eager to make a real impact? If so, this opportunity might be perfect for you!  At MAN Energy Solutions, we are at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge technologies to drive the decarbonization of world trade. As the global market leader in energy-efficient and fuel-flexible large marine engine solutions, our engines are powered by our own hardware and software platform. As an Embedded Software Developer joining our team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring that we deliver on our ambitious sustainability goals.  The MAN Energy Solutions engine control system is a distributed embedded system consisting of multiple FPGA-based controllers. You will join our embedded software department together with 13 other highly skilled and motivated colleagues. The team is responsible for the firmware and middleware of the control system which enables our control department to efficiently develop and bring to market, state-of-the-art solutions e.g. new alternative fuel types and emission reduction systems.  You will play an important role in:   Take part in developing new features, all the way from defining the architecture to implementation and maintenance.  Analyzing and debugging existing solutions.  Writing automated tests and documentation.   We imagine that you:   Have a degree in computer science, electrical engineering, software engineering, or similar, with an interest in embedded systems.  Well-founded in C++.  Enjoy working with complex systems.  Ability to work well in a team, but also self-driven and willing to take ownership.  Like technical challenges and have a "can-do" attitude.  Knowledge of agile development processes, test automation, and continuous integration, is a plus.   Welcome to the Embedded Software Department  Working in our team is a rewarding and collaborative experience. As part of the automation department in the R&D function, based in Copenhagen. We are responsible for everything connecting the application code with the control system hardware. This includes real-time operating system, hardware abstraction layer, board support package and application interfaces.  Collaboration is the cornerstone of our achievements. We work closely together with the hardware team to integrate new FPGA features, and the control departments to leverage their expertise to provide a meaningful and efficient API.  What can you expect from us : As an inclusive and supportive team, we prioritize the well-being of our members. We foster a friendly and informal atmosphere that encourages creativity and open communication. Our culture ensures a pleasant social environment, where we celebrate each other's successes.  When you join our team, you'll be surrounded by talented and dedicated individuals who are eager to learn from your experiences while gladly sharing their knowledge with you. We believe in continuous growth and mutual support, recognizing that every team member plays a crucial role in our collective success.  Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future We offer you an opportunity to help shape the world of tomorrow – whether you are just starting out, taking your first career steps after graduation, or looking for the next big career challenge.  At MAN Energy Solutions, we focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture. We believe that a diverse workforce with a mix of gender, nationalities, and perspectives will drive innovation, creativity and productivity. We are committed to our employees’ well-being, and you will have the opportunity to join different social activities from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.  We prioritize work-life balance, offering flexible working hours, the possibility of working from home, and mental well-being including health insurance and focus on work atmosphere. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.  At MAN Energy Solutions, you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions while achieving your personal career goals.  About MAN Energy Solutions   250 years of experience in advanced engineering  We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe  We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy  We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. Title: PhD scholarship in Computer Vision with Deep Learning for Human-Machine Collaboration – DTU Compute
Description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 PhD scholarship in Computer Vision with Deep Learning for Human-Machine Collaboration – DTU Compute        Kgs. Lyngby, Denmark                    Trending                                        Jobbeskrivelse   Do you want to advance the state-of-the-art research in computer vision systems using human-machine collaboration? The Technical University of Denmark (DTU) invites you to apply for a fully funded 3-year PhD position. The position is funded by the Sapere Aude: DFF-Starting grant . The position is offered at DTU, in the Department of Computer Science and Applied Mathematics, at the Visual Computing Group , and will work closely with researchers from the Pioneer Centre for AI . Project description Learning visual recognition models requires huge amounts of data, especially when relying on data-hungry deep neural networks. These data need to be manually and passively annotated by humans. This labeling procedure is one of the most important steps in a machine learning pipeline and is tedious, expensive, and susceptible to noise leading to erroneous labels. We aim to establish a deeper human-machine collaboration for all stages of the learning pipeline via multimodal labeling and learning. The goal of this project is to leverage information from different modalities that naturally occur near web images to assist the image annotation.  You will develop state-of-the-art multimodal models for self-supervision with human-in-the-loop text supervision. This PhD project will be supervised by Associate Professor (DTU). Responsibilities During the PhD program, you will:   Work with state-of-the-art deep learning computer vision models.  Develop state-of-the-art models for human-machine collaboration in computer vision.  Publish scientific papers and present research results in top computer vision conferences (CVPR, ECCV, ICCV).  Spend a few months during the PhD program abroad.  Work as a teaching assistant in courses at DTU.   Qualifications To succeed in this position, you should have the following required skills:   A master’s degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar in Computer Science, Informatics, Computer Engineering, Applied Mathematics or equivalent.  Proven experience in Python.  Hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks.  High level of motivation and innovation.  Experience in computer vision is a plus.   Excellent written and communication skills in English. Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education . Assessment The assessment of the applicants will be made by Associate Professor Dimitrios Papadopoulos . We offer DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility. Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years; start in Spring or Summer 2024. You can read more about career paths at DTU here . Further information  If you have questions, you are very welcome to contact Associate Professor Dimitrios Papadopoulos at dimp@dtu.dk . If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar “ PhD relocation to Denmark and startup “Zoom” seminar ” for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU. Application procedure Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 2 January 2024  (23:59 Danish time) . Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae (CV)  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English) including official description of grading scale   Incomplete applications will not be considered. You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it. Applications received after the deadline will not be considered. All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, disability, race, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply. DTU Compute DTU Compute is a unique and internationally recognized academic department with 385 employees and 11 research sections spanning the science disciplines mathematics, statistics, computer science, and engineering. We conduct research, teaching and innovation of high international standard – producing new knowledge and technology-based solutions to societal challenges. We have a long-term involvement in applied and interdisciplinary research, big data and data science, artificial intelligence (AI), internet of things (IoT), smart and secure societies, smart manufacturing, and life science. At DTU Compute we believe in a diverse workplace with a flexible work-life balance. Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Title: PhD Student in Wind Turbine Load Surrogate for Wind Farm Control - DTU Wind
Description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 PhD Student in Wind Turbine Load Surrogate for Wind Farm Control - DTU Wind        Roskilde, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   Are you a curious, self-driven individual with a strong passion for developing sustainable energy solutions? The Department of Wind and Energy Systems at the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) invites applications for a PhD position focused on the creation of a Wind Turbine Load Surrogate for Wind Farm Control. This is your opportunity to make a significant contribution towards improving wind farm efficiency and sustainability.  We need a passionate, curious, and enthusiastic new team member committed to addressing climate change through advancing renewable energy systems. We're searching for someone who flourishes in the face of complex problems, isn't afraid to ask probing questions, and possesses the grit to pursue innovative solutions in a rapidly evolving field.  You are a committed individual with a strong engineering or computer science background. You have a keen interest in scientific programming and machine learning. Your curiosity guides you to explore and understand the intricacies of wind energy systems, and your self-guided nature encourages you to push the limits of what is today possible for a better tomorrow.  You have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree.  As a PhD candidate, you will be tasked with the creation of dynamic and transient load surrogates that can interface with both reduced order models of wind farm wake flow and Dynamic Wake Meandering (DWM) type of engineering models. The aim is to develop versatile load surrogates that can predict time series or statistics of power and loads based on a range of data-driven/machine learning methodologies. Such models can accelerate the prediction of wind farm performance, and be used to devise sophisticated wind farm control strategies.  This project is co-financed by the EU-H2020 SUDOCO project , which focuses on developing new methods for the control co-design of offshore wind farms. In line with the goals of the SUDOCO project, the load surrogate should be capable of predicting changes in power and loads with respect to control set-points such as yaw misalignment, global pitch/RPM changes and cyclic pitch RPM.  You will get  the chance to work in one of the best Technical University Europe, at the Risø campus, the cradle and world renown campus of innovation and research in wind energy.  Furthermore, by being part of an EU project you will have the opportunity to meet regularly and work closely with a distributed team of experts, both from academia and wind industry located all across Europe.  Required Qualifications and Competencies  - A Master's degree in an engineering field or computer science - Proficiency in scientific Python programming - A background in machine learning  Desirable additional background knowledge  - Wind energy - Data-driven methods, such as SVD/POD and deep learning - Control or optimization - Wind turbine aero-elastic modelling - Wind farm flow physics (wind farm wake)  Wind and Energy System Department is a mission-oriented organisation focused on accelerating the development and integration of wind based energy systems. The System Engineering and Optimization (SYS) section work closely with experts from all across the department and companies to create simulation, design and control solutions for wind farm, wind clusters and hybrid-power plants.  DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation, and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility.  Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programs at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study program, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education .  Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years.  You can read more about career paths at DTU here .  Further information Further information may be obtained from Head of Section, Pierre-Elouan Réthoré tel.: +45 21331293, pire@dtu.dk  You can read more about DTU Wind at http://www.vindenergi.dtu.dk/   If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar " PhD relocation to Denmark and startup "Zoom" seminar " for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU.  Application procedure . Your complete online application must be submitted no later 15 December 2023 (23:59 Danish time) .  Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English), including an official description of the grading scale   You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master's degree but cannot begin before having received it.  Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.  All interested candidates, irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion, or ethnic background, are encouraged to apply.  Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. We're on the hunt for a talented amp; innovative UI/Front-End developer to join our dynamic team nestled in the heart of captivating Copenhagen. We are a pioneering cross-functional unit immersed in the enthralling realm of AI and ML technology.  With the power of cutting-edge technology and disruptive innovation at our fingertips, our objective is to create an intensely  As our UI/Front-End Developer, you'll be the creative brain behind our interface design. Your tech wizardry will empower our stakeholders - encompassing research and development departments, remote operation centers, and our esteemed customers - extracting maximum value from their data like never before.  Your mission won't just stop at design and build; you'll dive into the exciting world of new techniques with an experimental spirit ─ constantly exploring and challenging the status quo.  You will play an important role in:   Designing and developing highly interactive and intuitive user interface designs for our AI & ML-based models.  Continually testing and optimizing our front-end environments, ensuring seamless user-flow and exceptional user experience.  Work meticulously within a cross-functional team to develop data-driven solutions  Continually work hand-in-hand with our development departments and remote operation center   We imagine that you:  **Curiosity and Creativity**: As we work in a fast-pacing field of AI and ML, a burning desire to learn and experiment with new techniques is vital. You should be able to come up with out-of-the-box solutions and have a creative mind that doesn't stop at what already exists.  **Learning Agility**: A lifelong learner with a driving curiosity and the agility to pivot between projects and tasks smoothly. You're excited by new techniques, ideas, and perspectives. You are on a never-ending quest for growth and knowledge.  **Collaborative Spirit**: Our team thrives on synergy. It's important that you're both a team player and a clear communicator, capable of collaboratively working with a diverse, cross-functional team, and willingness to share and learn from others.  ️**User-Centric Focus**: An innate empathy towards end-users, understanding their needs, perspectives, and expectations will drive your design decisions.  **Tech Background** You have a strong relevant background in computer science, engineering or similar. You are Experienced in Angular as well as NX-Monorepo, DDD-Architecture (or similar), NGRX, RXJS and TDD.  Welcome to Digital lab, AI team MAN ES have formed a joint AI team consisting of software developers, data scientists, and engineering domain experts. The focus of the team is  to research and build POC’s,  AI models and projects using modern technologies and processes.  The team focus on getting their “hands dirty” with real-time problems rather than just focusing on the theoretical concepts involved.  What can you expect from us: ⚙️ **Welcome to MAN ES - Innovators of Marine Technology**  At MAN ES, we are charters of the unexplored, relentlessly pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the realm of 2-stroke marine engines. Offering state-of-the-art engine designs, we blend ingenuity with practicality, turning fascination into tangible, groundbreaking solutions every day. But our true engine of growth? Our team's open mindset and shared love for exploring the realms of technical possibilities.  ✅**Innovation Culture**: We encourage free thinking, welcoming new ideas and experimentation. Here, you'll have the power to question the status quo, bringing fresh perspectives and techniques to light.  ✅**Cross-functional Collaboration**: You'll get to work with various departments, broadening your scope of expertise, honing your communication skills, and bringing to work the thrill of solving diverse problems  ️ **Our Tech Ecosystem**: We are proud to leverage the AWS end-to-end tech stack, removing barriers to the utilization and execution of new technologies. This horizon of resources strengthens your convenience and ability to swiftly and seamlessly streamline any innovations. You'll be equipped with top-notch, cutting-edge technology to amplify and implement your ideas.   Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future We offer you an opportunity to help shape the world of tomorrow – whether you are just starting out, taking your first career steps after graduation, or looking for the next big career challenge.  At MAN Energy Solutions, we focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture. We believe that a diverse workforce with a mix of gender, nationalities, and perspectives will drive innovation, creativity and productivity. We are committed to our employees’ well-being, and you will have the opportunity to join different social activities from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.  We prioritize work-life balance, offering flexible working hours, the possibility of working from home, and mental well-being including health insurance and focus on work atmosphere. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.  At MAN Energy Solutions, you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions while achieving your personal career goals. Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                                  Senior Software Engineer   Cloud Services   |   Backend   |   Infrastructure   |   Data Science   |   Machine Learning  We are looking for a senior software engineer that can work alongside our data scientists to develop cloud-based analytics and machine learning solutions for the food production industry world-wide.  Scio+ is part of the SKOV A/S group of companies and we are the competence center for data-driven and vision-based solutions for the food production industry within the livestock segment. We provide production insights and predictions by applying machine learning techniques to discrete data and vision data from farm production sites. These innovative solutions focus on bringing added value to the production by optimizing processes, reducing cost and not least by reducing environmental footprint and improving animal welfare.  Working in Scio+  You will be a member of an international, skilled, highly motivated and self-driven team of software developers and data scientists spanning different educational backgrounds and competences. We do weekly sprint-like iterations, focusing our work on what adds value to our customers. We work as a DevOps teams meaning that we are responsible for developing, running and maintain our services.  We expect you to be passionate about development infrastructure backend and deployment of machine learning solutions. We value individuals who have an open and positive attitude towards colleagues, are ambitious about their work, and what we can achieve together.  You will be working together with colleagues in other development teams which are located globally in our regional offices.  What profile are we looking for?   You have a master's or PhD degree in computer science, engineering or in a related field  You are an experienced software developer (3-5 years+) that understand the challenges in designing and implementing and running cloud-based services  You have experience in delivering solutions using continuous integration and continuous delivery. It is beneficial if you have experience with continuous training of ML models  You have experience in Java, and it is a plus if you know .Net and Python.  You have experience with Azure or other cloud platforms like AWS or GCP  You have experience with Event-Streaming Platforms such as Apache Kafka or Azure Eventhub  You care about agile development processes and continuously improving velocity and applications  You like to foster the agile mindset within the group  You know the importance of data security  You are a great team player with a willingness to take responsibility in completing the different tasks for us to reach our goals together  You are flexible when it comes to tasks and able to keep an overview of multiple tasks in a sometimes hectic environment   What would you actually be doing?   Support, improve and maintain our current cloud infrastructure backend  Building reliable and secure data collection systems for experimentations and for production-ready systems  Create transparency on the health and the performance of cloud infrastructure for solutions in production and drive optimizations on operation and costs  Participate in chapter-work with other development teams in our group  Impact new products development on the infrastructure side   Join us  We offer a flexible work arrangement with respect for a healthy work–life balance for all employees, and a unique opportunity to make your impact on the organization as it grows together with you. We offer you to join social activities with your colleagues, also here we hope you might have a great idea for some activities.  Want to know more?  Please contact Recruitment Consultant Luqman Mohammed-Brown, phone +45 88 74 11 43 or by e-mail: l.mohammed-brown@frankgroup.com  Apply for the job  We are assessing applications on an ongoing basis, so please send your cover letter, CV and relevant attachments as soon as possible to Recruitment Consultant Luqman Mohammed-Brown by e-mail: l.mohammed-brown@frankgroup.com     Scio+ is an ambitious young company working at the forefront of data science in the food production sector. Our vision is to be a world class partner in data driven livestock yield optimization and our mission is to optimize livestock food production yield across the entire value chain by providing reliable data driven insights.        Apply for position  Application due: 12/29/2023  Workplace: Denmark  Position category: Research & Development        Share/Print    Questions regarding the position        Simon Binderup Johansen   Business Development Director  sij@skov.dk  +4572175588                                                                                ShareThis Copy and Paste

Title: Data Engineer - Machine Learning Research & Development
Description:

Vendors  Youtube, Linkedin      Accept these cookies  Decline non-necessary cookies                Career menu       Start    Departments    People    Jobs      Employee  Log in   WS Audiology  WS Audiology  WS Audiology APAC  WS Audiology Americas  WS Audiology EMEA   Candidate  Log in to Connect       WS Audiology EMEA             Facebook       X       LinkedIn       Mail            Research & Development  ·  Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark   Data Engineer - Machine Learning     Apply now            Join us in the newly established role and utilize your skills to advance the hearing aid industry with AI-based innovations. Does this sounds wonderful to you? Then have a look. Who we are At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services. Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world. With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes. Sounds wonderful? Then keep on reading The Team To deliver on our purpose to make wonderful sound part of everyone’s life, we are strengthening our capabilities with an additional, passionate, and purpose-driven team player in our AI Fitting Accelerator. This is a newly established unit, that is inspired by the opportunity to advance the hearing aid industry with AI-based innovations. You will get to learn a bit more about the innovations, that you will be working on, further along in the recruitment process. As it is a self-sustaining unit, it will handle the entire innovation cycle, from idea generation, through prototyping and testing, to product delivery. To do so, the team will foster a creative spirit while being on the forefront of newest technologies. You will be part of a team with an informal culture and consisting of skilled and dedicated individuals lifting together. The Role As our new Data Engineer , you will be building the bridge between our centralized data team (that are responsible for ingesting production data from various sources into a central data lake), and the AI Fitting Accelerator, by developing and maintaining a data eco-system that is the foundation of our machine learning projects. Main responsibilities and tasks e.g.  Ingesting production data, understanding the underlying hearing aid data domain, and ensuring development of a data model architecture that exposes the data in an interpretable way ready for data analysts, data scientists and other data consumers.  Collaborating with data scientists on machine learning projects by delivering curated datasets that are ready for predictive modelling, as well as seeking out opportunities where a data-centric approach can support move the project forward.  Building core infrastructure for data-driven products in collaboration with software and machine learning engineers.  About You To be successful in the role as our new Data Engineer you recognize that having quality data requires an understanding of where and how the data is generated, and thus what real-world process it describes. Therefore, you enjoy interacting with subject matter experts to understand the reality in the data you provide. You are a team player who seeks design feedback and engage in constructive discussions with your fellow colleagues. To summarize, we are hoping to see the following qualifications in you:  Master’s Degree within Computer Science, Data Science, or a similar field  Python machine learning/data science stack (such as Torch, Tensorflow, scikit-learn, ClearML, etc.)  Distributed data processing frameworks (such as Databricks, Spark, Hadoop, etc.)  Cloud development and deployment (we use Microsoft Azure)  As person we expect you to be creative, have attention to detail, and a collaborative attitude that you see as a part of what defines you. You can work with a range of programming languages and tools, depending on the project requirements. You have a diverse computer science foundation that enables you to learn and apply new skills as needed. The corporate language is English, so you need to have professional proficiency in English both verbally and in writing. What we would like to offer you The working environment at WS Audiology is informal with helpful and skilled colleagues. Our values focus on teamwork across functions, pioneering as well as having the passion to make an impact. So, if you can see yourself in those values, you will fit right in. The benefits we can offer include an advantageous pension scheme with health insurance, sports and arts club as well as good canteen facilities. Our Danish headquarter, is a CO2 friendly and modern facility with beautiful surroundings close to Allerød north of Copenhagen, Denmark.  Sounds wonderful? Join us Please submit your CV as soon as possible. We will screen and invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, but the latest deadline is the 1st of December 2023 . In case you have any questions, you are more than welcome to contact Caspar Bang Jespersen at caspar.jespersen@wsa.com WS Audiology is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.       Department   Research & Development   Role  Global Innovation and Intellectual Property  Locations  Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark  Employment type  Full-time                  Contact  Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen  Talent Acquisition Partner - EMEA

Title: Senior Network Security Architect
Description: Apply now                Forward  your career                      Hedehusene  Senior Network Security Architect     We are looking for a Senior Network Security Architect at DSV, to be responsible for designing, executing, and supporting security solutions to safeguard our information systems from external and internal threats.  Join Global IT  As Senior Network Security Architect, you will maintain one of the biggest global enterprise network solutions and become a member of a team consisting of approximately 10 specialists. You will be working on the latest technology systems in great working environment in Hedehusene.  Collaborate with implementation and operations teams  In this role, you will collaborate with implementation and operations teams, providing technical supervision on security matters. Moreover, your tasks will be:   Safeguard information system assets by identifying and solving potential security problems. Define access privileges, control structures, and resources to protect systems.  Implement security improvements by assessing the current situation and anticipating requirements.  Conduct periodic audits to identify security violations and inefficiencies. Upgrade systems by implementing and maintaining security controls.  Keep management informed through performance reports and system status communication.  Stay current with the latest IT security news, exploits, and developments.  Participate in vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, and security configuration reviews. Work independently and collaborate closely with incident responders, SOC analysts, and other technology leads. Plan, research, and design security architectures.  Establish disaster recovery procedures and conduct security breach drills. Respond quickly and effectively to all security incidents, providing post-event analyses.   Our Key Network Security Technologies, and the skills required for the role:   Next Generation Firewall – Cisco FTD and FMC, PaloAlto, Fortigate (Advanced skills).  Identity Management – ISE, RADIUS, TACACS, NAC (Advanced skills).  Micro Segmentation – Cisco Secure Workload (Advanced skills).  Micro Segmentation – Cisco ACI (Intermediate skills).  Secure Internet browsing – Cisco Web Security Appliance (Intermediate skills).  Security Monitoring and Automation – Stealthwatch (Advanced skills).  Secure DNS protection – Cisco Umbrella (Advanced skills).  Multi-Factor Authentication – Cisco DUO (Advanced skills).  Web Application Firewall – Citrix NetScaler (Intermediate skills).  DDOS attacks detection and prevention (Advanced skills).  Understanding of cloud security architectural design & technologies (Advanced skills).  Understanding of incident response processes and cyber-attack vectors (Intermediate skills).   Your background  You probably have a Bachelor's or Associate's degree in IT, Computer Science, or a related field. It would also be an advance, if you have advanced IT security certifications such as (CISSP, CEH, CCIE Sec, PAN Certs, Security +). Your work experience could be a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience, as well as:   5-10 years of experience in information security and IT risk management.  Strong working knowledge of current IT security implementations, computer operating systems, and software programs.  Ability to interact effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds and races.  Excellent teaching, problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.   Want to know more and apply?  We will be happy to answer any questions you may have regarding the position and about your options in DSV. You are welcome to call Christian Hinløv, Senior Manager, at +45 61 61 39 16 and Waseem Al-Saadi, Network Security Manager, at +45 43 20 35 04.  We look forward to receiving your application via the link below. We will process the applications as we receive them.  #DSVGlobalIT   Apply now      Read more           I work in the innovation part of IT, and I love that we get to work with the latest technologies. My team and DSV are very open to new ideas and ways of working, and everyone has a say.  - Inta, Senior UX Designer                       4 af 5 stjerner    241 of DSV’s employees have rated DSV on Jobindex     What I really love is that in DSV, it is entirely possible to combine having a career AND a family life. It is amazing not having to compromise – even with young kids at home. DSV gives me the flexibility needed to grow professionally while also enjoying my family.  - Inta, Senior UX Designer    See what else your new colleagues say                  There are hundreds of great reasons to work at DSV.  Here are just a few collected from our employees ...        EMPOWERMENT  We’ll empower you to make a difference. We believe that people do great things, when they are given the opportunity and support they need to succeed. We trust in people.     GLOBAL CAREER DEVELOPMENT  You’ll have access to a massive network of possibilities. We build inspiring careers locally and internationally.     INFORMAL ENVIRONMENT  You’ll be part of a dynamic and informal environment, where people speak their minds. This allows us to move fast, stay ahead and face challenges head-on. This is the DSV way.     LEARNING  Our DSV academy will give you access to knowledge and training, which will allow you to grow and influence the path of your career. We want you to realise your potential and reach your career goals.        OWNERSHIP  We’ll encourage you to act as if DSV were your own business. Our local branches work very autonomously and decisions are made close to the customer. This is what makes us unique, agile and strong.     PERFORMANCE  You’ll join a group of highly dedicated people who strive to improve every day. If you like a challenge and a constantly changing environment then join us.     TRULY GLOBAL  We’ll give you 75,000 colleagues in more than 90 countries all over the world. We’re a global family.     WE GROW TOGETHER  You will be part of a genuinely fast-growing company. We started our journey in 1976, and since then we have expanded our market share immensely. But we have only just begun – the most exciting time to join DSV is now!                                     Our hiring process  At DSV, we are always looking for the most skilled employees within our field. It is our goal to hire the very best match and ensure that our employees across the company are successful in their job. That is why our recruitment process is so important. Our drive, talent and devotion are what make DSV the exciting place it is.  Everyone is working to move what the world needs moved. Having a diverse workforce, where you can realise your potential based on your specific background, is at our core.    Because we believe that a diverse workforce in an inclusive culture fosters dynamic workplaces and, ultimately, better business decisions.  see our job areas                DSV in numbers       1.500  Offices and logistic facilities    80+  Countries worldwide    75.000+  Employees              Follow us                             Ansvarlig brug af dine oplysninger    ×     Jobindex ønsker at tilbyde en service, der giver dig den bedste oplevelse. Title: Quantitative Developer
Description: Apply now                         Quantitative Developer  Gentofte      Imagine a future where you employ your Modern C++ coding skills in our quantitative framework for decision support, risk managing, and Strategic prioritisations.  Join us in this role where you’ll be part of a team with several quantitative developers responsible for developing, managing, and operating our calculational framework. The framework includes Monte-Carlo- based calculation engines written in Modern C++, GUI interfaces in C#, Python integration, Full stack Web-applications, PostgreSQL databases, and Linux servers. In short – plenty of opportunities to influence, drive, and learn about anything and everything in a modern open-source Linux environment with a little Microsoft Windows on top.  Welcome to Trading and Revenue  You’ll be part of Exposure Analytics where you, together with your colleagues, will drive optimisation, valuation, and decision support for power and gas, be it natural gas, biogas, or hydrogen, in the future energy system. You’ll be part of a highly skilled and engaged team that enjoys a fun and challenging working environment, and work with many stakeholders across the organization.  You’ll play an important role in:   setting up, maintaining, and operating the models and tools used for optimising both our Power and Gas Portfolio  continuously developing and renewing tools and models to the business together with colleagues to ensure alignment with market conditions  delivering high-quality quantitative analyses and using your skills to translate mathematics to operational decision making  setting standards to improve our code quality and shape the way we deploy solutions to production  helping to ensure operational excellence of the Power and Gas Portfolio.   To succeed in the role, you:   have completed a degree within computer science, engineering, data science, mathematics, statistics, physics, or other quantitative-focused disciplines  are a team player with strong technical skills, motivated by understanding the business and transforming requirements into IT-solutions with a variety of stakeholders in an international, English-speaking environment  have experience working with Modern C++ and preferably previously deployed to and managed RedHat servers or containerised applications  have a passion for and experience with mathematical models, such as Monte Carlo Simulations, stochastic optimisation, option pricing, or linear programming  have experience with or are interested in learning more about the global energy markets and how to manage a broad portfolio of assets  adapt well to change and are constantly looking to challenge the norms to do things better.   Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.  Join a global leader in renewable energy  Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.  Shape the future with us  Send your application to us no later than 1 January 2024 . We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.  Please don’t hesitate to contact Martin Westring Soerensen, Head of Exposure Analytics, on (Denmark +45) 9955 7421, if you’d like to know more about the position. If you need to request any adjustments or accommodations to working practices, working patterns, or the assessment or interview process we're happy to discuss alternative arrangements.  Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country.    Apply now       Read More             5 af 5 stjerner     571 of Ørsted's employees have rated Ørsted on Jobindex    “I find it truly inspiring to work with so many bright minded people in order to make a difference.”  Mie Team Lead   See what else your new colleagues say              5 af 5 stjerner     571 of Ørsted's employees have rated Ørsted on Jobindex    “I find it truly inspiring to work with so many bright minded people in order to make a difference.”  - Mie, Team Lead   See what else your new colleagues say              Working at Ørsted       Purpose  A job at Ørsted puts you at the forefront of the global green energy transition. Help us create a world that runs entirely on green energy.     Development  At Ørsted, we want you to thrive, perform and develop. You’ll unfold your potential – through training, feedback, collaboration, and challenging assignments.     Innovation  Ørsted is a great workplace for innovators. In 2020, we ranked as the 19th best company in the world for innovators to flourish by the world leading magazine FastCompany.     Diversity  Talent is diverse by nature. You’ll experience an inclusive culture that embraces diversity of thought to solve challenges.              Hiring process    Find your area of work    Your development    Our culture             Hiring process  We’re always looking for bright minds to help us lead the energy industry and shape a brighter future. Explore the stages of the hiring process, learn what to expect and get some tips from our recruiters.    Research    Find your fit    Craft your application    Apply    Application review process    Interview and tests    Welcome to Ørsted    Learn more about our hiring process              Find your area of work  It takes a wide range of skills and competences from almost every discipline to run a global renewable energy company like Ørsted. Whatever your background and qualifications, you can find a job at Ørsted that fits you – one where you can develop personally and professionally, while helping us work towards our vision of a world that runs entirely on green energy.  Roles at Ørsted are grouped into 12 broad areas of work. Explore these areas to find out more about the kinds of roles they might include.  See all areas of work              Unleash your talent  We strive to bring out the best in all our people by enabling them to develop their potential. We invest significantly in continuous development for everyone because our people are at the heart of our future growth.  At Ørsted, every day brings new opportunities. You’ll work with your manager to learn what it takes to succeed at Ørsted and what resources are at your disposal – so together we’ll create the best career path for you.  Learn more about your development              An inclusive team  Talent is diverse by nature. We want to build diverse and inclusive teams, because we truly believe that different perspectives will strengthen our ability to be innovative and deliver on our mission. We take pride in recruiting the best person for the job, whatever their demographic, background or beliefs.  Flexible working conditions  We support our colleagues with flexible working arrangements wherever possible. This may include the flexibility to work from home, leave early or come in late if it's agreed with your manager and allows you to perform your role. If you require formalised flexibility in your working life, such as part-time hours, feel free to discuss this with us during the hiring process.  Learn more about our culture                                           “I love the fact that I’m encouraged to pursue my interests and develop in my own unique way.”   Leticia Strategy Associate at Ørsted                           “A surprising element of my role is the prominence of the soft skills. I knew it would be needed, but to such an extent I had never imagined.”   Aseem SCRUM master at Ørsted                    Let’s create a world that runs entirely on green energy  At Ørsted, we’re not only transforming the way the world is powered – we’re leading the global green energy transition.      9000  9000 employees worldwide    15  Headquartered in Denmark and located in 15 countries    100%  Our vision is to create a world that runs entirely on green energy         The Ørsted vision is a world that runs entirely on green energy. Ørsted develops, constructs, and operates offshore and onshore wind farms, solar farms, energy storage facilities, and bioenergy plants, and provides energy products to its customers. Ørsted ranks as the world’s most sustainable energy company in Corporate Knights' 2021 index of the Global 100 most sustainable corporations in the world and is recognised on the CDP Climate Change A List as a global leader on climate action. Headquartered in Denmark, Ørsted employs 6,400 people. Ørsted's shares are listed on Nasdaq Copenhagen (Orsted). In 2020, the group's revenue was DKK 52.6 billion (EUR 7.1 billion). Title: Software Development Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
See all positions              Software Development Engineer (f/m/d)   Permanent employee,
            Full-time
                                        · Denmark          At a glance  At Brüel & Kjær Vibro, we pride ourselves on protecting and monitoring the world's most important machines. From hydropower plants to wind turbines, from simple pumps and gearboxes to complex gas turbines, our customers rely on us to deliver machinery protection and condition monitoring systems that prevent unplanned machine downtime and increase plant profitability. We have successfully delivered tens of thousands of systems, complemented by our world-class services. For more than 80 years, we have pioneered intelligent monitoring solutions to keep our customer's rotating equipment operating at peak performance worldwide.    Your mission   Design, develop, test, maintain and improve on-premise software Build robust server-side components and support our desktop based diagnostic applications Lead implementation plans, design reviews and code reviews Coordinate with our product team to understand user requirements and translate them into robust software solutions Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate new features and updates Solve complex software issues and provide technical guidance to other team members Uphold best practices in SW engineering, security and design     Your profile   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience At least 5 years of experience in software development with a focus on on-premise applications Strong knowledge of languages such as C#, Python or Node.js Experience with desktop application development, particularly with frameworks like .NET Proficient understanding of databases (SQL, NoSQL) Strong knowledge of version control systems, such as Git Experience with Windows and Linux operating systems Demonstrated problem-solving skills and ability to work in a team Excellent verbal and written communication skills     Apply for this position    About us  Brüel & Kjær Vibro (B&K Vibro) is the world's leading independent 
 supplier of advanced electronic systems and software for protecting and 
 monitoring rotating machinery, for example turbines, compressors, pumps, 
 fans, blowers, generators and many more. Part of the NSK Group, we are forerunners and pioneers in providing 
 intelligent solutions to ensure uptime for our customers’ rotating machinery.      Apply for this position        Your application!  We appreciate your interest in ​Brüel & Kjaer Vibro. Title: PhD Student on Immersive Process Mining - DTU Compute
Description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                     Esc                                 PhD Student on Immersive Process Mining - DTU Compute        Kgs. Lyngby, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   If you are establishing your career as scientist and you are looking for the best possible foundation for fulfilling your dreams and ambitions, it is right here in front of you. The Technical University of Denmark (DTU) and the Technical University Eindhoven (TU/e) are opening an exciting opportunity for a PhD position in the intersection of business process management, formal methods, and human-computer interaction (HCI). This project will explore how Knowledge Intensive Processes (for instance, those processes executed by physicians or lawyers) can be better modeled, simulated and verified. Responsibilities and qualifications Your overall focus will be to strengthen the department’s competences within computational modeling, and the design, analysis and implementation of visual languages to represent complex organizational processes from a human-centered perspective. You will work with nearby colleagues, and with both academic and industrial partners in Denmark as well as in the Netherlands. In your PhD you will study how modeling languages can support the understanding, simulation and verification of knowledge-intensive processes. During your PhD you will likely cover activities such as:   Building or extending modelling languages for Knowledge Intensive Processes  Define methods for the verification of knowledge intensive processes and the conformance of existing systems against process models  Build immersive environments for the modelling, simulation and verification of Knowledge Intensive Processes  Create visual notations to adapt to context-specific environments (for instance, in hospital or legal departments)  Test the understandability of these tools with potential users   This position presupposes a co-supervision with academic partners in TU/e Eindhoven, and it requires at least 6 months of stay at the Netherlands spread over the duration of your PhD. The successful candidate will have previous experience in computer science, with a Master thesis or equivalent research experience in any of the following areas:  a) Computer science modelling, simulation, or verification, b) Business Process Management or Process Mining, or c) Human-Computer Interaction or Game Development Technologies. Moreover, the candidate will benefit from basic knowledge in formal methods and programming languages, process mining or human computer interaction. You must have a two-year master's degree (120 ECTS points) or a similar degree with an academic level equivalent to a two-year master's degree. Approval and Enrolment  The scholarship for the PhD degree is subject to academic approval, and the candidate will be enrolled in one of the general degree programmes at DTU. For information about our enrolment requirements and the general planning of the PhD study programme, please see DTU's rules for the PhD education . Assessment The assessment will be performed by members of the Software Systems Engineering (SSE) section. The chairman for this position is Hugo A. López (hulo@dtu.dk). We offer DTU is a leading technical university globally recognized for the excellence of its research, education, innovation and scientific advice. We offer a rewarding and challenging job in an international environment. We strive for academic excellence in an environment characterized by collegial respect and academic freedom tempered by responsibility. Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations. The allowance will be agreed upon with the relevant union. The period of employment is 3 years. Starting date is March 2024 (or according to mutual agreement). The position is a full-time position. You can read more about career paths at DTU here . Further information  Further information may be obtained from Hugo A. López ( hulo@dtu.dk - http://lopezacosta.net/). You'll be part of the Software Systems Engineering section and the Department of Applied mathematics and computer science department at DTU. If you are applying from abroad, you may find useful information on working in Denmark and at DTU at DTU – Moving to Denmark . Furthermore, you have the option of joining our monthly free seminar “ PhD relocation to Denmark and startup “Zoom” seminar ” for all questions regarding the practical matters of moving to Denmark and working as a PhD at DTU. Application procedure Your complete online application must be submitted no later than 1 December 2023 (23:59 Danish time) . Applications must be submitted as one PDF file containing all materials to be given consideration. To apply, please open the link "Apply now", fill out the online application form, and attach all your materials in English in one PDF file . The file must include:   A letter motivating the application (cover letter)  Curriculum vitae  Grade transcripts and BSc/MSc diploma (in English) including official description of grading scale  Any research publications relevant to the call (if any)   You may apply prior to ob­tai­ning your master’s degree but cannot begin before having received it. Applications received after the deadline will not be considered. All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion or ethnic background are encouraged to apply. DTU Compute is a unique and internationally recognized academic department with 385 employees and 11 research sections spanning the science disciplines mathematics, statistics, computer science, and engineering. We conduct research, teaching and innovation of high international standard – producing new knowledge and technology-based solutions to societal challenges. We have a long-term involvement in applied and interdisciplinary research, big data and data science, artificial intelligence (AI), internet of things (IoT), smart and secure societies, smart manufacturing, and life science. At DTU Compute we believe in a diverse workplace with a flexible work-life balance. The section for Software Systems Engineering advances and combines applied and foundational knowledge in software engineering, programming languages, process modelling, security and formal methods to address current and future scientific and societal challenges. Technology for people DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Title: Developer, Software for Self-Protection Systems, Aeronautics, Lystrup
Description: Developer, Software for Self-Protection Systems, Aeronautics, Lystrup       We are looking for a passionate software developer to be a part of a team that creates world-class software for our self-protection systems within the aerospace domain.  Are you excited about the opportunity to develop software for the best self-protection systems for jet fighters, military transport aircraft, helicopters, and other aircraft worldwide?  Do you want to work closely together with engineers, computer scientists, and systems engineers to maintain and build systems used by nations around the world?  Then we have a unique opportunity for you!  Job description  We are looking for a passionate developer for our Self-Protection Systems software (SPS SW)  department to join the Flight team that maintains and builds mission-critical software for military aircraft.  The department is part of the Self-Protection Systems (SPS) organization which consists of approximately 60 engineers across Denmark and the US working within systems, hardware,  electronics, automated test equipment, and mechanical engineering disciplines.  The department delivers Flight and Ground software; the former is embedded Operational Flight Program (OFP) software for supporting inflight  operations during missions; the latter is high-level application software for supporting pre- and postflight operations on the ground, such as mission planning and debriefing.  In total, the staff of permanent employees in the department is 15, split between the Flight software team and the Ground software team.  You will be part of the Flight software team and primarily work with the Flight software, but you will get the opportunity to also work with the high-level application software, should you have  the will and desire.  Areas of responsibility  Your responsibilities will cover:   Develop maintainable, testable embedded code for proprietary and COTS hardware.  Participate in code review practices to provide and receive constructive feedback.  Work closely together with the architects and systems engineers.  Help maintain our integrated toolchain.  Maintain and review technical documentation such as requirements specifications, test specifications, and interface control documents.  Develop automated test suites, unit tests, and integration tests and conduct tests on real hardware in the lab.   You will work with these technologies :   C++ and C.  Microsoft Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code with Resharper Ultimate.  Real-Time Operating Systems.  Google Test.   What’s our company like?  We are an international company representing world-class expertise, delivering complex and high-tech products. We value our colleagues and our meaningful contributions to securing people through advanced technology. During your onboarding in Terma, you can expect a thorough introduction and training in our systems and processes, as well as a strong focus on teaching you useful new competencies and further strengthening current ones, both professionally and personally. Our company culture is autonomous and engaging, and we acknowledge the importance of flexibility in a great working environment. In our different locations, we offer various social activities to bring all our colleagues together.  How to succeed in this position?  Minimum qualifications:   You hold a relevant degree in computer science or engineering.  You have a desire to work with software architecture and business logic.  You speak and understand English (all documentation is in English).   The ideal candidate:   You have a few years of professional work experience.  Experience with design patterns and understanding of S.O.L.I.D principles.  Experience with task management and knowledge-sharing tools like Jira and Confluence.  Experience with the continuous integration tools Git, Gerrit, and Jenkins.  Understanding of agile development.   The two most important personal characteristics are, first and foremost, the ability to function well in the context of teamwork. Building mission-critical software often involves working within teams or with stakeholders that are multidisciplinary; effective communication, collaboration, and teamwork skills are crucial for coordinating efforts, exchanging information, and ensuring successful project execution. Next, attention to detail is highly valued; building software for mission-critical use requires a meticulous approach and a strong focus on detail, precision, and accuracy to ensure that the software functions reliably and meets the strict requirements and specifications.  We have fun at work with an informal and relaxed working environment although, at the same time, we are aware of the crucial nature of the solutions that we are a part of – and we’d love to have you on board!  Any unanswered questions?  Feel free to contact Hans Kristian Lintrup, Senior Manager at +45 2328 7483 or hkl@terma.com in case of any further questions regarding this position.  We look forward to receiving your application and CV. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com .  Application deadline: Applications will be processed continuously.  Bear in mind that you must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defence Intelligence Service. This entails that you, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.  The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.  T erma A/S is headquartered at Aarhus, Denmark. Internationally, Terma has subsidiaries and operations in The Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, United Kingdom, United Arab Emirates, India, Singapore and the U.S.          Application deadline: Ongoing
