Title: Junior System Engineer
Description: About the job  Saab life     Apply               Junior System Engineer                Sønderborg             We are rapidly growing our global business and we are looking for new colleagues.  Do you want to kick-start your career in system engineering in a company that develops systems to help keep people and society safe?  We are looking for Junior System Engineers to join our growing organization. You will become part of a large team of experienced and highly competent System Engineers where you will be able to learn from them and grow into the role as System Engineer.  Your role  As Junior System Engineer, you will interact with the other System Engineers and help with the technical part of projects. Based on customer requirements and internal design processes, you will plan the system design in close cooperation with other System Engineers. You will:   Participate in customer projects as part of the system engineering team  Support the team with requirement breakdown in our system  Participate in internal and external design and document reviews  Support the team with data collection in various parts of the organization  Support the team with collection of equipment data   Your profile  This opportunity requires a person who likes to learn and work with many stakeholders. The candidate we are looking for is a team player with initiative and interpersonal skills. You have a broad technical background and work in a structured way.  We expect you to hold a degree within engineering, computer science or a technical education with equivalent experience. This is a perfect opportunity for a recent graduated candidate.  We are in a global environment and therefore look for candidates with various backgrounds and experiences. We interact with each other and therefore need good communicators, who like to interact with stakeholders and who speak/write English.  What can you expect from us?  Saab Danmark is a company that is growing and you will therefore experience a company that is dynamic and able to adapt. In the Saab group we have a saying ”Business is done between people”, and this is also the environment you can expect here. We offer:   Initial learning process with mentorship and support  Good career and development opportunities in a professional company  A vibrant and international atmosphere with colleagues from all over the world  Benefits that support our employees’ wellbeing  A variety of social activities, lunch scheme, pension as well as flexible work conditions  Focus on our teams, good cooperation and giving our employees the ability to take ownership of their tasks.   Our attractive offices are located in Sønderborg with easy access and a fantastic view of the surroundings.  As a condition of employment, candidates will be required to participate in a background investigation and/or successfully demonstrate eligibility to receive applicable government security clearance(s).   Workplace Saab Danmark A/S Porten 6-8 6400 Sønderborg   Application As we interview candidates continuously, send in your application now.   Questions? Contact: Lilian Duborg Jepsen Manager, System Engineering.  lilian.jepsen@dk.saabgroup.com       Apply         Saab Danmark A/S  Saab in Denmark is part of the Saab Group with headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden. At the same time, Saab is an independent legal company with a flat organizational structure. Saab Danmark has close to 40 years of experience in fully secure integrated communication solutions.  With systems in active service on all continents, our communication solutions has extensive experience in developing and delivering turnkey systems for all domains within both defence and civil segments.  You can find further information about our integrated communication solutions TactiCall on TactiCall .  See more about our company here.                   Saab life         Work environment  Saab has a strong company culture, based on our common goal to contribute to safety in a complex and unpredictable world. We are proud of what we do and the important purpose the defence industry serve in society.          What we offer  Saab’s most important assets are the people who work here. To keep creating groundbreaking solutions, we need our employees to thrive and be inspired to grow together with us.  Working at Saab, means you get your own development plan, lots of training opportunities as well as benefits that are designed to fit your individual needs.         Learn more about Saab Life            We offer a career at the forefront of technology, in a challenging and everchanging environment where all share one common goal – to help protect people.           Quick facts      Number of employees in the world  17,822  2020    Employees who are engaged in their work  78%  2020    Sales in 2020  35,431  MSEK              About us  Saab is a global defence and security company operating in the fields of air, land and naval defence, civil security and commercial aeronautics. We number 17,800 employees and have operations on all continents. Technologically we are leaders in many areas, and one-fifth of our earnings are spent on research and development.  Saab is also a company with opportunities. A company where we see diversity as an asset and where you have both considerable responsibility and good opportunities for advancing in your career. But also a company that respects each person’s need for a rewarding life beyond work. Title: Embedded Software Developer
Description: 31.200 job i dag         For jobsøgere    For arbejdsgivere     DA    EN          Log ind  Opret profil                Jobsøgning       Søg job Vælg mellem flere søgekriterier    Din side Skab overblik over din jobsøgning      Jobagent Få nye job direkte i din indbakke    CV Opret dit CV og bliv headhuntet      QuickApply-profil Søg jobbet nemt fra mobilen    Jobannoncearkiv Find inspiration i udløbne jobopslag      Få en jobvejleder Bliv afklaret i din jobsøgning    Jobs For Ukraine Hjælper ukrainske flygtninge med at få job        Arbejdspladser       Se virksomhedsprofiler Få viden om din næste arbejdsplads      Evaluér arbejdsplads Hvordan er din arbejdsplads? Stresstest Mål dit stressniveau      Talenttest Find dine arbejdstalenter        Guides       Ansøgninger Sådan skriver du en god ansøgning    CV Få de bedste tips til dit CV      Jobsamtale Gør et godt indtryk til samtalen    Lønforhandling Stå stærkt til lønforhandlingen      Opsigelse Brug denne guide og kom godt videre    Uopfordret ansøgning Sådan søger du uopfordret      Dit første job Værktøjer og tips til dit nye arbejdsliv    Jobglæde Sæt jobglæde på agendaen        Kurser       6 ugers jobrettet uddannelse Opgrader dine kompetencer      Jobsøgningskursus Skab struktur i din jobsøgning              For arbejdsgivere    Tilmeld dig Jobindex    Switch to English        Log ind  Opret profil                    Søg job       Gemte job       Jobagent       Mere     Overblik   Ansøgninger   Henvendelser   CV   QuickApply-profil   Virksomheder   Råd og vejledning   Indstillinger          Save  Share  Apply        Shure Scandinavia A/S    Copenhagen     Share    Save      Embedded Software Developer    Overview  Shure has an ambitious goal of offering our customers innovative ecosystems of top-quality software to support our networked devices. In Copenhagen, we design and develop high quality conferencing products and solutions. As we are expanding our product portfolio, we are looking for an Embedded Software Developer to join our team in Ørestad, Copenhagen.  Keep your designs in balance with our software ecosystem   We are a technology-driven company that embraces the SAFe methodology. While we operate in sprints, we don't succumb to the pressures of haste. Our emphasis lies in producing high-quality code rather than resorting to quick workarounds. In this role, you will be working with everything from low-level drivers to high level MCU application code. Using your programming skills, you will ensure that our mechanics, hardware, and algorithms are integrated to connect our devices.  Be part of a culture that makes people stay on   You will join a team of around 10 embedded software developers. At Shure, we appreciate collaboration, commitment, and innovation as well as a natural interest in solving complex issues. We strive towards achieving extraordinary results and we are not afraid of taking on challenging tasks.  Responsibilities  In your new position, you will be part of a cross-functional, cross-site development team that designs and implements cutting edge audio products, platforms and technologies.  Your daily tasks will typically include:   Designing, developing, and debugging embedded application software written in C++ for 16/32-bit processors running RTOS or embedded Linux.  Designing, developing, and debugging low-level peripheral device drivers for controlling external HW modules, ASICS, FPGAs or similar.  Reviewing system requirements and developing software designs accordingly. Conducting and participating in firmware architecture and design reviews.  Developing and maintaining unit tests for testing your implementation. Participating in system integration efforts.  Contributing to CI-CD pipelines as necessary and helping in developing relevant tools to ensure that continuous delivery chain is always functional.   Qualifications  Who we think you are You have a B.Sc. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, or similar, and minimum 2 years of experience designing and developing embedded firmware.   You are very skilled with C and C++ and have a demonstrated understanding of object-oriented design using UML diagrams.  You have solid knowledge and experience utilizing object-oriented design patterns and architectures.  You understand key software design principles such as: separation of concerns, high cohesion and low coupling to facilitate reuse as well as maintainability in software architecture.  You develop unit tests using frameworks such as CUnit, CppTest and/or GoogleTest.  You are familiar with version control tools such as Subversion and Git.   Furthermore, it is a plus if you are experienced with:   Scripting languages such as Bash and Python.  Test automation frameworks such as Robot and Selenium.  Working in a team setup using the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).  Knowledge of low-latency audio networking protocols such as Dante and AES67.  Development of embedded Linux firmware components using the Yocto project framework.  Wireless technologies such as GSM, Bluetooth, LTE, Wi-Fi, WiMAX.   In addition to your technical skills, you are a great team player who loves to share your knowledge - just as your colleagues do. Since Shure is a global company, you will get the chance to collaborate with development teams located in the United States, Scotland, India and China.  Our value proposition to you  We see software development as a team effort, and you will join a collaborative mix of employees with different levels of experience. We are a company of passionate and dedicated people, and our technological innovations are the result of the creativity and dedication of our Associates.  We offer you an exciting and challenging job with ample opportunity for learning and growth as well as an attractive compensation package reflective of your experience and qualifications.  In this role, you will become part of an inspiring and flexible workplace with a dynamic work environment and great colleagues that appreciate, support and respect one another. We believe in the value of a good work-life balance and do our outmost to ensure that our employees thrive in our well-established company culture of innovation and high quality. Shure is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and cherish inclusion in the workplace.  Our technological innovations are the result of the creativity and dedication of our employees, and in short, it is our employees who define our culture and make Shure a great place to work!  Applying for the job  The mix matters: We recognize that every professional journey is unique and are committed to providing an equitable candidate experience for all prospective Shure Associates. If you are excited about this role, believe you have the skills to be successful, and you share our passion for creating an inclusive, diverse, equitable, and accessible work environment, then apply!  To find out more about this job, please contact Ömer Yurdal at: +45 3248 2300.   About Shure Shure’s mission is to be the most trusted audio brand worldwide – and for nearly a century, our Core Values have aligned us to be just that. Founded in 1925, we are a leading global manufacturer of audio equipment known for quality, reliability, and durability. We engineer microphones, headphones, wireless audio systems, conferencing systems, and more. And quality doesn’t stop at our products. Our talented teams strive for perfection and innovate every chance they get. We offer an Associate-first culture, flexible work arrangements, and opportunity for all.  Shure is headquartered in United States. We have more than 35 regional sales offices, engineering hubs, and manufacturing facilities throughout the Americas, EMEA, and Asia.  In our Copenhagen office, we are 55 dedicated and committed employees that value the exchange of ideas, high quality in everything that we do and respect for each other. Located in Ørestad, we have bright new offices, a good canteen as well as an open work environment and an informal tone. At Shure, we always aim at taking good care of our employees and do what we can to ensure that they thrive in our well-established company culture of innovation and high quality. We have an ambitious goal of offering our customers innovative ecosystems of high-quality software to support our networked devices, and our products are the first choice whenever audio performance is a top priority. Shure Incorporated is presented through a global partner network in more than 80 countries, with offices in Europe, Middle East, and Asia.  To reinforce our development/operations infrastructure, the DevOps team is looking for a Senior DevOps Developer.  As a DevOps Engineer, you will be part of a global team with stakeholders in the US, India, Scotland, Denmark, and China playing an active role in the CI/CT/CD infrastructure as well as contact to our IT department. You will also be part of our journey as we take our products and infrastructure to the Cloud (AWS). This role is based in Copenhagen, Denmark.  Responsibilities  In this role, you will:   Contribute to the continuous improvement and automation of product development tools for the entire software ecosystem at Shure.  Act as liaison between a variety of product development teams, being the contact for the tools, infrastructure, and automation to take their products to market.  Support the transition of Shure’s on premises DevOps infrastructure to an AWS cloud infrastructure using configuration as code.  Be a key contributor to Shure’s CI/CT/CD environment and be responsible for availability, security, and support.  Contribute to the documentation of our development, staging, and production environments and develop required monitoring and reporting mechanisms.   Qualifications  You are passionate about audio and it-technology and have:   A B.Sc. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering or similar.  Experience developing software and automating activities such as build, release and deployment, as well as creating and integrating industry tools.  Programming experience working with various languages – Python, Perl, C/C++, Java, C#, .Net, Shell, Make, & CMake etc.  Robust knowledge in configuration management tools and concepts - Git, Subversion, & Jenkins as well as strong understanding of CI, CT, and CT.  Experience developing code to automate tasks and processes, using the right technologies depending on the circumstances.  Experience with SAFe and agile processes.  Solid communication and problem-solving skills and able to fully document tools and processes.  Interest in proactively working with geographically diversified teams.  Experience working with cloud vendors (Shure uses AWS) as well as experience working with Docker, Kubernetes, Grafana, Prometheus and network infrastructure is a plus  Experience working with various environments (Windows, Mac, Linux, iOS, Android).   In addition to your technical skills, you are a great team player who loves to share your knowledge - just as your colleagues do. As Shure is a global company, you will have ample opportunity to collaborate with developers and DevOps colleagues in our other Shure locations around the world.  Our Value Proposition to You  We see software development as a team effort, and you will join a collaborative mix of employees with different levels of experience. We are a company of passionate and dedicated people, and our technological innovations are the result of the creativity and dedication of our Associates.  We offer you an exciting and challenging job with ample opportunity for learning and growth as well as an attractive compensation package reflective of your experience and qualifications.  At Shure, you be part of an inspiring and flexible workplace with a dynamic work environment and great colleagues that appreciate, support and respect one another. We believe in the value of a good work-life balance and do our outmost to ensure that our employees thrive in our well-established company culture of innovation and high quality. Shure is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and cherish inclusion in the workplace.  Applying for the job  The mix matters: We recognize that every professional journey is unique and are committed to providing an equitable candidate experience for all prospective Shure Associates. If you are excited about this role, believe you have the skills to be successful, and you share our passion for creating an inclusive, diverse, equitable, and accessible work environment, then apply!  To find out more about this job, please contact Rasmus Voss at: +45 3248 2300    About Shure Shure’s mission is to be the most trusted audio brand worldwide – and for nearly a century, our Core Values have aligned us to be just that. Founded in 1925, we are a leading global manufacturer of audio equipment known for quality, reliability, and durability. We engineer microphones, headphones, wireless audio systems, conferencing systems, and more. And quality doesn’t stop at our products. Our talented teams strive for perfection and innovate every chance they get. We offer an Associate-first culture, flexible work arrangements, and opportunity for all.  Shure is headquartered in United States. We have more than 35 regional sales offices, engineering hubs, and manufacturing facilities throughout the Americas, EMEA, and Asia.  In our Copenhagen office, we are 55 dedicated and committed employees that value the exchange of ideas, high quality in everything that we do and respect for each other. Located in Ørestad, we have bright new offices, a good canteen as well as an open work environment and an informal tone. At Shure, we always aim at taking good care of our employees and do what we can to ensure that they thrive in our well-established company culture of innovation and high quality. Lead IoT Software Development Engineer           Application Deadline:            Workplace:  Hybrid Position          Location:    Bjerringbro, DK, 8850             Contract Type:  Full-Time          Working Hours:  37          Employment Type:  Regular                  Take the opportunity to join  our specialized IoT development team and craft cutting-edge solutions for industrial applications. Help deliver innovative, sustainable solutions that minimize environmental impact while being at the forefront of digital development.      What is the job about?  You'll become a valuable member of the digital development team of the I ndustry D ivision, within the Digital Solutions department which is dedicated to conceiving, developing, and introducing novel and impactful digital solutions to our industrial clients.     As a lead IoT Software Development Engineer, you will play a key role in shaping the future of digital applications and at the heart of creating robust and scalable solutions that power our IoT ecosystem and Industry Solutions. Your work and emphasis will be on creating robust and scalable solutions , you’ll collaborate closely with  colleagues and cross-functional teams to create and deliver excellence, while continuously enhancing our team's capabilities.     We are continually advancing our multi-tenant platform on Microsoft Azure Cloud by employing a comprehensive tech stack that includes cutting-edge technologies, languages, and development tools such as :    Microservices and event-driven solution-architecture     C#, .Net 6, Node, TypeScript, React, GraphQL , and Apollo server   Kubernetes , Docker, Terraform, and software  pipelines   Datadog, SonarCloud , BlackDuck , Seeker, Azure DevOps, and Jira   High security and coding standards, with extensive coverage of testing      Your main responsibilities :   Design, develop, and deploy complete IoT software meeting all requirements including scalability, security, and test.   Provide overall technical leadership for solution design and implementation in close collaboration with the agile team and across teams to ensure the successful delivery of solutions.   Provide technical solution stewardship and hands-on development while guiding the team with best practices and fostering cross-disciplinary understanding and collaboration.   Lead the resolution of intricate technical challenges making aligned decisive choices to the technical direction.   Formulate and cocreate technical roadmap and technology solution design for up coming developments.   Implement and define development, testing, and optimization ambitions to enhance processes and efficiency while fostering a culture of continuous improvement.   Work collaboratively with stakeholders to design best-in-class solutions that meet objectives and ambitions.   Collaborate efficiently with teams and stakeholders to identify project goals and strategies that ensure successful outcomes .      Your background :  We imagine that you have:   You probably hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or software development or have equivalent skills .   You bring 5+ years of software development  experience , the expertise includes deep understanding and knowledge of  IoT development .   You have a strong background in IoT, cloud technologies, frontend and backend development, and programming languages as mentioned above.   You have a track record of tech leadership, probably been a coding solution architect, a team lead or the natural technical authority who sees end-to-end, can set direction, and mak e the right calls.   You have a proven ability to create overview , define, and steer the technical direction and  the solution , and can understand a complex business domain whilst designing for the big picture .     You provide t echnical solution leadership  together with your team , based on  knowledge of best practices, cross-discipline understanding and experience .   Strong problem-solving skills and strategic thinking with e xcellent communication and collaboration skills.   High proficiency in English– verbally and in writing      Our team is a collaborative force: Our cross-functional team operates within a professional framework, upholding high standards and following agile methodologies. We are a team of professionals with an unwavering ambition to make a significant impact, both for our customers and the world at large. Your contribution, backed by your experience and expertise , will be highly valued. Our work environment is open, safe, collaborative, and built on trust and a part of Grundfos' Digital community, collaborating and working alongside other digital teams.     Together, we are evolving and optimizing a platform that collects real-time data from intelligent sensors in our smart pumps and Systems . Our web applications uniquely empower industrial users to control, monitor, predict, and prevent issues while optimizing their systems.  Currently, we are on the verge of launching an innovative solution to a completely new customer group for Grundfos  that intelligently monitors and controls pump systems, provide s smart and valuable insights to the customer while  reduces unnecessary and costly inspections.     What’s in it for you?   Opportunity to work on ground-breaking IoT projects.   Competitive salary and benefits package.     Opportunities for career advancement within a global organization.    A dynamic, collaborative, and inclusive work environment.       Whether it’s developing leadership skills or advancing your expertise even further, we’ll support you with continuous learning and development opportunities, to help discuss and steer your long-term Grundfos career path. You’ll be welcomed from day one into an inclusive, trusting environment  guided by six core values .    In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:   If you’ll be working from your home office, we’ll make sure you are well equipped with a good workstation. However, you are always welcome to our offices where you can engage, learn, and have fun with colleagues  On top of it, flexible working hours and up to 3 days’ additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice  Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes  Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development  Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly     Do you want to learn more?  If you have questions or would like to know more about this position, please contact IND Head of Digital Development,  Karsten Sørensen at kasoerensen@grundfos.    If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume and cover letter by clicking “Apply”.    To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube , and t o get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people    We look forward to hearing from you.                About Grundfos  Grundfos is one of the world’s leading water technology companies with more than 19.000 employees in 60+ countries all over the world. Our skills commit us to pioneering solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do, as we believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.  An inclusive team If you like the look of this job and know you can bring your skills to contribute to our purpose, please apply. We need and welcome professional people from all corners – however you identify and whatever your background is. Title: Product Owner - Condition Monitoring enabling Devices (f/m/d)
Description:
See all positions              Product Owner - Condition Monitoring enabling Devices (f/m/d)   Permanent employee,
            Full-time
                                        · Denmark          At a glance  At Brüel & Kjær Vibro, we pride ourselves on protecting and monitoring the world's most important machines. From hydropower plants to wind turbines, from simple pumps and gearboxes to complex gas turbines, our customers rely on us to deliver machinery protection and condition monitoring systems that prevent unplanned machine downtime and increase plant profitability. We have successfully delivered tens of thousands of systems, complemented by our world-class services. For more than 80 years, we have pioneered intelligent monitoring solutions to keep our customer's rotating equipment operating at peak performance worldwide.    Your mission   Act as the primary owner and advocate for our embedded devices used for vibration-based condition monitoring. Understand customer requirements, market trends and technological advancements to drive the product vision and roadmap. Collaborate closely with the product management, development team, engineers, testers and stakeholders to define product requirements, prioritize features and ensure the successful execution of the product roadmap. Collaborate with external suppliers and development partners to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality components and modules. Establish and maintain strong relationships to leverage their expertise in hardware, software and other relevant areas. Work closely with the testing team to define comprehensive test plans, conduct system integration tests and ensure the highest level of product quality and reliability. Stay updated on market trends, competitive landscape and emerging technologies in the field of vibration-based condition monitoring. Conduct market research and gather customer feedback to identify new opportunities and improve existing product offerings.     Your profile   Bachelor's degree or higher in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related field. Proven experience as a Product Owner or similar role, preferably in the field of embedded devices in the industrial domain. Strong technical background with a deep understanding of embedded software and hardware components. Experience with modularization techniques and familiarity with Docker containers for efficient software development. In-depth knowledge of industrial communication protocols such as MODBUS or OPC-UA and a good understanding of IoT protocols e.g., MQTT. Demonstrated ability to manage external suppliers and development partners effectively. Excellent project management and organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to address technical challenges and make data-driven decisions.     Apply for this position    About us  Brüel & Kjær Vibro (B&K Vibro) is the world's leading independent 
 supplier of advanced electronic systems and software for protecting and 
 monitoring rotating machinery, for example turbines, compressors, pumps, 
 fans, blowers, generators and many more. Part of the NSK Group, we are forerunners and pioneers in providing 
 intelligent solutions to ensure uptime for our customers’ rotating machinery.      Apply for this position        Your application!  We appreciate your interest in ​Brüel & Kjaer Vibro. Please fill in the following short form. Should you have any difficulties in uploading your files, please contact us by mail at career@bkvibro.com. Data Processor:     Purpose:     Data Processor Privacy Policy:      Expiry:  a year    Name:  cf_clearance    Provider:  .insights.thehub.io            Your consent applies to the following domains:  insights.thehub.io, hubtest.io, thehub.io    Cookie declaration last updated on 08.11.2023     Please read our cookie and privacy policy   What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small datafile that is saved on your computer, tablet or mobile phone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful programs or viruses.  How/why the homepage uses cookies  Cookies are necessary for the homepage to function. Cookies help us get an overview of your visit to the homepage so that we can continually optimise and adjust the homepage to your requirements and interests. For example, cookies remember what you might have added to a shopping cart, if you have previously visited the page, if you are logged in and what languages and currency you want displayed on the homepage. We also use cookies to target our ads to you on other homepages. On a very general level, cookies are used as part of our services in order to show content that is as relevant as possible to you.  How long are cookies saved?  How long cookies are saved on your device can vary. The time when they are scheduled to expire is calculated from the last date you visited the homepage. When cookies expire, they are automatically deleted. You can view a complete list of cookies below.  This is how you can reject or delete your cookies  You can always reject cookies on your computer, tablet or phone by changing your browser settings. Where these settings can be found depends on the type of browser you are using. If you do change the settings, please be aware that there will be some functions and services that you cannot use because they rely on the homepage being able to remember the choices you have made. You can choose to not receive cookies from Google Analytics here .   Deleting cookies  You can delete cookies that you have previously accepted. If you are using a PC with a recent version of a browser, you can delete your cookies by using these shortcut keys: CTRL + SHIFT + Delete.  If the shortcut keys do not work and/or you are using an Apple computer, you must find out what browser you are using and then click on the relevant link:   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Windows 7   Remember: If you are using several different browsers, you must delete the cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  Should you have any questions or comments in connection with this information and/or our processing of personal data, you are welcome to get in touch with us. The cookie declaration itself is updated every month via Cookie Information . If you have any questions regarding the Cookie Information, you can send an email to info@cookieinformation.com.      Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Chief Technology Officer (CTO) & Co-Founder  Zack Health  Copenhagen  Cofounder   Salary Competitive  Equity To be negotiated    🤖 About Zack Health: Zack Health is a pioneering startup dedicated to transforming the landscape of healthcare through innovation and technology. With a focus on preventive care, we are addressing a critical gap in the European healthcare system. Our mission is to enable individuals to attain their healthiest and happiest life by enhancing their well-being and preventing chronic diseases - Diseases that accounts for 70% of all deaths in Europe and cost the healthcare system more than €800bn annually. Our solution is a revolutionary digital health twin that replicates an individual's health profile by integrating data from various sources including blood tests, DNA tests, wearables, lifestyle habits, and symptom tracking. Leveraging advanced AI and ML technologies, we create hyper-personalized, science-based health plans that not only improve health outcomes but also empower individuals to predict the impact of their health efforts effectively. 👥 The Team: The Zack Health team is currently quite small, actually, 'we' are just a one-man army, but hopeful to bring on board a CTO and CSO (Scientific) as Co-Founders very soon. That one-man army is me, Daniel, a BSc. in Industrial Engineering, who has founded a few startups, the latest being Welldium, a HealthTech startup. I also have about six years of experience in management consulting, most recently as a Strategy & M&A Consultant at EY-Parthenon. Additionally, I might be considered a biohacker, so I am quite familiar with the industry. 🚀 Zack Health Today: Over the past 2-3 months, we have devoted our efforts to the following: Ensured the Proof of Concept (PoC) by conducting extensive market research, interviewing market experts and potential customers, conducting customer survey, analyzing the competitive landscape, and sizing the market. Engaged with relevant suppliers and partners, such as laboratories for blood analysis. Developed the initial Go-To-Market (GTM) strategy, financial model, and business plan. Initiated the build of the website and opened up for waiting list sign-ups. Started early conversations with a dozen of VCs and investors for the upcoming seed investment round. Initiated the planning of the alpha and beta testing of the logistics setup, blood testing, and the digital twin platfrom. Now, as we stand ready to initiate the alpha & beta testing together with the development of our MVP/prototype, we are at a pivotal point in our journey. We are on the lookout for a talented and driven CTO who is enthusiastic about joining us as a Co-Founder. 🤜 Your Key Responsibilities: Lead and oversee the development of our AI/ML algorithms, data science & software engineering efforts, and both front-end (mobile app) and back-end systems. Spearhead the development and innovation of our digital health twin platform. Collaborate closely with the rest of the founding team to align technology strategy with business goals and user needs. Oversee the technical team, including hiring, managing, and mentoring engineers, data scientists and developers. Ensure our systems and data are scalable, secure, and compliant with health data privacy regulations. Foster a culture of continuous improvement, experimentation, and innovation within the technology team. 👩‍🎓 The Perfect Candidate's Qualifications: We are seeking a talented, motivated and ambitious CTO & Co-Founder, with the following qualifications: Background as a Data Scientist, Full-stack Developer, OR Front-end Developer, with sufficient cross-disciplinary knowledge to build the MVP/prototype - We will hire the needed tech skills after the MVP is build and we have our seed funding. 3+ years of experience as Data Scientist or Developer, preferably as a CTO or other leadership role in a startup A university degree such as BSc., MSc. or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Bioinformatics or a related field with top academic results. Proven track record of developing and scaling complex digital platforms and systems, preferably in or related to HealthTech Experience in or a deep interest in startups. Ready to put in hard work to attain shared goals, objectives, and success with Zack Health. Exceptional leadership, team management, and mentoring skills. Strong problem-solving, analytical, and strategic thinking abilities. Passionate about HealthTech, Health & Wellness, Biohacking, or like. 🏅 What We Can Offer You: An opportunity to co-found a company with a noble mission and enormous market potential. Significant equity package, and competitive salary once we get our seed funding, unless we agree on something different. Dynamic, innovative, and supportive work environment. A challenging and super fun journey of building and shaping a startup with global ambitions.  For more information or questions please contact us at  dak@zackhealth.com   Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Near public transit  Easy access and treehugger friendly workplace.  Paid holiday  Metropolitists, beach boys and mountaineers we salute you and pay you to go and explore the world.  Maternity / paternity leave  Kids are the future, go spend time with them.  Remote work allowed  You know how you perform best. Work from your couch, your favorite cafe or abroad when you feel like it.  Equity package  Want to be a partner? Look no further.  Social gatherings  Social gatherings and games; hang out with your colleagues.  See all 16 benefits  Working at Zack Health  See company profile  In a nutshell, Zack Health is a health digital twin that aggregates consumer health data to help track, improve, and predict health outcomes. We are addressing a significant problem in the current healthcare system - See below👇

70% of all deaths in Europe are caused by chronic diseases, costing the healthcare system more than €800 bn every year.

The most effective approach to address chronic diseases is prevention, but only 3% of the European healthcare budget is allocated to preventive care.

This leaves the individual responsible for their own health, which more than 50% also make an effort to do so.

However, the problem is that many of these individuals:
1. Don't find any holistic and convenient solution to quantify their health
2. Feel they are given very generic health advices with less impact
3. Have no clue whether their efforts actually have a measurable impact on their health

We believe that one of the solutions to this problem is a health digital twin that replicates the consumer’s health by aggregating data from blood tests, DNA tests, wearables, lifestyle habits, preferences, and symptom tracking. This data is then analyzed using AI and ML to create hyper-personalized and science-based health plans that help improve and predict health outcomes and prevent diseases. Do you want to be part of a bigger cause and help people living with diabetes across the world and be a part of our amazing journey?  We’re now looking for someone special to join our IT department in IPF Bagsværd, maybe this is the right place for you! We are looking for an IT Project Manager to partner with our team in IPF Bagsværd, who are the liaison and key point between the IT organisation, Digital, Data & IT, and the production unit. What we're looking for is someone to be responsible for IT projects with the focus of new, scalable, and sustainable technologies for the production unit. Our aim is to be at forefront of technology within pharmaceutical manufacturing technology, and to drive automatization and digitalisation of the Novo Nordisk manufacturing value chain. For this we need the brightest and most innovative minds! As an IT Project Manager, you will navigate in a big stakeholder landscape. On top of that you will oversee the project team's leadership, direction, guidance, and coaching. Your role will include navigating between traditional waterfall project methods and the Scaled Agile Framework. We value diversity in our team, this means that many of our partners bring a competency spike from other functions or experiences, so we really want to know what yours is, but also how that can build the team further.  To give you a better idea, here are some tasks you will perform as an IT Project Manager: Driving projects through initiation, analysis, execution, and implementation into our operations Develop project plans and manage project budget and cost Ensure strategic alignment with stakeholders Establish and maintain the project portfolio And last but not least, and most important is that you have a passion for the field, you are willing to expand your knowledge, and that you enjoy the responsibilities that come along with such a role You will thrive in this role if you: You have completed a Master's degree in Business, Engineering, or Computer Science preferred with hands-on experience in a similar role You have competencies from 1-5 years You have strong analytical, technical, and business skills Flair to developing relationships and working with multiple stakeholders on high-profile, cross-functional, and multinational initiatives You have experience with IT projects, preferably within pharma or another regulated industry You are proactive, solution-oriented, like to share your knowledge and collaborate effectively You have proficient oral and written communications skills in English Why join Novo Nordisk? Novo Nordisk is a global healthcare company headquartered in Denmark. For almost 100 years, we have been driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic diseases. As a result, our treatments today benefit millions of people living with diabetes, obesity, and rare blood and endocrine diseases. We are proud of that. Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few lines about your motivation in your resume or CV.  Contact For further information, please contact Emilie Hilsted on phone +45 30777728 or email QEHY@novonordisk.com.  Deadline 15th December 2023 We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.  At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing. Data Engineer

Do you want to be part of saving millions of peoples live by bringing your passion into play? Then please apply and become the newest member of our growing Digital, Data & IT (DD & IT) Development organization.  What you will be doing DD&IT Development in Novo Nordisk is an integral part of supporting the development of products that improve the lives of patients all over the world. You will be close to the heart of Novo Nordisk’s clinical operations where you will play a key role in shaping the future of clinical trials and patient care, by building scalable solutions in the cloud. Your key responsibilities include the following: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop and maintain data pipelines and analytics solutions Design and build a foundational platform for a modern data lake architecture, optimizing it for scalability, flexibility, and performance Develop automated test to ensure data accuracy and quality You will assist with planning and maintaining the Azure architectural runway and pipeline for multiple products, ensuring their stability and efficient operation Continuously secure improvement that can make developers on the platform work even more efficiently and act as a sparring partner on use of Azure services for the organisation Leverage your expertise in cloud development to design and implement innovative digital solutions focused on delivering business insights and patient care in real time Overall, our goal is to improve the clinical experience for patients, doctors and nurses world-wide, and your role will support this journey What we are looking for We are seeking a candidate with an educational background in Computer Science and Software Development , as well as experience in some of the following areas: Strong proficiency in Python programming Extensive experience with Azure, including Azure Data Factory and Azure Databricks, and a deep understanding of Azure architecture and services Experience in using Spark, including Spark SQL and understanding of how to optimize Spark performance Automated unit testing and code quality inspection CI/CD Pipelines using Azure DevOps (or similar) Working in pharma domain or other regulated area is considered an advantage In Novo Nordisk people are not just hard skills, and as we value teamwork and personal contributions to maintain a good work environment, we are further looking for a colleague who is open to feedback to grow new soft skills, works independently and attends to deadlines. As our corporate language is English, we expect you to be fluent both in writing and spoken. The team waiting for you As Senior Data Engineer at Novo Nordisk, you will be part of DD&IT Development IT, which is located in Søborg, Denmark, and counting around 120 colleagues in Denmark and 50 in India. We are responsible for the development, implementation, and operation of DD&IT Development’s digital solutions. You will join an agile, inspiring, and ambitious work environment where advanced use of IT and teamwork are key. Join a collaborative team of talented people dedicated to driving progress and innovation in patient care. With a focus on collaboration and a culture of learning, this team will challenge you to push boundaries, think critically, and bring your unique perspective to the table. Surrounded by talented peers and a supportive work environment, you'll have the opportunity to grow and make a meaningful impact, both on the projects you work on and the patients we serve. We offer a modern work environment with flexible working conditions (remote/on-site), free flow of coffee and tea, fruit, canteens serving world cuisine, take-out dinner options, access to internal fitness centres at our sites, bike repair at work, electric car charge stations, health insurance, social clubs, team outings and so much more!  Working at Novo Nordisk Founded in Denmark in 1923, Novo Nordisk has become one of the world’s leading healthcare companies. At Novo Nordisk, we are committed to driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic diseases. To fulfil this purpose, we pioneer scientific breakthroughs, expand access to our medicines, and work to prevent and ultimately cure disease. That said, we are anything but linear. With us, your skills, commitment, and ambition help us change patients’ lives worldwide. In exchange, we offer you a rewarding and purpose-driven culture with talented and diverse co-workers. Therefore, your professional and personal development is essential for us, and in Novo Nordisk, the sky is the limit for career opportunities.  Contact For further information, please contact our Department Director EMMA Eng at EMRI@novonordisk.com, or Senior Developer Jonas Knudsen at EJKN@novonordisk.com  Deadline 7 January 2024 Note that relevant candidates may be invited for interviews on an ongoing basis before the deadline. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.  Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they’re 100% “qualified”. If this is part of the reason you hesitate to apply, we like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think. We look forward to receiving your application We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.  We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.  At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing. Do you want to be part of a team where your opinion is valued, and you have real influence? Do you want to join a highly motivated team and rapidly growing software scale-up?  If your answer to the above questions is a clear “YES”, then read on.  Briefly about us: Princh is a strong player in the sharing economy space with an innovative, cloud-based solution for printing, copying, scanning and electronic payment. We’re the leading solution in Northern Europe and fastest growing in North America – and we’re just getting started! We are an international team funded by professional investors fighting to reach our vision: Become the standard for printing and payment in the public space!  What you’ll be doing: You improve and extend the full software stack, including our microservice-based backend and our web, desktop, and mobile applications in collaboration with the rest of the development team.  Cool things you’ll be working with:   Kubernetes, AWS, MongoDB, RabbitMQ  Java, TypeScript, Kotlin, Python, Rust  Event driven micro services  Contributions to our wall of memes  The right tool for the right job   A typical day involves building and deploying great code, planning, or executing the next sprint, getting and giving feedback while collaborating with fun and competent people. At the end of the day, you have made a real difference for our team, our product, and our customers.  What we ask of you: You’re curious and confident by nature – yet humble. You build clean code that works. You have a positive and strong mind and fight hard to achieve your goals. You enjoy learning and using new technologies while also taking pride in helping others grow. You are a collaborator showing trust and respect for people with different opinions and skills but know when to assert your views and ideas.  You have a strong theoretical base and a practical mindset.  We expect you to have a degree in computer science, software engineering or a related field.  What we offer you: We offer you a unique chance to learn firsthand what it’s like to develop and grow a software company. Expect to join an informal and pleasant working environment with great conditions for growing as a person and a professional. You will be challenged and supported in continuously enhancing your skills and toolbox.  Process: We’re looking for just the right person with the right skillset and personality and will be reviewing applications and conducting interviews continuously. Data Processor:     Purpose:     Data Processor Privacy Policy:      Expiry:  a year    Name:  cf_clearance    Provider:  .insights.thehub.io            Your consent applies to the following domains:  insights.thehub.io, hubtest.io, thehub.io    Cookie declaration last updated on 08.11.2023     Please read our cookie and privacy policy   What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small datafile that is saved on your computer, tablet or mobile phone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful programs or viruses.  How/why the homepage uses cookies  Cookies are necessary for the homepage to function. Cookies help us get an overview of your visit to the homepage so that we can continually optimise and adjust the homepage to your requirements and interests. For example, cookies remember what you might have added to a shopping cart, if you have previously visited the page, if you are logged in and what languages and currency you want displayed on the homepage. We also use cookies to target our ads to you on other homepages. On a very general level, cookies are used as part of our services in order to show content that is as relevant as possible to you.  How long are cookies saved?  How long cookies are saved on your device can vary. The time when they are scheduled to expire is calculated from the last date you visited the homepage. When cookies expire, they are automatically deleted. You can view a complete list of cookies below.  This is how you can reject or delete your cookies  You can always reject cookies on your computer, tablet or phone by changing your browser settings. Where these settings can be found depends on the type of browser you are using. If you do change the settings, please be aware that there will be some functions and services that you cannot use because they rely on the homepage being able to remember the choices you have made. You can choose to not receive cookies from Google Analytics here .   Deleting cookies  You can delete cookies that you have previously accepted. If you are using a PC with a recent version of a browser, you can delete your cookies by using these shortcut keys: CTRL + SHIFT + Delete.  If the shortcut keys do not work and/or you are using an Apple computer, you must find out what browser you are using and then click on the relevant link:   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Windows 7   Remember: If you are using several different browsers, you must delete the cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  Should you have any questions or comments in connection with this information and/or our processing of personal data, you are welcome to get in touch with us. The cookie declaration itself is updated every month via Cookie Information . If you have any questions regarding the Cookie Information, you can send an email to info@cookieinformation.com.      Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Frontend Developer - Vilnius 🇱🇹💻  Relesys  Remote  Full-time   Salary Competitive     Do you know how to crack the code to a sublime user experience, and would you like to develop amazing solutions and set your mark on our scaling company growth? Then read along! 🚀  We are on the lookout for an ambitious and talented Frontend Developer to join our Development team on an exciting growth journey. You will have a vital role in assuring the highest quality of our product and strengthen our UX on all our user platforms. You will work closely with other Front- and Backend Developers to build the market's best mobile app platform targeting employee engagement across industries. You will have the possibility to form part of a brand new office environment in Vilnius! 🇱🇹 You will be joining a thriving business, which is going strong with a product that is crucial for our clients to keep reaching, engaging and uniting their employees through whatever challenges goes on in the World, like the current Energy Crisis. You will therefore be joining a stable and strong organisation that is only going forward 🚀  Your key responsibilities:  Develop best in class UI/UX targeting the mobile user  Design solutions and implement best practices in close collaboration with the product and development team members  Collaborate with an amazing team of developers, software testers, and other team members  Being ambitious, leading, and driving the implementation of new functionality and improvements to the Relesys platform  Design and implement new features together with our Domain Experts and Product Designers  Maintain and troubleshoot complex problems in the existing codebase   Who are you?  Disciplined, structured, and open-minded, even when it's burning  You have a natural desire to lead and guide your team and ensure a strong team spirit in your daily work  You believe that performance is not a matter of fast deliveries but high-quality deliveries and a strong team spirit  You thrive working under a high level of autonomy taking responsibility of own tasks  You are located in or near Vilnius, as this position is hybrid with 3 days in-office with colleagues  You have excellent communication skills in verbal and written English    We also appreciate that you have the following skill set:   You have 3+ years of professional experience within software development  You have solid experience with frontend development – and experience with modern JavaScript libraries and frameworks, e.g., Angular, React TypeScript  You have experience working in Visual Studio, GIT, Atlassian/Jira, Figma, and similar tools  You have a strong intuition about good UI and UX design and a good eye for the details of what makes up an excellent frontend solution  You are a team player and wishes to engage in the office and its success  You have a bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or similar   What do we offer?  Grow together with an already international publicly listed company.  Great level of responsibility from day one in a dynamic and international working environment.  You will spend time with positive, collaborative, and supportive colleagues.  We offer you exciting challenges and opportunities to steer your career path in your desired direction.  Be part of a hyper growth organization.  Competitive salary based on your skills.  Free coffee, tea, soda or similar ☕️🧃  Strong ties to HQ in Copenhagen and possible trips to Denmark.  Brand-new office space in Vilnius with all necessary for productive work.   The hiring process:  1. A Teams call with the Talent recruiter  2. First meet and interview with the VP of Product  3. Meet some team members in the Vilnius office  4. Meet our Founder  5. The Challenge  Follow-up conversation about our match – If successful, we are excited to welcome you to the team! 🎉🤝   How and when do you start?  Apply for the position by sending your CV through the Apply button. If you are in the mood, we would love to hear about your motivation!  We are always looking for great Talents, and are not in a rush, so the starting date is flexible depending on when we find our right match 🌟   We can't wait to hear from you and meet our future colleague! 🤩🙌  Who are we? Relesys isn't just another SaaS company; we're a dynamic force revolutionizing communication and performance management platforms. Established in 2014, we set out on a mission to bridge the gap between HQ and non-desk workers, fostering a thriving workforce. What value do we bring? People are the heartbeat of our client's business. When employees are thriving and successful, businesses flourish and retention rates increase. Relesys enables our clients to achieve this through an all-in-one app that streamlines communications, training, and daily operations into their own customized and ever-evolving app. Relesys serves clients in 14 different countries, supporting them in 29 languages with 322,000 licenses across 17,000 stores and users in 91 countries. We have a strong presence in the Nordics and EMEA, and we continue to increasingly attract clients from across the globe, as we are breaking into new, dynamic markets. Our prestigious clients include Salling Group, Specsavers, Telia, Matas, Normal, Mercedes-Benz, Blokker, and many more. Join us on this thrilling journey as we grow and venture into new horizons. At Relesys, we're shaping the future for frontline workers across various industries: Retail, Hospitality, Production/Manufacturing, and Transportation.  Our Culture Building a world-class organization and culture is our highest priority. We believe in the talent of our people and in long-term collaborations where we value an informal yet highly professional culture. We always go 'the extra mile' for our colleagues and clients, but rule number one - Have fun! This rule is always at the forefront of our minds when we come to work, creating an environment that is filled with passion, energy, and inspiration. We are eager to see what exciting contributions you, as our new colleague, will bring, as we believe that each and every individual has a tremendous influence on the whole 🌍    Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Free lunch  Enjoy a free catered lunch with your colleagues, every day.  Free coffee / tea  Get your caffeine fix to get you started and keep you going.  Near public transit  Easy access and treehugger friendly workplace.  Social gatherings  Social gatherings and games; hang out with your colleagues.  Pension plan  We take care of you, even when you are old and wrinkly.  Free friday beers  Friday is something special, let's enjoy a beer together.  See all 7 benefits  Working at Relesys  See company profile  Relesys is a software company supporting organizations globally in reaching, engaging, and uniting their workforce by delivering a customized Communication & Performance Platform. Relesys was founded in 2014 with the ambition to innovate the retail industry and make it possible for every non-desk worker to have easy access to information and business insight. And since then, we haven’t looked back.
 
The Relesys mantra is ”Growing people – Growing business”. We believe that people are the most important asset in every business. If the people in an organization are not happy and engaged, your business will not succeed. Relesys gather and implements solutions for internal communication, performance management, gamification, and training into one single platform. The Relesys Platform is customized to every individual business. Through this platform businesses engage their employees, increase their performance, and boost their organizations which results in better service and increased productivity.

With customers such as Salling Group, Specsavers, Telia, Matas, Normal, Mercedes, and Blokker - just to mention a few - Relesys supports more than 17.000 stores in 84 countries and 22 different languages. We presently employ over 60 employees. And are you looking for a position where you can set your mark on your company's growth while accelerating your own career? 🚀  We are on the lookout for an ambitious .NET Developer to join our Product Engineering Team in Vilnius on our exciting growth journey. You will have a vital role in assuring the highest quality of our product: The market's best mobile app for employee engagement to empower and connect the frontline workers and HQ. You will be part of a new and growing Product Engineering team in Vilnius which has strong ties to the Danish team in Copenhagen. This is a unique opportunity to make your mark on your workplace and accelerate your career growth, as you will be joining a thriving business that is going strong with a product that is crucial for our clients to keep reaching, engaging, and uniting their employees through whatever challenges goes on in the world, like the current Energy Crisis. You will therefore be joining a stable and strong organization that is only going forward 🚀  Your responsibilities:  Development and support of responsive web applications and web portals for content administration  Development and support of Web APIs and services, as well as different integrations with external services  Architecture design and implementation  Being ambitious, leading, and driving the implementation of new functionality and improvements to the Relesys platform  Collaborate with an amazing team of developers, software testers, and other team members   Who are you?:  Disciplined, structured, and open-minded, even when it's burning  You have a natural desire to lead and guide your team and ensure a strong team spirit in your daily work  You believe that performance is not a matter of fast deliveries but high-quality deliveries and a strong team spirit  You thrive working under a high level of autonomy taking responsibility of own tasks  You are located in or near Vilnius, as this position is hybrid with 3 days in-office with colleagues  You have excellent communication skills in verbal and written English    You have the following skill set:  You have 3+ years of experience as a .Net Developer  College or University degree in Computer Science or a related discipline  Have a perfect knowledge of C#, .NET Framework, and .NET Core  Understand web application design principles, micro-service architecture principles, and event-driven architecture principles  Have experience with ASP.NET (Core, Web API, and MVC)  Know SQL and how to use it  Work in Visual Studio and use Git  It is considered a plus if you have experience with JavaScript - either AngularJS or ReactJS  It is an advantage if you have skills in Azure services, unit and integration testing, bootstrap, and responsive layout   What do we offer?:  Grow together with an already international publicly listed company  Great level of responsibility from day one in a dynamic and international working environment  You will spend time with positive, collaborative, and supportive colleagues  Exciting challenges and opportunities career growth opportunities  Be part of a hyper-growth organization  Competitive salary based on your skills  Free coffee, tea, soda, or similar at the office ☕️🧃  Strong ties to the team in Denmark and possible business trips to meet with the DK team  Global Summer Party in Copenhagen with the whole organization  Brand-new office space in Vilnius with all necessary for productive work   The hiring process:  1. A Teams call with the Talent recruiter  2. First meet and interview with the VP of Product  3. Meet some team members in the Vilnius office  4. Meet our Founder  5. Relesys isn't just another SaaS company; we're a dynamic force revolutionizing communication and performance management platforms. Relesys enables our clients to achieve this through an all-in-one app that streamlines communications, training, and daily operations into their own customized and ever-evolving app. Relesys serves clients in 14 different countries, supporting them in 29 languages with 322,000 licenses across 17,000 stores and users in 91 countries. We always go 'the extra mile' for our colleagues and clients, but rule number one - Have fun! This rule is always at the forefront of our minds when we come to work, creating an environment that is filled with passion, energy, and inspiration. We are eager to see what exciting contributions you, as our new colleague, will bring, as we believe that each and every individual has a tremendous influence on the whole 🌍    Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Free lunch  Enjoy a free catered lunch with your colleagues, every day.  Free coffee / tea  Get your caffeine fix to get you started and keep you going.  Near public transit  Easy access and treehugger friendly workplace.  Social gatherings  Social gatherings and games; hang out with your colleagues.  Pension plan  We take care of you, even when you are old and wrinkly.  Free friday beers  Friday is something special, let's enjoy a beer together.  See all 7 benefits  Working at Relesys  See company profile  Relesys is a software company supporting organizations globally in reaching, engaging, and uniting their workforce by delivering a customized Communication & Performance Platform. Relesys was founded in 2014 with the ambition to innovate the retail industry and make it possible for every non-desk worker to have easy access to information and business insight. And since then, we haven’t looked back.
 
The Relesys mantra is ”Growing people – Growing business”. We believe that people are the most important asset in every business. If the people in an organization are not happy and engaged, your business will not succeed. Relesys gather and implements solutions for internal communication, performance management, gamification, and training into one single platform. The Relesys Platform is customized to every individual business. Through this platform businesses engage their employees, increase their performance, and boost their organizations which results in better service and increased productivity.

With customers such as Salling Group, Specsavers, Telia, Matas, Normal, Mercedes, and Blokker - just to mention a few - Relesys supports more than 17.000 stores in 84 countries and 22 different languages. We presently employ over 60 employees.
