Stresstest Mål dit stressniveau      Talenttest Find dine arbejdstalenter        Guides       Ansøgninger Sådan skriver du en god ansøgning    CV Få de bedste tips til dit CV      Jobsamtale Gør et godt indtryk til samtalen    Lønforhandling Stå stærkt til lønforhandlingen      Opsigelse Brug denne guide og kom godt videre    Uopfordret ansøgning Sådan søger du uopfordret      Dit første job Værktøjer og tips til dit nye arbejdsliv    Jobglæde Sæt jobglæde på agendaen        Kurser       6 ugers jobrettet uddannelse Opgrader dine kompetencer      Jobsøgningskursus Skab struktur i din jobsøgning              For arbejdsgivere    Tilmeld dig Jobindex    Switch to English        Log ind  Opret profil                    Søg job       Gemte job       Jobagent       Mere     Overblik   Ansøgninger   Henvendelser   CV   QuickApply-profil   Virksomheder   Råd og vejledning   Indstillinger          Save  Share  Apply        Novo Nordisk A/S    2880 Bagsværd     Share    Save     Senior Zscaler Operations Engineer    Category: Digital & IT  Are you an experienced and agile Zscaler Operations Engineer? Would you like to join our newly established international team responsible for monitoring, maintaining, and optimizing Novo Nordisk’s global Zscaler infrastructure? Do you want to be a part of saving millions of people’s lives? Does it sound like your next adventure? Then, don’t stop reading because you might be our new Senior Zscaler Operations Engineer we are looking for to join our Digital, Data & IT (DD&IT) team in Denmark. Apply now!  About the role As our Zscaler Operations Engineer, you will play a critical role in ensuring the implementation, stability, performance, and security of Novo Nordisk’s Zscaler infrastructure and features. In addition, you will help to build and mature Zscaler Operations along with creating, contributing, and maintaining accurate documentation of network configurations, processes, and procedures so staying up to date with new Zscaler functionality and industry trends also will be crucial. Your primary responsibilities include: Monitor and analyze Zscaler performance (ZIA, ZPA, ZDX), identifying and resolving issues proactively to minimize downtime and ensure optimal network functionality and end User experience along with implement and manage new features, infrastructure and change requests Respond to escalated alerts, incidents, and requests in a timely manner, following established procedures and protocols Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical Zscaler stakeholders as well as collaborate with other IT teams, including Network Architects and engineers, Systems Engineers, and Security Analysts, to troubleshoot and resolve Zscaler network-related problems Manage time effectively and execute Zscaler tasks based on organizational needs Work closely with the Zscaler Technical Account Coordination  (TAC) team to troubleshoot and resolve issues Implement new capabilities and collaborate with external Operations Team to ensure the smooth operation of Zscaler Help build and mature Zscaler Operations along with creating, contributing, and maintaining accurate documentation of network configurations, processes, and procedures Participate in Agile planning and Zscaler network and function design discussions to ensure scalability and reliability of the Zscaler infrastructure  Qualifications The ideal candidate for this position should meet most of the following requirements: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or equivalent experience At least 3 years of experience in similar OPS roles, with a focus on Zscaler systems along with in-depth understanding of Zscaler Internet Access, Zscaler Private access, and ZDX Strong understanding of Network technologies: Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol (TCP/IP), routing, switching, cybersecurity, security protocols and best practices, including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and VPN technologies Solid Linux knowledge and familiarity with Service Now and Azure DevOps systems Great communication (verbal and written), and collaboration skills in English Hands-on experience with network monitoring tools and protocols (e.g., SolarWinds, SNMP, NetFlow, Wireshark) Background in scripting, automation (e.g., Python, Terraform CLI), and knowledge in Software Defined Access (SDA) and Cisco Digital Network Architecture (DNA) would be advantageous. Relevant certifications (e.g.Zscaler, CCNA, CCNP, ITIL) preferred but not mandatory  On a personal level you have excellent problem solving, time management and analytical thinking skills and attention to details. In addition, you are familiar with how to work under pressure and prioritize tasks effectively by using your open and agile mindset.  The team waiting for you The Zscaler Operations team is a recently formed group within the DD&IT Corporate Cloud Infrastructure organization. The team members are located globally, including Philippines, India, and Denmark, and consists of Novo Nordisk colleagues as well as an external operations partner. We take pleasure in collaborating to deliver outstanding user support, always mindful that incorporating fun into our work is a crucial aspect of our professional lives.  Working at Novo Nordisk Novo Nordisk is a global healthcare company headquartered in Denmark. For 100 years, we have been driving change to defeat diabetes and other serious chronic diseases. As a result, our treatments today benefit millions of people living with diabetes, obesity, and rare blood and endocrine diseases. We are proud of that. We are proud of our people too, and we employ more than 57,000 bright and diverse minds in 80 offices worldwide. With us, your bright mind and commitment help us change lives for people worldwide. In exchange, we offer you a seat in a rewarding and purpose-driven culture where your professional and personal development is highly valued. That said, opportunities are many in Novo Nordisk.  Contact If you want to know more, please contact Tomas Laucys, Product Owner at TLAY@novonordisk.com  Deadline 30 November 2023 Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis, so we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV. We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.  At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing. Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                                   Embedded Software Developer              Embedded Software Developer for improving and optimizing the wind industry  Tech stack  GitHub , GitHub Actions, Docker, Zephyr (mainline), Yocto (Langdale), GCC/Clang, C, C++20/23, Rust, Python, Raspberry Pi for automated testing, Jira Cloud, Confluence.    The IoT Sensors & Devices department  As our new Embedded Software Developer, you will be part of our Embedded Software team within the IoT Sensors & Devices department and work closely together with our Electronics, Optics, and Sensor Technology specialists. You strive together to deliver innovative sensing solutions to improve the efficiency of wind turbines all over the world. This team has an inspiring atmosphere with great opportunities to develop your personal and technical skills.  You will be part of our international multi-sited research and development department with more than 75 colleagues who are engineers and technicians. You will be situated in an environment with other developers where you have plenty of opportunity to share knowledge with your 30 colleagues in Electronics and Embedded Software and bring your ideas and solutions into new and existing products.    A job that supports the foundation for all our sensing products and solutions  At Polytech, we work to create a world powered primarily by renewable energy. Your mission as an Embedded Software Developer will be to provide the firmware that is the foundation for all our sensing products and solutions. By developing systems that feed real-time data to the wind turbine controllers, your contributions will directly help make wind energy more efficient and affordable.  Furthermore, you will be responsible for   designing technical solutions and concepts addressing our customers' challenges  work with different microcontrollers and SoCs, e.g., i.MX and Nordic nRF families  regularly evaluating new embedded technologies or communication standards  continuously improving our codebase and testing infrastructure  improving the security of the platforms     What do you need to succeed?  You are a structured person with a focus on clean, efficient, and maintainable solutions. A broad-based, inquisitive team in a global context matches your best work environment. Then work with us passionate on delivering Wind for life. Moreover, you should   be familiar with C/C++, Python, and shell scripting  be comfortable with working in an UNIX environment  have experience with Linux and Embedded RTOS development  speak English fluently, since you’ll be part of a global organization.   Furthermore, it will be an advantage if you have   experience in working with Yocto and Zephyr  worked with industrial field busses like CANopen, PROFINET and EtherCAT  previously worked in the wind industry  experience with sensors     Apply and become part of the Polytech family  Please send us your CV by using the apply button. CVs are reviewed continuously.  For further information about the job opening and Polytech, you are more than  welcome to reach out to Senior Manager, Embedded Software, Jeppe Frandsen, jfr@polytech.com or +45 41998514.            Application due   Workplace Herning   Homepage  https://www.polytech.com    Questions regarding the position         E-mail             E-mail             E-mail             E-mail            Follow us          Want to contribute to changing the world?  At Polytech, we are on a mission to make wind power the preferred source of energy. Not only is it an important job — there is also a lot of work to be done. So, if you are driven, curious, and inventive, chances are we could use you on our team.  As a trusted partner to the world’s leading wind turbine manufacturers, we cover everything from research and development to prototyping, testing, production, logistics, installation, service, and support. In other words, at Polytech you get to be involved in every step of the journey. From vision to finished product.  We drive our operations globally considering what is good for business, must also be good for the environment. Sustainability is at the core of our interactions with customers, suppliers, and employees.  Founded in Bramming in 1994, we are now a global company with locations in Denmark, Germany, China, and Mexico.  At Polytech, all colleagues have the freedom to use their creativity and put forward suggestions. As such, they can make their mark on our solutions and, ultimately, on the world we live in.  Polytech – Wind for life™                                    ShareThis Copy and Paste

Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                        Senior Software Developer      Do you want to be a part of developing software for Weibel’s advanced Doppler radars?  In Weibel we develop complex radar systems to customers over most of the world. We are constantly improving and optimizing our front-end software along with our core backend systems. We are looking for a new colleague to join our software development team in order to strengthen and preserve our ability to stay on top in a challenging and advanced part of modern software industry.  Our challenge is to build a new intuitive GUI based UI with a UX that will help radar operators to utilize all the new and advanced features we are adding to our radar systems. On one hand, the operator must have access to the sophisticated and advanced functionality found in our modern radars. On the other hand, the system must limit the amount of information to only the most important information required to maintain the full overview in e.g., satellite launches or when monitoring large areas at land and sea.    Develop and implement software to control advanced radar systems  You will be part of a team that develop and maintain code for handling UI, communication, calculations, data storage and much more. Your tasks will primarily be to:   Design and implement new functionality  Optimize and develop our existing solutions  Architectural and interface definitions in teams of 2-6 developers  Develop unit- and integration test of your code  System test in simulated environments and on full radar systems  Our technical environment consists of Visual Studio C++/C#, .NET6, Git and Azure DevOps.     Solid experience across Windows applications  You will be part of a team with extensive self-governance meaning it is the team that design and implement the solutions and at the same time are responsible for quality and deadlines. We have a user centric mind-set that enables us to keep track of details while ensuring that the end-user is provided with an intuitive and easily accessible solution.  Your professional CV comprises:   Expert programming skills in C#  Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF)  Experience with development of Windows applications  Experience with Azure DevOps  Knowledge of parallel programming  Good communication skills in English both written and spoken   We expect you to have a technical background in software development for engineering, but we do not expect you to have radar knowledge. The most important thing is that you are motivated for a steep learning curve, we have a tailored introduction ready for you.  It is a requirement for this position that you can obtain a security clearance.    Your new team  Our team consists of 11 highly competent and dedicated colleagues, and we work closely together with the rest of Weibel’s software teams with approximately 50 developers across the different teams. We are a part of Weibel’s Technology department where you will join more than 140 engineering colleagues and together design and develop the best solutions for our customers. We have all of our development in-house and our competencies spans across many technical fields such as system engineering, mechanical, electrical, hardware, software and technical design.    Contact and application  Apply through our website using the ”Apply” button. If you have any questions, please reach out to Application Software manager, Jakob Seedorff on +45 31 25 31 96.  The deadline is December 17th, 2023.  We are looking forward to hearing from you.      About Weibel Scientific Weibel Scientific A/S is an independent privately held Danish engineering company and the leading global producer and exporter of Doppler radars for use in space research, the aerospace industry, defense, and missile defense and critical infrastructure protection. Since its formation in 1977, Weibel has delivered more than 5,000 radars to more than 40 countries. To maintain the greatest possible control and quality trough all stages of production, all work from development to manufacturing is done at Weibel’s headquarters in Allerød, Denmark, where Weibel employs approximately 345 people. Read more at www.weibelradars.com           Job type Engineer, application software      Application due  12/17/2023      Contact person      Jakob Seedorff     E-mail                   E-mail                   E-mail                   E-mail    E-mail             Homepage  https://weibelradars.com/      Workplace  Allerød        Follow us                 Om stillingen    Jobbtype Vikariat  Heltid/Deltid Heltid  Arbeidstid Dag

Title: Robotics Software Engineer – R&D
Description: Sorry, Internet Explorer 11 is no longer supported by SmartRecruiters    Please update to one of the following browsers:   Google Chrome  Microsoft Edge  Apple Safari  Mozilla Firefox     You can find details about supported web browsers here .       Robotics Automation Engineer - R&D Full-time Job Description Do you want to play a crucial role in developing near real time software solutions within robotics and automation technology on an application level? And are you interested in Artificial Intelligence and Vision?  As our new Robotics Automation Engineer, you will become part of a cross functional R&D team consisting of highly skilled people within vison, mechanical, electrical engineering, data analytics and software developers. We strive for a high competence level. The position is in Aarhus and you will have stakeholders within the organization, both locally and internationally Take part in a fascinating journey You will play a pivotal role in our journey by ensuring a high level of technology readiness and knowledge of robot and automation technology. You will be working on developing real time software and bringing already existing technology to a higher utilization level as well as creating new products and solutions. Moreover, your tasks will include: Be part of the R&D team, participate in project development as a software specialist. Participate in the entire journey; from product ideation through exploration, validation, and development to the first test installation at a customer. Develop near real time software using applied robot and automation systems with the marketplace of logistic systems and airports in mind. Often on an industrial pc level, Linux or windows based. Robot types like 6 axis Fanuc, Schneider, Kuka etc. Facilitate configuration and programming of applied robots and motion control. Participate in validation of relevant technologies Manage and organize large data sets and perform analysis and optimization Your background: We are looking for someone who is passionate about AI, vision and real time software and who is eager to put it into play in a robotics and automation technology context. We imagine that you might have: An education within computer science, engineering, physics or a related field Experience with robotics and automation technology – maybe from a similar or related industry Experience with near real time software and solid knowledge of C#. Knowledge of Python could be an advantage Interest in robot software and technologies in combination with vision applications You as a person In general, you are driven by technology, curiosity and willingness to learn new things, always with a proactive attitude and a high sense of quality. You work independently and take pride in keeping one step ahead of things and pay attention to the details. You communicate effectively and find it easy to work with others You are a robust and persevering person – and good at maintaining focus on long-term goals You are service-minded and have a corporate understanding. Would you like to play a committed part in our successful family business? Then please follow the link. If you have any questions about the job, please feel free to call Head of R&D Henrik Skyum at +45 20 15 13 80. We look forward to welcoming you!  Conveying, loading, palletizing, packing, sortation and distribution – BEUMER Group is a leader within the development and manufacture of high-technological intralogistics systems for global markets. Our employees stand out from others thanks to their ability to supply innovative solutions to our customers. They can do this because they know the industry and are passionate about continuously developing and expanding their knowledge. We support these high standards through teamwork, mutual respect and a working culture based on trust that fosters stability and security for all of our employees. Our common goal is to implement outstanding and innovative projects worldwide. Title: Competent C++ Backend Developer
Description: Job description  Working at FOSS  Meet our employees  About FOSS    Apply                Competent C++ Backend Developer                       Save    Company Profile     Follow   Following    Share      Join our friendly and fast-paced R&D software department at FOSS – an international company delivering complex instruments and world-class innovative solutions to the food and agriculture industries.  The R&D Software development department is split into business units and a platform team. Business unit teams deliver the SW for the end products, whereas the platform team controls and develops the common functionality and features for our instruments.  The R&D Software department comprises of more than 70 people within software development and makes up for about 1/3 of the R&D organization in FOSS - and we are growing.  The job  We are looking for an object-oriented developer to join a great team. Your primary task will be to help us maintain and optimize our stable and proven C++ software and your deliveries will play a key role in our innovative and market leading instruments. You will work closely together with other software developers and the software PO in the team. We follow an agile development process.  We value cooperation and take pride in good team spirit, and we always focus on how we can assist each other in reaching our goals of delivering high-quality products.  Your primary tasks will include:   Back-end development of applications for analytical instruments using C++  Contributing and innovating how “we do things”, while suggesting new technologies  Participating in clarifications and documentation of new features  Ensuring the code can be tested automatically   Your key responsibilities will be:   Develop software for instrument projects and maintenance  Take responsibility for the implemented solutions  Support your team members by participating in code reviews  Troubleshooting and bug fixing  Follow agile processes  Be active in improving your team’s quality  Participate in the daily teamwork   Your daily work will be at the FOSS Innovation Center in Hillerød, Denmark.  Qualifications  Apply now if you can subscribe to the following qualifications:   Experienced SW Engineer/Developer  Expert in C++ - preferably with knowledge of MFC  Good at visualizing and documenting designs  A strong team player that is ready to learn and improve  Experience with Agile methodologies and scrum development processes   We will evaluate your competences within software development using an external programming test framework followed by an interview with one of our principal software engineers.  Personal skills  You have an analytical mindset and a methodical approach to software development, as well as the ability to bring a positive attitude into the development team. You have courage to flag problem areas, and a flair for doing this in a positive and constructive manner.  People respect you, and like to work with you, because of your technical competencies and ability to communicate complex concepts in a concise manner. You master the art of simplicity, and you promote continuous improvement to the way of working for you and your team.  We are an international company, and we expect your English to be fluent.  We offer  A challenging job, in an international and innovative company, that is small enough for you to get high influence in the job, and big enough for complex development and career development.  We have a flat and informal company culture and an open-minded and collegial spirit. The size of our company allows for independent, dynamic, and fast decisions, and you will have the opportunity for constant learning through new projects, technologies, and market opportunities. We strive to use the latest technology with updated tools etc.  The R&D Software department is responsible for developing software for our analytical instruments and we have many exciting new projects in the pipeline, that require world-class software solutions and a structured platform to support a wide variety of industry leading instrument solutions.  FOSS has a solid record of continued business growth and a strong business strategy for an exciting future journey. We anticipate increased software development so there are plenty of opportunities for personal growth.  Application    Send us your application via the link below. We screen applications as they come in, so apply now - better today than tomorrow! Any questions can be directed to Trine Aarup Ahrensberg: +45 2761 6820 / taa@foss.dk .  FOSS is committed to maintaining an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. You can help us sustain an unbiased recruitment process by not including photo or age in your application.          How to apply  Our goal is to make the recruitment process as professional and positive as possible. The recruitment process starts when you’ve submitted your application online. Vacant positions at FOSS do not always have an application deadline, so please apply today rather than tomorrow. The reason for this is that we want to ensure a fast and efficient process, which means that we review applications on an ongoing basis. Candidates who are invited for interviews will receive an invitation per email.   Apply                Sustainability is an integral part of our business  At FOSS, we have a taken a holistic approach to Sustainability. It’s not only about conducting our business in a responsible and ethical manner. It’s also about developing solutions that make a difference in the world. We help our customers tackle difficult global challenges such as efficiency in food production, consistency in quality and food safety.  We are operating in a world with significant population growth, scarce resources, food safety scandals and growing concerns about the climate. As the leading business-to-business provider of dedicated analytical technology, we play a key role in this environment.  For example, our technology is increasingly important in expanding food supply by making rational use of increasingly limited resources, while ensuring the best quality food reaches the consumer. To address this challenge there is a need for the development of solutions that analyze and make data manageable and actionable throughout the production process. Information management of analytics will be the future of the food and feed industry, enabling producers to increase yields by being more efficient. Intelligent and automated processes that run on data will define our customers’ future production - and much of the 10% of our turnover we annually invest in research and development will be dedicated to this area.           Working at FOSS  We work on a global scale to develop the people working at FOSS. We strive to enhance job satisfaction and motivation by constantly improving the competencies of our managers as well as following up on employee satisfaction.  We know our employees are our strongest asset.  Therefore, we emphasise, invest in and appraise our employees’ knowledge, skills and attitudes, and take pride in creating an environment with trust, confidence and development. We also believe that clearly defined objectives enable people to achieve their performance potential and that the support from the immediate superior is essential. Most important of all; trained, well-motivated and competent employees are a perquisite for success in the future. We manage by values, but also clear objectives, and follow up through regular meetings between the employee and the manager. In these meetings, there is also room to discuss career aspirations and other development opportunities including internal career moves.  You will have the opportunity for internal career development.  As a company, we are small enough for you to get high influence in the job, but we are also big enough for complex development and global careers. If you want to move in a new direction and continue to develop along with your professional capable colleagues, we offer the opportunity for internal career moves inside FOSS. As we are a knowledge-heavy company, this is a win-win scenario for both FOSS and our employees.          Philip from Sales and Hanne from Digital Business work close together  Philip and Hanne share their experience working in a business culture that encourages collaboration between many different colleagues, from research and development to global sales, across departments and countries.        Follow Søren during his work day  Søren is a Project Manager in Research & Development. In this video Søren shares how his career at FOSS has developed from student help to chemist to project manager. The project manager position is a very diverse job that involves bringing together a team of specialists with different skill sets with the shared goal of developing new and better products.           Work with creative and professionally strong colleagues.  Teamwork is essential to FOSS. By developing solutions in cross-functional teams, we integrate knowledge, experience and competences from many perspectives to achieve great results. We communicate in a straight-forward manner and solve challenges together. In FOSS, we truly value that you voice your opinion, take responsibility and ownership. Our company size in turn allows for independent, dynamic and fast decisions.  If you join FOSS, we promise you that you will enter an environment with new learnings through projects, new technologies and market opportunities. We love to be entrepreneurial and open-minded to new ideas, and if you get a good idea – you can bring it forward.  Join a company with a clear business idea and purpose, but also strong values.  In a global world with a growing population, there is an ever-increasing demand for safer food, production that is more efficient and less food waste. Globally, we need to produce as much food the next 40 years as the last 8,000 years to meet the needs of a growing population and declining natural resources. A huge challenge, which requires that we become better at utilizing the resources available.  The business vision of FOSS to contribute to a more sustainable use of increasingly valuable agricultural resources, and to the nutrition and health of the people of the world. We provide the industry’s best analytics, which add value to our customers by improving quality and optimising food and agricultural production.  Join FOSS, and you will be part of this mission, more relevant today than ever.         Meet our employees        Meet Mette   Mette has just started in a new position as Head of Market Management in FOSS. She comes from a position as launch manager today and has been with FOSS for more than 14 years. During this time she has been in 7 different positions at 3 different departments.   A great journey  “A great journey” Mette sums up. Mette’s openness towards new opportunities, combined with her experience and unique qualifications has recently got her the position as Head of Market Management in Sales & Marketing.   Mette emphasizes the benefits of internal career development: “You have the ability to transfer knowledge from your prior position into a new, gain a deeper organizational understanding and build a greater network. This makes it easier to create results”.                 Meet Jan – manager of Concept Development in Research & Development  Jan’s daily work as a manager in Concept Development consists of generating new ideas in collaboration with his team and deciding which ideas should be developed. The daily challenge of finding the right solutions to address the needs of our customers is solved by a diverse and competent group of specialists working together.       Meet Mariana – Chemometrician in Research & Development  Mariana is a Spanish Chemometrician specialised in NIR. Coming from a research background her move to FOSS was motivated by a desire to work with real products and real customers. AT FOSS she is involved in the innovation of new products, developing calibrations for the EyeFoss image analysis grain analyser.          About FOSS  FOSS creates end-to-end solutions that secure and improve food quality. From raw material to finished product. Our analysis instruments refine measurements into information management that enables businesses to run intelligent data-driven productions with less waste and bigger yields. Controlling cost and quality across all sectors and value chains, we help food and agricultural producers limit the number of human errors, scale their business faster and reduce manual labour as well as labour costs. We call it analytics beyond measure.  Over the last 60 years, we have made it our business to define the standard of analytical solutions for the food and agricultural industry. We pioneered advanced analysis for the challenging production environments in the 1960’s, and we were the first to integrate chemical composition analysis in process lines. Now our resolve and ambition have also made us the international benchmark in the field of chemometrics and real time analytics.  FOSS is a 100% family-owned company and the leading supplier of innovative analytical solutions; 98 percent of FOSS’ business is generated outside Denmark. FOSS has more than 100 patents and more than 20 world-first product introductions. FOSS employs more than 1700 dedicated people worldwide and has manufacturing, research and development facilities in Denmark and China. Solutions are sold and supported through FOSS sales and service companies in 28 countries and by more than 75 distributors. Many employees have a top-level scientific or technical background, including more than 130 Master of Science and more than 20 PhDs in areas such as photonics, chemometrics, physical chemistry, analytical chemistry, fermentation and bio-engineering, astrophysics, optical communication, physics, quality, nanotechnology, food science and adaptive radiotherapy. We also employ many factory-trained and certified support engineers stationed close to our customers.                               FOSS  Foss Allé 1  DK-3400 Hilleroed  Denmark    Phone: +45 70 10 33 70  E-mail: info@foss.dk                                Ansvarlig brug af dine oplysninger    ×     Jobindex ønsker at tilbyde en service, der giver dig den bedste oplevelse. Til dette ønsker vi at bruge cookies og personoplysninger til statistik og markedsføring. Vi indsamler oplysninger om din enhed, tidspunkt, besøgte sider og din IP-adresse. Vi og vores samarbejdspartnere opbevarer og/eller tilgår oplysninger på din enhed med henblik på at vise tilpassede annoncer og annoncemåling, tilpasset indhold, indholdsmåling, målgruppeindsigter og produktudvikling. Title: Technical Solution Expert
Description:
This website uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our website.  XCI and selected partners use cookies and similar technologies to ensure you get the best experience on this website.

        If you consent to it, we will use cookies for analytics purposes.  See our Cookie Policy to read more about the cookies we set.  You can withdraw and manage your consent at any time, by clicking "Manage cookies" at the bottom of each website page.    Accept all cookies  Disable non-necessary cookies  Cookie preferences      Select which cookies you accept  On this site, we always set cookies that are strictly necessary, meaning they are necessary for the site to function properly.  If you consent to it, we will also set other types of cookies. You can provide or withdraw your consent to the different types of cookies using the toggles below. You can change or withdraw your consent at any time, by clicking the link “Manage Cookies”, that is always available at the bottom of the site.  To learn more about what the different types of cookies do, how your data is used when they are set etc, see our Cookie Policy .          Strictly necessary  These cookies are necessary to make the site work properly, and are always set when you visit the site.   Vendors  Teamtailor          Analytics  These cookies collect information to help us understand how the site is being used.   Vendors  Teamtailor      Accept these cookies  Decline non-necessary cookies                Career menu       Start    Jobs    People      Employee  Log in  Candidate  Log in to Connect  Homepage  xci.dk                     Facebook       X       LinkedIn       Mail            Sales  ·  Aalborg   Technical Solution Expert  Elevate cybersecurity at XCI! Architect solutions, advise clients, and collaborate with sales. Join our dynamic team, where innovation thrives. Apply now!🚀     Apply for this job            Shape the Future of Cybersecurity as XCI's Technical Solution Expert Orchestrate cutting edge software solutions to prevent cyber-crime. And become the linchpin between customers, sales and developers Would you like to play a key role in enabling intelligence and law enforcement agencies to investigate cyber-crime, by conveying customer needs into tangible solutions in our agile development teams? If, at the same time you want to join a software house focusing on ground-breaking AI technologies, work alongside friendly and experienced colleagues – and of course get the flexibility you are probably already used to. This is the perfect fit for you! This is what you will be doing You will step into a growing sales team and serve as a key point of contact for customers, offering both pre- and post-sales advice. Your responsibilities include advising customers on topics such as where to use microservices and high-performance data processing. Or when to use a stream/event processing platform like Apache Kafka. Playing a crucial role in the presales process, your task is to ensure that we arrive at a solution that is aligned with customer requests and is feasible. Consequently, you will be responsible for connecting the dots between customers, sales, and our development team. In short, you can look forward to:  Architecting complex customer solutions in close collaboration with our product development teams  Demonstrating the latest software and conveying customer feedback to the development department  Partnering with sales executives to plan and execute complex deals  Aligning customer needs with proposed solutions, distilling the information for the product development teams to ensure successful solution delivery  Delivering compelling presentations and demos that highlight our unique value proposition.  Managing all technical aspects of RFP/RFI responses  Travelling approximately 30-40 days a year.  This is what we are looking for:  You have database knowledge – and you know the difference between SQL, NOSQL and graph databases  You have a proven track record as a software developer  You possess an innate talent for initiating and sustaining connections with both customers and development teams  You know how to simplify and present complex concepts effectively.  You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in Danish and English.  This is what you get At XCI you'll be part of a team working together to build products with a purpose. We value freedom to innovate as much as keeping red-tape at a minimum. Naturally, we provide you with the tools and support you need to grow both professionally and personally. And in addition to an attractive and inclusive work environment, we also enable flexibility to make everyday life work. An active staff association with activities such as champagne tastings, festivals, and group trips is part of our cultural DNA, bringing joy and a sense of community to the highest level! How to apply: We look forward to receiving your resume (a motivated application is not needed). If you have any questions or need additional information about the position, please reach out to our COO, Jesper Andersen, at +45 20286070 or email jesper.andersen@xci.dk . Please send your resume via the Apply button due to GDPR regulations. Applicants will be continuously reviewed. Welcome to XCI – Let's make nations safe! XCI is a forward-thinking Danish software company dedicated to serving government customers worldwide. Our off-the-shelf software products provide unprecedented insights from vast amounts of communication data, enabling users to extract actionable information effortlessly. Founded in 2017, XCI is committed to supporting intelligence and law enforcement agencies in efficiently investigating both historical and future threats arising from the complexities of modern data. By combining domain expertise, advanced analytics, artificial intelligence, and deep knowledge of communication data, we tackle this challenge head-on. At XCI, our 40+ engineers bring a wealth of 500+ years' industry experience. We're driven to stay ahead of adversaries in communication technology. Join us to empower customers and shape the future of tech security. Your expertise matters at XCI.       Department   Sales   Locations  Aalborg                  Contact  Maria Suhr Bay  People & Culture Manager
         – 
        Administration         Colleagues            Jesper Andersen  CCO            Per Nygaard Larsen  Senior Sales Engineer         About XCI   XCI is a Danish software company proudly serving intelligence and law enforcement agencies across the world. Our off-the-shelf software products provide unprecedented insights from communications data, empowering users to easily investigate past and future threats from the rapidly growing amounts of data and protocol complexity. This requires a new, machine-assisted, data-driven approach. To solve this complex challenge, we combine domain knowledge, deep understanding of communications data, artificial intelligence, and analytics.        Apply for this job          Sales  ·  Aalborg   Technical Solution Expert  Elevate cybersecurity at XCI! Architect solutions, advise clients, and collaborate with sales. Join our dynamic team, where innovation thrives. A cookie is a small text file that stores your internet settings on your computer, smartphone or other devices. Your internet browser downloads the cookie the first time you visit a website. Cookies are used by most websites and are often essential for the website to function properly. They can even improve your user experience when you return to a website you have visited previously – but only if you are using the same device and the same internet browser. The cookies will then remember your preferences. The law states that we can store cookies on your device if they are strictly necessary for the operation of this site. For all other types of cookies we need your permission. This site uses different types of cookies. Some cookies are placed by third party services that appear on our pages. You can at any time change or withdraw your consent from the Cookie Declaration on our website. Learn more about who we are, how you can contact us and how we process personal data in our Privacy Policy . Please state your consent ID and date when you contact us regarding your consent. Title: Embedded Software Developer Research & Development
Description:

Vendors  Youtube, Linkedin      Accept these cookies  Decline non-necessary cookies                Career menu       Start    Departments    People    Jobs      Employee  Log in   WS Audiology  WS Audiology  WS Audiology APAC  WS Audiology Americas  WS Audiology EMEA   Candidate  Log in to Connect       WS Audiology EMEA             Facebook       X       LinkedIn       Mail            Research & Development  ·  Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark   Embedded Software Developer     Apply now            For WSA, it is all about making Wonderful Sound for All, and we really hope you are ready to join our exciting projects. So, continue reading, if you are looking for a position with a true purpose, as we are looking for an Embedded Software Developers to contribute to our purpose. Who we are At WS Audiology, we provide innovative hearing aids and hearing health services. Together with our 12,000 colleagues in 130 countries, we invite you to help unlock human potential by bringing back hearing for millions of people around the world. With us, you will become part of a truly global company where we care for one another, welcome diversity and celebrate our successes. Sounds wonderful? Then keep reading The role At WS Audiology, Research & Development it is all about understanding people – and building awareness about how our hearing aids can improve their quality of life. In our Embedded Software department, we are looking for an experienced Embedded Software Developer who can deliver top quality output. You are a very structured team player, who can communicate in a precis and easy-to-understand way. You can make things happen and you do not back down from a challenge. Finally, you thrive in walking the extra mile for the team and you have great collaboration skills. You will be working on development projects, from specifying the features to writing the code. You will be responsible for creating efficient software that is optimized for speed, power consumption and memory. Interested in a virtual coffee meeting? We are curious to get to know you and discover if there could be a mutual interest. We welcome people with different kinds of experience and uniqueness as long as you have practical experience with being an embedded software developer, work permit in Denmark and can commute to the Lynge office. So, click the apply button now and upload your CV, or read on and learn more about the position. Your responsibilities With us you will be responsible for:  Create requirements which is the foundation for what we develop  Write design which describes what you intend to implement  Implement feature to match the requirements and design  Contribute to our peer review and continuous integration  Implement unit tests to ensure correct behavior of your      implementation  Create test specifications to ensure high-quality deliveries      for our users  Meet our Definition of Ready and Definition of Done  Ensure compliance with medical standards  Bring a positive mindset to continue the cozy atmosphere which      we treasure in the team  About you The ideal candidate holds a B.Sc. or M.Sc. in IT, Software, Electronics, Computer Science or similar combined with several years of practical experience within the medical industry. As a person, you have the passion for impact and are motivated by seeing the results of your effort as well as engaging with others to create them. You are an excellent team player and believe that you can accomplish more as a team than as an individual. We guarantee that when working at WSA, you will grow personally as well as building a new set of competencies. At the same time, you will be supporting people in making wonderful sound for all through the solutions you develop. We expect you to have:  B.Sc. or M.Sc. in IT, Software, Electronics, Computer Science      or similar  Experienced within C++/Python and real-time embedded      programming.  Thorough experience in communicating with hardware  A thorough understanding and experience with multithreaded      programming  Experience with debugging real-time systems that have very few      resources  A proven continuous improvement mindset  Great communication skills, to effectively communicate across      cross-functional teams  Knowledge and understanding of Medical Device Regulation and      Design Control is a plus  Knowledge about EN 62304 is a plus  Sounds Wonderful? All you need to do is click “Apply now” to show your interest and we will schedule a virtual meeting with you. Please send your CV no later than the 7th of January 2024. WS Audiology is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.       Department   Research & Development   Role  Embedded Software  Locations  Lynge, Copenhagen Region, Denmark  Employment type  Full-time                  Contact  Kathrine Schlegel Rasmussen  Talent Acquisition Partner - EMEA

Title: Software Engineering Manager
Description: Skip to main content.                                                   Profile    Sign Out                                                                      View More Jobs                                    Software Engineering Manager (Brøndby)        Brondby, Hovedstaden, Denmark                                       Job Description   CLOSING DATE 30 NOVEMBER 2023  Are you passionate about creating software solutions that drive operational excellence? Are you ready to join a dynamic and international environment in the global energy industry? Then join us and help empower future energy!  "What initially drew me to NOV were the high-tech products and the prospect of a meaningful job. What has kept me at the company is not only these aspects but also the people. NOV plays a crucial role in the global value chain that powers the world. Currently, we are in the midst of a transformation to align ourselves with the changing future, and our newly formed department will play a pivotal role in driving and facilitating this transformation. You will be joining a team of highly motivated individuals who are enthusiastic about making a significant impact." Bogi Laksafoss, Director - Business Systems and Processes, NOV SPS  Welcome to NOV - And to empowering future energy  You will be part of NOV’s business unit Subsea Production Systems with headquarters in Brøndby. NOV SPS consists of about 1400 colleagues based in Denmark, Brazil, Norway, the UK and US, including production plants in Denmark, Scotland and Brazil. You’ll be joining a business unit with approximately 40 different nationalities, with customers based all around the world.  The Oil and Gas industry has driven us over the last decades and will continue to be our main market for some time. However, the industry landscape is in transition and so are we.  We are proud to say that we empower future energy, which also means diversifying our business model to support renewables and low carbon energy resources.  A dynamic, collaborative, and international culture  As Software Engineering Manager in BSP you will play a pivotal role in our organization, being responsible for leading the team of 15-20 software engineers to deliver high-quality software products aligned with our strategic objectives and operational needs. This key leadership position demands a balance of technical expertise, people management, and strategic thinking. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams and the Product Manager, when relevant, to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet our quality standards. You also play a vital role in defining, optimizing, and implementing software development processes and methodologies.  As a Software Engineering Manager, you'll lead by example, demonstrating a strong commitment to fostering employee development, optimizing processes, and delivering continuous durable performance. You'll use your technical background and experience to provide guidance, mentorship, and support to your team, ensuring they have the skills and knowledge needed to succeed. Additionally, your leadership skills will be instrumental in recruiting and hiring top talent who align with our company culture.  Success in this role contributes directly to our company's digital strategy and overall success.  “Being part of this newly established department (BSP) has been such an interesting challenge - and a lot of fun! I have had the opportunity to grow and learn in new areas, and I see a huge potential for our work to have a positive impact on the entire business. “ Ann-Sofie Bjørke, Project Lead - Business Systems and Processes, NOV SPS  Key duties and responsibilities   Lead and manage the team of software engineers, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to ensure their professional growth and success.  Foster a collaborative and inclusive team culture, promoting open communication and knowledge sharing.  Collaborate with the Product Manager, when relevant, the senior software developers in the team and other relevant stakeholders to define project requirements and ensure alignment with business objectives.  Develop project plans, including scope, timelines, and resource allocation, and monitor progress throughout the project lifecycle.  Develop and implement effective software development processes and methodologies to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, and meet quality standards.  Identify areas for optimization and drive initiatives to implement process improvements.  Maintain effective communication with stakeholders, providing regular project status updates and addressing concerns or issues promptly. This is done in close collaboration with the Product Manager, when relevant.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that software development aligns with the overall organizational digital strategy.  Provide technical guidance to the software engineering team, ensuring they have the necessary skills and knowledge to deliver high-quality software products.  Help resolve technical challenges and make informed decisions regarding technology and architecture choices.  Empower the senior software engineers within the team to serve as valuable resources for offering technical guidance and expertise to the broader team, particularly in areas such as technology stack and architecture.  Recruit and hire new software engineering team members as needed, focusing on selecting high-performing individuals who align with the company culture.  Build a cohesive and productive team, encourage professional development, and manage team dynamics.  Empower the senior software engineers within the team to serve as valuable resources for offering technical guidance and expertise to the broader team, particularly in areas such as technology stack and architecture.  Ensure that software products meet quality standards through testing and quality assurance processes.  Implement and maintain best practices for code quality and software testing.  Implement and maintain Agile methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban, to ensure efficient and iterative development processes.  Facilitate Agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.  Use strong problem-solving skills to analyze complex issues and develop effective solutions to technical and project-related challenges.  Maintain comprehensive project documentation where relevant, e.g. technical specifications, architectural diagrams, and progress reports.  Provide regular updates to upper management and stakeholders on project status. This is done in collaboration with the Program Manager, when relevant.  Promote a culture of continuous improvement within the team, identifying areas for enhancement and driving initiatives to achieve better performance and efficiency.  Contribute to the development of long-term technology and software development strategies that align with the business needs and objectives  Identify potential project risks and develop contingency plans to ensure project goals are met without significant disruptions.  Ensure software development practices adhere to compliance requirements and security standards, protecting sensitive data and ensuring data privacy.   Your profile: An impact-oriented Software Engineering Manager  Education:  A Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related discipline. The educational foundation shall provide a solid understanding of software development principles and best practices.  Professional Experience:  At least 5 years of hands-on experience in software development and a deep understanding of software development processes, methodologies, and challenges.  Management Experience:  Prior experience in managing software development teams is crucial. This experience includes leading, mentoring, and motivating software engineers to achieve their goals and deliver high-quality software products.  Leadership Skills:  Demonstrated leadership abilities in a technical or managerial role, showcasing the capability to guide and inspire the team to achieve results.  Technical Proficiency:  Strong technical background and proficiency in programming languages, such as C# and Python, development tools, such as Git, JIRA and the Azure platform, and software architecture. Knowledge about AI/ML technologies is also an advantage. This expertise enables you to provide effective technical guidance to the team.  Project Management Skills:  Proficiency in project management practices, including planning, scheduling, resource allocation, and risk management. Experience in successfully managing multiple projects is an advantage.  Communication Skills:  Effective communication skills, both written and verbal, are essential for collaborating with team members and stakeholders, as well as presenting complex technical information clearly.  Strategic Thinking:  The ability to think strategically and align software development activities with the organization's long-term goals and digital strategy.  Are you interested?  Send your application and CV to us as soon as possible. If you have any questions about the job, you are welcome to contact Bogi Laksafoss, Director – Business Systems and Processes (+45) 29 63 38 69.  We call for interviews on an ongoing basis and hire when we have found the right candidate.    We are looking forward to hearing from you!  We power the industry that powers the world    For more than 150 years, NOV has pioneered innovations that empower the global energy industry, enabling our customers to safely produce abundant energy while minimizing their environmental impact.    The energy industry depends on our deep expertise and technology to continually improve oilfield operations and assist in efforts to advance the energy transition towards a more sustainable future.     Read more about us on www.nov.com or on the NOV SPS LinkedIn showcase page                                                                                           About Us   Every day, the oil and gas industry’s best minds put more than 150 years of experience to work to help our customers achieve lasting success.  We Power the Industry that Powers the World Throughout every region in the world and across every area of drilling and production, our family of companies has provided the technical expertise, advanced equipment, and operational support necessary for success—now and in the future.  Global Family We are a global family of thousands of individuals, working as one team to create a lasting impact for ourselves, our customers, and the communities where we live and work.  Purposeful Innovation Through purposeful business innovation, product creation, and service delivery, we are driven to power the industry that powers the world better.  Service Above All This drives us to anticipate our customers’ needs and work with them to deliver the finest products and services on time and on budget.                             About the Team   Completion & Production Solutions Through NOV Completion & Production Solutions, we serve well intervention service providers and oil and gas producers, and we pursue opportunities around hydraulic fracture stimulation, wellbore intervention equipment, composite tubulars, pumps, floating production systems, and subsea production technologies. Our integrated approach delivers greater certainty, reliability, and peace of mind. Title: Experienced LabVIEW/TestStand-developer

Stresstest Mål dit stressniveau      Talenttest Find dine arbejdstalenter        Guides       Ansøgninger Sådan skriver du en god ansøgning    CV Få de bedste tips til dit CV      Jobsamtale Gør et godt indtryk til samtalen    Lønforhandling Stå stærkt til lønforhandlingen      Opsigelse Brug denne guide og kom godt videre    Uopfordret ansøgning Sådan søger du uopfordret      Dit første job Værktøjer og tips til dit nye arbejdsliv    Jobglæde Sæt jobglæde på agendaen        Kurser       6 ugers jobrettet uddannelse Opgrader dine kompetencer      Jobsøgningskursus Skab struktur i din jobsøgning              For arbejdsgivere    Tilmeld dig Jobindex    Switch to English        Log ind  Opret profil                    Søg job       Gemte job       Jobagent       Mere     Overblik   Ansøgninger   Henvendelser   CV   QuickApply-profil   Virksomheder   Råd og vejledning   Indstillinger          Save  Share  Apply        CIM A/S    Hørsholm or Aarhus     Share    Save      Experienced LabVIEW/TestStand-developer    Do you dream of a flexible work week with room for a life in balance and do you want to create code that moves the world?  Our software is used for testing everything from the smallest hearing aid components to wind turbine motors, so your contribution will have a big impact on the quality of products that are vital to people and planet.  Work for better products across industries  You will play a key role in ensuring the quality of our software systems. Based on a solid understanding of the reality in which the systems will operate, you take pride in creating excellent code that can be decoupled and reused between projects and facilitate maintenance of existing equipment.  You will be working closely with other software developers/architects, engineers, IT and sales consultants. You are typically part of the process right from establishing of the customer’s needs to planning, design, implementation, and testing.  At CIM, we work with technologies ranging from data collection applications in LabVIEW to test sequences typically executed from TestStand. We are a National Instruments Center of Excellence so you will be joining a team of experts within this field.  We want you to focus on doing what you do best, so expect that meetings and time-consuming processes are kept to an absolute minimum.  You choose whether you want to be based at the Aarhus or Hørsholm office.  System engineer with an eye for quality  We imagine that you   are an experienced LabVIEW/TestStand-developer  have a relevant degree in Computer Science, Engineering (electronics, low voltage, software, mechanics, etc.), or Software Engineering  have good communication skills and are a strong team player  combine business acumen with a sense of how best to create value in your work  speak and write English at a professional level  have experience with project management and agile working methods such as Scrum  use some of the technologies (or comparable) that we work with daily: LabVIEW / TestStand / SQL / communication protocols / hardware interfaces / software interfaces, etc.  We encourage anyone qualified to apply for the position regardless of age, gender, religion or ethnicity.   Adapt your schedule to fit your lifestyle  You are the expert on what makes you happy and efficient. Whether that entails a 4-day work week or working in the evening or from home is entirely up to you.  25 years of working with the best  Companies like Pfizer, Novo Nordisk, Danfoss, Siemens, Vestas, Grundfos, and Mærsk rely on our expertise and solutions for collecting, analyzing and making data available.  Start making an impact on product quality  Please apply for the position by sending your CV and a short application by email to Site Director Anders Rohde at ar@cim.as .  Start date is as soon as possible, but we will wait for the right candidate. Please note that we will conduct interviews on an ongoing basis.  If you have any questions, please feel free to call Anders on +45 28 11 88 58.   We look forward to hearing from you! Title: Senior Software Engineer
Description:

        If you consent to it, we will use cookies for analytics purposes.  See our Cookie Policy to read more about the cookies we set.  You can withdraw and manage your consent at any time, by clicking "Manage cookies" at the bottom of each website page. If you consent to it, we will also set other types of cookies. You can provide or withdraw your consent to the different types of cookies using the toggles below. You can change or withdraw your consent at any time, by clicking the link “Manage Cookies”, which is always available at the bottom of the site.  To learn more about what the different types of cookies do, how your data is used when they are set etc, see our Cookie Policy .          Strictly necessary  These cookies are necessary to make the site work properly, and are always set when you visit the site. Vendors  Teamtailor      Accept these cookies  Decline non-necessary cookies                Career menu       Start    People    Jobs      Employee  Log in  Candidate  Log in to Connect  Homepage  e-conomic.dk                     Facebook       X       LinkedIn       Mail            Software Development  ·  Copenhagen - Gærtorvet 1-5  ·  Hybrid Remote    Senior Software Engineer     Apply for this job    We usually respond within a month           At Visma e-conomic, we are the backbone of over 180,000 Danish companies, empowering them with our cloud software for mission-critical business operations. Our system, used by more than 10,000 daily active users, handles over 90 million external HTTP requests and 35,000 SQL Server batch requests per second. We pride ourselves on deploying to production several times a day, constantly enhancing our product to deliver exceptional value.  About You As a passionate and skilled Senior Software Engineer, you will play a crucial role in our FinTech projects. We are seeking someone with at least 3-5 years of hands-on experience working in .NET Framework, SQL, and React, who thrives in a dynamic environment. Your primary responsibilities will include:  Work within the sales domain, focusing on invoicing and debt collection workflows  Write, review, and refactor code to maintain high-quality standards  Actively participate in team meetings and discussions.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.   Qualifications  Proficiency in .NET Framework/.NET, Web API, C#, SQL, React, Git, HTML, CSS.  Comfortable working with an existing codebase.  Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.  Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration with team members.  Team player mentality with a clear understanding of teamwork dynamics.  Based in Denmark.   Additional Skills (Not Required but Advantageous):  Development of SaaS systems.  TypeScript.  GitHub Actions.  Google Cloud.  Mentorship skills.   Our Team Join a team of 5 software developers, a QA engineer, an Engineering Manager, Product Manager, and User Experience experts. We focus on enhancing the sales component of the e-conomic ERP system, developing features such as quote-to-cash, integrations, customer and product portfolio management, subscription-based invoicing, document handling, and automation features.  We Offer 🧑🏽‍💻 A flexible work environment (Hybrid work) 🌍 An international and creative workplace with +30 nationalities 🔍 Autonomy and complexity - a unique opportunity to take on autonomous roles and work on complex rewarding challenges. 🚀 Planned Hackathon // Development Days every year 🏬 A modern office and facilities in Carlsberg Byen 🏥 Company-paid pension, internet and health insurance 💆🏻‍♀️ Lots of offerings to support your physical and mental well-being such as fitness, massage, Mental Health sessions and much more 🎉 Lots of social events  Next Steps We invite you to share your CV and a motivated application (optional). We are committed to finding the right candidate and reserve the right to conclude the hiring process once the position is filled. For further questions, contact our Hiring Manager, Martin Graarup, at martin.graarup@visma.com . The recruitment process  The first hello. A short phone Interview with HR.  Culture Talk. A first talk where you and hiring manager will meet to get to know each other, share experiences, and discuss the role.  Technical interview. You will receive a technical case that we expect you to complete, present and we together will discuss.  Personality interview. This interview will include a personality test session.  References        Department  Software Development  Role  Software Engineer  Locations  Copenhagen - Gærtorvet 1-5  Remote status  Hybrid Remote  Sub Category  Development  Application deadline  17 December, 2023  Competencies  Software Development                  Contact  Ismail Abarkan  Talent Acquisition Specialist           About Visma e-conomic A/S  e-conomic is a part of Visma - a leading provider of core business software for a more efficient and resilient society. We simplify the work of companies and organisations of all sizes, empowering people and helping businesses grow and thrive. Think of Visma as an ecosystem of companies, cultures, and people, united by shared values and the vision to shape the future of society through technology . Let’s recruit together and find your next colleague.         @@visma.com                                       Applicant tracking system by Teamtailor

Title: Senior Software Developer
Description: Job description    Working at Interacoustics    Meet our employees     Apply                  Middelfart  Senior Software Developer                 Come join our software team at the world’s leading company for diagnostic audiology and balance  We offer team spirit, professional development and a great working environment.  It’s important to us that you enjoy your job. We will go many a length to make sure that you are properly onboarded and trained to the tasks and areas of new expertise. To help you do that, you will get a wingman for the first months as well as have access to internal and external learning portals at which you can develop your skills at your own pace – also during work hours.  At Interacoustics we have trust in each other, and we offer a flexible working environment by focusing on personal wellbeing and effort, not just counting the hours in front of the screen.  In the Interacoustics R&D software team we are 48 dedicated developers, architects, testers, scrum masters and team managers located across Denmark, Poland and Malaysia, we aim to ensure that everybody feels part of the same team. You will find that our team closely collaborates with our hardware and digital signal processing department teams. To us software development is more than only writing code.  The job  We are rooting for you! Together with your skilled team members we expect you to actively participate in all phases of software development. Everyone's opinions are valued - the more senior, the more we appreciate you taking a place at the center of the refinement process as well as being able to keep an eye out on the goal in the horizon. We expect you take part and pride in developing and maintain quality software solutions for diagnostics, research, hearing aid dispensers, schools and more.  Expected areas of knowledge:   .NET (C#)  Unit testing  Common architecture principles (DDD, SOLID, MVVM)  Familiarity with Scrum, code review and Azure DevOps, would help you  Maybe even WPF and XAML   Who are you?  Ideal you hold a degree in computer engineering, computer science or have knowledge of related technical disciplines. Furthermore, you have extensive programming experience and will bring theoretical knowledge and professional practical skills. You are fluent in C# with broad knowledge of software methodologies and tools. Most importantly, you can see yourself as an enthusiastic member of the team – And you are eager to keep the ball rolling, as we must meet market requirements for new functionality!  We wish to support and strengthen your personal and professional development through clear and tangible goals found in an ongoing development and one to one dialog. And yes – a mechanical keyboard is an ergonomic accepted need as well as noise canceling headsets and a say in office layout.  We offer:  As we develop products and software used in the medical industry the focus is on quality over quantity. We have great open office spaces made for collaboration, but also room to focus and space to just take a break. Maybe with a game of table football.  Each day we offer a delicious lunch in our canteen, and you can use our training facilities with easy access to a large changing room, often used by those biking to work or having a short run at lunch. We have an active staff organization that organizes social events like running events, cooking evenings, summer party, hackathon, and Christmas come together. On top of that we also offer a health care scheme, and the above mentioned flexible working hours.  Questions and applications  We look forward to receive your application and CV as soon as possible in either English or Danish. We encourage you to apply even if you do not think that you meet all the above-mentioned requirements entirely, then just let us know, where we can support you in getting up-to-date.  If you would like to know more about the job, please contact Kasper Jensen, Team manager at +45 2420 7729. We’ll conduct interviews on a rolling basis. Please know, that as a part of recruitment we might ask you to provide a reference or two. As we conduct interviews on a rolling basis, don’t hesitate to get in touch.   Apply       Follow us                     Save    Company Profile     Follow   Following    Share               Working at Interacoustics  Watch video            Life-changing opportunities  We are always looking for talented people, who are keen to make life easier for hearing care professionals in diagnostic audiology and balance.       High-tech and innovative  We are a high-tech organization with highly skilled employees. Our innovative approach offers you the opportunity to explore new technology and put your mark on new solutions. Our global presence offers the opportunity to work with customers and colleagues all over the world.       Ambitious and forward-thinking  Supported by our brand promise ‘Science made smarter’ and the values of Ambition, Integrity and Customer Value, we strive to do a little better each day. You can expect a challenging workday in an ambitious working environment. We value open communication, collaboration and teamwork, and celebrate achievements together.            Meet our employees           Meet our employees         As an intern with Interacoustics, I worked with electronics and programming. I was able to influence my tasks and take my tasks in a direction I thought was relevant - not just to the benefit of the company, but also to satisfy my own needs.  Nicolas , Development Engineer              About Interacoustics      Interacoustics is a world leading diagnostic solutions provider in the field of hearing and balance assessment. We design, manufacture and sell products across the whole audiological spectrum, from small portable devices to full clinical instruments. Our products are sold in more than 100 countries through our extensive network of sales companies and distributors. Interacoustics employs more than 180 people at the head office in Middelfart, more than 500 worldwide and is among the world's leading suppliers of audiological equipment.  Interacoustics is part of the Demant Group. This group of international companies develops, manufactures and markets a wide variety of technological solutions, ranging from state-of-the art digital hearing instruments and assistive listening devices to revolutionary new diagnostic systems.         interacoustics.com               ×                 ×                        Ansvarlig brug af dine oplysninger    ×     Jobindex ønsker at tilbyde en service, der giver dig den bedste oplevelse.
