Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                         Embedded Software Developer            Are you looking to join a world-leading company and contribute to the development of the embedded platform controlling the world's largest 2-stroke engines? Are you passionate about the green transition and eager to make a real impact? If so, this opportunity might be perfect for you!  At MAN Energy Solutions, we are at the forefront of leveraging cutting-edge technologies to drive the decarbonization of world trade. As the global market leader in energy-efficient and fuel-flexible large marine engine solutions, our engines are powered by our own hardware and software platform. As an Embedded Software Developer joining our team, you will play a crucial role in ensuring that we deliver on our ambitious sustainability goals.  The MAN Energy Solutions engine control system is a distributed embedded system consisting of multiple FPGA-based controllers. You will join our embedded software department together with 13 other highly skilled and motivated colleagues. The team is responsible for the firmware and middleware of the control system which enables our control department to efficiently develop and bring to market, state-of-the-art solutions e.g. new alternative fuel types and emission reduction systems.  You will play an important role in:   Take part in developing new features, all the way from defining the architecture to implementation and maintenance.  Analyzing and debugging existing solutions.  Writing automated tests and documentation.   We imagine that you:   Have a degree in computer science, electrical engineering, software engineering, or similar, with an interest in embedded systems.  Well-founded in C++.  Enjoy working with complex systems.  Ability to work well in a team, but also self-driven and willing to take ownership.  Like technical challenges and have a "can-do" attitude.  Knowledge of agile development processes, test automation, and continuous integration, is a plus.   Welcome to the Embedded Software Department  Working in our team is a rewarding and collaborative experience. As part of the automation department in the R&D function, based in Copenhagen. We are responsible for everything connecting the application code with the control system hardware. This includes real-time operating system, hardware abstraction layer, board support package and application interfaces.  Collaboration is the cornerstone of our achievements. We work closely together with the hardware team to integrate new FPGA features, and the control departments to leverage their expertise to provide a meaningful and efficient API.  What can you expect from us : As an inclusive and supportive team, we prioritize the well-being of our members. We foster a friendly and informal atmosphere that encourages creativity and open communication. Our culture ensures a pleasant social environment, where we celebrate each other's successes.  When you join our team, you'll be surrounded by talented and dedicated individuals who are eager to learn from your experiences while gladly sharing their knowledge with you. We believe in continuous growth and mutual support, recognizing that every team member plays a crucial role in our collective success.  Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future We offer you an opportunity to help shape the world of tomorrow – whether you are just starting out, taking your first career steps after graduation, or looking for the next big career challenge.  At MAN Energy Solutions, we focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture. We believe that a diverse workforce with a mix of gender, nationalities, and perspectives will drive innovation, creativity and productivity. We are committed to our employees’ well-being, and you will have the opportunity to join different social activities from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.  We prioritize work-life balance, offering flexible working hours, the possibility of working from home, and mental well-being including health insurance and focus on work atmosphere. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.  At MAN Energy Solutions, you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions while achieving your personal career goals.  About MAN Energy Solutions   250 years of experience in advanced engineering  We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe  We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy  We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are 2,200 passionate employees with more than 40 nationalities   Build your own future Please submit your application to us no later than 01.12.2023. We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Department Manager Nicolai Pedersen by phone +45 42 75 16 06. More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com  We encourage all qualified candidates regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position.            Application due 12/1/2023  Start date   Work hours  Position category  Position type IT  Workplace Teglholmsgade 41, 2450 København SV  Homepage man-es.com     Contact         E-mail                  E-mail                  E-mail                  E-mail                More vacant positions  Follow us         With headquarter in Germany, MAN Energy Solutions employs around 15,000 people worldwide. Of these, we are approx. 2,200 passionate employees in Denmark in 3 locations: Copenhagen, Frederikshavn and Holeby. With more than 250 years of experience in advanced engineering, we deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe. At MAN Energy Solutions we have the technologies and the experience to make a significant contribution to decarbonization. That's why we care about "Moving Big Things to Zero”. "So that the small things matter, too."                                       ShareThis Copy and Paste

Title: Highly competent C# Backend Azure Cloud Developer with architecture skills
Description: Job description  Working at FOSS  Meet our employees  About FOSS    Apply                Highly competent C# Backend Azure Cloud Developer with architecture skills                       Save    Company Profile     Follow   Following    Share       Join our friendly and fast-paced R&D software department at FOSS – an international company delivering complex instruments and world-class innovative solutions to the food and agriculture industries.   The R&D Software department comprises of more than 70 people within software development and makes up for about 1/3 of the R&D organization in FOSS - and we are growing.  The job  We are looking for a highly competent C# backend developer for our Grain & Feed development team. You will work closely together with other software developers and the software PO in the team. We follow an agile development process. You will be part of developing a cloud-based solution. The solution must fit the overall architecture from another division, so collaboration is important. We value cooperation and take pride in good team spirit, and we always focus on how we can assist each other in reaching our goals of delivering high-quality products.  Your key responsibilities will be:   Develop the new cloud-based solution for the instrument project  Take responsibility for architectural design of the implemented solutions  Work together with the other division and ensure successful implementation of the cloud solution  Troubleshooting and bug fixing  Participate in the daily teamwork   Your daily work will be at the FOSS Innovation Center in Hillerød, Denmark.  Qualifications  Apply now if you can subscribe to the following qualifications:   Experienced and highly competent C#/.Net and .Net Core software engineer or computer scientist  Experience with Web API  Experience with SQL server  Experience with Microsoft Azure  A strong knack for architectural design and know when to apply various patterns  Experience with Agile methodologies and scrum development processes   We will develop our solution in Microsoft Azure therefore knowledge on the following is preferred:   Azure Functions  Azure Service Bus  Azure Storage  Azure virtual networks  Azure containers   We will evaluate your competences within software development using an external programming test framework followed by an interview with one of our principal software engineers.  Personal skills  You have an analytical mindset and a methodical approach to software development, as well as the ability to bring a positive attitude into the development team. You have courage to flag problem areas, and a flair for doing this in a positive and constructive manner.  People respect you, and like to work with you, because of your technical competencies and ability to communicate complex concepts in a concise manner. You master the art of simplicity, and you promote continuous improvement to the way of working for you and your team. We are an international company; therefore, we expect your English to be fluent.  We offer  A challenging job, in an international and innovative company, that is small enough for you to get high influence in the job, and big enough for complex development and career development. We have a flat and informal company culture and an open-minded and collegial spirit. The size of our company allows for independent, dynamic, and fast decisions, and you will have the opportunity for constant learning through new projects, technologies, and market opportunities. We strive to use the latest technology with updated tools etc.  The R&D Software department is responsible for developing software for our analytical instruments and we have many exciting new projects in the pipeline, that require world-class software solutions and a structured platform to support a wide variety of industry leading instrument solutions. FOSS has a solid record of continued business growth and a strong business strategy for an exciting future journey. We anticipate increased software development so there are plenty of opportunities for personal growth.  Ready to embark our journey?  For further information regarding the job, feel free to reach out to People Manager, Christian Thystrup: cth@foss.dk , +45 2761 6800.  We conduct interviews on an ongoing basis, so we look forward to hearing from you soon! Please note that we only consider applications received through the link below. FOSS is committed to maintaining an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce so all applications are welcome. They will be considered on the relative merits of the applicant regardless of ethnicity, nationality, gender, who you love, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief. You can help us sustain an unbiased recruitment process by not including a photo or age in your application.          How to apply  Our goal is to make the recruitment process as professional and positive as possible. The recruitment process starts when you’ve submitted your application online. Vacant positions at FOSS do not always have an application deadline, so please apply today rather than tomorrow. The reason for this is that we want to ensure a fast and efficient process, which means that we review applications on an ongoing basis. Candidates who are invited for interviews will receive an invitation per email.   Apply                Sustainability is an integral part of our business  At FOSS, we have a taken a holistic approach to Sustainability. It’s not only about conducting our business in a responsible and ethical manner. It’s also about developing solutions that make a difference in the world. We help our customers tackle difficult global challenges such as efficiency in food production, consistency in quality and food safety.  We are operating in a world with significant population growth, scarce resources, food safety scandals and growing concerns about the climate. As the leading business-to-business provider of dedicated analytical technology, we play a key role in this environment.  For example, our technology is increasingly important in expanding food supply by making rational use of increasingly limited resources, while ensuring the best quality food reaches the consumer. To address this challenge there is a need for the development of solutions that analyze and make data manageable and actionable throughout the production process. Information management of analytics will be the future of the food and feed industry, enabling producers to increase yields by being more efficient. Intelligent and automated processes that run on data will define our customers’ future production - and much of the 10% of our turnover we annually invest in research and development will be dedicated to this area.           Working at FOSS  We work on a global scale to develop the people working at FOSS. We strive to enhance job satisfaction and motivation by constantly improving the competencies of our managers as well as following up on employee satisfaction.  We know our employees are our strongest asset.  Therefore, we emphasise, invest in and appraise our employees’ knowledge, skills and attitudes, and take pride in creating an environment with trust, confidence and development. We also believe that clearly defined objectives enable people to achieve their performance potential and that the support from the immediate superior is essential. Most important of all; trained, well-motivated and competent employees are a perquisite for success in the future. We manage by values, but also clear objectives, and follow up through regular meetings between the employee and the manager. In these meetings, there is also room to discuss career aspirations and other development opportunities including internal career moves.  You will have the opportunity for internal career development.  As a company, we are small enough for you to get high influence in the job, but we are also big enough for complex development and global careers. If you want to move in a new direction and continue to develop along with your professional capable colleagues, we offer the opportunity for internal career moves inside FOSS. As we are a knowledge-heavy company, this is a win-win scenario for both FOSS and our employees.          Philip from Sales and Hanne from Digital Business work close together  Philip and Hanne share their experience working in a business culture that encourages collaboration between many different colleagues, from research and development to global sales, across departments and countries.        Follow Søren during his work day  Søren is a Project Manager in Research & Development. In this video Søren shares how his career at FOSS has developed from student help to chemist to project manager. The project manager position is a very diverse job that involves bringing together a team of specialists with different skill sets with the shared goal of developing new and better products.           Work with creative and professionally strong colleagues.  Teamwork is essential to FOSS. By developing solutions in cross-functional teams, we integrate knowledge, experience and competences from many perspectives to achieve great results. We communicate in a straight-forward manner and solve challenges together. In FOSS, we truly value that you voice your opinion, take responsibility and ownership. Our company size in turn allows for independent, dynamic and fast decisions.  If you join FOSS, we promise you that you will enter an environment with new learnings through projects, new technologies and market opportunities. We love to be entrepreneurial and open-minded to new ideas, and if you get a good idea – you can bring it forward.  Join a company with a clear business idea and purpose, but also strong values.  In a global world with a growing population, there is an ever-increasing demand for safer food, production that is more efficient and less food waste. Globally, we need to produce as much food the next 40 years as the last 8,000 years to meet the needs of a growing population and declining natural resources. A huge challenge, which requires that we become better at utilizing the resources available.  The business vision of FOSS to contribute to a more sustainable use of increasingly valuable agricultural resources, and to the nutrition and health of the people of the world. We provide the industry’s best analytics, which add value to our customers by improving quality and optimising food and agricultural production.  Join FOSS, and you will be part of this mission, more relevant today than ever.         Meet our employees        Meet Mette   Mette has just started in a new position as Head of Market Management in FOSS. She comes from a position as launch manager today and has been with FOSS for more than 14 years. During this time she has been in 7 different positions at 3 different departments.   A great journey  “A great journey” Mette sums up. Mette’s openness towards new opportunities, combined with her experience and unique qualifications has recently got her the position as Head of Market Management in Sales & Marketing.   Mette emphasizes the benefits of internal career development: “You have the ability to transfer knowledge from your prior position into a new, gain a deeper organizational understanding and build a greater network. This makes it easier to create results”.                 Meet Jan – manager of Concept Development in Research & Development  Jan’s daily work as a manager in Concept Development consists of generating new ideas in collaboration with his team and deciding which ideas should be developed. The daily challenge of finding the right solutions to address the needs of our customers is solved by a diverse and competent group of specialists working together.       Meet Mariana – Chemometrician in Research & Development  Mariana is a Spanish Chemometrician specialised in NIR. Coming from a research background her move to FOSS was motivated by a desire to work with real products and real customers. AT FOSS she is involved in the innovation of new products, developing calibrations for the EyeFoss image analysis grain analyser.          About FOSS  FOSS creates end-to-end solutions that secure and improve food quality. From raw material to finished product. Our analysis instruments refine measurements into information management that enables businesses to run intelligent data-driven productions with less waste and bigger yields. Controlling cost and quality across all sectors and value chains, we help food and agricultural producers limit the number of human errors, scale their business faster and reduce manual labour as well as labour costs. We call it analytics beyond measure.  Over the last 60 years, we have made it our business to define the standard of analytical solutions for the food and agricultural industry. We pioneered advanced analysis for the challenging production environments in the 1960’s, and we were the first to integrate chemical composition analysis in process lines. Now our resolve and ambition have also made us the international benchmark in the field of chemometrics and real time analytics.  FOSS is a 100% family-owned company and the leading supplier of innovative analytical solutions; 98 percent of FOSS’ business is generated outside Denmark. FOSS has more than 100 patents and more than 20 world-first product introductions. FOSS employs more than 1700 dedicated people worldwide and has manufacturing, research and development facilities in Denmark and China. Solutions are sold and supported through FOSS sales and service companies in 28 countries and by more than 75 distributors. Many employees have a top-level scientific or technical background, including more than 130 Master of Science and more than 20 PhDs in areas such as photonics, chemometrics, physical chemistry, analytical chemistry, fermentation and bio-engineering, astrophysics, optical communication, physics, quality, nanotechnology, food science and adaptive radiotherapy. We also employ many factory-trained and certified support engineers stationed close to our customers.                               FOSS  Foss Allé 1  DK-3400 Hilleroed  Denmark    Phone: +45 70 10 33 70  E-mail: info@foss.dk                                Ansvarlig brug af dine oplysninger    ×     Jobindex ønsker at tilbyde en service, der giver dig den bedste oplevelse. Title: Software Development Engineer
Description: We use cookies to offer you the best possible website experience. Your cookie preferences will be stored in your browser’s local storage. This includes cookies necessary for the website's operation. Software Development Engineer           Application Deadline:  30th of November          Workplace:  Hybrid Position          Location:    Bjerringbro, DK, 8850             Contract Type:  Full-Time          Working Hours:  37          Employment Type:  Regular                Are you open for a professional career as Software Developer? Do you have the skills, vision, and creative mindset to take part in accomplishing our goals? Then join our team working with embedded software for our industry products.  We offer you an exciting and varied development job, with a high degree of influence and direction setting for product software and for our software platform.  You will have a unique opportunity to further develop your skills and career as a software developer at Grundfos, a global company with more than 20.000 employees committed to making clean water available to more people. We have launched our 2025 strategy, with a clear focus on addressing climate change and the quality of life for people through innovation.   What is the job about? You will join one of our teams in the Software Development department which is part of Global Technology & Innovation taking care of all embedded software development in Grundfos. As Software Developer, you play a central role in the software team. You will be involved in the complete development cycle from analysis, design and architecture over coding and unit test to system testing and verification. Furthermore, you will take part in the platform and process development across the software organization.  Your main responsibilities:   ·         To create software applications and solutions to solve our customer’s needs. Take part in ensuring that the solutions fulfill the customers’ expectations towards usability and quality.  ·         Become part of a scrum team with software developers in Denmark and India, with a Scrum Master and a Product Owner.  ·         Be part of our great department with a great sense of unity and freedom, and in a larger, international software organization with 130+ colleagues placed in Denmark, Germany, China and India, where traveling will be a part of the job.  ·         Take part in a transformation process where digital offerings are in focus. Software development is closely involved in this transformation, and you are also expected to participate and contribute to this journey.  “ You will be part of an experienced and self-organized agile software team, who is in daily dialogue with our colleagues in Development and Business, to solve the customers’ requests for new features and quality improvement on our solutions ”, Manager, Kenneth Quade Kristensen says.   Your background: We imagine that you are an embedded software developer with embedded C knowledge. Moreover, you have a bachelor's or master’s degree in science or engineering. You are communicative in English both verbally and in writing and finally could have experience in one of the following areas:   ·         distributed embedded system design and architecture  ·         experience with C# and/or Phyton  ·         agile SW development – scrum and scaling scrum  ·         basic understanding of HW Schematics and design  ·         software development of display products  ·         with test automation of display products  ·         basic experience with iOS/Andriod apps development  ·         embedded Linux development  ·         tools such as Jira, Bitbucket, Doors and Pure::Variants  ·         CI/CD and high focus on quality  Focus is on the embedded software for our products, but it is an advantage with a broader development mindset, enabling the team to work as independent with the complete customer experience.  “ You enjoy working in depth with your tasks. You are not afraid to promote your ideas and ask if you have questions or need input. You are ready bring forward something that is not quite done to get feedback from your peers and stakeholders, ” Kenneth finishes.   What’s in it for you?  Whether it’s developing leadership skills or advancing your expertise even further, we’ll support you with continuous learning and development opportunities, to help discuss and steer your long-term Grundfos career path. You’ll be welcomed from day one into an inclusive, trusting environment guided by six core values. In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:   ·         If you’ll be working from your home office, we’ll make sure you are well-equipped with a good workstation. However, you are always welcome to our offices where you can engage, learn, and have fun with colleagues  ·         On top of it, flexible working hours and up to 3 days additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice  ·         Annual bonuses, internal well-being consultants and programs  ·         Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development  ·         Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly   Do you want to learn more? If you have questions or want to know more about the position, please contact manager, Kenneth Quade Kristensen at +45 30262354.  If this job sounds appealing to you, please send your resume and cover letter today and no later than 30th of August 2023 by clicking on “Apply”. We expect interviews during December.  To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube , and to get to know some of your future colleagues and why they enjoy working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people  We look forward to hearing from you.            About Grundfos  Grundfos is one of the world’s leading water technology companies with more than 19.000 employees in 60+ countries all over the world. Our skills commit us to pioneering solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do, as we believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.  An inclusive team If you like the look of this job and know you can bring your skills to contribute to our purpose, please apply. We need and welcome professional people from all corners – however you identify and whatever your background is. Title: Senior Software Developer – Platform Team
Description: Sorry, Internet Explorer 11 is no longer supported by SmartRecruiters    Please update to one of the following browsers:   Google Chrome  Microsoft Edge  Apple Safari  Mozilla Firefox     You can find details about supported web browsers here .       Senior Software Developer – Platform Team Full-time Job Description We are looking for a Senior Software Developer to join the Software Platform team, a strong team of highly skilled software developers, who provide core software services, tools, and expert guidance to the other +250 software developers in BEUMER Group. The team works in a global setup with developers in Denmark and Germany.  What do we offer you? Flexibility in your work-life balance Global, young and openminded team Extensive onboarding incl. a personal buddy out of your new team Team events, like Hackathons etc. Family-owned company (save job in the future) We champion your personal and professional development (Lead Developer or architect or ? … up to you) Interesting and changing work Topics (investigate in new and interesting technologies) Developing the future of Software Development inside of BEUMER The Platform Team currently consists of +8 employees (3 in DK and 5 in GER). It is part of our global Software division, consisting of more than 250 software developers in Denmark, Germany, Poland, Austria, the USA, and Singapore.  The Platform team has a clear ambition, this is our WHY:  " To ease the application developers´ daily work, reduce their cognitive load, and bring new ideas and technologies into software development ".  This is achieved by providing a software ecosystem and engineering toolbox that can be used by application and project teams. This allows them to focus on business value and produce quality products for BEUMER Group's airport and logistics customers.   "In the Platform team, we develop some of the core frameworks on which BEUMER's software products and applications are built. Our 'customers' are the developers on the product teams, which is a rewarding challenge: our work impacts many people, so high software quality is a top priority." Yourself You are a software developer by nature, language agnostic, motivated by tools and new technologies. You have a relevant education and have worked already with some of following tools / Technologies: Docker Git / GitLab C# (.net6+) or/and Java (Quarkus) SQL/MSSQL RabbitMQ/Kafka & GRPC Prometheus, Kibana and/or Grafana Linux cyber security Interested? Then apply or call and let's have a chat. Contact persons: Senior Manager Ulrich Bjørn +45 53 84 65 12 Teamlead Marcel Rolfsmeyer +49 2521-24475. BEUMER Group Conveying, loading, palletizing, packing, sortation, and distribution – BEUMER Group is a leader within the development and manufacture of high-technological intralogistics systems for global markets. Our employees stand out from others thanks to their ability to supply innovative solutions to our customers. They can do this because they know the industry and are passionate about continuously developing and expanding their knowledge. We support these high standards through teamwork, mutual respect and a work culture based on trust that fosters stability and security for all our employees. Our common goal is to implement outstanding and innovative projects worldwide. Title: Data Engineer with a flair for DevOps for Research Portal Denmark - IT Service (AIT)
Description: Spring til hovedindhold.                                          Profil    Log af                                                                   Esc                                 Data Engineer with a flair for DevOps for Research Portal Denmark - IT Service (AIT)        Roskilde, Denmark                                       Jobbeskrivelse   We are seeking a new team member to join the Research Portal Denmark team. We are the developers of a national infrastructure that hosts an expanding array of databases, enabling open and robust overviews, insights, and analyses of Danish research.  Are you passionate about developing open-source software for research information infrastructures, working closely with a global community of developers and data providers? Do you enjoy taking part in the operation of our infrastructure, updating databases, and ensuring the stability and performance of our services? Are you experienced in these areas or do you aspire to be? Are you intrigued by the world of research and innovation?  If your answer is 'yes' to these questions, we encourage you to consider applying for this exciting opportunity at Research Portal Denmark, managed by DTU on behalf of the Ministry of Higher Education and Science.  Research Portal Denmark ( https://forskningsportal.dk ) is already available as a partial prototype, and will undergo significant expansion and development in the coming years:   Our databases will expand to cover not only publications but also funders and grants, patents, research datasets, clinical trials, policy papers, and the connections between these entities.  We will further develop our retrieval systems and analytical tools in terms of capacity and usability.  Our server and security infrastructures will grow to meet increasing demands.   Qualifications:   A relevant IT education and substantial experience in related roles.  Expertise in data engineering, ETL processes, and data modeling.  Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Perl, etc.  Strong experience with databases like MongoDB, Neo4J, and SQLite.  Experience in indexing using Apache Solr or Elasticsearch.  Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Google Data Studio, and VOSViewer.  Outstanding problem-solving and communication skills.  A genuine passion for data and a commitment to maintaining data quality.   We do not expect you to know everything when you start, but that you are a quick learner, committed and not least have the desire to familiarize yourself with new areas. Of course, we make sure that you get a good start in the team's tasks.  We are NORA, the National Open Research Analytics , a unit within DTU IT-Service dedicated to the Research Portal Denmark. We are a small and dedicated team consisting of 5 information specialists/data analysts and 5 software developers, including you. We are enthusiastic, hardworking, and enjoy what we do. We are always eager to learn and do more.  Our location is at Risø, in close proximity to DTU Research-IT and several of the nation's prominent data and supercomputing infrastructures. Normally, we work on-site at Risø three days a week and remotely for two days. You will collaborate with a multinational team and work with international partners, where English is the primary language of communication.  Salary and appointment terms The appointment will be based on the collective agreement with the Danish Confederation of Professional Associations (AC) or in accordance with the OAO-S Joint Agreement and the organization agreement for IT employees (Prosa) in the service of the state.  The position is a full-time position. Starting date is 1 March 2024 (or according to mutual agreement).  The workplace is DTU Risø, Roskilde Campus.  Application and contact Please submit your online application no later than 12 December 2023. Open the “Apply now” link, fill out the form and attach your motivated application, CV and exam certificates.  If you would like additional information about the position, please contact Polyxeni Makri polma@dtu.dk / 9351 8914 or Karen Hytteballe Ibanez kshi@dtu.dk / 9351 1902.  Applications received after the deadline will not be considered.  All interested candidates irrespective of age, gender, race, disability, religion, or ethnic background are encouraged to apply.  Technology for people  DTU develops technology for people. With our international elite research and study programmes, we are helping to create a better world and to solve the global challenges formulated in the UN’s 17 Sustainable Development Goals. Hans Christian Ørsted founded DTU in 1829 with a clear mission to develop and create value using science and engineering to benefit society. That mission lives on today. DTU has 13,500 students and 6,000 employees. We work in an international atmosphere and have an inclusive, evolving, and informal working environment. DTU has campuses in all parts of Denmark and in Greenland, and we collaborate with the best universities around the world. Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                         UI/Front-End Developer            Digital lab, AI team Ready to Shape the Future of AI & ML Technologies? - Are you a UI/Front-End Developer with a Touch of Curiosity and Boldness?  We're on the hunt for a talented amp; innovative UI/Front-End developer to join our dynamic team nestled in the heart of captivating Copenhagen. We are a pioneering cross-functional unit immersed in the enthralling realm of AI and ML technology.  With the power of cutting-edge technology and disruptive innovation at our fingertips, our objective is to create an intensely  As our UI/Front-End Developer, you'll be the creative brain behind our interface design. Your tech wizardry will empower our stakeholders - encompassing research and development departments, remote operation centers, and our esteemed customers - extracting maximum value from their data like never before.  Your mission won't just stop at design and build; you'll dive into the exciting world of new techniques with an experimental spirit ─ constantly exploring and challenging the status quo.  You will play an important role in:   Designing and developing highly interactive and intuitive user interface designs for our AI & ML-based models.  Continually testing and optimizing our front-end environments, ensuring seamless user-flow and exceptional user experience.  Work meticulously within a cross-functional team to develop data-driven solutions  Continually work hand-in-hand with our development departments and remote operation center   We imagine that you:  **Curiosity and Creativity**: As we work in a fast-pacing field of AI and ML, a burning desire to learn and experiment with new techniques is vital. You should be able to come up with out-of-the-box solutions and have a creative mind that doesn't stop at what already exists.  **Learning Agility**: A lifelong learner with a driving curiosity and the agility to pivot between projects and tasks smoothly. You're excited by new techniques, ideas, and perspectives. You are on a never-ending quest for growth and knowledge.  **Collaborative Spirit**: Our team thrives on synergy. It's important that you're both a team player and a clear communicator, capable of collaboratively working with a diverse, cross-functional team, and willingness to share and learn from others.  ️**User-Centric Focus**: An innate empathy towards end-users, understanding their needs, perspectives, and expectations will drive your design decisions.  **Tech Background** You have a strong relevant background in computer science, engineering or similar. You are Experienced in Angular as well as NX-Monorepo, DDD-Architecture (or similar), NGRX, RXJS and TDD.  Welcome to Digital lab, AI team MAN ES have formed a joint AI team consisting of software developers, data scientists, and engineering domain experts. The focus of the team is  to research and build POC’s,  AI models and projects using modern technologies and processes.  The team focus on getting their “hands dirty” with real-time problems rather than just focusing on the theoretical concepts involved.  What can you expect from us: ⚙️ **Welcome to MAN ES - Innovators of Marine Technology**  At MAN ES, we are charters of the unexplored, relentlessly pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the realm of 2-stroke marine engines. Offering state-of-the-art engine designs, we blend ingenuity with practicality, turning fascination into tangible, groundbreaking solutions every day. But our true engine of growth? Our team's open mindset and shared love for exploring the realms of technical possibilities.  ✅**Innovation Culture**: We encourage free thinking, welcoming new ideas and experimentation. Here, you'll have the power to question the status quo, bringing fresh perspectives and techniques to light.  ✅**Cross-functional Collaboration**: You'll get to work with various departments, broadening your scope of expertise, honing your communication skills, and bringing to work the thrill of solving diverse problems  ️ **Our Tech Ecosystem**: We are proud to leverage the AWS end-to-end tech stack, removing barriers to the utilization and execution of new technologies. This horizon of resources strengthens your convenience and ability to swiftly and seamlessly streamline any innovations. You'll be equipped with top-notch, cutting-edge technology to amplify and implement your ideas.   Unleash your potential: Join us towards a carbon-neutral future We offer you an opportunity to help shape the world of tomorrow – whether you are just starting out, taking your first career steps after graduation, or looking for the next big career challenge.  At MAN Energy Solutions, we focus on diversity and equality to create a creative and inclusive culture. We believe that a diverse workforce with a mix of gender, nationalities, and perspectives will drive innovation, creativity and productivity. We are committed to our employees’ well-being, and you will have the opportunity to join different social activities from yoga and fishing to creative clubs.  We prioritize work-life balance, offering flexible working hours, the possibility of working from home, and mental well-being including health insurance and focus on work atmosphere. Here you have opportunities for growth, development, and mentorship.  At MAN Energy Solutions, you can create, drive, build, and be a part of improving innovative energy solutions while achieving your personal career goals.  About MAN Energy Solutions   250 years of experience in advanced engineering  We deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe  We operate under the motto "Future in The Making" as it reflects our dedication to developing sustainable solutions and actively contributing to a carbon-neutral economy  We have over 15,000 employees worldwide. In Denmark, we are 2,200 passionate employees with more than 40 nationalities   Build your own future Please submit your application to us no later than Sunday the 10th of December 2023. We will conduct interviews during the application period. If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Chief Digital Officer Gregory Puckett by email at gregory.puckett@man-es.com. More information about the company can be found at www.man-es.com  We encourage all qualified candidates regardless of gender, age, religion, disability and ethnic background to apply for this position.            Application due 12/10/2023  Start date Start as soon as possible   Work hours  Category  Position type Engineering Development  Workplace Teglholmsgade 41, 2450 København SV  Homepage man-es.com     Contact         E-mail                  E-mail                  E-mail                  E-mail                More vacant positions  Follow us         With headquarter in Germany, MAN Energy Solutions employs around 15,000 people worldwide. Of these, we are approx. 2,200 passionate employees in Denmark in 3 locations: Copenhagen, Frederikshavn and Holeby. With more than 250 years of experience in advanced engineering, we deliver a unique portfolio of technologies and opportunities in the development of engines for use on ships and in power plants across the globe. At MAN Energy Solutions we have the technologies and the experience to make a significant contribution to decarbonization. That's why we care about "Moving Big Things to Zero”. "So that the small things matter, too."                                       ShareThis Copy and Paste

Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                                  Senior Software Engineer   Cloud Services   |   Backend   |   Infrastructure   |   Data Science   |   Machine Learning  We are looking for a senior software engineer that can work alongside our data scientists to develop cloud-based analytics and machine learning solutions for the food production industry world-wide.  Scio+ is part of the SKOV A/S group of companies and we are the competence center for data-driven and vision-based solutions for the food production industry within the livestock segment. We provide production insights and predictions by applying machine learning techniques to discrete data and vision data from farm production sites. These innovative solutions focus on bringing added value to the production by optimizing processes, reducing cost and not least by reducing environmental footprint and improving animal welfare.  Working in Scio+  You will be a member of an international, skilled, highly motivated and self-driven team of software developers and data scientists spanning different educational backgrounds and competences. We do weekly sprint-like iterations, focusing our work on what adds value to our customers. We work as a DevOps teams meaning that we are responsible for developing, running and maintain our services.  We expect you to be passionate about development infrastructure backend and deployment of machine learning solutions. We value individuals who have an open and positive attitude towards colleagues, are ambitious about their work, and what we can achieve together.  You will be working together with colleagues in other development teams which are located globally in our regional offices.  What profile are we looking for?   You have a master's or PhD degree in computer science, engineering or in a related field  You are an experienced software developer (3-5 years+) that understand the challenges in designing and implementing and running cloud-based services  You have experience in delivering solutions using continuous integration and continuous delivery. It is beneficial if you have experience with continuous training of ML models  You have experience in Java, and it is a plus if you know .Net and Python.  You have experience with Azure or other cloud platforms like AWS or GCP  You have experience with Event-Streaming Platforms such as Apache Kafka or Azure Eventhub  You care about agile development processes and continuously improving velocity and applications  You like to foster the agile mindset within the group  You know the importance of data security  You are a great team player with a willingness to take responsibility in completing the different tasks for us to reach our goals together  You are flexible when it comes to tasks and able to keep an overview of multiple tasks in a sometimes hectic environment   What would you actually be doing?   Support, improve and maintain our current cloud infrastructure backend  Building reliable and secure data collection systems for experimentations and for production-ready systems  Create transparency on the health and the performance of cloud infrastructure for solutions in production and drive optimizations on operation and costs  Participate in chapter-work with other development teams in our group  Impact new products development on the infrastructure side   Join us  We offer a flexible work arrangement with respect for a healthy work–life balance for all employees, and a unique opportunity to make your impact on the organization as it grows together with you. We offer you to join social activities with your colleagues, also here we hope you might have a great idea for some activities.  Want to know more?  Please contact Recruitment Consultant Luqman Mohammed-Brown, phone +45 88 74 11 43 or by e-mail: l.mohammed-brown@frankgroup.com  Apply for the job  We are assessing applications on an ongoing basis, so please send your cover letter, CV and relevant attachments as soon as possible to Recruitment Consultant Luqman Mohammed-Brown by e-mail: l.mohammed-brown@frankgroup.com     Scio+ is an ambitious young company working at the forefront of data science in the food production sector. Our vision is to be a world class partner in data driven livestock yield optimization and our mission is to optimize livestock food production yield across the entire value chain by providing reliable data driven insights.        Apply for position  Application due: 12/29/2023  Workplace: Denmark  Position category: Research & Development        Share/Print    Questions regarding the position        Simon Binderup Johansen   Business Development Director  sij@skov.dk  +4572175588                                                                                ShareThis Copy and Paste

Do you have a strong technical and theoretical background and enjoy working with quality code and complex data? Then you might be the future team lead at ForeFlight!  ... the role ForeFlight is looking for an experienced team lead or a senior developer with experience and motivation to lead a team of skilled specialists and software developers for a Jeppesen-brand commercial flight planning system. You will be responsible for the Jeppesen product brand leading your team from requirements to implementation. You will also be assuming responsibility for the people management of your team including being enrolled in our management processes and leadership development programme which includes receiving supervision, mentoring and coaching on leadership-related topics yourself. The backend code (C#/.NET) is hosted in AWS, and the team itself is responsible for creating everything from feature specifications to deployment and running and managing the code. You will get to work with complex data models and aviation data, and we are therefore looking for someone who likes to dive deep into the theory. The quality of the product is more important than speed. So in this role you will help facilitate a good environment for the team, where thorough testing and a high theoretical understanding is at the center. your profile You are an experienced team lead or maybe a senior developer with experience and motivation to take on leadership responsibility for a team of skilled specialists and software developers. In order to succeed in this role, you should be able to recognize yourself in more than one of the following points: - Your educational background might be a bachelor’s degree or beyond within software development and computer science or another relevant field - You are experienced or very familiar with all aspects of software development, and you have a solid understanding of architecture, technology and the conditions that apply to software development environments - You have experience with C#/.NET and cloud environment - You master English with professional proficiency both written and oral as the industry is predominantly English speaking about foreflight AviationCloud A/S was established in 2012 and is the legal entity of ForeFlight in Denmark. ForeFlight includes 450 employees globally with offices in Odense in Denmark as well as Austin and Houston in Texas and Portland in Maine, USA. Få kontrol over dine cookies Hos Randstad kombinerer vi teknologiens fortrin med vores HR-medarbejderes lidenskab for at skabe en mere menneskelig oplevelse. For at nå dette mål benytter vi os af teknologi – inklusive cookies. Hvis du samtykker i installationen af alle de beskrevne cookies, skal du klikke på "acceptér cookies". Hvis du ønsker at tilpasse dine cookie-indstillinger, skal du klikke på "cookie-indstillinger" for at markere, hvilke cookies du accepterer. Hvis du kun vil acceptere installation af strengt nødvendige cookies, skal du klikke på "afvis alle". Du kan læse om de cookies, vi bruger, og hvorfor, i vores cookie-politik. cookie-indstillinger  afvis alle  acceptér cookies Præferencecenter for privatlivets fred Når du besøger en hjemmeside, kan den gemme eller indhente oplysninger fra din browser, hovedsagelig i form af cookies. Disse oplysninger kan handle om dig, dine præferencer, din enhed og anvendes ofte til at få hjemmesiden til at fungere korrekt. Oplysningerne identificerer normalt ikke dig direkte, men de kan give dig en mere personlig hjemmesideoplevelse. Du kan vælge ikke at tillade visse typer cookies. Klik på de forskellige overskrifter for at finde ud af mere og ændre i vores standardindstillinger. Du bør dog vide, at blokering af visse typer cookies kan eventuelt påvirke din oplevelse med henblik på hjemmesiden og de tjenester, vi kan tilbyde. Mere information tillad alle Administrer indstillinger for samtykke meget nødvendige cookies Altid aktive Disse cookies er nødvendige for, at hjemmesiden kan fungere og kan ikke slås fra i vores systemer. De er normalt kun indstillet som svar på handlinger foretaget af dig, f.eks. en anmodning om tjenester, som f.eks. indstilling af dine personlige præferencer, indlogning eller udfyldning af en formular. Du kan indstille din browser til at blokere eller advare dig om disse cookies, men nogle dele af hjemmesiden vil dermed muligvis ikke fungere. Oplysninger om cookies‎ funktionelle cookies   funktionelle cookies  Disse cookies giver mulighed for forbedret funktionalitet og personalisering med henblik på f.eks. videoer og live chat. De kan blive indstillet af os eller af tredjepartsleverandører, hvis tjenester vi har tilføjet til vores sider. Hvis du ikke tillader disse cookies, kan nogle eller alle disse funktionaliteter muligvis ikke fungere korrekt. Oplysninger om cookies‎ performance cookies   performance cookies  Disse cookies giver os mulighed for at tælle besøgende og trafikkilder, så vi kan måle og forbedre ydeevnen af vores hjemmeside. De hjælper os med at finde ud af, hvilke sider der er mest og mindst populære samt hvordan de besøgende bevæger sig rundt på hjemmesiden. Alle oplysninger, som disse cookies indsamler, er aggregerede og derfor anonyme. Hvis du ikke tillader disse cookies, vil vi ikke have information om, hvornår du har besøgt vores hjemmeside. Oplysninger om cookies‎ målrettede cookies   målrettede cookies  Disse cookies indstilles gennem vores side af vores reklamepartnere. De kan blive brugt af disse virksomheder til at opbygge en profil for dine interesser og vise dig relevante reklamer på andre hjemmesider. De identificerer din unikke browser og enhed. Hvis du ikke tillader disse cookies, vil du ikke opleve vores målrettet annoncering på tværs af forskellige hjemmesider. Oplysninger om cookies‎ sociale medier - cookies   sociale medier - cookies  Disse cookies er angivet af en række sociale medier, som vi har tilføjet til hjemmesiden, så du kan dele vores indhold med dine venner og netværk. De kan spore din browser på tværs af andre hjemmesider og opbygge en profil for dine interesser. Dette kan påvirke indholdet og meddelelserne, du ser på andre hjemmesider, som du besøger. & Nbsp; & nbsp; Hvis du ikke tillader disse cookies, kan du muligvis ikke bruge eller se disse delningsværktøjer. Stresstest Mål dit stressniveau      Talenttest Find dine arbejdstalenter        Guides       Ansøgninger Sådan skriver du en god ansøgning    CV Få de bedste tips til dit CV      Jobsamtale Gør et godt indtryk til samtalen    Lønforhandling Stå stærkt til lønforhandlingen      Opsigelse Brug denne guide og kom godt videre    Uopfordret ansøgning Sådan søger du uopfordret      Dit første job Værktøjer og tips til dit nye arbejdsliv    Jobglæde Sæt jobglæde på agendaen        Kurser       6 ugers jobrettet uddannelse Opgrader dine kompetencer      Jobsøgningskursus Skab struktur i din jobsøgning              For arbejdsgivere    Tilmeld dig Jobindex    Switch to English        Log ind  Opret profil                    Søg job       Gemte job       Jobagent       Mere     Overblik   Ansøgninger   Henvendelser   CV   QuickApply-profil   Virksomheder   Råd og vejledning   Indstillinger          Save  Share  Apply        CSIS Security Group A/S    Copenhagen     Share    Save      Senior Software Developer     Do you want to be part of a company on the forefront of the fight against cybercrime? Do you like working with vast amounts of data and take pride in delivering great code? Would you like to enjoy having a good work-life balance in a mid-size company in the middle of Copenhagen? Are you ready to have fun with but also draw inspiration from your colleagues?   Make a profound impact in cybersecurity  Our 70+ skilled employees from all over the world help businesses and government organizations prevent and manage cyberattacks. You will be an essential part of our development team which currently has 14 employees and 6 nationalities. You'll also be part of an inclusive culture that values everyone's contribution – especially yours! We emphasize good collaboration across teams, disciplines and levels. You will meet some very dedicated colleagues who love their work and who at the same enjoy having fun together.  We encourage working from home when it best fits your schedule and are always happy to see you in the office to join our tight-knit team.  Our stack:   Python 3 - FastAPI, Pydantic, SqlAlchemy, Flask  PostgreSQL, Redis, ElasticSearch  Kubernetes, Docker  Terraform  Google Cloud, AWS  Linux  Git   About the job  You will be part of our Cyber Intelligence Services team, which is responsible for the systems that collect, structure, and categorize information about threats on the Internet.  But there will be projects across the department as well as in the other product teams to which you will also contribute. Your primary tasks will be scoping, estimating, and executing together with the Product Owner as well as reviewing code across all teams.  Examples of tasks you will encounter:   Bottleneck identification and remediation in our data ingestion pipeline. This could involve new forms of instrumentation that you add to our stack at the same time.  Back-of-envelope evaluation of technologies in relation to a concrete identified problem.  We see the same type of bug over and over again – you design a test that reveals the problem and make sure it's part of our CI/CD.   About you  The most important thing for us is that you are motivated for what you do and take pride in delivering a good job – together with your colleagues. You can see yourself in our values, so you are responsible, show respect for others, and are proactive.  In addition to 5-10 years of practical experience with several of the technologies in our stack, you must have experience with CI/CD pipelines.  In addition, we value if you:   Have a healthy mix of pragmatism and ideology  Can work independently as well as in teams – you will do both  Can receive and give respectful and constructive criticism  Good language skills in English, both written and oral, as the working language is English in CSIS   We offer  We offer an exciting and meaningful job in a growing market-leading company. But most importantly, we offer the most amazing and committed colleagues you can dream of. In addition, of course, we have:   Pension scheme, health insurance and dental insurance  Flexible working hours and the possibility of working from home  5 weeks of vacation + 5 floating vacation days (feriefridage)  Delicious, healthy and varied lunch scheme (including vegetarian and vegan options)  Free phone and internet  Company subsidized massage  Lots of social events   About the position   Start Date: as soon as possible.  Place of work: Vestergade 2B, 4th floor, 1456 Copenhagen  Salary and terms of employment: Terms are agreed in relation to your qualifications. It's a full-time permanent position.   How to apply   To apply for this position, click 'Apply' and submit your personal and contact details as well as your CV and a motivated application  If you have any questions: please contact Development Manager Serban Ghiuta ( lsg@csis.com ) or Director of Development Hauke Lübbers ( hjl@csis.com )  Interviews: We will schedule ongoing interviews. SW Product Owner           Application Deadline:            Workplace:  Hybrid Position          Location:    Bjerringbro, DK, 8850             Contract Type:  Full-Time          Working Hours:  37          Employment Type:  Regular                Would you like to participate in developing software for future products and platforms within embedded software development at Grundfos ?    Then join the SW Platform & Architecture department in Bjerringbro. We are responsible for developing embedded software from low level hardware drivers to application layer features for our complete product portfolio. In this position as product owner, you work with defining and prioritizing backlog for your software development teams. You will be part of a department consisting of product owners, architechs, SCRUM Masters and software developers where you will report to Senior Manager, Erik Adam Schulz Laursen:    “You will join a team of experienced specialists who both complement and challenge each other, to continuously do better and develop the best solutions. “, Erik says.    What is the job about?  Your  key tasks will be to specify and prioritize the software backlog, so it is prepared for the embedded software teams in your area of responsibility. To do this you will have a close cooperation with our business developers, project stakeholders, product owners, software architects and the development teams.    Your main responsibilities :   Ensuring that the software backlogs for your embedded software development teams are visible, transparent, and clear to all, and shows what the development team will work on next.  Creating, specifying, and maintaining backlog items in cooperation with business, peer product owners and architects.  Be available for development teams to clarify and discuss ambiguities.  Participate in software development governance and feature model governance within software development.  Coordination and alignment of dependencies with other product owners and teams including proactive stakeholder management. There will be elements of project management in this position.   It is an advantage if you understand development of embedded systems and have application knowledge from water systems. Understanding of working in a global organization across different cultures and development sites is a plus.  “The challenge in this position lies in transforming business and technology needs into tangible backlog items through collaboration with relevant stakeholders. It requires that you can have focus on both short- and long-term needs ensuring that our short-term goals do not block long-term requirements”, Erik explains .    Your background :  What we are looking for in you is your ability to transform business and technology needs into an executable backlog combined with some project management experience. Any understanding of the products we deliver is highly beneficial, and you probably hold a relevant bachelor’s or master’s degree. Also, you have excellent communication and facilitation skills, enabling you to work with software professionals as well as business organization on technical projects.      What’s in it for you?  Whether it’s developing leadership skills or advancing your expertise even further, we’ll support you with continuous learning and development opportunities, to help discuss and steer your long-term Grundfos career path. You’ll be welcomed from day one into an inclusive, trusting environment guided by six core values .    In addition, your day-to-day benefits include:   If you’ll be working from your home office, we’ll make sure you are well equipped with a good workstation. However, you are always welcome to our offices where you can engage, learn, and have fun with colleagues  On top of it, flexible working hours and up to 3 days’ additional paid leave for volunteering of your choice  Annual bonuses, health insurance, parental support, internal well-being consultants and programmes  Access to the modern Grundfos Academy to pursue further both personal and professional development  Diverse, inclusive environment with employee-led forums offering colleagues a safe place to connect and share openly     Do you want to learn more?  If you have questions or would like to know more about this position, please contact Senior Manager, Erik Adam Schulz Laursen, on +45 20222009 .      If this job sounds appealing, please send your resume and cover letter by clicking “Apply”.    To dig deeper into the Grundfos universe, follow us on LinkedIn or Youtube , and t o get to know some of your future colleagues and why they love working at Grundfos, check out Meet our people    We look forward to hearing from you.                About Grundfos  Grundfos is one of the world’s leading water technology companies with more than 19.000 employees in 60+ countries all over the world. Our skills commit us to pioneering solutions to the world’s water and climate challenges and improve the quality of life for people. We dare to do things that others cannot or dare not do, as we believe innovation is not only a business opportunity, but an obligation. And what really matters to us is not short term profit, but the impact we make. By becoming part of our united powerful team, you too can drive this change no matter your role.  An inclusive team If you like the look of this job and know you can bring your skills to contribute to our purpose, please apply. We need and welcome professional people from all corners – however you identify and whatever your background is. Global security and stability are under pressure, and innovative solutions are needed in the Defence Industry.   MDSI is looking for an embedded software developer to work on an innovative new product. In this position, you will have a central role in the company and influence the development of a capability that does not exist in the market.  Tasks  Your main task will be to work on the development of the new product, as a part of MDSI's team of hardware and software developers.  You will be working in a small team and among other things tasks will include integrating hardware and software, writing device drivers for sensors and actuators and developing the control system.  You will be able to benefit from continuous sparring with management, colleagues, and experts in a broad range of fields.  What we are looking for in a candidate   Qualifications    A relevant education within embedded software development  General experience with Linux  Experience working within a larger software framework  Experience with the following topics is an advantage: Realtime operating systems, UAV’s, control systems, navigation and sensor fusion  Must achieve Nato Secret security clearance (MDSI will apply on your behalf)  We are looking for candidates with 3+ years' working experience, but exceptions can be made depending on the type of experience    Personal Characteristics    You have personal drive and take initiative  You are responsible and self-reliant  You are structured in your approach to tasks and know how to prioritize  You take pride in writing quality software and view documentation as a natural part of the development cycle  You thrive in an entrepreneurial environment and have a flexible mindset   About MDSI ApS  MDSI is a young company founded in 2017. With several decades of military aviation experience, and a deep knowledge of defence technology and operations, we at MDSI specialize in developing high-tech equipment and capabilities for military purposes.  Our mission is to combine military operational experience with rapid innovation to deliver innovative solutions to a market that is traditionally slow moving. MDSI currently consists of 12 dedicated employees, including 7 engineers, and we expect to add 5-6 new employees to our team within the next year.  We Offer  This is a unique opportunity to become part of an exciting company with committed colleagues thoroughly experienced in starting up their own business, and with a product with great potential within its industry. You will occupy an influential post and get the opportunity to develop your skills through challenging tasks. Our tone is informal, and we attach great importance to learning and knowledge sharing. We have health insurance, dental insurance, pension scheme, and offices near public transportation in central Copenhagen.  Application and Contact  Please send your resume, cover letter, and relevant appendices to job@mdsi.dk .  All inquiries will be processed continuously and treated confidentially.  If you would like to know more about this opportunity, feel free to contact us on +45 91 567 007.   Start: As soon as possible.  Working hours: Full-time.  Workplace: Copenhagen Oe  Salary and conditions: By qualifications. Title: Developer, Software for Self-Protection Systems, Aeronautics, Lystrup
Description: Developer, Software for Self-Protection Systems, Aeronautics, Lystrup       We are looking for a passionate software developer to be a part of a team that creates world-class software for our self-protection systems within the aerospace domain.  Are you excited about the opportunity to develop software for the best self-protection systems for jet fighters, military transport aircraft, helicopters, and other aircraft worldwide?  Do you want to work closely together with engineers, computer scientists, and systems engineers to maintain and build systems used by nations around the world?  Then we have a unique opportunity for you!  Job description  We are looking for a passionate developer for our Self-Protection Systems software (SPS SW)  department to join the Flight team that maintains and builds mission-critical software for military aircraft.  The department is part of the Self-Protection Systems (SPS) organization which consists of approximately 60 engineers across Denmark and the US working within systems, hardware,  electronics, automated test equipment, and mechanical engineering disciplines.  The department delivers Flight and Ground software; the former is embedded Operational Flight Program (OFP) software for supporting inflight  operations during missions; the latter is high-level application software for supporting pre- and postflight operations on the ground, such as mission planning and debriefing.  In total, the staff of permanent employees in the department is 15, split between the Flight software team and the Ground software team.  You will be part of the Flight software team and primarily work with the Flight software, but you will get the opportunity to also work with the high-level application software, should you have  the will and desire.  Areas of responsibility  Your responsibilities will cover:   Develop maintainable, testable embedded code for proprietary and COTS hardware.  Participate in code review practices to provide and receive constructive feedback.  Work closely together with the architects and systems engineers.  Help maintain our integrated toolchain.  Maintain and review technical documentation such as requirements specifications, test specifications, and interface control documents.  Develop automated test suites, unit tests, and integration tests and conduct tests on real hardware in the lab.   You will work with these technologies :   C++ and C.  Microsoft Visual Studio and Visual Studio Code with Resharper Ultimate.  Real-Time Operating Systems.  Google Test.   What’s our company like?  We are an international company representing world-class expertise, delivering complex and high-tech products. We value our colleagues and our meaningful contributions to securing people through advanced technology. During your onboarding in Terma, you can expect a thorough introduction and training in our systems and processes, as well as a strong focus on teaching you useful new competencies and further strengthening current ones, both professionally and personally. Our company culture is autonomous and engaging, and we acknowledge the importance of flexibility in a great working environment. In our different locations, we offer various social activities to bring all our colleagues together.  How to succeed in this position?  Minimum qualifications:   You hold a relevant degree in computer science or engineering.  You have a desire to work with software architecture and business logic.  You speak and understand English (all documentation is in English).   The ideal candidate:   You have a few years of professional work experience.  Experience with design patterns and understanding of S.O.L.I.D principles.  Experience with task management and knowledge-sharing tools like Jira and Confluence.  Experience with the continuous integration tools Git, Gerrit, and Jenkins.  Understanding of agile development.   The two most important personal characteristics are, first and foremost, the ability to function well in the context of teamwork. Building mission-critical software often involves working within teams or with stakeholders that are multidisciplinary; effective communication, collaboration, and teamwork skills are crucial for coordinating efforts, exchanging information, and ensuring successful project execution. Next, attention to detail is highly valued; building software for mission-critical use requires a meticulous approach and a strong focus on detail, precision, and accuracy to ensure that the software functions reliably and meets the strict requirements and specifications.  We have fun at work with an informal and relaxed working environment although, at the same time, we are aware of the crucial nature of the solutions that we are a part of – and we’d love to have you on board!  Any unanswered questions?  Feel free to contact Hans Kristian Lintrup, Senior Manager at +45 2328 7483 or hkl@terma.com in case of any further questions regarding this position.  We look forward to receiving your application and CV. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com .  Application deadline: Applications will be processed continuously.  Bear in mind that you must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defence Intelligence Service. This entails that you, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.  The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.  T erma A/S is headquartered at Aarhus, Denmark. Internationally, Terma has subsidiaries and operations in The Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, United Kingdom, United Arab Emirates, India, Singapore and the U.S.          Application deadline: Ongoing A cookie is a small text file that stores your internet settings on your computer, smartphone or other devices. Your internet browser downloads the cookie the first time you visit a website. Cookies are used by most websites and are often essential for the website to function properly. They can even improve your user experience when you return to a website you have visited previously – but only if you are using the same device and the same internet browser. The cookies will then remember your preferences. The law states that we can store cookies on your device if they are strictly necessary for the operation of this site. For all other types of cookies we need your permission. This site uses different types of cookies. Some cookies are placed by third party services that appear on our pages. You can at any time change or withdraw your consent from the Cookie Declaration on our website. Learn more about who we are, how you can contact us and how we process personal data in our Privacy Policy . Please state your consent ID and date when you contact us regarding your consent. Title: Embedded Software Developer
Description: 31.200 job i dag         For jobsøgere    For arbejdsgivere     DA    EN          Log ind  Opret profil                Jobsøgning       Søg job Vælg mellem flere søgekriterier    Din side Skab overblik over din jobsøgning      Jobagent Få nye job direkte i din indbakke    CV Opret dit CV og bliv headhuntet      QuickApply-profil Søg jobbet nemt fra mobilen    Jobannoncearkiv Find inspiration i udløbne jobopslag      Få en jobvejleder Bliv afklaret i din jobsøgning    Jobs For Ukraine Hjælper ukrainske flygtninge med at få job        Arbejdspladser       Se virksomhedsprofiler Få viden om din næste arbejdsplads      Evaluér arbejdsplads Hvordan er din arbejdsplads?
