Stresstest Mål dit stressniveau      Talenttest Find dine arbejdstalenter        Guides       Ansøgninger Sådan skriver du en god ansøgning    CV Få de bedste tips til dit CV      Jobsamtale Gør et godt indtryk til samtalen    Lønforhandling Stå stærkt til lønforhandlingen      Opsigelse Brug denne guide og kom godt videre    Uopfordret ansøgning Sådan søger du uopfordret      Dit første job Værktøjer og tips til dit nye arbejdsliv    Jobglæde Sæt jobglæde på agendaen        Kurser       6 ugers jobrettet uddannelse Opgrader dine kompetencer      Jobsøgningskursus Skab struktur i din jobsøgning              For arbejdsgivere    Tilmeld dig Jobindex    Switch to English        Log ind  Opret profil                    Søg job       Gemte job       Jobagent       Mere     Overblik   Ansøgninger   Henvendelser   CV   QuickApply-profil   Virksomheder   Råd og vejledning   Indstillinger          Save  Share  Apply        Shure Scandinavia A/S    Copenhagen     Share    Save      Embedded Software Developer    Overview  Shure has an ambitious goal of offering our customers innovative ecosystems of top-quality software to support our networked devices. In Copenhagen, we design and develop high quality conferencing products and solutions. As we are expanding our product portfolio, we are looking for an Embedded Software Developer to join our team in Ørestad, Copenhagen.  Keep your designs in balance with our software ecosystem   We are a technology-driven company that embraces the SAFe methodology. While we operate in sprints, we don't succumb to the pressures of haste. Our emphasis lies in producing high-quality code rather than resorting to quick workarounds. In this role, you will be working with everything from low-level drivers to high level MCU application code. Using your programming skills, you will ensure that our mechanics, hardware, and algorithms are integrated to connect our devices.  Be part of a culture that makes people stay on   You will join a team of around 10 embedded software developers. At Shure, we appreciate collaboration, commitment, and innovation as well as a natural interest in solving complex issues. We strive towards achieving extraordinary results and we are not afraid of taking on challenging tasks.  Responsibilities  In your new position, you will be part of a cross-functional, cross-site development team that designs and implements cutting edge audio products, platforms and technologies.  Your daily tasks will typically include:   Designing, developing, and debugging embedded application software written in C++ for 16/32-bit processors running RTOS or embedded Linux.  Designing, developing, and debugging low-level peripheral device drivers for controlling external HW modules, ASICS, FPGAs or similar.  Reviewing system requirements and developing software designs accordingly. Conducting and participating in firmware architecture and design reviews.  Developing and maintaining unit tests for testing your implementation. Participating in system integration efforts.  Contributing to CI-CD pipelines as necessary and helping in developing relevant tools to ensure that continuous delivery chain is always functional.   Qualifications  Who we think you are You have a B.Sc. degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, or similar, and minimum 2 years of experience designing and developing embedded firmware.   You are very skilled with C and C++ and have a demonstrated understanding of object-oriented design using UML diagrams.  You have solid knowledge and experience utilizing object-oriented design patterns and architectures.  You understand key software design principles such as: separation of concerns, high cohesion and low coupling to facilitate reuse as well as maintainability in software architecture.  You develop unit tests using frameworks such as CUnit, CppTest and/or GoogleTest.  You are familiar with version control tools such as Subversion and Git.   Furthermore, it is a plus if you are experienced with:   Scripting languages such as Bash and Python.  Test automation frameworks such as Robot and Selenium.  Working in a team setup using the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe).  Knowledge of low-latency audio networking protocols such as Dante and AES67.  Development of embedded Linux firmware components using the Yocto project framework.  Wireless technologies such as GSM, Bluetooth, LTE, Wi-Fi, WiMAX.   In addition to your technical skills, you are a great team player who loves to share your knowledge - just as your colleagues do. Since Shure is a global company, you will get the chance to collaborate with development teams located in the United States, Scotland, India and China.  Our value proposition to you  We see software development as a team effort, and you will join a collaborative mix of employees with different levels of experience. We are a company of passionate and dedicated people, and our technological innovations are the result of the creativity and dedication of our Associates.  We offer you an exciting and challenging job with ample opportunity for learning and growth as well as an attractive compensation package reflective of your experience and qualifications.  In this role, you will become part of an inspiring and flexible workplace with a dynamic work environment and great colleagues that appreciate, support and respect one another. We believe in the value of a good work-life balance and do our outmost to ensure that our employees thrive in our well-established company culture of innovation and high quality. Shure is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and cherish inclusion in the workplace.  Our technological innovations are the result of the creativity and dedication of our employees, and in short, it is our employees who define our culture and make Shure a great place to work!  Applying for the job  The mix matters: We recognize that every professional journey is unique and are committed to providing an equitable candidate experience for all prospective Shure Associates. If you are excited about this role, believe you have the skills to be successful, and you share our passion for creating an inclusive, diverse, equitable, and accessible work environment, then apply!  To find out more about this job, please contact Ömer Yurdal at: +45 3248 2300.   About Shure Shure’s mission is to be the most trusted audio brand worldwide – and for nearly a century, our Core Values have aligned us to be just that. Founded in 1925, we are a leading global manufacturer of audio equipment known for quality, reliability, and durability. We engineer microphones, headphones, wireless audio systems, conferencing systems, and more. And quality doesn’t stop at our products. Our talented teams strive for perfection and innovate every chance they get. We offer an Associate-first culture, flexible work arrangements, and opportunity for all.  Shure is headquartered in United States. We have more than 35 regional sales offices, engineering hubs, and manufacturing facilities throughout the Americas, EMEA, and Asia.  In our Copenhagen office, we are 55 dedicated and committed employees that value the exchange of ideas, high quality in everything that we do and respect for each other. Located in Ørestad, we have bright new offices, a good canteen as well as an open work environment and an informal tone. At Shure, we always aim at taking good care of our employees and do what we can to ensure that they thrive in our well-established company culture of innovation and high quality. Title: Software developer - Backend .NET
Company: Peak Rekruttering recruiting on behalf of SKATEPRO ApS
Description: Software developer - Backend .NET Stillingsbetegnelse: Software developer - Backend .NET Kontaktperson: Bettina Askjær v. Peak Rekruttering Virksomhed: SkatePro ApS Geografisk placering: Region Midtjylland By: Søften v. Aarhus N. SOFTWARE DEVELOPER WANTED FOR ONE OF EUROPES LEADING ACTION SPORTS WEBSHOPS We are searching for a backend .NET developer with at least 5 years of professional experience. You will be part of a team consisting of 3 web developers, who is working on the customer facing website, and 2 backend developers, as well as 2 student developers, primarily working on the internal systems at SkatePro. YOUR PRIMARY TASKS WILL BE:  Development and correction of existing internal systems.  Implementation and integration of new systems and features.  Focus on optimizing internal workflows and processes with the use of IT solutions.  Helping and guiding student and junior developers in software development.   PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS:  We are an international company, so you must be able to speak and write English.  Minimum 5 years of professional experience with .NET 5+ and/or .NET Framework (C#).  Experience with Microsoft SQL Server.  Experience with Continuous Integration/Deployment, i.e. Jenkins, Teamcity or similar is a plus.  Experience with Messaging Queues, for example RabbitMQ or similar, is a plus.  Have you worked with, and maybe even developed in Microsoft C5, then you are a strong candidate.  At least 5 years of professional experience from a similar position is a requirement, and you must be able to work with existing code in multiple projects.   WE OFFER: An informal international working environment with highly focused employees. We are facing further expansion outside of Europe, so we offer a unique opportunity to help shape the international action sports store of the future. Salary is according to qualifications. ABOUT SKATEPRO: SkatePro was founded in 1996. We are one of Europe's largest E-commerce companies within Action Sports. We want to "Support, Inspire, Grow" action sports. We are an idealistic company that does not recommend anything we cannot vouch for ourselves. We want to be trustworthy, professional and customer-oriented. We have won the Stock Exchange's Gazelle award 5 times, and the E-commerce award 5 times. We have also won the Gold Award and received silver in the European E-commerce award in 2015. We have been named EY Entrepreneur of the year and were a top 5 finalist in 2018. You will be part of a company where over 25 different nationalities are employed in Søften in Aarhus and our average age is 27 years. We give high priority to social events outside working hours, where we go out and wake board, go on ski trips, inline marathon in Berlin etc. PRACTICAL INFORMATION:  37 hours per week.  We want you to start as soon as possible.  Application deadline: We hold interviews continuously, so send your application as soon as possible.  Workplace: Omega 6, Søften, 8382 Hinnerup, Denmark.  Flexible working hours.    Send ansøgning                     Du har allerede ansøgt    Du har allerede sendt din ansøgning med denne e-mail. Hvis du vil ændre din ansøgning, så henvend dig til den rette kontaktperson.     Luk

Get the best experience with speed, security and privacy by using the latest version of Chrome, Firefox, Microsoft Edge, Safari or Opera   ×                                        Senior Software Developer      Do you want to be a part of developing software for Weibel’s advanced Doppler radars?  In Weibel we develop complex radar systems to customers over most of the world. We are constantly improving and optimizing our front-end software along with our core backend systems. We are looking for a new colleague to join our software development team in order to strengthen and preserve our ability to stay on top in a challenging and advanced part of modern software industry.  Our challenge is to build a new intuitive GUI based UI with a UX that will help radar operators to utilize all the new and advanced features we are adding to our radar systems. On one hand, the operator must have access to the sophisticated and advanced functionality found in our modern radars. On the other hand, the system must limit the amount of information to only the most important information required to maintain the full overview in e.g., satellite launches or when monitoring large areas at land and sea.    Develop and implement software to control advanced radar systems  You will be part of a team that develop and maintain code for handling UI, communication, calculations, data storage and much more. Your tasks will primarily be to:   Design and implement new functionality  Optimize and develop our existing solutions  Architectural and interface definitions in teams of 2-6 developers  Develop unit- and integration test of your code  System test in simulated environments and on full radar systems  Our technical environment consists of Visual Studio C++/C#, .NET6, Git and Azure DevOps.     Solid experience across Windows applications  You will be part of a team with extensive self-governance meaning it is the team that design and implement the solutions and at the same time are responsible for quality and deadlines. We have a user centric mind-set that enables us to keep track of details while ensuring that the end-user is provided with an intuitive and easily accessible solution.  Your professional CV comprises:   Expert programming skills in C#  Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF)  Experience with development of Windows applications  Experience with Azure DevOps  Knowledge of parallel programming  Good communication skills in English both written and spoken   We expect you to have a technical background in software development for engineering, but we do not expect you to have radar knowledge. The most important thing is that you are motivated for a steep learning curve, we have a tailored introduction ready for you.  It is a requirement for this position that you can obtain a security clearance.    Your new team  Our team consists of 11 highly competent and dedicated colleagues, and we work closely together with the rest of Weibel’s software teams with approximately 50 developers across the different teams. We are a part of Weibel’s Technology department where you will join more than 140 engineering colleagues and together design and develop the best solutions for our customers. We have all of our development in-house and our competencies spans across many technical fields such as system engineering, mechanical, electrical, hardware, software and technical design.    Contact and application  Apply through our website using the ”Apply” button. If you have any questions, please reach out to Application Software manager, Jakob Seedorff on +45 31 25 31 96.  The deadline is December 17th, 2023.  We are looking forward to hearing from you.      About Weibel Scientific Weibel Scientific A/S is an independent privately held Danish engineering company and the leading global producer and exporter of Doppler radars for use in space research, the aerospace industry, defense, and missile defense and critical infrastructure protection. Since its formation in 1977, Weibel has delivered more than 5,000 radars to more than 40 countries. To maintain the greatest possible control and quality trough all stages of production, all work from development to manufacturing is done at Weibel’s headquarters in Allerød, Denmark, where Weibel employs approximately 345 people. Read more at www.weibelradars.com           Job type Engineer, application software      Application due  12/17/2023      Contact person      Jakob Seedorff     E-mail                   E-mail                   E-mail                   E-mail    E-mail             Homepage  https://weibelradars.com/      Workplace  Allerød        Follow us                 Om stillingen    Jobbtype Vikariat  Heltid/Deltid Heltid  Arbeidstid Dag

Data Processor:     Purpose:     Data Processor Privacy Policy:      Expiry:  a year    Name:  cf_clearance    Provider:  .insights.thehub.io            Your consent applies to the following domains:  insights.thehub.io, hubtest.io, thehub.io    Cookie declaration last updated on 08.11.2023     Please read our cookie and privacy policy   What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small datafile that is saved on your computer, tablet or mobile phone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful programs or viruses.  How/why the homepage uses cookies  Cookies are necessary for the homepage to function. Cookies help us get an overview of your visit to the homepage so that we can continually optimise and adjust the homepage to your requirements and interests. For example, cookies remember what you might have added to a shopping cart, if you have previously visited the page, if you are logged in and what languages and currency you want displayed on the homepage. We also use cookies to target our ads to you on other homepages. On a very general level, cookies are used as part of our services in order to show content that is as relevant as possible to you.  How long are cookies saved?  How long cookies are saved on your device can vary. The time when they are scheduled to expire is calculated from the last date you visited the homepage. When cookies expire, they are automatically deleted. You can view a complete list of cookies below.  This is how you can reject or delete your cookies  You can always reject cookies on your computer, tablet or phone by changing your browser settings. Where these settings can be found depends on the type of browser you are using. If you do change the settings, please be aware that there will be some functions and services that you cannot use because they rely on the homepage being able to remember the choices you have made. You can choose to not receive cookies from Google Analytics here .   Deleting cookies  You can delete cookies that you have previously accepted. If you are using a PC with a recent version of a browser, you can delete your cookies by using these shortcut keys: CTRL + SHIFT + Delete.  If the shortcut keys do not work and/or you are using an Apple computer, you must find out what browser you are using and then click on the relevant link:   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Windows 7   Remember: If you are using several different browsers, you must delete the cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  Should you have any questions or comments in connection with this information and/or our processing of personal data, you are welcome to get in touch with us. The cookie declaration itself is updated every month via Cookie Information . If you have any questions regarding the Cookie Information, you can send an email to info@cookieinformation.com. Title: Hospital physicist with programming skills, The Danish Center for Particle Therapy at Aarhus University Hospital (AUH)
Description: Startside    Ledige jobs   Hele Region Midtjylland  Aarhus Universitetshospital  Hospitalsenhed Midt  Regionshospitalet Randers  Regionshospitalet Horsens  Regionshospitalet Gødstrup  Psykiatrien  Socialområdet  Præhospitalet  Hospitalsapoteket     Job og karriere   Jobagent  Hjælpecenter     Regionens arbejdspladser          Log på Min profil Min profil                     Hospital physicist with programming skills, The Danish Center for Particle Therapy at Aarhus University Hospital (AUH)   Do you want to help fight cancer, while gaining experience in cutting-edge data-science and AI technology?  Would you enjoy working in a multidisciplinary team of developers, clinicans and researchers, while enjoying flexible working hours? About the job The Danish Center for Particle Therapy at Aarhus University Hospital (AUH) offers a 5-year 50% position as a medical physicist (“hospitalsfysiker”) and software developer in the recently funded DESIRE project. The goal of the DESIRE project is to develop national data infrastructure, open source sharing and high-tech tools to support research in radiotherapy. Depending on your skills and interests, you will be working with: Development and implementation of AI Data harvesting methods FAIR data Federated learning methods User interface development Your next great idea! Your qualifications As you will be working close with both colleagues and users, we are looking for someone with great collaboration skills. Furthermore, we expect that you: hold a degree in programming, physics, engineering, data science or related fields, and preferably that you hold a certification as clinical medical physicist. have knowledge of some of the following fields: database structure, image processing, artificial intelligence, creation of user-friendly WEB pages, C-sharp, Matlab, Python. are proficient in English – both written and verbal Meet the team As our new data scientist, you will join our multidisciplinary team of medical physicists, computer scientists, medical doctors, PhD students and professors at the department. Furthermore, you will be a part of small national team of 5- 10 data-scientists and developers working on the DESIRE project. In both groups, social activities and the flexibility to design a working day that matches our personal preferences are considered essential to an enjoyable worklife. We enjoy a flat organizational hierarch, and right to make mistakes and learn from them. In the end we are all just nerds that want to make a difference. What we offer An opportunity to work with pioneering technology and people You will be working with colleagues who are at the top of their fields and will be eager to teach you what they know. Vast development opportunities You will have opportunities to take courses and participate in international conferences. Flexibility Flexible working hours, optional work-from-home days. The position is for part-time employment of 50% (18.5 hours per week), but increased time may be negotiated at a later time. Deadline for application is December 3rd 2023, and interviews will be held on December 6th 2023. Start will be as early as possible. Please note that it is a requirement for employment that satisfactory childrens certificate can be obtained. Salary and employment conditions in accordance with the applicable collective agreement. For further information about the position, do not hesitate to contact: Professor Stine Korreman, Danish Center for Particle Therapy, Aarhus University Hospital. Phone: +45 2811 9886 or E-mail: stine.korreman@clin.au.dk   Da Region Midtjylland løbende gennemfører besparelser og omorganiseringer, vil medarbejdere i omplacering, der søger stillingen, have fortrinsret. Fascinated by 3D, cloud and machine learning? Love working with cutting-edge tools, on a blank canvas, and in unconstrained environments? Want to play a leading role as H3D grows from a profitable startup to an iconic scaleup?  We are looking for an ambitious 3D Developer who gets excited by these questions! You will report directly to the R&D Director and shape the DNA of our company.  Location: EU (Copenhagen or Dublin area preferred)  About H3D  H3D is an Australian Ph.D. research spinout whose mission is to make custom-fit devices (e.g. hearing aids, dental appliances) accessible to everyday people. We do this by providing AI technology to audio and dental labs – our Dental CAD , Audio CAD and Smartphone Scanning products – to grow their businesses and better support patients.  Since our product launch in 2021, H3D are growing fast and working with industry leaders such as Logitech, GN Resound, Modern Dental Group and many others. The company is backed by leading VC investors and has customers based worldwide.  What You’ll Do  Outcomes you’ll deliver:   Research, write, and document algorithms in Python/C++ that perform specific processes on raw 3D data.  Research and develop machine learning algorithms to improve the systems, we mainly work with PyTorch.  Write regression tests to ensure functioning outputs from our systems.  Work with product management to plan feature requests from customers  Give opinions and help drive the technical product roadmap   Who You Are  Must-Have Experience:   3+ years of Python development  Knowledge of 3D data processing  3D creation/altering/manipulation of 3d surfaces and objects   Nice-To-Have Experience:   C++ programming  3D Design using Blender  Working with Git, Docker, and AWS Lambda   Our Culture   Mission Driven: we value the social impact our work drives.  Balanced + Fun Loving: we value our lives outside of work, as we’re a collective of dedicated family members, surfers, rock climbers, musicians, travellers, and more.  Quick Movers: we value getting things done, with a bias for action.  Autonomy and Empowerment: we value independence and ownership.  Embrace Challenges: we value resourcefulness, facing ambiguity with comfort.   The Benefits   Impactful Work : your work will benefit patients and humanity at large, and you will gain a unique career experience.  Generous Remuneration : we value working with the best, and we remunerate accordingly. This includes valuable equity options.  Remote First + Flexible : we enjoy the liberty of living where we want and working when we want, with teammates spanning Ireland, Denmark, Ukraine, France, and Australia. Fascinated by 3D, cloud and machine learning? Love working with cutting-edge tools, on a blank canvas, and in unconstrained environments? Want to play a leading role as H3D grows from a profitable startup to an iconic scaleup?  We are looking for an ambitious Full Stack Developer who gets excited by these questions! You will report directly to the R&D Director and shape the DNA of our company.  Location: EU (Copenhagen area preferred)  About H3D  H3D is an Australian Ph.D. research spinout whose mission is to make custom-fit devices (e.g. hearing aids, dental appliances) accessible to everyday people. We do this by providing AI technology to audio and dental labs – our Dental CAD, Audio CAD and Smartphone Scanning products – to grow their businesses and better support patients.  Since our product launch in 2021, H3D are growing fast and working with industry leaders such as Logitech, GN Resound, Modern Dental Group and many others. The company is backed by leading VC investors and has customers based worldwide.  What You’ll Do  Outcomes you’ll deliver:   Assist in the development and deployment of web apps hosted on AWS, using common frameworks such as VueJS, Flask, etc.  Solve complex AWS cloud architecture to deliver reliable and efficient services to both web applications and iOS apps.  Help to improve our build and deployment processes to make iterations more efficient. We are fully AWS-hosted and use a range of tools, including ECS and Docker.  Collaborate with our product managers and customers to design, build and integrate new features into our systems.  Write both unit and integration tests.  Establish, maintain and document multiple API systems.   Who You Are  Must-Have Experience:   2-5+ years as a professional full-stack software developer  Language required = Javascript (VueJS, ReactJS, etc) and Python, with a demonstratable portfolio  Deployed and/or maintained at least 1 web-hosted app  Working with APIs (REST/GraphQL)   Nice-To-Have Experience:   Design and deployment of AWS cloud services (AWS ElasticBeanstalk, AWS S3, AWS Lambda, AWS Batch, etc)  Processing 3D data – e.g. visualizing 3D models in a web browser  Designing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines  Developing iOS applications or knowledge of Swift programming   Our Culture   Mission Driven: we value the social impact our work drives.  Balanced + Fun Loving: we value our lives outside of work, as we’re a collective of dedicated family members, surfers, gamers, rock climbers, musicians, historians, travellers, and more.  Quick Movers: we value getting things done, with a bias for action.  Autonomy and Empowerment: we value independence and ownership.  Embrace Challenges: we value resourcefulness, and facing ambiguity with comfort.   The Benefits  Impactful Work : your work will benefit patients and humanity at large, and you will gain a unique career experience.  Generous Remuneration : we value working with the best, and we remunerate accordingly. This includes valuable equity options.  Remote First + Flexible : we enjoy the liberty of living where we want and working when we want, with teammates spanning Ireland, Denmark, Ukraine, France, and Australia. And would you like to work in a company, where we strongly believe that working closely together across departments and teams helps us collaborate on designing and building better solutions for our customers, but also creates a better working environment?  WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR? We are looking for a developer with a curious mindset and strong social skills. Since we will be spending a lot of time working together, it might as well be fun doing so. Contributing to a pleasant and relaxing environment is key here at Bekey (no pun intended). We believe in working together as a team and helping each other the best we can.  Tasks and responsibilities:   Write and maintain firmware specifications and firmware, including tests and test procedures  Actively participate in the creation of document requirements and design specifications  Excellent communication skills to cooperate with Product Owners, Product Managers, and the rest of the development team during investigations related to support requests and discovering opportunities and defining features  Ensure that all design and documentation is in accordance with company standards  Write test procedures and run tests supported and reviewed by other team members  Provide input and suggest improvements to company practices and tools  Participate in build-up and maintenance of software structures and libraries  Research, design and develop new firmware features for various Bekey products  Familiarity with software testing methodologies such as unit testing and integration testing   Need to have role requirements:   Skills in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related fields.  Strong experience in embedded software development, particularly with the nRF51 microcontroller series or similar series of any kind  Proficiency in programming languages such as C and C++  Experience with version control systems such as Git  Strong understanding of hardware and software interactions in embedded systems  Solid analytical and problem-solving skills paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions  A deep understanding that we must always navigate between the immediate impact of a feature and the technical debt incurred by its implementation. You are able to carefully weigh the pros and cons and make a choice in favor of the company and the team  A natural interest in the latest trends within (embedded) software development, wireless communication and hardware manufacturing  You have very good oral and written communication skills in Danish and English   Nice to have role requirements:   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.  Experience with wireless protocols such as Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) and Zigbee is a plus  Experience with processes and tools like Scrum, JIRA and Confluence is also a plus   WHO ARE WE? Bekey is a scale-up company based in Søborg, and part of the established North Media group along with our successful sister companies Ofir.dk, BoligPortal and FK Distribution – just to name a few.  We provide digital access for professionals within distribution, homecare, and other segments. Our goal is to make their work/everyday life easier and to deliver a pleasant and safe user and customer experience doing so.  At the heart of Bekey, we are building a new Product Department, with Developers and Product Owners managed by our CTO. We are working in planned 2-week sprints to secure an agile approach to product development. Furthermore, we work with a structured and sustainable approach to continuous product discovery, which gives us the confidence to explore opportunities that can potentially meet customer needs.  WORKLIFE At Bekey we strongly support and encourage a healthy work/life balance. Getting work done is important, but so is taking care of your hobbies, your family, and your friends. Working at Bekey should be fun and inspiring, even when we are running late on a deliverable or faced with interesting challenges.  Here’s a list of the benefits and perks that you can expect at Bekey:   Flexible work hours  Working from home when needed  Social events with your colleagues  Opportunity to make a real difference for 50,000+ users in Denmark and Norway  Competitive compensation package incl. pension and healthcare  Working with a team that inspires you and works together to achieve industry-changing goals  A transparent work environment based on trust  Career and professional growth   HOW TO APPLY? If you like what you’ve read and can picture yourself being a part of our Product Team, please let us know by uploading your resume, portfolio, and application today. Interviews are held on an ongoing basis, so do not hesitate to apply today. If you have any questions or want to hear more before applying, please feel free to contact Jacob Dinesen, CTO at Bekey on jacob.dinesen@bekey.dk or phone number +45 2014 4026. Bekey A/S is a subsidiary of North Media A/S which is a listed media group in Nasdaq, Co. North Media A/S is behind Ofir A/S, BoligPortal A/S, FK Distribution A/S and other companies. Today, North Media A/S has a turnover of approximately DKK 1 bn. and more than 550 employees. Title: Customer Success Manager for AI software
Description: Skip to main content GN.com uses cookies to analyze traffic, maximize user-friendliness and improve functionality. By continuing to browse this website you agree to our use of cookies for these purposes. Read more about our use of cookies and how you deactivate cookies in our  Cookie policy Decline Accept Cookies GN Careers Sign In Search for Jobs Customer Success Manager for AI software page is loaded Customer Success Manager for AI software Apply locations Ballerup time type Full time posted on Posted 11 Days Ago job requisition id R19937 Join the world’s oldest start-up and turn up the volume on your career At GN we aspire to continuously lead major technology shifts with intelligent audio solutions and provide professionals and consumers around the world with truly innovative headsets and speakerphones. Software is playing an increasingly larger role in our intelligent solutions. For this reason, we have entered a strategic partnership with the German company audEERING, a global leader in voice AI. This is where you come into the picture. What your colleagues say about working at Jabra: “ We are introducing voice AI as a way for our B2B customers to analyze and drive more value out of their voice interactions. This is a new business area for us, but an area with great potential, budget, and attention. We have already developed promising pilot partnerships with multiple customers. It is now up to you to take it to the next level .” – Andreas Wenzel, Global Leader for Engage AI Your contribution is appreciated, and you will: Add your expertise to a cross-functional team from our office in Ballerup, including UX/UI specialists and software developers. Here, you play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our customer success model. To achieve this, you will: Advance the customer success framework, building modules where necessary, and creating the path to future iterations Build and nurture customer relationships – deeply understanding their needs/goals and identifying opportunities to create value Collaborate with software team to define robust feedback systems, giving leading indicators for customer health and input into product development Oversee all aspects of customer onboarding, journey mapping, and feedback Do what’s right for each of our diverse, global customers To succeed in the role, we imagine that you : We imagine that there are several ways to succeed in the role, but your background and experience might include: Customer success or account management experience in enterprise software (or other complex sales) Technical and business understanding of AI applications and SaaS Great consultative ability – listening, questioning, empathy, negotiation skills, clear communication, and creativity Excellent presentation skills with orientation towards teaching and enablement No matter which background you have, we hope you will be as excited as we are about our new AI product. We also hope that you will enjoy interacting with our customers ranging from customer service agents to executives. We encourage you to apply Even if you don’t match all the above-mentioned skills, we will gladly receive your application if you think you have transferrable skills . We highly value a mindset, motivation, and energy, that aligns with our core values, to not only ensure success for you, but for your team and the wider GN organization as well. We are dedicated to an inclusive recruitment process and all applicants will receive equal consideration for employment. Join us in bringing people closer GN brings people closer through our leading intelligent hearing, audio, video, and gaming solutions. Inspired by people and driven by innovation, we deliver technology that enhance the senses of hearing and sight. We help people with hearing loss overcome real-life challenges, improve communication and collaboration for businesses, and provide great experiences for audio and gaming enthusiasts. Working in the intersection between many stakeholders – customers, partners, colleagues from Sales, and many more – you will quickly notice that everyone around you are excited about voice AI. “ There is a very special start-up vibe in this team, and also a global organization with a strong brand behind it, so you can really hit the ground running here. ” – Andreas Wenzel, Global Leader for Engage AI Think you’ve got what it takes? Let’s chat! If you want to know more about the position, you are welcome to contact Jim Wang jimwang@jabra.com or https://www.linkedin.com/in/jimwang1/ . We’re really looking forward to hearing from you. Loading Follow Us © 2023 Workday, Inc. All rights reserved.

Do you want to work with software as a service (Saas), deliver on operational agility, speed of implementation and scalability? Then this role might be just for you !  Your role / Responsibilities:  Together with our growing team of software developers and QA engineers in R&D, your assignment will be to further develop the core part of one of the main Multidomain Master Data Management solutions. As a technical expert you will have the chance to make a difference and feel the importance and relevance of the work you do, and there will constantly be an exciting new challenge to follow, while looking into the always very ambitious roadmap of Client's software product.  Furthermore, you will:   Analyze user requirements to define robust application designs.  Develop Java based applications; creating back-end and database functionality.  Resolve complex technical tasks writing secure, reliable, scalable and maintainable code.  Collaborate with the team making sure deliverables are delivered on time with high quality.  Implement and execute relevant Unit & Integration tests; debug and resolve technical problems that arise.  Support in project estimation, planning and risk management activities.   The team  You will become a part of the R&D department, where we use the principles of SCRUM/SAFE quite intensively. We mostly work in teams consisting of 3-4 experienced developers and 1 QA engineer, and are challenged by Product Owners who know what they are talking about.  Within R&D we have 120+ colleagues  "We are looking for a new developer to join our team of friendly and talented people. Our team is based in Poland and Denmark and the team collaborates with its many international colleagues in creating valued solutions for our customers.." Says Piotr Muszyński Section Manager, R&D  The candidate  You have a flexible and proactive attitude and can work analytically even with tasks that are not very well defined. You want to get things done, and you can communicate in a constructive manner clarifying your knowledge to your colleagues in the team.  Furthermore, you have:   A Master's degree in Computer Science or similar  2+ years of solid experience in Java development  Experience with ETL related work on JSON/XML based formats and data standards  Experience with Web Service Architecture based on REST, GraphQL, and/or SOAP   What will set you apart, but not required:   Experience with server-based architecture (parallelism, performance, scalability, security)  Knowledge of no-sql database such as Apache Cassandra, Mongo DB  Knowledge of SQL and RDBMS (Oracle)  Understanding of the potential of Cloud computing including Micro-Service architecture principles  Experience with React   We offer  At Stibo System, we offer more than just a job. We put people first and inspire you to become the best version of yourself.   We care about our colleague's work-life balance, and we offer flexibility through a hybrid work model  International: A growing global company, worldwide career opportunities, and multicultural teams  Well-being: A caring and inspiring environment, promoting a happy and healthy lifestyle through a wide range of facilities and activities   This is who we are  Stibo Systems is a global company with a Nordic heritage. We help companies transform into digital leaders through market-leading multidomain master data management that delivers transparency. Through our solution, large brands (our customers) connect data across their products, customers, stores, employees, suppliers, digital assets and much, much more.  We have been around for a while but still have that scale-up feel, even with offices across the globe – from Atlanta to Tokyo. Our people are key to our success and together we continue to create a diverse, unique and exciting work environment.  https://www.stibosystems.com/  Interested?  We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible on:  https://stibosystems.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/careers-at-stibo-systems/details/Java-Developer_JR1257?q=dev  Should you have questions about the position, you are also welcome to contact Piotr Muszyński R&D Section Manager, R&D on pimu@stibosystems.com  We look forward to hearing from you. Data Processor:     Purpose:     Data Processor Privacy Policy:      Expiry:  a year    Name:  cf_clearance    Provider:  .insights.thehub.io            Your consent applies to the following domains:  insights.thehub.io, hubtest.io, thehub.io    Cookie declaration last updated on 08.11.2023     Please read our cookie and privacy policy   What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small datafile that is saved on your computer, tablet or mobile phone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful programs or viruses.  How/why the homepage uses cookies  Cookies are necessary for the homepage to function. Cookies help us get an overview of your visit to the homepage so that we can continually optimise and adjust the homepage to your requirements and interests. For example, cookies remember what you might have added to a shopping cart, if you have previously visited the page, if you are logged in and what languages and currency you want displayed on the homepage. We also use cookies to target our ads to you on other homepages. On a very general level, cookies are used as part of our services in order to show content that is as relevant as possible to you.  How long are cookies saved?  How long cookies are saved on your device can vary. The time when they are scheduled to expire is calculated from the last date you visited the homepage. When cookies expire, they are automatically deleted. You can view a complete list of cookies below.  This is how you can reject or delete your cookies  You can always reject cookies on your computer, tablet or phone by changing your browser settings. Where these settings can be found depends on the type of browser you are using. If you do change the settings, please be aware that there will be some functions and services that you cannot use because they rely on the homepage being able to remember the choices you have made. You can choose to not receive cookies from Google Analytics here .   Deleting cookies  You can delete cookies that you have previously accepted. If you are using a PC with a recent version of a browser, you can delete your cookies by using these shortcut keys: CTRL + SHIFT + Delete.  If the shortcut keys do not work and/or you are using an Apple computer, you must find out what browser you are using and then click on the relevant link:   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Windows 7   Remember: If you are using several different browsers, you must delete the cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  Should you have any questions or comments in connection with this information and/or our processing of personal data, you are welcome to get in touch with us. The cookie declaration itself is updated every month via Cookie Information . If you have any questions regarding the Cookie Information, you can send an email to info@cookieinformation.com.      Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Full Stack Developer for an exciting AI beauty company💄  Compar  Copenhagen  Full-time   Salary Competitive  Equity To be negotiated    Who are we?  Do you want to be a first mover in BeautyTech and innovate the beauty market? Compar is a highly advanced machine, utilising AI and machine learning to help consumers navigate the beauty market. Our powerful engine identifies the consumer’s unique face and hair features, then unlocks a personalised beauty space filled with beauty products, in-depth match and ingredient analysis, guides, and trends that match the consumer’s features.  We make it technologically easy and efficient for consumers to identify their unique features and give them objective, scientific, and sustainable advice for buying and applying beauty products. All of this will be available in our mobile app…which you will be building!    Why work for us?  As a startup that is well and truly in its “scale-up” phase, we offer an enormous opportunity to be a part of the most exciting time in our journey so far. A full-stack developer at Compar will be helping the business realise its potential and leave a lasting, positive impression on the beauty industry.  We are still a small team, meaning you will get to work directly with our founder, Thea. You will gain direct insight into how the business works and what makes it successful. If you are interested in being up close and personal with the decisions and processes that make a startup business successful, then you will learn a lot at Compar.  Our office is located in central Copenhagen, making it easily accessible and surrounded by beautiful buildings and cafés. We also offer a flexible working arrangement but do require you to work primarily from our office in order to collaborate directly with the team. Finally, you will not only be offered a competitive salary, but also an opportunity to have a stake in the company (equity).    What is your role?  As the new Full-Stack Developer, you will develop the frontend and backend of our mobile application and assist with our admin web application. The role will morph into a CTO or Founding Engineer depending on the right candidate’s level of skill and experience.  Current Tech Stack: React Native, React.js, Typescript, Express.js, AWS, TypeOrm, PostgreSQL, Docker, Python    Who are you?    You are comfortable developing user-friendly cross-platform mobile apps from scratch on your own and have examples to show    Full-stack developer experience, with 2+ years of experience    Experience with building secure, fast, large, and scalable RDBMS    Experience with software development projects and frameworks like Scrum    Attention to detail, quality, testing, and obsession with pixel perfection    You speak and write fluent English (and/or Danish)    You live in Denmark    Degree in Computer Science      Required skills    React Native / React.js    Typescript    Docker    Relational databases and CRUD operations, preferably experience with AWS    Understanding of UX design principles    GitHub      Bonus skills    TypeOrm, Express.js, Python    Web scraping    Mobile app development experience with phone camera, images, executing Python scripts, authentication, notifications      HOW TO APPLY    We will be inviting candidates on an ongoing basis. Please send your application by pressing 'Apply'.    Answer the screening questions    Include your LinkedIn profile and CV    If we believe you are a match for us, we will invite you to a 30 minute conversation followed by a case test and a final interview in person at our Copenhagen office.    For more information or questions please contact us at  marko@thehub.io   Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Social gatherings  Social gatherings and games; hang out with your colleagues.  Equity package  Want to be a partner? Look no further.  Near public transit  Easy access and treehugger friendly workplace.  Central office  Your local office is your anchor point, thus, we placed it centrally at your convenience.  Free coffee / tea  Get your caffeine fix to get you started and keep you going.  Paid holiday  Metropolitists, beach boys and mountaineers we salute you and pay you to go and explore the world.  See all 7 benefits  Working at Compar  See company profile  Today's beauty market is a jungle to navigate, exactly 70% report experiencing choice paralysis when researching products for themselves. Consumers often choose beauty products that are wrong for them and contain harmful ingredients, resulting in poor beauty outcomes and wasteful consumption. Consumers are not aware of how their specific features have an influence on what beauty products are their match.

Our AI-driven app scans your unique face and hair features, providing you with personalized and scientifically-backed beauty advice. Discover the perfect products on the first try, save money, reduce plastic waste, and boost your confidence. With our intelligent beauty expert right at your fingertips, you'll access a wealth of knowledge beyond what a traditional beautician can offer.

Our CEO is Thea Emilie Larsen, a software developer passionated about AI, algorithms and Beauty. Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Senior Frontend Developer (Remote - EU)  Agreena  Remote  Full-time   Salary Competitive      About Agreena Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 200 employees across more than 40 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe. Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading, and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation, and fun. And this is where you come in: We need your seasoned React expertise to join our team and take care of our web projects. You'll be an integral member of one of our cross-functional teams, dedicated to managing and enhancing specific sets of features within the product:Farmer facing team: focuses on solving farmer facing problems, delivering quality improvements to the farmers experience and the Agreena productInternal solutions team: focuses on building solutions to accelerate internal teams We work in classic Scrum methodology: 2 weeks sprints, dailies on everyday basis, plannings, retros and grooming meetings included. Our tech stack is: -Turborepo -TypeScript -React -Tanstack Query -Vanilla Extract The job is remote, and we are looking for someone who is located within EU. How will you make an impact: You'll play a crucial role in shaping our product by collaborating with other developers, engineers, designers and product owners - by using your frontend skills to create user-friendly parts of the app that work smoothly. We are looking for someone who will solve technical issues, helping us work better and faster. It is important for us that you are a team player, as you’ll be helping the team members in shaping our projects and guiding new developers. Ideally, we would like someone who has fresh ideas on the product and will keep our technology up to date, making our app amazing for our users.   Who we’re looking for:  Experienced React Developer : You're no newcomer to the React universe. With over 3+ years of hands-on experience, you've honed your skills and have a deep understanding of building robust web applications using React; HTML & JS Proficiency : Your mastery of HTML and JavaScript allows you to seamlessly translate design concepts into functional, user-friendly interfaces. Your attention to detail ensures that (almost ;)) every pixel is in its rightful place; CI/CD Enthusiast : You're well-versed in the world of Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD). You understand the importance of automating builds and deployment processes to maintain a smooth development workflow; Collaborative Team Playe r: You thrive in a collaborative environment, having successfully worked within product teams alongside designers, product managers, and fellow developers. Your ability to communicate effectively and work harmoniously is a key asset; Tech-Savvy Trailblazer : You stay ahead of the curve by keeping up with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies. Your curiosity and willingness to explore new tools and techniques sets you apart.   What’s in it for you:  A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change; A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues; Competitive compensation package and holidays; Remote Work Policy; Team events throughout the year; An exciting purpose-led culture and mission; Open communication and supportive feedback culture.   🌱 Not quite what you're looking for? We encourage you to follow our Agreena LinkedIn page to keep updated on content, articles as well as new opportunities opening. You can also subscribe to our job alerts talent pool to stay in the loop for the departments you're interested in exploring further at Agreena. 🌍 Be your best-self everyday at Agreena At Agreena we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. We are on the path towards expansion and growth so with that, we believe everyone’s uniqueness should be celebrated and embraced to help us achieve this exciting journey. This is critical to our success and innovation. We want to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams. With this in mind, we are working to ensure Agreena remains a diverse and inclusive environment for everyone.    Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Free lunch  Enjoy a free catered lunch with your colleagues, every day.  Central office  Your local office is your anchor point, thus, we placed it centrally at your convenience.  Flexible working hours  Time is precious. Make it count. Morning person or night owl, this job is for you.  Free coffee / tea  Get your caffeine fix to get you started and keep you going.  Pension plan  We take care of you, even when you are old and wrinkly.  Paid holiday  Metropolitists, beach boys and mountaineers we salute you and pay you to go and explore the world.  See all 10 benefits  Working at Agreena  See company profile  Every hectare of agricultural land has the potential to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.                  
At Agreena we help enable that potential. Agreena has the solutions to drive environmental and financial sustainability in agriculture. Within one year, we have helped farmers across 10 countries to convert more  than ​100K hectares of land to regenerative farming practices. ​Agreena is a well funded (recently raised €20M ​in Series A round) ​, Danish growth company.

We have Europe's #1funded soil carbon certification program. Succeeding in our mission could result in billions of Euros saved and megatons of CO2e removed. Data Processor:     Purpose:     Data Processor Privacy Policy:      Expiry:  a year    Name:  cf_clearance    Provider:  .insights.thehub.io            Your consent applies to the following domains:  insights.thehub.io, hubtest.io, thehub.io    Cookie declaration last updated on 08.11.2023     Please read our cookie and privacy policy   What is a cookie?  A cookie is a small datafile that is saved on your computer, tablet or mobile phone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful programs or viruses.  How/why the homepage uses cookies  Cookies are necessary for the homepage to function. Cookies help us get an overview of your visit to the homepage so that we can continually optimise and adjust the homepage to your requirements and interests. For example, cookies remember what you might have added to a shopping cart, if you have previously visited the page, if you are logged in and what languages and currency you want displayed on the homepage. We also use cookies to target our ads to you on other homepages. On a very general level, cookies are used as part of our services in order to show content that is as relevant as possible to you.  How long are cookies saved?  How long cookies are saved on your device can vary. The time when they are scheduled to expire is calculated from the last date you visited the homepage. When cookies expire, they are automatically deleted. You can view a complete list of cookies below.  This is how you can reject or delete your cookies  You can always reject cookies on your computer, tablet or phone by changing your browser settings. Where these settings can be found depends on the type of browser you are using. If you do change the settings, please be aware that there will be some functions and services that you cannot use because they rely on the homepage being able to remember the choices you have made. You can choose to not receive cookies from Google Analytics here .   Deleting cookies  You can delete cookies that you have previously accepted. If you are using a PC with a recent version of a browser, you can delete your cookies by using these shortcut keys: CTRL + SHIFT + Delete.  If the shortcut keys do not work and/or you are using an Apple computer, you must find out what browser you are using and then click on the relevant link:   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Windows 7   Remember: If you are using several different browsers, you must delete the cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  Should you have any questions or comments in connection with this information and/or our processing of personal data, you are welcome to get in touch with us. The cookie declaration itself is updated every month via Cookie Information . If you have any questions regarding the Cookie Information, you can send an email to info@cookieinformation.com.      Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Environmental Systems Modeller (Remote - EU)  Agreena  Remote  Full-time   Salary Competitive      About Agreena Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 200 employees across more than 40 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe. Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading, and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation, and fun. And this is where you come in: As a Environmental Systems Modeller at Agreena, your primary objective is to contribute to the creation of modelling frameworks for the simulation and quantitative assessment of the ecological effects of regenerative agriculture practices. These assessments are focused on the flows and stocks of Greenhouse Gases (GHGs), but extend to incorporate biodiversity and livestock management. Your role will encompass tasks such as conducting research, developing, calibrating (i.e. fitting to new data), validating and running models representing soil and agricultural systems. This also involves producing reports on model design and performance for external partners. You will be a part of the broader Program team that contributes to the Science, Standards and Data required to operate carbon and nature-based solutions for the business.   How will you make an impact:  Collaborate with our team of scientists to design, develop, and validate GHGs flow models that accurately represent GHGs dynamics in the agricultural environment, specially in soils. Convert and implement qualitative principles into mathematical models. Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and other researchers to collect and manage data from the different sources, including both Agreena’s own data and external data sets. Staying up-to-date and engaging with the soil and agroecosystems models research community to support the development of science based products in Agreena. Communicating your research in a business context, to external partners and standard setting bodies. Addressing team inquiries about soil, agroecosystems, and the modelling thereof.   Who we’re looking for:  Academic background in agricultural sciences, agriculture economy, environmental sciences, soil science, biogeochemistry, or similar. Strong programming skills in languages such as R and/or Python are a must. Experience with soil carbon dynamics and/or GHG flux models Strong communication skills and the ability to work in an interdisciplinary environment.   Bonus points if:  You have a Ph.D in a related field. Ability to work with geospatial data. Experience with version control systems like git/GitHub. Familiarity with Bayesian modelling tools.   What’s in it for you:  A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues Competitive compensation package and holidays Option to work from home part time with planned trips to the central office in CPH. Team events throughout the year An exciting purpose-led culture and mission Open communication and supportive feedback culture   🌱 Not quite what you're looking for? We encourage you to follow our Agreena LinkedIn page to keep updated on content, articles as well as new opportunities opening. You can also subscribe to our job alerts talent pool to stay in the loop for the departments you're interested in exploring further at Agreena. 🌍 Be your best-self everyday at Agreena At Agreena we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. We are on the path towards expansion and growth so with that, we believe everyone’s uniqueness should be celebrated and embraced to help us achieve this exciting journey. This is critical to our success and innovation. We want to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams. With this in mind, we are working to ensure Agreena remains a diverse and inclusive environment for everyone.    Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Free lunch  Enjoy a free catered lunch with your colleagues, every day.  Central office  Your local office is your anchor point, thus, we placed it centrally at your convenience.  Flexible working hours  Time is precious. Make it count. Morning person or night owl, this job is for you.  Free coffee / tea  Get your caffeine fix to get you started and keep you going.  Pension plan  We take care of you, even when you are old and wrinkly.  Paid holiday  Metropolitists, beach boys and mountaineers we salute you and pay you to go and explore the world.  See all 10 benefits  Working at Agreena  See company profile  Every hectare of agricultural land has the potential to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.                  
At Agreena we help enable that potential. Agreena has the solutions to drive environmental and financial sustainability in agriculture. Within one year, we have helped farmers across 10 countries to convert more  than ​100K hectares of land to regenerative farming practices. ​Agreena is a well funded (recently raised €20M ​in Series A round) ​, Danish growth company.

We have Europe's #1funded soil carbon certification program. Succeeding in our mission could result in billions of Euros saved and megatons of CO2e removed.  Read more about Agreena    Apply       We connect global talents with career opportunities in Nordic
        startups. A cookie is a small datafile that is saved on your computer, tablet or mobile phone. A cookie is not a program that can contain harmful programs or viruses.  How/why the homepage uses cookies  Cookies are necessary for the homepage to function. Cookies help us get an overview of your visit to the homepage so that we can continually optimise and adjust the homepage to your requirements and interests. For example, cookies remember what you might have added to a shopping cart, if you have previously visited the page, if you are logged in and what languages and currency you want displayed on the homepage. We also use cookies to target our ads to you on other homepages. On a very general level, cookies are used as part of our services in order to show content that is as relevant as possible to you.  How long are cookies saved?  How long cookies are saved on your device can vary. The time when they are scheduled to expire is calculated from the last date you visited the homepage. When cookies expire, they are automatically deleted. You can view a complete list of cookies below.  This is how you can reject or delete your cookies  You can always reject cookies on your computer, tablet or phone by changing your browser settings. Where these settings can be found depends on the type of browser you are using. If you do change the settings, please be aware that there will be some functions and services that you cannot use because they rely on the homepage being able to remember the choices you have made. You can choose to not receive cookies from Google Analytics here .   Deleting cookies  You can delete cookies that you have previously accepted. If you are using a PC with a recent version of a browser, you can delete your cookies by using these shortcut keys: CTRL + SHIFT + Delete.  If the shortcut keys do not work and/or you are using an Apple computer, you must find out what browser you are using and then click on the relevant link:   Internet Explorer  Microsoft Edge  Mozilla Firefox  Google Chrome  Opera  Safari  Flash cookies  Apple  Android  Windows 7   Remember: If you are using several different browsers, you must delete the cookies in all of them.  Do you have any questions?  Should you have any questions or comments in connection with this information and/or our processing of personal data, you are welcome to get in touch with us. The cookie declaration itself is updated every month via Cookie Information . If you have any questions regarding the Cookie Information, you can send an email to info@cookieinformation.com.      Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Research Software Engineer (Remote - EU)  Agreena  Remote  Full-time   Salary Competitive      About Agreena Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 200 employees across more than 40 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe. Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading, and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation, and fun. And this is where you come in: As a Research Software Engineer at Agreena, you will play a crucial role in advancing our research initiatives by collaborating in the development, maintenance, and optimisation of  software solutions that quantify the environmental benefits of regenerative agriculture. You will work closely with cross-functional teams of researchers, data engineers, and backend developers to help develop and scale simulation models as part of new products and technologies. You will be closely aligned with the broader Program team that contributes to the science, standards and data required to operate carbon and nature-based solutions for the business.   How will you make an impact:  Collaborate with program scientists and research modellers to design and implement solutions for research software development. Design and help manage the infrastructure for an effective software development environment. Develop, test and maintain custom software tools (Predominantly R and Python packages) Optimise existing software code to improve performance and scalability. Collaborate with data engineers and scientists to build data pipelines for model development. Develop implementation plans for change requests, evaluate risks to integrity of infrastructure and research software environment. Document software design, implementation, and user guides for internal and external audiences. Keep up-to-date with the latest developments in software engineering and scientific computing to advance the research efforts in the company.   Who we’re looking for:  A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. We recognise that research software engineering happens in a variety of contexts, so do also apply if you have demonstrable software engineering experience, but don’t necessarily have a CS/SE degree. Strong programming skills in R and Python. Experience working in a research environment. Expertise in version control systems, and package managers. Strong communication skills and the ability to work in an interdisciplinary environment.   Bonus points if:  Experienced with scientific computing libraries and frameworks (e.g., Tidyverse, NumPy, SciPy, or similar). Experienced in engineering for compute intensive problems, either HPC or cloud-based (GCP/AWS).   What’s in it for you:  A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues Competitive compensation package and holidays Option to work from home part time with planned trips to the central office in CPH Team events throughout the year An exciting purpose-led culture and mission Open communication and supportive feedback culture   🌱 Not quite what you're looking for? We encourage you to follow our Agreena LinkedIn page to keep updated on content, articles as well as new opportunities opening. You can also subscribe to our job alerts talent pool to stay in the loop for the departments you're interested in exploring further at Agreena. 🌍 Be your best-self everyday at Agreena At Agreena we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. We are on the path towards expansion and growth so with that, we believe everyone’s uniqueness should be celebrated and embraced to help us achieve this exciting journey. This is critical to our success and innovation. We want to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams. With this in mind, we are working to ensure Agreena remains a diverse and inclusive environment for everyone.    Perks and benefits  This job comes with several perks and benefits   Free lunch  Enjoy a free catered lunch with your colleagues, every day.  Central office  Your local office is your anchor point, thus, we placed it centrally at your convenience.  Flexible working hours  Time is precious. Make it count. Morning person or night owl, this job is for you.  Free coffee / tea  Get your caffeine fix to get you started and keep you going.  Pension plan  We take care of you, even when you are old and wrinkly.  Paid holiday  Metropolitists, beach boys and mountaineers we salute you and pay you to go and explore the world.  See all 10 benefits  Working at Agreena  See company profile  Every hectare of agricultural land has the potential to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.                  
At Agreena we help enable that potential. Agreena has the solutions to drive environmental and financial sustainability in agriculture. Within one year, we have helped farmers across 10 countries to convert more  than ​100K hectares of land to regenerative farming practices. ​Agreena is a well funded (recently raised €20M ​in Series A round) ​, Danish growth company.

We have Europe's #1funded soil carbon certification program. Succeeding in our mission could result in billions of Euros saved and megatons of CO2e removed. Powered By: Cookie Information  Save settings                                                Find jobs Browse startups News & Insights Pricing For startups  Sign up  Log in         Senior Backend Engineer (Remote - EU)  Agreena  Copenhagen  Full-time   Salary Competitive      About Agreena Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 200 employees across more than 40 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe. Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading, and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation, and fun. And this is where you come in: We are looking for experienced Backend Engineers who will work closely with our Product Managers to get new features groomed and implemented across the Agreena product portfolio. You will be a part of an already established team of software engineers at Agreena. We work on the latest Node.js version of the code, and we mostly use Nest.js with postgres. We have integrations with multiple services such as Stripe, DocuSign, Hubspot, our own authentication service and more.   How will you make an impact:  Playing a key role in the design, implementation and integration of product features; Solving technical problems of high scope and complexity; Helping to define and improve our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale web environment; Helping to migrate our old code to the new Node.js codebase.   Who we’re looking for:  Several years of full-time working experience with Node.js & Typescript Experience in writing well designed, testable and efficient code Experience in writing APIs (REST) and API documentation (swagger) Experience with Node.js frameworks (we use Nest.js but this experience is not required to apply) Experience with integrating with 3rd party services (Stripe, DocuSign, etc.) Experience with Data modelling, SQL and Database (relational and non-relational) knowledge Experience with TDD and Jest;Good communication skills;Taking ownership of your code Desire to constantly learn and improve yourself by embracing technical challenges   Bonus points if:  Experience with Nest.js Working experience on performance optimization - application monitoring, profiling, caching strategies and improvements implementation; Experience with changing from monolith to microservices; Experience with deployment and other dev-ops configurations with technologies like Heroku, Docker and/or AWS services such as S3, EC2, etc.   What's in it for you:  A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues Competitive compensation package and holidays Remote Work Policy Team events throughout the year An exciting purpose-led culture and mission Open communication and supportive feedback culture   🌱 Not quite what you're looking for? You can also subscribe to our job alerts talent pool to stay in the loop for the departments you're interested in exploring further at Agreena. 🌍 Be your best-self everyday at Agreena At Agreena we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. This is critical to our success and innovation. We want to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams. With this in mind, we are working to ensure Agreena remains a diverse and inclusive environment for everyone. Central office  Your local office is your anchor point, thus, we placed it centrally at your convenience.  Flexible working hours  Time is precious. Make it count. Title: Solutions Architect (Augmented Reality)
Description: Skip to main content VELUX uses its own cookies as well as cookies from third parties to personalize content and ads, to provide social media features and to analyse our traffic. The list of third parties setting cookies on VELUX contains among others Microsoft, Google and Facebook (full list in cookie policy). We also share information about your use of our site with our social media, advertising and analytics partners. You consent to our cookies by clicking "allow all cookies" or by selecting the types of cookies you will consent to and click "allow selection". Your consent applies to the current site including related sites. You can change or withdraw your consent at any time, learn more in our cookie policy. Read Full Privacy Message Decline Accept Cookies Home English Sign In Home Search for Jobs Solutions Architect (Augmented Reality) page is loaded Solutions Architect (Augmented Reality) Apply remote type Hybrid locations Ådalsvej 99 Hørsholm Andrássy út 9., Budapest time type Full time posted on Posted 19 Days Ago job requisition id R1065447 In the VELUX Group, we offer you a world of opportunities and the chance to create a bright future. From the forefront of the sustainable indoor living industry, we enable those who live, work and play under the roof transform their spaces and live a healthier everyday life with more daylight and fresh air. The VELUX Group is an international, family-owned business with strong financial roots and each year we are able to create real impact by reinvesting in society, our employees and planet through our foundations. Alongside the rest of our values, “courage” and “mutual respect” define our actions every day and how we wish to contribute to the world. As an Augmented Reality Solution Architect at VELUX, you will play a pivotal role in designing and developing innovative AR solutions for internal projects and initiatives. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, internal stakeholders, and partners to transform concepts into reality by architecting and implementing AR solutions. Our ambition is to make more customers aware of the opportunity and benefits of daylight and fresh air through the roof so they truly desire our solutions. You can be based in our headquarters in Horsholm or in our regional office in Budapest. Key Responsibilities: Solution Design: Lead the design of AR solutions that align with VELUX needs and project objectives. Create detailed architecture blueprints and documentation. Technical Expertise and Innovation : Stay up-to-date with the latest AR technologies, trends, platforms, and tools. Provide guidance together with our enterprise architects on the selection of appropriate hardware and software components for each project. Prototyping: Develop rapid prototypes and proof of concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and potential of AR solutions. Collaboration: Work closely with software developers, 3D designers, and content creators to ensure seamless integration of AR features and functionality. Stakeholder Engagement : Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their goals, propose AR solutions, and build strong client relationships. Velux For more than 80 years, The VELUX Group has created better living environments for people around the world; making the most of daylight and fresh air through the roof. Our product programme includes roof windows and modular skylights, decorative blinds, sun screening products and roller shutters, as well as installation and smart home solutions. These products help to ensure a healthy and sustainable indoor climate, for work and learning, for play and pleasure. We work globally – with sales and manufacturing operations in more than 38 countries and around 12,500 employees worldwide. The VELUX Group is owned by VKR Holding A/S, a limited company wholly owned by non-profit, charitable foundations (THE VELUX FOUNDATIONS) and family.
